Without such powerful, yet simplistic, sounds, this would be like a 70 or something and just a mere curiousity instead of what it is now: a fantastic short.

film.summary: As a young couple stops and rests in a small village inn, the man is abducted by Death and is sequestered behind a huge doorless, windowless wall (imdb)
film.quote: A really interesting premise with some odd but fascinating sets. This is cleary a really ambitious movie and it usually works. Probably my favourite Lang movie because when it works, it really really works, and that allows me to overlook the very slight failures. Plus, it entertained me more than his other movies I've seen.

film.summary: The Fountain is an odyssey about one man's eternal struggle to save the woman he loves. (Warner Bros.)
film.quote: Stunning visuals, a deep story about love, among other things. Great performances by the lead and an emotional payoff.

film.summary: A documentary centered on a young Frenchman who convinces a grieving Texas family that he is their 16-year-old son who went missing for 3 years. (imdb)
film.quote: Knowing nothing about the real case I didn't know what to expect. I liked the premise and wanted to see what came from it. Turns out this is a pretty complex docu-thriller, and not what I thought at all. It draws you into the world of a pathological liar/identity theft, goes from being a gripping tale of a family and loss to a true-crime movie. Like his identity, you're left wondering what the truth is in all of this, what happened to Nicholas?

film.summary: This is the story a nine-year-old boy named Hogarth Hughes who makes friends with an innocent alien giant robot that came from outer space. Meanwhile, a paranoid U.S. Government agent named Kent Mansley arrives in town, determined to destroy the giant at all costs. It's up to Hogarth to protect him by keeping him at Dean McCoppin's place in the junkyard. (imdb)
A traumatized member of an elite para-military police force falls for the sister of a female terrorist courier who died in front of him on duty [IMDB]
film.quote: The subject matter alone pretty much guaranteed that I'd at least like it. It didn't disappoint. Like a few others have said, the Riding Hood theme was pummeled into us, but the movie still had a great score, great plot and good animation. I liked the twists and turns of the plot and the multiple factions fighting. Very true to life. The Special Force Unit also has a frightening "suit." Imagine seeing just those red eyes down a dark hallway.

film.summary: A petty thief posing as an actor is brought to Los Angeles for an unlikely audition and finds himself in the middle of a murder investigation along with his high school dream girl and a detective who's been training him for his upcoming role... (imdb)
film.quote: Yeah, it gets really meta at times, but this is a hilarious crime thriller with a lot of wit. Downey Jr. does a great job, as does Val Kilmer.

film.summary: In 2072, when the mob wants to get rid of someone, the target is sent 30 years into the past, where a hired gun awaits. Someone like Joe, who one day learns the mob wants to 'close the loop' by transporting back Joe's future self. (imdb)
film.quote: I would like to say that there are probably holes in the plot, because in time travel movies there pretty much always is... but I know this fact so I don't dwell on it. It's not like we know how time traveling works. But the movie doesn't get too complex, opting to tell an emotional tale instead. Some amazing scenes like the diner, and wonderful jobs by everyone involved make this thrilling. Minor gripes aside, I also like that TK is involved. That just makes everything cool. Because I am TK.

film.summary: When a group of teenage boys and one bold young girl seek playful revenge on the kid who has tormented them, nothing turns out the way they expected. What begins as a trip down a river and a childish prank soon turns into an eye-opening encounter with the enemy -- a harrowing journey into wilderness and an event that will force them to grapple with the very meaning of friendship and responsibility. (Paramount Classics)
film.quote: A tragic, in depth character study revolving around an unfortunate incident. It isn't so much about what happens, it's about why it happens and how the characters deal with it. This is absolutely top notch film making with memorable characters that challenge your perception of what good and bad really is. Throw in some intense scenes and you got a near masterpiece.

film.summary: A reclusive man sets out for justice and redemption when three troublesome teens kill his dog for no good reason.
Set in an affluent neighbourhood of the San Fernando Valley in 1987, the film recounts the life of a seemingly unremarkable homemaker, Carol White who develops multiple chemical sensitivity.
An abusive husband, his wife and their psychic son take care of a haunted hotel over the winter, but the isolation becomes too much pressure

Shotgun Stories tracks a feud that erupts between two sets of half brothers following the death of their father. Set against the cotton fields and back roads of Southeast Arkansas, these brothers discover the lengths to which each will go to protect their family. (imdb)
film.quote: Love this film. From the brilliant and extremely emotional music to the acting (especially Shannon, who is fantastic), to the simplistic but extremely engaging plot, everything is great here. The ending scene is a scene of beauty.

film.summary: 1000 AD, for years, One Eye, a mute warrior of supernatural strength, has been held prisoner by the Norse chieftain Barde. Aided by Are, a boy slave, One Eye slays his captor and together he and Are escape, beginning a journey into the darkness.
film.quote: This movie is what Randal (in Clerks) criticizes Lord of the Rings for: people walking. That's what you get mostly, except for a few violent fight scenes that are quick but kind of gross. The cinematography is astounding and really gives the rather tedious events an air of importance, and the movie doesn't really tell you a lot so you're left wondering afterwards what everything means. One Eye is a badass, and the ending is a WTF, but it feels like it fits.

film.summary: A man performs his usual trip to work, immersed in a system in which the use of people as objects is part of everyday life. (cinemajove.com)
film.quote: What an interesting idea, and it was pretty funny too.

film.summary: From the creators of &#034;Toy Story,&#034; &#034;Monsters, Inc.&#034; and &#034;Finding Nemo,&#034; comes this hilarious action-packed animated adventure about superheroes. (Disney Enterprises, Inc./Pixar Animation Studios)
Film about filmmaking. It takes place during one day on set of non-budget movie. Ultimate tribute to all independent filmmakers (imdb)
film.quote: Very funny and clever, with great performances. A gem of a movie which, last I checked, didn't make much money at all. Which is a shame, there's a movie like this with actual ideas and concepts that makes nothing and then there's Epic Movie.

film.summary: In 1944 fascist Spain, a girl, fascinated with fairy-tales, is sent along with her pregnant mother to live with her new stepfather, a ruthless captain of the Spanish army. During the night, she meets a fairy who takes her to an old faun in the center of the labyrinth. He tells her she's a princess, but must prove her royalty by surviving three gruesome tasks. If she fails, she will never prove herself to be the the true princess and will never see her real father, the king, again. (imdb)
Poignant coming-of-age story of a precocious and outspoken young Iranian girl that begins during the Islamic Revolution. (imdb)
Fletcher Munson is a lethargic, passive worker for a Scientology-like self-help corporation called Eventualism...(imdb)
film.quote: A film that dissects communication and the break down of it. It is highly original and adventerous, and it works as both an experiment and as a comedy.

film.summary: 10 minutes by Ahmed Imamovic. 1994. Sarajevo, Bosnia and Rome, Italy. How many different things can happen for only 10 Minutes. The film won the award for the best European short film in 2002. (YouTube)
film.quote: Does what it has to do very well. Great single shot, as well. The message might not be the deepest (as I see some people criticizing it for), but it tells its message in a fantastic way.

film.summary: A pair of underachieving cops are sent back to a local high school to blend in and bring down a synthetic drug ring.
film.quote: Gotta say I enjoyed the hell out of this. It would have hit 90 had it not gone a little long without a decent joke SOMETIMES. But they do a good job of scattering good jokes throughout the whole thing for the most part, with some amazing laughs. Really it's worth seeing just for the drug freakout scene, which reminded me of Keyboard Drumset Fucking Werewolf (to those indie game fans out there) in tone. Fuck Yeah Motherfucker!

film.summary: After making their way through high school (twice), big changes are in store for officers Schmidt and Jenko when they go deep undercover at a local college. (imdb)
film.quote: I think I just love these movies. It's the same formula as the first, but unlike a movie like The Hangover, it doesn't overstay its welcome for me. I laughed a lot and love the credit sequence. The only minor dig is that sometimes the excessive swearing is not that funny... it doesn't do it for me. But in a movie that has more than just excessive swearing, it's not as noticeable, and 22 Jump Street has a lot to fall back on. Very good chemistry between the two as well.

film.summary: When 9 first comes to life, he finds himself in a post-apocalyptic world where all humans are gone, and it is only by chance that he discovers a small community of others like him taking refuge from machines that roam the earth intent on their extinction.
film.quote: Am I the highest ranking here? Perhaps so. Anyway, I adore this movie and view it (both plot, obviously and less obviously, characters) as an allegory for something much deeper than a lot of mainstream stuff, both politically and psychologically. It's not the deepest movie ever, don't get me wrong, but I appreciate the fact you can think about it. Besides that, some great animation, great scenery (sucker for this stuff), and some genuinely memorable scenes.

film.summary: In this chilling and inventive documentary, the unrepentant former members of Indonesian death squads are challenged to re-enact some of their many murders in the style of the American movies they love. (tiff.net)
film.quote: I loved the premise but I didn't know what to really expect. What I got was a disgusting documentary that is incredibly hard to watch, a film that makes you incredibly angry at these people and how they seemingly bath in the glory of their pasts. There are moments of enlightenment, but for them its too little too late. Maybe too powerful for its own good, as it's the type of film that will alienate people. I don't know if I enjoyed it so much as I was just impacted by it. Chilling documentary.

film.summary: AI WEIWEI: NEVER SORRY is the first feature-length film about the internationally renowned Chinese artist and activist, Ai Weiwei. In recent years, Ai has garnered international attention as much for his ambitious artwork as his political provocations. (imdb)
film.quote: An interesting look into an interesting man. The documentary does a good job showcasing his art and his activism, often times blending the two together (as it should be). If you're into this kind of thing, it should be really fascinating for you (unless you already know his story).

film.summary: Emmi, a woman truly in the second half of life falls in love with Ali, an more than ten years younger Arab guest worker.

All About My Dog is a 2005 Japanese film consisting of interwoven shorts about dogs. The film's various short stories are directed by Isshin Inudou, Hideki Kuroda, Yoshio Kuroda, Satoshi Nagai, Shinsuke Sato, Tetsuhisa Yazu and Atsushi Sanada. The Marimo short section is particularly popular on internet memes (Wikipedia)
film.quote: For dog lovers, this is a must see. It's really sappy but beautiful. Maybe it's really easy to play on the general love people have for dogs, but the director/writer doesn't even pretend to give a shit about how easy it is, and instead goes balls to the wall with it.

film.summary: Charlie Kaufman's first stop-motion film about a man crippled by the mundanity of his life. (imdb)
film.quote: It's not a long movie anyway but time just flew by. Before I knew it I was really invested in these characters. Kaufman explores human interaction, love and relationships in a profoundly intelligent and realistic way... this time using stop-motion animation. Deeply touching and surreal -- plus, it has one of the most intimate sex scenes I've ever seen in a movie.

film.filmname: The Assassination of Jesse James by the Coward Robert Ford (2007)
film.summary: Robert Ford joins Jesse James's gang, only to become resentful of the legendary outlaw and hatch a plan to kill the fastest gun in the West. (imdb)
A look at the legendary era in WWE/WWF history: The Attitude Era.
film.quote: Being a massive wrestling fan, especially during that era, this is like preaching to the choir. It's just a look at what made the Attitude Era special. To a non-wrestling fan it's nothing, but to me, it's just great to look back. So take this with a huge grain of salt because there is a lot of bias here.

film.summary: When Tony Stark tries to jumpstart a dormant peacekeeping program, things go awry and it is up to the Avengers to stop the villainous Ultron from enacting his terrible plans. (imdb)
film.quote: A vast improvement on the original in every way. Better villain, more attention paid to fleshing out the characters, more exciting action (the Hulkbuster fight or even the beginning scene). Ultron was pretty awesome with his snarkiness for the most part. This is what the Avengers should be.

film.summary: Animated film about a young deer, Bambi, growing up in the wild after his mother is shot by hunters. (imdb)
film.quote: Sad. Really sad. Thumper also brings back childhood memories. Really charming movie.

film.summary: A triangle: Franz, Arthur, and Odile. Franz, a young man with Alain Delon good looks, has met Odile in an English class. She lives in Joinville with wealthy benefactors and has mentioned to Franz that Mr. Stolz keeps a pile of 10,000 franc notes unlocked in his room. Franz tells his friend Arthur, a swarthy guy whose shady uncle is pressing him for money. Arthur and Franz, who mimic American movie tough guys, case Odile's house, pressure her to assist them with a burglary, and make passes at her as well. She's alternately compliant and distressed. Will they pull off the heist? (imdb)
film.quote: It's an endearing and adventurous movie; the classic dance scene and moment of silence scene prove that. It's funny while working well as a crime drama, with fun dialogue and compelling characters. Ultimately, it's not as experimental as some other Godard films, but the accessibility does not mean it's sub-par. This is brilliant film making.

film.filmname: Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice (2016)
film.summary: Fearing the actions of a god-like Super Hero left unchecked, Gotham City's own formidable, forceful vigilante takes on Metropolis' most revered, modern-day savior, while the world wrestles with what sort of hero it really needs. And with Batman and Superman at war with one another, a new threat quickly arises, putting mankind in greater danger than it's ever known before. (imdb)
film.quote: I love it, and the hate is unfounded. It feels like a comic book, whereas Nolan did not (and stop comparing the two! They're entirely different). The action was crunchy and intense, the music was wonderful outside of one misguided track and placement, Ben did great and so did Galdot. I understood everything that went on so I don't know where it's incoherent, and I think it has more depth than it's given credit for, but ultimately style over substance isn't actually a bad thing.

film.summary: Tough cop Dave Bannion takes on a politically powerful crime syndicate. (imdb)
film.quote: Just an excellent noir with compelling characters all around and an exciting plot with enough twists and turns to keep it going, filmed beautifully by Mr. Lang. Never boring, never stupid, plenty of fantastic dialogue and performances. So you know, it was okay or whatever.

film.summary: When a devastating event befalls the city of San Fransokyo and catapults Hiro into the midst of danger, he turns to Baymax and his close friends adrenaline junkie Go Go Tomago, neatnik Wasabi, chemistry whiz Honey Lemon and fanboy Fred. Determined to uncover the mystery, Hiro transforms his friends into a band of high-tech heroes called "Big Hero 6." (imdb)
film.quote: The first half or so is hilarious, and Baymax is a big reason for that. The movie shifts once the superhero sections really get underway and sacrifices its humour (for the most part) for action and emotion. There's an incredibly dark but effective scene scattered in there, and most everything works. It's formulaic but tackles some pretty mature elements with finesse and charm. Also; great animation.

film.summary: Private detective Philip Marlowe is hired by a rich family. Before the complex case is over, he&#039;s seen murder, blackmail, and what might be love (imdb)
film.quote: Bogie, Noir, a complex and confusing as hell plot with lots of twists and turns. So basically: awesome.

film.summary: A washed-up actor who once played an iconic superhero must overcome his ego and family trouble as he mounts a Broadway play in a bid to reclaim his past glory.
film.quote: There's very little in Birdman that isn't brilliant. The way the editing and filming was done to make it look like one shot (and as if life is like live theatre) was amazing. Keaton was fantastic but everyone else did well too. Though I wouldn't listen to the music outside of the movie, in context it's great... Love the usage of drums. Great satire, funny, is really saying something... But it is also surreal and well, kinda silly (in a good way).

film.summary: This is the story of 1970s African-American action legend Black Dynamite. The Man killed his brother, pumped heroin into local orphanages, and flooded the ghetto with adulterated malt liquor. Black Dynamite was the one hero willing to fight The Man all the way from the blood-soaked city streets to the hallowed halls of the Honky House. (imdb)
film.quote: This is just absolutely hilarious. It does a wonderful job of being both a tribute and a parody. Fantastic stuff with a lot of great one liners. And yeah, the music is awesome. DYNOMITE, DYNOMITE.

film.summary: 15-year-old Adèle dreams of finding the love of her life. When she meets Thomas - a dark, handsome, friendly stranger who falls for her instantly - her dream seems to have come true. But an unsettling erotic reverie upsets the romance before it begins. Adèle imagines that the mysterious, blue-haired girl she encountered in the street slips into her bed and possesses her with an overwhelming voluptuous pleasure. (wildbunch.biz)
film.quote: STOP GIVING ME BONERS. Both leads give a dazzling performance to the point I just said dazzling which I never do, but Adele is the best by far, because she perfectly conveys every inch of sadness or happiness at every second it is needed. It's an intensely gripping coming of age tale that humanizes everything and everyone perfectly. It moves along at a perfect pace so it doesn't even feel like it's 3 hours. Beautiful film making on all fronts.

film.summary: The story of a a young man who has spent his life searching for revenge only to find himself up against a bigger challenge than he originally bargained for. (imdb)
film.quote: This is style over substance. It's very stylish, using origami, great colours and everything. The action is stylish. It puts together a few different genres in an extremely fun way. There are so many awesome scenes but this really is about the style and visuals. The plot is interesting and dystopian, the fights are cool, the characters are interesting (and good homages to the genres included in here) and the music is sweet. Even the end credits are cool because of the Patton song.

film.summary: Political interference in the Avengers' activities causes a rift between former allies Captain America and Iron Man. (imdb)
film.quote: I usually really enjoy superhero movies these days, and I'm not ashamed. This is another Marvel movie, but the formula continues to work. There is some heart, and some great action, and the plot moves along at a brisk pace, but people who haven't seen other movies won't know what's going on. Superhero overload hasn't set in for me yet, so I appreciate what they've done here. Still engaging and exciting, even while lacking a sense of gravitas. Separate oneself from Civil War comics, however.

film.summary: A short anime based on the legendary manga Nekojiru. (imdb comments)
film.quote: It had some really inventive animation, which went from being really odd, to cute, to disturbing, to original. But it was also difficult to understand what was going on, since it's a surreal black comedy. It has really powerful music that fits the scenes really well.

film.summary: At Helge's 60th birthday party, some unpleasant family truths are revealed.
film.quote: Definitely succeeds at what Dogme 95 sets out to do: Return movies back to realism and narrative. It offers a simplistic plot but the characters are alive, the acting is superb and when everything eventually comes apart it is both beautiful and ugly. Excellent choice of credit music as well. Great film.

film.summary: After being kidnapped by two criminals during birth, Chappie becomes the adopted son in a strange and dysfunctional family. Chappie is preternaturally gifted, one of a kind, a prodigy. He also happens to be a robot. (imdb)
film.quote: This is sadder than District 9. While D9 was more socio-political, Chappie is more about social conditioning and what it's like to bring children into a scary world. Because of this, Chappie is an incredibly memorable character (I love his voice and how he talks), and there's a lot of depth here. Yo-Landi, Dev, and Ninja all do a great job, Jackman is expendable, but Copley is the star here as Chappie. Some of the tone shifts don't work. There are some really crushing scenes here... fuck humans.

film.summary: An invading army destroys all color in a harmless town and brings it in a state of depression. Then a jester arrives. (imdb)
film.quote: Playful, somewhat brutal (when you consider what the army is doing), fun, meaningful, artistic and intelligent. Chromophobia tackles the idea of individuality--both seemingly in society and in the military--with a lot of finesse. It's a lot simpler to follow than some of his other works that I've seen, but it's also his strongest because it's able to take this to a logical and exciting extreme. The 10 minutes zoom by.

film.summary: Three high school friends gain superpowers after making an incredible discovery. Soon, though, they find their lives spinning out of control and their bond tested as they embrace their darker sides. (imdb)
film.quote: Sucker for superhero films AND films shot with this style. Sure, the handheld camera thing always makes you go "why is there a camera here?" but outside of that sometimes wonkiness (that all movies in this genre suffer from on occasion), this is so engaging. It's got drama, cool action, wonderful acting, and a nice little mysterious origin story. It's deeper than you'd think, the characters aren't cardboard cutouts, and I was into it from the very beginning.

film.summary: Six stories set in a different time and place become intricately related to each other. (imdb)
film.quote: While there were moments where I was less entertained by certain parts of the narrative, all in all, I was interested in all of the six stories. I'm also a big fan of genre bending and tone shifting, and CA does that in spades. I thought the acting was solid, the music was beautiful, the visuals were gorgeous. Yes, it has that heavy-handedness that might turn off some but some movies have it, and some are more subtle, I appreciate both styles. It all comes together with an emotional payoff.

film.summary: Revolves around a monster attack in New York as told from the point of view of a small group of people. (imdb)
film.quote: It was awesome. The monster was really cool and now that I know the story behind it it's just that much cooler. Competent acting and camera work that makes you feel like you're there, along with some inspired scenes (horse and buggy for example) created an incredible atmosphere. I had loads of fun watching this and since it's short it doesn't overstay its welcome.

film.summary: A cab driver finds himself the hostage of an engaging contract killer as he makes his rounds from hit to hit during one night in LA. He must find a way to save both himself and one last victim.
film.quote: Exciting with a great performance by Cruise, this is a solid flick with some nice choices in the music. It also has good direction from Mann and some pretty nice cinematography.

film.summary: Paul Javal, a writer, is hired to work out a script for the new movie about Ulisses, directed by Fritz Lang and produced by Prokosch (imdb)
film.quote: Flashy. Not a lot of emotional weight behind it, it is a really original, adventerous flick.

film.summary: This feature documentary analyzes the very nature of the corporate institution, its impacts on our planet, and what people are doing in response. (Zeitgeist Films)
film.quote: I want to give it a 100 but that would indicate classic status. This issue is very important to me so I'm bias.

film.summary: A man brutally murdered comes back to life as an undead avenger of his and his fiancée&#039;s murder (imdb)
film.quote: Incredibly moody and gothic with a great score that sets the scenes wonderfully. Some of it is a bit overly cheesy (such as playing a guitar on a rooftop then smashing it), but for the most part it just oozes badassery. Seriously, Brandon Lee was fantastic in this; watching him dispatch his enemies was a joy because he was brutal but also incredibly odd. Plus, the movie managed to hit some emotional points, and it's always nice with a revenge flick has genuine heart.

film.filmname: Dawn of the Planet of the Apes (2014)
film.summary: A growing nation of genetically evolved apes led by Caesar is threatened by a band of human survivors of the devastating virus unleashed a decade earlier. They reach a fragile peace, but it proves short-lived, as both sides are brought to the brink of a war that will determine who will emerge as Earth's dominant species. (imdb)
film.quote: I was only going to give this an 85 but there wasn't a moment that I didn't enjoy this movie, and for a lot of it I can honestly say I was in love with it. The beginning, before all the combat starts, is well-written and emotional. It's not the deepest social commentary in the world but it's done incredibly, and it's hard not to feel things... all the time. I was surprised with how much it turned me into a little baby. When the fighting happened it was good, but the highlight is before all that.

film.summary: An ex-tennis pro carries out a plot to murder his wife. When things go wrong, he improvises a brilliant plan B. (imdb)
film.quote: I love how it mostly takes place in one room because it makes it a character in itself and makes it feel claustrophobic. I also enjoy how one simple thing, a latchkey, is the main focus. It's brilliantly told with excellent dialogue that is snappy and clever, with convincing acting all around. So much entertainment and tension is found within.

film.summary: A three-part depiction of various forms of communication. &#039;Exhaustive Discussion&#039; depicts three heads (made up of fruit, kitchen utensils and writing implements respectively) endlessly devouring and regurgitating each other. &#039;Passionate Discourse&#039; shows two clay figures romantically intertwined, and the problems with dealing with the end product of their passion, while &#039;Factual Conversation&#039; shows two animated heads playing a bizarre variant of the old scissors-paper-stone game. (imdb)
film.quote: Great animation, with a great message. I think I get it all, and it's certainly nice seeing the communication and breakdown of communication in all of them. I liked all 3 segments, the 1st was a little creepy to me, the second hurt my feelings, and the 3rd was a nice way to wrap it all up.

film.summary: A neurosurgeon with a destroyed career sets out to repair his hands only to find himself protecting the world from inter-dimensional threats.
film.quote: I'm either easy to please or I'm just THAT into these movies that I can rate this a 90. Not a hard 90, but a 90 nevertheless. Anyway, sometimes Marvel cuts the nuts off their villains with unnecessary attempts at comedy (because heaven forbid they're too serious) that briefly break my immersion, and this isn't overly funny, but the Doctor is awesome, the story is fine, the visuals are outstanding and the environmental manipulation makes for truly exciting action. Marvel formula, but with magic.

film.summary: The latest battle in the eternal war between Good and Evil has come to New Jersey in the late, late 20th Century. In Kevin Smith's comic fantasia Dogma, angels, demons, apostles and prophets (of a sort) walk among the cynics and innocents of America and duke it out for the fate of humankind. (Lions Gate Films)
film.quote: By far its Smith's biggest commentary. There are a few parts that are really lame and stupid, and Hayek is horrible by default, but it isn't short on laughs.

film.summary: The beautiful fugitive Grace arrives in the isolated Dogville on the run from a team of gangsters. With some encouragement from Tom, the self-appointed town spokesman, the little community agrees to hide her and in return, Grace agrees to work for them.
An insurance rep lets himself be talked into a murder/insurance fraud scheme that arouses an insurance investigator&#039;s suspicions. (imdb)

film.filmname: Dr. Strangelove or: How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Love the Bomb (1964)
film.summary: An insane general starts a process to nuclear holocaust that a war room of politicians and generals frantically try to stop. (imdb)

Bob is a bartender at a bar. Marv, his cousin, ceded ownership of the bar to Chechen mobsters and now operates it with Bob as a 'drop' for illegal takings. One night, Nadia discovers Bob rescuing a battered pit bull abandoned in her garbage can. The bar is robbed by two masked gunmen. The next day, Chovka, the face of the Chechen mob, shows up and warns Marv he must retrieve the money. It is later revealed that Marv orchestrated the robbery by meeting with one of the perpetrators.
film.quote: Slow-paced but expertly written, it has an awesome narrative. Hardy was incredible in this in the same way Rocky worked, with his simplistic outlook (though this goes in interesting directions later) on life, and Gandolfini did a great job too. When the violence happens it is intense like violence should be, and everything just works really well.

film.summary: The mysterious and charismatic Russian-born Nikolai Luzhin is a driver for one of London&#039;s most notorious organized crime families of Eastern European origin. The family is part of the Vory V Zakone criminal brotherhood. Headed by Semyon--whose courtly charm as the welcoming proprietor of the plush Trans-Siberian restaurant impeccably masks a cold, brutal core--the family is tested by Semyon&#039;s volatile son and enforcer, Kirill, who is more tightly bound to Nikolai than to his own father. (Focus Features)
film.quote: A pretty straight forward Cronenberg gangster flick. I like this direction for him. He's done the body horror, now he's dealing with a seedy underworld. Viggo and Naomi (doesn't hurt that I have the hots for her) all turn in wonderful performances and there is some gritty realism here. The twists and turns are interesting and never seem forced, all building towards a wonderful climax. Plus, the shower scene. Wow.

film.summary: A soldier fighting in a war with aliens finds himself caught in a time loop of his last day in the battle, though he becomes better skilled along the way. (imdb)
film.quote: I really dug this. It's smart, and thrilling almost the entire time. Blunt is lovely and her and Cruise have chemistry. The action is really intense, and it actually feels like the aliens are a real threat as opposed to just being things to shoot. The ending is a little Hollywood, but I guess that's to be expected. I also like Sci-Fi movies with a sword in them, I don't know why.

film.summary: Film star Vince Chase and his cronies take on Hollywood. (imdb)
film.quote: I mean, I love Entourage. It does a lot of the same shit that the show does but that's what I wanted. It's shallow on the surface but there is a genuine heart beating below with the way these friends have each others backs, which keeps the endless cameos and sex from becoming typical fluff. It's one of the funnier movies of the year and while early reviews have not been amazing, I really enjoyed myself.

film.summary: Ten of Muhammad Ali's former rivals pay tribute to the three-time world heavyweight champion. (imdb)
film.quote: Obviously it's about Ali, and the impact he has had on boxing (and the world). It's also about the impact boxing had on him, for better and worse, but also about his rivals lives. It's an interesting idea for a documentary... you learn about Ali, you learn about them as well. It's got a touching ending, and it was well put together.

film.summary: Original premiere in 2006 at the Toronto Film Festival. In a hospital a little girl with a broken collar bone meets a bedridden man who starts telling her a fantastical story which reflects his state of mind. As time goes by fiction and reality start to intertwine in this uplifting epic fantasy. (imdb)
Nightmarish experimental short.
film.quote: I have a bias towards experimental things so that helps explain the 90, but here's my justification: every now again there's a horror film that makes you feel like you've stumbled across something you shouldn't be seeing. This happens more with shorts, because it's harder to stretch that feeling out to a feature length, but this does it. No, I don't know what the fuck is going on, but the imagery worked. Also, the noise in the beginning portion is fantastic and terrifying, same with the end.

film.summary: An African-American father struggles with race relations in the United States while trying to raise his family in the 1950s and coming to terms with the events of his life. (imdb)
film.quote: Loved it but it's heavily dependent on the performances, specifically Washington and David, but everybody else was believable. That's important because this ends up being one of those movies where you almost forget you are watching something, because everybody is so invested in these characters that it's easy to become invested yourself. I don't understand some of the criticisms because this is fantastic and raw filmmaking. It's just always nice to see Denzel though, so there's bias on my part.

film.summary: Treachery is discovered amongst a traveling circus sideshow. (imdb)
film.quote: Awesome. I was most surprised by how invested I was in the characters. Browning could have just played it all for shock value (which, in '32 it woulda been shocking), but he didn't. There's real heart here, and the drama between them all is fascinating. That doesn't mean that there aren't some eerie parts though, like the chase in the rain at the end. To the credit of all involved, that tonal shift actually worked.

film.filmname: From One Second to the Next (2013)
film.summary: Documentary about the dangers of texting and driving.
film.quote: Pretty much the perfect road safety ad. It makes you feel like complete shit. That's a good thing. Just depressing, well shot, nothing new for such a legendary director.

film.summary: The true story of Oscar, a 22-year-old Bay Area resident who crosses paths with friends, enemies, family and strangers on the last day of 2008. (sundance.org)
film.quote: Incredibly emotional piece. Some of it is a bit too much, too unsubtle and in your face (in a bad way), but that's a pretty minimal problem when you consider by the end I was so invested in what was going on that I had forgotten the bad. Great song playing during the credits, wonderful performance by Jordan, and the beginning (with the real footage) was a great way to start. Gritty, cruel, cold, unflinching, sentimental, all of these things describe this movie.

film.summary: The story of an 18-year-old marine recruit named Private Joker - from his carnage-and-machismo boot camp to his climactic involvement in the heavy fighting in Hue during the 1968 Tet Offensive. [Warner Bros.]
After trying to rescue a man on the subway tracks, two teens wake up in a room dominated by a mysterious black sphere that sends them to hunt down and kill aliens hiding on Earth. (imdb)
film.quote: I don't know if reading the manga would change my expectations, but I thought this was a lot of fun! It makes you wonder why this is happening, what the hell is going on? I can't wait to see the next one. The bosses were cool, I liked the music, I liked the acting, I liked pretty much everything. It felt like such a video game, and in that way it made it thrilling. What I like is that it doesn't pretend to be something it's not... movies can take place in unrealistic worlds. Gantz embraces that.

film.summary: Kei Kurono (Kazunari Ninomiya) and Masaru Kato (Kenichi Matsuyama) are summoned by the mysterious black globe GANTZ. They continue the fight against extraterrestrial beings and, as they continue to battle, they become stronger. Kei Kurono opts to keep fighting to survive, but Masaru Kato hates the world which is controlled by violence and refuses to fight. As the two friends finds themselves opposing each other in a continuous game of violence, a critical last choice is to be made ... (asianmediawiki.com)
film.quote: I'm giving both the same ranking but they're sort of different. The first had more action and weirder boss battles and raised questions. This one doesn't have as much action and the couple bosses are more normal, but the story breathes more and tries to answer questions. It doesn't answer it fully which some critics noted but I like that it's sort of vague. Too often we're just gifted answers. Very entertained by these Wuxia/Saw/Sci-Fi/ hybrids. It made me think about what it all means.

film.filmname: George Carlin: Life Is Worth Losing (2005)
film.summary: George Carlin continues making people laugh with his 13th HBO stand-up special. (imdb)
A female cyborg cop and her partner hunt a mysterious and powerful hacker called the Puppet Master (imdb)
film.quote: Beautifully animated with great action when it happens (that tank scene is wonderful and a clear influence on something else I love, Metal Gear Solid). It asks heavy questions about sex/gender and identity, in a blunt way that is a bit confusing regardless. It could probably use more exposition to explain the world that it has set up, but I got the general idea. I give special attention to the music which actually added a lot to the scenes.

film.summary: Bounty killers led by Loco prey on outlaws hiding out in the snowbound Utah mountains. After Pauline's husband becomes Loco's latest victim, she hires a gunman for revenge; Silence, mute since his throat was cut as a child. (imdb)
film.quote: Satisfies on all fronts. Has a badass main character, some fun Western moodiness, snow (it's a nice change), it's shot well (though dubbed horribly), and even though it doesn't appear to do a whole lot different with the Western at first, the ending displays a set of balls that most movies today can't even imagine having. What a depressing and violent ending. It takes what may have been an 80 or 85 and turns it into a hard 90. One of the more memorable endings I think I've seen.

film.summary: In his mesmerizing new film, acclaimed director Werner Herzog explores the life and death of amateur grizzly bear expert and wildlife preservationist Timothy Treadwell. (Lions Gate Films)
film.quote: Timothy is interesting enough by himself but what makes this even better -- besides the great footage, and the interesting subject matter -- is Herzog's commentary. He's poetic but never pretentious and always fascinating. I like how he, not surprisingly, concentrates a lot on the film making process.

film.summary: A weatherman finds himself living the same day over and over again.

A soldier introduces himself to the Peterson family, claiming to be a friend of their son who died in action. After the young man is welcomed into their home, a series of accidental deaths seem to be connected to his presence. (imdb)
film.quote: Stevens was awesome in the lead; so charming. The movie itself is 80s like Drive (but campier), with its style (especially later on) and badass synth soundtrack, but it's also compelling because it goes from a tense thriller, to a minor Sci-Fi government conspiracy movie, to a campy, slasher flick. It's sure to not please everybody, especially as it goes straight 80s later on, but the mixture of tone, influences and genres worked hard for me.

film.filmname: Harold and Kumar Go to White Castle (2004)
film.summary: In the great cinematic tradition of &#034;Road Trip&#034; and &#034;Dude, Where&#039;s My Car?&#034; comes Harold and Kumar Go to White Castle, which follows two likeable underdogs who set out on a Friday night quest to satisfy their craving for White Castle hamburgers and end up on an epic journey of deep thoughts, deeper inhaling and a wild road trip as un-PC as it gets. (New Line Cinema)
film.quote: This is one of my favourite comedies of all time. It was a go to movie when I was bored.

film.summary: From award-winning directors Steve Balderson and Elizabeth Spear comes this special presentation of three episodes from their never before released prime-time horror-comedy series HELL TOWN. These episodes are the painstakingly remastered episodes seven, eight and nine of Season Two. Seasons One and Three were completely destroyed in a studio fire. The executives suspected arson. (imdb)
film.quote: A great parody/homage to melodramatic soap operas AND slasher flicks. It's about actors playing actors on a television show so while the dialogue is intentionally hammy, it's also delivered with a lot of conviction. The cinematography brilliantly mimics the way soap operas look as well. It's just a really great time if you're looking for something silly and funny.

film.filmname: Henry: Portrait of a Serial Killer (1986)
film.summary: Based on the true life serial killer, Henry Lee Lucas. (imdb)

film.filmname: Homeless: A Mile In Their Shoes (2012)
film.summary: A documentary where homeless people talk about what it's like being homeless, along with addressing the stigma around it and the reasons why they're homeless. (Myself)
film.quote: Necessary viewing for people who hate homeless people. I don't have enough room to say a lot about the subject but yes, some are, but others aren't. You can't judge an entire group based on some. So with that said, Abel just lets them talk, and that's really all he should have done anyway: let them give THEIR side of the story, because lord knows we hear the other side enough. Though this is in the UK, the stories are pretty much universal, anyway.

film.summary: In this action-packed comedy from the makers of "Shaun of the Dead," Nicholas Angel (Pegg) is the finest police officer London has to offer, with an arrest record 400% higher than any other officer on the force. He's so good, he makes everyone else look bad. As a result, Angel's superiors send him to a place where his talents won't be quite so embarrassing -- the sleepy and seemingly crime-free village of Sandford. A small village is about to get some big city justice. (Rogue Pictures)
film.quote: I don't know why I had this at an 84... this is a 90, this is one of the best comedies I've ever seen. Part homage, part parody, all awesome (yeah that was cheesy!)

film.summary: An artist in crisis is haunted by nightmares from the past in Ingmar Bergman&#039;s only horror film, which takes place on a windy island... (imdb)
film.quote: Definitely belongs to another time, or at least in a different category of horror movie than audiences are used to these days: meaning that it's more creepy than outright scary. But I dig that because I want to have something gnaw away at me rather than throw meaningless jump scares my way. This is effective but it's interesting, has great performances, looks wonderful and showcases Bergman's talent in a completely different genre than we're accustomed to seeing him in.

film.summary: A short documentary about life in an Iranian Leper Colony.
film.quote: This isn't a documentary that gives you facts. Instead it impacts you in a more visual way. The images are depressing and affective, and the movie is very poetic. It can depress you but it also offers hope, as these people do have a community while they're getting treated, so the film does show some light. Very accomplished piece of cinema, it makes me say things like "very accomplished piece of cinema," which I'd never say otherwise.

film.summary: Katniss Everdeen and Peeta Mellark become targets of the Capitol after their victory in the 74th Hunger Games sparks a rebellion in the Districts of Panem. (imdb)
film.quote: I've never read the books, but god damn I love these movies. Since the series is "young adult," it's obviously not going to be as gritty as perhaps it could be, but I don't even care about that. What matters is that while the dystopia isn't the best ever, it is still good and interesting. But it's the characters and relationships that put it up to a 90. The actual games are still interesting, it has a great cliffhanger, Lawrence (and everyone) was great. This is YA done right.

film.summary: Katniss Everdeen is in District 13 after she shatters the games forever. Under the leadership of President Coin and the advice of her trusted friends, Katniss spreads her wings as she fights to save Peeta and a nation moved by her courage. (imdb)
film.quote: I'm apparently a massive HG apologist despite never reading the books. I just dig these movies. I think this was awesome. Was it slow? Kinda, but it was a good slow. It was building and building, watching the little acts of rebellion was intense. This was darker and more gritty, with less comic relief and a general sense of urgency. Sure, it doesn't have a ton of action but it doesn't need it because the action that does take place has huge consequences. Part 1 tried something a little diff.

film.summary: After being symbolized as the "Mockingjay," Katniss Everdeen and District 13 engage in an all-out revolution against the autocratic Capitol. (imdb)
film.quote: Anybody who hates this movie can come get some (please don't, I'm a wimp). In all seriousness, this is incredibly grim and satisfying. It has great performances but Lawrence especially is amazing. It's a little predictable but that doesn't mean it's not still engaging... it's expertly written and acted so it's easy to get lost in it. The ending is balls (it should have ended with "Your love for me... real or fake? "Real." But they decided to extend it. Lame. Anyway, awesome.

film.summary: Kanji Watanabe is a longtime bureaucrat in a city office who, along with the rest of the office, spends his entire working life doing nothing... (imdb)
film.quote: A movie built around a great performance by the lead. This movie is slow paced but in a great way... you watch the main character pull himself out of a mindless way of life to do something good and meaningful with himself. It has some really iconic shots. While the tale of Kanji is uplifting, I think that the rest of the movie is kind of depressing in a way.

film.summary: After series of bad events in her life, Elvira, a transsexual, undergoes an emotional journey to reexamine her life and sexual identity.
In Nazi-occupied France during WW2, a group of Jewish-American soldiers known as "The Basterds" are chosen specifically to spread fear throughout the Third Reich by scalping and killing Nazis.
film.quote: It's typical Tarantino, in a good way instead of a bad way like in Death Proof. Some great dialogue, some bad-ass scenes, some humour, even some social commentary in exaggerated awesomeness that is this movie. It's just everything you want from a Tarantino flick, and is my fave of his besides Kill Bill.

film.summary: Experimental short, featuring strobe-like homoerotic imagery with several shots of the Rolling Stones in performance and an original synthesizer score by Mick Jagger. (imdb)
film.quote: The score is incredible, first and foremost. Another weird, experimental short with some crazy imagery that makes you scratch your head if you don't know what's going on, but you will still admire this.

film.summary: Between his tax problems and his legal battle with his wife for the custody of his daughter, these are hard times for the action movie star who finds that even Steven Seagal has pinched a role from him! In JCVD, Jean-Claude Van Damme returns to the country of his birth to seek the peace and tranquility he can no longer enjoy in the United States. (imdb)
film.quote: This movie was a lot better than I expected. I knew it was different for JCVD but not this different. The opening tracking shot really is great, and the 4th wall breaking monologue was also fantastic, showing off his acting skills. The story was interesting and just as a pretty original film, this thing works.

film.summary: A symbolic depiction of hell on Earth, set in the last days of the Warsaw uprising in 1944. (imdb)
film.quote: Drags you through war. Only complaint is that I couldn't really get into the characters so much (but still seeing the shit they go through is tough). The sewer part is easily the highlight... it's pretty scary and this is one of those films that want to make you feel above all else. Fuck conventional film making, this makes you feel claustrophobic because it's drenched in darkness.

film.summary: Kevin Smith conducts a Q&A session about the aftermath of his latest film, Red State. (imdb)
film.quote: I always love watching Kevin Smith talk. Even when he stops making movies, I'd still watch him talk. The fact that he kinda based it on Red State (an amazing movie, fuck the negative critics) made it even more interesting.

film.summary: Aspiring comic Rupert Pupkin wants to achieve success in showbiz, by resorting to stalking his idol, a late night talk show host who craves his own privacy.
film.quote: I really knew nothing about this but I'm glad I'm not the only person to think that it's a lot like Taxi Driver. That doesn't mean it's bad or unoriginal; it's just the tone is off in the same ways (in a good way). It's not really that funny, though it does have some decent jokes, but De Niro's performance is awesome and it's an unpredictable film; some of it is awkward and uncomfortable, but yet there is some sympathy here for the characters.

film.summary: A movie with no conventional plot: merely a collection of expertly photographed scenes. Subject matter has a highly environmental theme (imdb)
film.quote: It wasn't as moving to me as others, it seems. I appreciate this movie a lot and there's no denying the beauty of the shots and the subject matter. The music is usually on the mark and there's loads of talent here. I couldn't get into it as much as I would have liked, and don't fool yourself if you haven't seen this: It has no conventional dialogue, and is just scenery shots. But I still give it a high rating because it's incredibly daring and original.

film.summary: A young girl is born and raised to be an instrument of revenge. (imdb)
film.quote: Doesn't always work but it usually does. It does explore society issues a bit, but most people are probably watching it to see a girl get revenge. And it succeeds. The ending is wonderful, with a great atmospheric shot in the snow.

film.summary: A fine day in the life of a fly presented completely from the fly's point of view. A fine day until something dreary happens, that is. (imdb)
film.quote: Amazing soundtrack. But seriously: My. God. It's actually really... disgusting/disturbing. Like, just hearing the slapping seeing the fly get frantic through his own eyes and my god, trying to get out the window :( Great animation, as well.

film.summary: A scene from The Bells (1926) is optically reprinted and edited to Michael Gordon¹s 7 minute composition. A meditation on the fleeting nature of life and love, as seen through the roiling emulsion of an film. (imdb plot summary)
film.quote: I saw someone on youtube say, "it's like burning memories." I can't say anything better than that. I'll simply just add that the music is beautiful.

film.summary: Follows the epic adventures of a young lion cub named Simba as he struggles to accept the responsibilities of adulthood and his destined role as king of the jungle. (Disney)

In the near future, a weary Logan cares for an ailing Professor X in a hide out on the Mexican border. But Logan's attempts to hide from the world and his legacy are up-ended when a young mutant arrives, being pursued by dark forces. (imdb)
film.quote: Best X-Men movie since X2, but this is a different beast. It's a very personal tale that manages to touch on a view different relevant issues (like immigration obviously), while throwing in enough brutal Wolverine violence to be satisfying in that way as well. Stewart and Jackman are brilliant in their roles, as they always are, so I'd rather talk about how Keen is excellent; an actress who demonstrates acting ability well beyond her years. Also, yes, very sad, perfect ending too. The X cross!

film.summary: Donnie Yen takes up the role of China's legendary hero Guan Yu during the time before a great war begins within China. The Lost Bladesman follows Guan Yu as he tries to escort the wife of Liu Bei and escape the grasp of Cao Cao and his ever expanding presence.
film.quote: I realized I'm just a fan of these historical drama/action, live-action Dynasty Warriors films. If they get the basics right, I tend to enjoy them quite a bit. I like seeing crazy, inventive martial arts action, nice visuals and really, the story comes after all that. Luckily, this movie went even farther beyond just getting it right to being truly awesome, with some really inspired action scenes. A lot of fun, and interesting even when the fighting isn't going on.

film.summary: In this unique and dynamic live concert experience, Louis C.K.'s exploration of life after 40 destroys politically correct images of modern life with thoughts we have all had... but would rarely admit to. Louis C.K.: Hilarious, premiered at The Sundance Film Festival in January as the first stand-up concert film presented at Sundance. Filmed at the Pabst Theater in Milwaukee on April 18, 2009, Louis C.K.: Hilarious confirms why Louis C.K. is the most respected comedic voice of his generation. (Epix)
film.quote: It dragged in a few parts which kept it from being a 95 but the rest of the time it was so hilarious. I laughed so hard at the "what if there was a guy who everytime he did this [jerk off hand movement] he had to finish" part. As someone who has only seen a little bit of this guy before, I was impressed. Gonna check out his earlier stuff.

film.summary: When the police in a German city are unable to catch a child-murderer, other criminals join in the manhunt. (imdb)
A strange creature races against time to make the most important and beautiful creation of his life.
film.quote: The animation is beautiful and expressive, with the creature being surprisingly emotive. Sure, for most of it you're just watching this thing create something, and no matter how gorgeous it is, it wouldn't be deserving of anything more than an 80 (which is still hugely respectable). However, that ending puts it all into context and adds the proper oomph; it's not even that difficult to understand. Just appreciate life, work for happiness, find those people/things you love.

film.summary: A camera crew follows a serial killer/thief around as he exercises his craft. He expounds on art, music, nature, society, and life as he offs mailmen, pensioners, and random people. (imdb)
A young itinerant worker is forced to confront his secret extraterrestrial heritage when Earth is invaded by members of his race.
film.quote: Criticker doesn't allow me enough space to fully explain myself but, I love the dark tone, appreciate the absolute seriousness (because why does every movie have to be Marvel?), and I usually hate Supes but I cared here. Snyder, once again, showcases talent in perfectly blending insane action with an incredible soundtrack... which is his main focus generally. It's a little long, but generally moves along at a good pace. Script is fine enough to compliment the action and Cavill is convincing.

film.summary: Denzel Washington stars as a government operative/soldier of fortune who has pretty much given up on life. In Mexico City, he reluctantly agrees to take a job to protect a child (Fanning) whose parents are threatened by a wave of kidnappings. He eventually becomes close to the child and their relationship reawakens and rekindles his spirit. When she is abducted, his fiery rage is unleashed on those he feels responsible, and he stops at nothing to save her. (20th Century Fox)
After a vicious attacks leaves him brain-damaged and broke, Mark Hogancamp seeks recovery in "Marwencol", a 1/6th scale World War II-era town he creates in his backyard. (imdb)
film.quote: Hogancamp is an interesting, talented and sad man. At first you just kind of think the situation is sad (which it is definitely sad, and he was traumatized, among other things). Then you actually start to get involved in the actual art project itself. I found myself being intrigued in the stories he created. A fantastic glimpse into an interesting person, and a great examination of what art and what happens when your "therapy becomes art."

film.summary: A toy stuffed dog has just been sewn together when it hears a young child ask for an orange. The child's mother explains that they have no money, and so she cannot buy any oranges. The dog is then packed up along with a box full of other toys to be sold, but it soon winds up in the street... (imdb)
film.quote: Very very impressive. Good even by todays standards, trail blazing by 1934 standings (in terms of animation and whatnot). My favourite characters are; the lovable dog and the badass with a knife who stabs the devil (he doesn't give one little bit of a fuck). This is really good stuff though... an interesting story told mostly with visuals, a surreal Hell, and oranges. It's all about the orange.

film.summary: It is the future, and humans are divided into two groups: the thinkers, who make plans (but don't know how anything works), and the workers, who achieve goals (but don't have the vision). (imdb)
film.quote: I'm giving it a high rating because I know everyone has to see it. I didn't enjoy it as much as I could have. But the imagery and the message were brilliant, along with the astounding set pieces. Personal preference brings it down 10 points.

film.summary: A father and son go on the run after the dad learns his child possesses special powers. (imdb)
film.quote: Masterfully builds a sense of mystery, never divulging too much info or getting lost in pointless exposition; instead it uses its beautiful cinematography, music and acting to tell a story about a kid with superpowers. If you want answers, you're missing the point: we are thrown into the same shoes as the characters, the ambiguity is crucial. Also, MS drifts into some minor horror territory due to how grave certain things feel, but is a sci-fi flick at its core definitely. Wonderful road movie.

film.summary: The film travels through Finland and the camera joins men in many different saunas to let us hear touching stories about love, death, birth and friendship; about life. In all of its simplicity camera records the landscapes, saunas and men in almost magical pictures. The presence of the characters and the depth of the emotion reaches the limit where it is almost intolerable for the viewer to watch. (ses.fi)
film.quote: I love off-beat documentaries and this is slightly off-beat. It's a simple concept... a bunch of Finnish men from all walks of life in a sauna opening up. It's sometimes sad (I think mostly sad), but sometimes funny. Along with the beautiful imagery of Finland and the music, these stories go deep into one simple fact of life: No matter where we're from, what we do, what we wear, we're all more alike than we think.

film.summary: The IMF is shut down when it's implicated in the bombing of the Kremlin, causing Ethan Hunt and his new team to go rogue to clear their organization's name. (imdb)
film.quote: Not as good as the first, which is still a clever and interesting thrill ride, but this is also the best since the 1st and I can say I actually really like this. Yeah the melodrama was poorly played but the action (like the entire Dubai sequence) was pretty awesome and jaw-dropping. And the more gadget/espionage oriented parts were also entertaining. A nice return to form for the series. Also: I love Tom Cruise the actor.

film.filmname: Monty Python and the Holy Grail (1975)
film.summary: King Arthur and his knights embark on a low-budget search for the Grail, encountering many very silly obstacles (imdb)
film.quote: Definitely a wonderful comedy that subverts expectations and clichés and gives us one of the funniest movies ever. That ending is classic.

film.summary: A drama centered on two teenage boys who encounter a fugitive and pact to help him escape from an island in the Mississippi. (imdb)
film.quote: It's slow-paced but beautiful, with the scenery pretty much being a character by itself. Luckily Mud and Ellis are compelling leads, and the rest of the cast fleshes out the rest of the backbone of the movie. McConaughey gives a wonderful performance (and still manages to take off his shirt), and when the shit hits the fan at the end, it's more intense because of the tone of the rest of the film. It's hard to not feel something by the end.

film.summary: In this complex tale of suspense, set in the unreal universe of Los Angeles, writer/director David Lynch explores the city's schizophrenic nature, an uneasy blend of innocence and corruption, love and loneliness, beauty and depravity. (Universal Focus)
film.quote: Lynch shows why he's a master at surrealism. The plot doesn't get muddled amongst all the symbolism, it has a couple genuinely creepy parts, it's well acted, brilliantly edited. And this isn't even his best film.

film.summary: The Muppet character tell their version of the classic tale of an old and bitter miser's redemption on Christmas Eve. (imdb)
While on a grand world tour, The Muppets find themselves wrapped into an European jewel-heist caper headed by a Kermit the Frog look-alike and his dastardly sidekick. (imdb)
film.quote: It's not quite as good as the last one, but I thought the last one was awesome. This is a clever movie for all ages, and there are some really good gags scattered throughout. Of course it relies on knowing who the Muppets are, and I'll admit that I'm guilty of probably finding it funnier because of "nostalgia," but it doesn't change the fact that I loved it. "He's so stupid he can't be stupid, so he must be some sort of genius."

film.summary: A personal portrait of filmmaker Guy Maddin's hometown of Winnipeg, Manitoba. (imdb)
film.quote: For sure it's very very interesting and original. The narration becomes a bit much and sometimes seems forced, like it has to be more poetic than it should be, but then other times he's right on, mixing fact and fiction to create a work that explores memory, nostalgia and ultimately, the difficulty to truly leave your town/city (who you are) and the oppressive nature of this. Really liked the images and the cinematography as well. Also enjoyed his stuff about hockey rinks when he gets angry.

film.filmname: The Naked Gun: From the Files of Police Squad! (1988)
film.summary: Leslie Nielsen stars as Police Squad&#039;s own granite-jawed, rock-brained cop Frank Drebin, who bumbles across a mind-control scheme to assassinate Queen Elizabeth. Priscilla Presley, O.J. Simpson, a stuffed beaver, two baseball teams and an odd assortment of others join the wacko goings-on and blow the laugh-o-meter to smithereens. (Paramount)
film.quote: Sometimes you just need to laugh. This actually got funnier as it went on. The part at the baseball stadium had me cracking up the entire time.

film.summary: A private eye investigates the apparent suicide of a fading porn star in 1970s Los Angeles and uncovers a conspiracy. (imdb)
film.quote: This movie is special. Gosling is hilarious, Crowe plays a wonderful (and violent) straight man, and the chemistry between them is undeniable. There are some great laughs here and coming out of the theatre I said that "it had enough successful jokes to be a good comedy" rather than only having a few and failing like so many, but even when it's not funny it's stylish and entertaining. Any flaws here are insignificant.

film.summary: One of the most vivid depictions of the horrors of Nazi Concentration Camps. Filmed in 1955 at the post-war site of Auschwitz... (imdb)
film.quote: Can you imagine this back in 1955? I think that back then it would be more shocking but that doesn't mean it can't make an impact even today, that's how good it is. The narration is pitch perfect in describing it, even though he says he basically can't describe it. That, along with the images of both past and -- at the time -- present, this is a really great documentary and should be necessary viewing in History courses.

film.summary: A sinister crook posing as a preacher pursues two children for the secret they are privy to of the location of a cache of money. (imdb)
film.quote: Excellent usage of lighting/shadows that really make everything seem more menacing. Brilliant acting by Mitchum as the very evil Harry Powell. Everything is just on point here, whether it's the blend of horror and comedy, or the German Expressionism (distorted buildings in a fake looking town is brilliant). Such a lovely film, even today, and a bit of an oddball in cinema history.

film.summary: A look at the New World Order, a pro-wrestling organization that took the wrestling world by storm.
film.quote: If for some reason you saw my review for the Attitude Era movie (that I submitted), I'm pretty much going to say the same thing here: big wrestling fan, there's a lot of bias here because of that. I just love hearing about the NWO, reliving the memories where I would look forward to WCW every week, and then go to school the next day and talk about it with my friends. I also love the Sting part, &quot;like he was in mourning.&quot; That's beautiful. It's also nice to see the docu touch on the bad

film.filmname: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest (1975)
film.summary: Upon arrival at a mental institution, a brash rebel rallies the patients together to take on the oppressive Nurse Ratched, a woman more a dictator than a nurse. (imdb)
A happy, carefree couple is haunted by a demonic spirit. (imdb)
film.quote: The ending is a great climax and ties into the themes of the movie. The night scenes were always creepy and you felt safe during the day until they turn that on you. This is a really great, human flick that uses its low budget really well. If every movie was filmed like this it would get boring but they aren't, and also, this film is very psychological in a way a lot of horror movies aren't.

film.summary: A misunderstood boy who can speak with the dead, takes on ghosts, zombies and grown-ups to save his town from a centuries-old curse. (imdb)
film.quote: While the story is nothing that different really, what makes ParaNorman so good is how well it's told: with heart and intelligence. I laughed numerous times, and I won't lie... the movie touched me a couple times, especially in the last section, which is so brilliantly done it leaves "kids" movies with a lot to live up to. Hell, the whole movie does. It straddles the line between kid and adult really well. Ultimately a kids horror-comedy, it's adult enough for older people as well.

film.summary: A couple are driving home to their kids when their car runs out of gas just as the Purge commences. Meanwhile, Leo goes out into the streets to get revenge on the man who killed his son, and a mother and daughter run from their home after assailants destroy it. The five people meet up as they attempt to survive the night in Los Angeles. (imdb)
film.quote: I like it more than the original because instead of a horror movie they just decided to make it a mixture of Escape from New York and The Warriors (in terms of there being different, silly groups of people). Because of this, it was a lot of fun. The social commentary is very heavy-handed and at one point perhaps a little too blunt, even for me, but at least it was there. I think this will end up being a flick I deem "underrated" in years to come.

film.summary: Two years after choosing not to kill the man who killed his son, former police sergeant Barnes has become head of security for Senator Charlene Roan, the front runner in the next Presidential election due to her vow to eliminate the Purge. (imdb)
film.quote: Since the Purge became Escape from New York meets The Warriors with the second one, it's been fun. Same things I liked about Anarchy applies here: ridiculousness, a message (no matter how heavy handed, who cares?), talking points, awesome masks, awesome violence, and an eeriness as you watch the disturbing nature of humans; though if you're watching these as horror movies you're doing it wrong. Not as good as the second but still wonderful trashy entertainment.

film.summary: When a naive young woman marries a rich widower, they settle in his gigantic mansion, where she finds the memory of the first wife maintaining a grip on her husband and the servants. (imdb)
film.quote: A nice drama/noir movie with really great direction. Not one missed shot/poorly used camera angle. Excellent use of shadows, lighting and mood. Excellent use of suspense as well. Some nice plot twists here and there.

film.summary: A horror film in which a group of misfits encounter fundamentalism gone to the extreme in Middle America.
film.quote: It's militant satire. The beginning really over stressed the gay elements of the movie. Then the script worked itself out. It goes from horror to action, and there's some comedy thrown in. I always like Goodman, Parks was great. The tone is unsettling, there are a lot of twists that I liked. It was unpredictable with some nicely done deaths. It's darin' cuz Smith didn't restrain himself at all. I like the trumpet part. And the explanation to it. Lack of soundtrack was interesting.

film.summary: Gambler Jack Green (Statham) enters into a game with potentially deadly consequences. (imdb)
film.quote: I might just be horribly pretentious but I dug this film. A lot. It's complex yeah, but it opens itself up for repeat viewings. This is my favourite Ritchie film for that reason among others, such as the convincing performances, enjoyable characters, interesting and deep script and the stylish direction and cinematography.

film.summary: A documentary which examines copyright issues in the information age. (imdb)
film.quote: I'll admit it, I love the idea of the remix culture so I'm a little biased. It's not even that I listen to the music or watch the videos very often or whatever, I just absolutely love the idea. This docu could have gone into a little more detail, maybe like, say an idea of what can be done, but I guess that might not be the point. It says a lot about how bullshit the copyright system is and doubles as a love letter to the culture and, especially, Girl Talk.

film.filmname: Rogue One: A Star Wars Story (2016)
film.summary: Rebel spies make a risky move to steal the plans to the Empire's ultimate weapon, the Death Star. Setting up the epic saga to follow.
film.quote: It doesn't have the scale or excitement of a new Episode, for obvious reasons, but as it approached I kept saying I think it'll be a better MOVIE than The Force Awakens. Tyler was right! It's gritty but with enough comedy (mostly from K-2SO) to make it genuinely funny. I actually cared about these characters quite a bit. The ending scene was fantastic. My only issue is that Whitaker sometimes hams it up and he did here; luckily he wasn't around a lot. Smaller story but intimate and exciting.

film.summary: Obsessed with teaching his victims the value of life, a deranged, sadistic serial killer is abducting morally wayward people and forcing them to play horrific games for their own survival. Faced with impossible choices, each victim must struggle to win back his/her life, or else die trying. (Lions Gate Films)
film.quote: This movie succeeds because they used their low budget to their advantage, thinking up an idea that heavily revolves around not having the money to make expansive set pieces. Two guys in a room. Very little gore, an interesting villain (if slightly offbase), decent enough performances that are only sometimes poor, a creepy score and an excellent plot twist. See this, you don't really need the other 84392. (Predicting the future, y'see.)

film.summary: In a small dilapidated village in post-communist Hungary, life has come to a virtual standstill. The autumn rains have started. The villagers expect to receive a large cash payment that evening, and then plan to leave. Some want to abscond earlier with more than their fair share of the money... (imdb)
film.quote: More "damp" than overly depressing (it's pretty funny at times), this is a richly detailed world and characterization isn't always easy to pick up on but it's there amongst the long, atmospheric shots. Though it didn't get to me as much as Werckmeister Harmonies, it's still an emotional film with a bunch of memorable scenes. I especially loved the doctor. This is a fantastic film but on occasion I couldn't get as into what was happening as I had hoped.

film.summary: Scott Pilgrim must defeat his new girlfriend's seven evil exes in order to win her heart.

A quiet filling-station attendant runs away from the police. While escaping, he meets father Lucas, whose doorman happens to be a key piece in completing the puzzle that helps to unveil 'The Secdleto of the Tlumpeta'. (Cinema16.org)
film.quote: EXACTLY what chemical404 said. I don't think I can word it any better than that. I sat there, not having a clue what was going on, but some of the jokes just made me laugh out loud. It had such a fun pacing to it, it was hard not to get completely lost in it. I love the helicopter bit.

film.summary: Two big city detectives (Pitt, Freeman) find themselves on the trail of a vicious serial killer that chooses his victims according to the seven deadly sins. (New Line Cinema)
film.quote: Stylish, interesting film, with great acting from the two leads. It asks good questions and not enough can be said about the classic ending.

film.summary: The plot couldn&#039;t be simpler or its attack on capital punishment (and the act of killing in general) more direct (imdb)
film.quote: Decalogue is great, so this is a wonderful extension of an episode of it. The ugliness of the area -- the usage of colours and filters -- really adds to the experience. Although it tells a simple tale of a man who kills another man and then gets executed, it is emotionally told without being melodramatic, and while the soundtrack is slim, the reoccurring song is amazing.

film.summary: The eerie and deserted town of Silent Hill draws a young mother desperate to find a cure for her only child&#039;s illness. Unable to accept the doctor&#039;s diagnosis that her daughter should be permanently institutionalized for psychiatric care, Rose (Mitchell) flees with her child, heading for the abandoned town in search of answers -- and ignoring the protests of her husband. (Sony Pictures)
film.quote: Okay, some of the time when the actors are talking you want to hit them with a rock, the script is sometimes mediocre at best and Sean Bean is pretty unnecessary. But the cinematography is absolutely fantastic and they really nailed the Silent Hill mythos/atmosphere. The monsters are right on. The ending is intense. I forgive the flaws of it because it feels so much like Silent Hill.

film.summary: Four tales of crime focusing around a muscular brute who's looking for the person responsible for the death of his beloved Goldie; a man fed up with Sin City's corrupt law enforcement who takes the law into his own hands after a horrible mistake; a cop who risks his life to protect a girl from a deformed pedophile; and a hitman looking to make a little cash.
film.quote: A stylish violent thriller-noir, and that's all it wants to be.

film.filmname: Sin City: A Dame to Kill For (2014)
film.summary: The town's most hard-boiled citizens cross paths with some of its more reviled inhabitants. (imdb)
film.quote: I rate it the same as the first but it's a LITTLE lesser. It's still worthy of a 90 though. I waited so long for this and it didn't disappoint me at all! Like the first, a stylish, violent film-noir, with badass characters. The black and white, with some symbolic colour, still works wonderfully and I had a lot of fun. Unlike most comic book movies, this actually feels like a comic book and doesn't just use the characters. I love me other CB movies, but it's nice to have a change like this.

film.summary: Several yakuza from Tokyo are sent to Okinawa to help end a gang war. The war escalates and the Tokyo drifters decide to lay low at the beach. (imdb)
film.quote: As my first Kitano movie, I didn't know what to expect. This has incredible tonal changes that really work, it's odd, and my love for almost anything Yakuza puts it over even more for me. Funny when it wants, violent when it wants... it's Yakuza: Beach House Vacation for the entire middle but it works somehow. Beautifully shot.

film.summary: Sutter is a high school senior who lives for the moment; Aimee is the introvert he attempts to "save." As their relationship deepens, the lines between right and wrong, friendship and love, and "saving" and corrupting become inextricably blurred. (sundance.org)
film.quote: Extremely compelling coming-of-age tale. Teller and Woodley put this on their backs... really, their chemistry is so god damn good and believable it's insane. It is pretty cripplingly depressing at times, but that's fine. It's not really funny, but it's wonderful watching these two share moments together and wrestle with their own problems. It's not a revelation, it's just an amazingly well put together movie on all fronts.

film.summary: Kevin, a man with at least 23 different personalities, is compelled to abduct three teenage girls. As they are held captive, a final personality - "The Beast" - begins to materialize. (imdb)
