film.quote: Not even ashamed of my love. Now, the twist took this from an 80 to a 90 because I can't remember the last time an ending amped me up as much as this. I also think McAvoy might be my early dark horse for best performance because he was dynamic. Sometimes I can't tell if Night is trying to be funny or his shit writing tendencies come out, much like in The Visit, but I can't even deny that I don't care cuz it's fun. He's always been a talented DIRECTOR but now he's regaining some prestige.

film.filmname: Stanley Kubrick: A Life in Pictures (2001)
film.summary: The career and life of Stanley Kubrick is explored through pictures, clips from his films, his old home movies, comments from his colleagues and a narration by Tom Cruise. (imdb)
film.quote: It's a great documentary about um, Kubrick. You learn things like you should, as it tackles different aspects of his personality and movies. So what if I teared up a little bit.

film.filmname: Star Wars: Episode IV - A New Hope (1977)
film.summary: A long time ago in a galaxy far, far away... Princess Leia (Fisher) is held hostage by the evil Imperial forces in their effort to quell the rebellion against the Galactic Empire. Luke Skywalker (Hamill) and Captain Han Solo (Ford) team together with the lovable droid duo, R2-D2 and C-3PO, to rescue the beautiful princess and restore justice in the galaxy. (20th Century Fox)
film.quote: Great start to a classic series. Though I find Hamill to be the weakest link, everyone else does a great job, especially Ford who is charming as hell. Amazing model work, great usage of special effects, a fun story, wonderful music, visuals that still look good today. Because of the talent involved, the sometimes corny dialogue is still cool. Not much more you can say, there's a reason it's so highly regarded.

film.filmname: Star Wars: Episode VI - Return of the Jedi (1983)
film.summary: Darth Vader and the Empire are building a new, indestructible Death Star. Meanwhile, Han Solo has been imprisoned, and Luke Skywalker has sent R2D2 and C3PO to try and free him. Princess Leia - disguised as a bounty hunter - and Chewbacca go along as well. The final battle takes place on the moon of Endor, with its natural inhabitants, the Ewoks, lending a hand to the rebels. Will Darth Vader and the dark side overcome the rebels and take over the universe ? (imdb)
film.quote: Star Wars sometimes rides that line between a little childish and more mature and dark. Empire was mostly dark, but this does a little bit of both. While I don't think the more lighthearted parts, like Endor, are bad, they're not what Return does best. I almost rated it a 95 though because of the last little while with Luke and Vader... riveting stuff. Besides that, just another great sci-fi flick, same elements as the previous two in the original trilogy. This is my second fave.

film.filmname: The Story of the Weeping Camel (2003)
film.summary: Set amid the cast expanse of South Mongolia's Gobi Desert, this film follows the adventures of a family of camel herders who face a crisis when one mother camel rejects her newborn, following a particularly difficult delivery. Invoking an ancient ritual, the family sends two of its young boys to the capital city to enlist the aid of a musician whom they believe will coax the mother camel into nursing her baby. (ThinkFilm)
film.quote: This is a documentary that basically crushed me. But at least it ends okay. It's slow and not very exciting and there's a lot of shots of camel faces, but if you're willing to get emotionally involved with a bunch of camels, then watch this.

film.summary: A young girl is institutionalized by her wicked stepfather. Retreating to an alternative reality as a coping strategy, she envisions a plan which will help her escape from the facility. (imdb)
film.quote: It's got all kinds of style, and that counts for a lot. It has boss battles, fun action sequences and amazing music. I wanted a little more badassery, because I thought this would be completely batshit insane, like Nicolas Cage batshit insane, and it wasn't QUITE to the level I expected, so I knocked it down a few points. But it's still amazing at what it does: provide crazy action entertainment. Fun as hell. Dark and kind of comical, too.

film.summary: Tommy Lee Jones and Samuel L. Jackson star in a two-character drama that examines the relationship between strangers who are brought together by desperate circumstances. (HBO)
film.quote: Fantastic acting and a fantastic script. It's a simple concept of two people in a room, talking, and really it couldn't be done any better. Jones and Jackson give some of their best performances, ever. I can't stress that enough: watching them was a treat. It's smart but emotional, even funny a few times. A movie about -- among other things -- belief, though I'd have to rewatch it to catch every single thought and view expressed, but really, they're both right in some ways.

film.summary: [Originally Released in 2008] A former spy (Neeson) relies on his old skills to save his estranged daughter (Grace), who has been forced into the slave trade. (imdb)
A mentally unstable Vietnam war veteran works as nighttime taxi driver in a city whose perceived decadence and sleaze feeds his urge to violently lash out. (IMDB.com)
This action adventure from the creators of &#034;South Park&#034; features an all-marionette cast as Team America, an international police force dedicated to maintaining global stability. (Paramount)

Nearly 10 years have passed since Sarah Connor was targeted for termination by a cyborg from the future. Now her son, John, the future leader of the resistance, is the target for a newer, more deadly terminator. Once again, the resistance has managed to send a protector back to attempt to save John and his mother Sarah. (imdb)

Thank You for Smoking is a fiercely satirical look at today's "culture of spin." The hero of the film is Nick Naylor (Eckhart), chief spokesman for Big Tobacco, who makes his living defending the rights of smokers and cigarette makers in today's neo-puritanical culture. (Fox Searchlight)
film.quote: Very funny, Network worthy satire. That says a lot. Eckhart once again proves that he's a great actor... but why does he get overlooked so much?

film.summary: On an island, Karin, a recently released mentally sick young woman, is spending her vacation with her husband Martin... (imdb)

Journalist David Farrier stumbles upon a mysterious tickling competition online. As he delves deeper he comes up against fierce resistance, but that doesnt stop him getting to the bottom of a story stranger than fiction. (imdb)
film.quote: Like Dear Zachary or The Imposter, this is a documentary that ends up being a bit of a thriller, due to the unexpected twists and turns. Within the first 5 minutes (when Farrier gets an email criticizing him for being gay, while the person defended tickling) I was hooked, and it just kept getting deeper and deeper. A pretty haunting look into abuse and threats in an online space, and the pathos of a twisted individual. Doesn't go into much detail about the fetish itself, so don't expect it to.

film.summary: Dislocation in time, time signatures, time as a philosophical concept, and slavery to time are some of the themes touched upon in this nine-minute, experimental film, which was written, directed, and produced by Jim Henson-and starred Jim Henson! Screened for the first time at the Museum of Modern Art in May of 1965, Time Piece enjoyed an eighteen-month run at one Manhattan movie theater and was nominated for an Academy Award for outstanding short subject. (imdb)

film.filmname: To Speak or Not to Speak (1970)
film.summary: A seemingly benign TV interviewer asks people in the street (and under the street), "What&#039;s your opinion about the actual political situation?" Several people fumble, one won&#039;t talk, and an older man who sits in an easy chair says, "Make love." (imdb)
film.quote: I don't think you could tackle this subject matter any better than this. At first it seems kind of silly and good but not great but then it just starts hitting you over the head with aggressive weirdness. Everything is symbolic and stuff becomes a mantra for us to hear over and over (consumerism for example), and it really hits how we don't say what we think in fear of what will happen. This is an amazing short.

film.summary: A cowboy toy is profoundly threatened and jealous when a fancy spaceman toy supplants him as top toy in a boy's room. (imdb)

Ninja and Yo Landi are wheelchair-bound lovers and real gangstas. They live in the outskirts ofcivilization, they shoot guns for fun, smoke massive joints, and sleep in the woods. They don’t have any bling to show for their gangsta cred, but the world deserves to know who they are. They’re tramps, and their wheels are starting to fall off. Ninja become despondent over their vagabond existence, but Yo Landi won’t let him give up. What ensues is straight up gangsta mayhem... (MUBI)
film.quote: It's just me with more Korine nuthuggery (see other rankings of his). You got to watch his films in a different state of mind if you want any chance of liking his shit. That's not saying the skill isn't there, but if you're not in the right mood, you won't be entertained. You know what you're getting with Korine... broken or non-existent narrative, beautiful (very underrated by haters) cinematography and a lot of WTF? This is more of the same. Gorgeous, weirdly poetic... and fucked.

film.summary: While video chatting one night, six high school friends receive a Skype message from a classmate who killed herself exactly one year ago. A first they think it's a prank, but when the girl starts revealing the friends' darkest secrets, they realize they are dealing with something out of this world, something that wants them dead. Told entirely from a young girl's computer desktop, Cybernatural redefines 'found footage' for a new generation of teens. (imdb)
film.quote: The gimmick works tremendously well so we should be encouraging filmmakers to take a chance on things like this, even if the concept might only be good as a one-and-done. Besides that, the relationships between the main characters are emotional and believable. Unfriended doesn't overuse tacky jump scares, but instead focuses on creeping you out. The few flaws that exist are slight. The humor works, and there are some incredibly memorable scenes.

film.summary: Ryan Bingham is a corporate downsizing expert whose cherished life on the road is threatened just as he is on the cusp of reaching ten million frequent flyer miles and just after he's met the frequent-traveler woman of his dreams.
film.quote: I thought I only liked it but I'm pretty sure I love it. I know this because it made me think a lot about my own life... not many movies really affect me like that. Not much more I can say, really.

film.summary: Set against the futuristic landscape of totalitarian Britain, V for Vendetta tells the story of a mild-mannered young woman named Evey who is rescued from a life-and-death situation by a masked man known only as "V." Incomparably charismatic and ferociously skilled in the art of combat and deception, V ignites a revolution when he urges his fellow citizens to rise up against tyranny and oppression. [RELEASED IN 2005]
film.quote: Even though it changes a bit from the graphic novel, this movie never failed to involve me in the story. And given the plot of it, I would say it did its job. But I'm also biased, because the subject matter is something I can relate to (no I don't blow things up).

film.summary: Young Vincent Malloy dreams of being just like Vincent Price and loses himself in macabre daydreams which annoys his mother. (imdb)

film.filmname: We Need to Talk About Kevin (2011)
film.summary: Kevin's mother struggles to love her strange child, despite the increasingly vicious things he says and does as he grows up. But Kevin is just getting started, and his final act will be beyond anything anyone imagined.
film.quote: Honestly, you can't help but feel something: disgust, sadness, anger, whatever. The film is so good at exploring its complex themes, where no shot is wasted, that it digs itself deep into you and it'll stay there. The way the music mixes so well with the great, stylish visuals (and the jumping back and forth between past and present), the acting... This is a dark as hell movie, and that's wonderful because it doesn't pull punches.

film.summary: After living a life marked by coldness, an aging professor is forced to confront the emptiness of his existence. (imdb)
film.quote: Tragic.

film.summary: An unflinching Ozark Mountain girl hacks through dangerous social terrain as she hunts down her drug-dealing father while trying to keep her family intact.
film.quote: I actually didn't know that this movie was going to be a redneck gangster flick. Jack Parsons already said "redneck mafia" so I guess I'm not original but that's what I thought while watching this. Great lead performance, great script. Really this film has just about everything going for it. Pretty subtle about the issues it tackles and all the better for it. Also loved the acting and the character of Teardrop... a badass in his own right.

film.summary: Two mutants come to a private academy for mutants whose resident superhero team must oppose a powerful mutant terrorist organization. (imdb)
The X-Men send Wolverine to the past in a desperate effort to change history and prevent an event that results in doom for both humans and mutants. (imdb)
film.quote: I'm just going to come out and say it. Continuity be damned, I loved this flick. I love the X-Men in general, and love the relationship because Prof. X and Magneto, so anytime I get to see that play out I'm interested. But there's more to this than that... it has great action scenes and commentary, and though time travel is always risky business, it does a pretty good job with it. Probably the best X-Men since the second. But I love the core series as a whole anyway (not the Wolverine spin-offs)

film.filmname: The Yakuza Papers 2: Deadly Fight in Hiroshima (1973)
film.summary: Hirono, now dug deep into a Japanese crime family based in Hiroshima, finds a new adversary in the person of Katsutoshi Otomo (Sonny Chiba), a ruthless killer who is willing to do anything to promote his family's interests. Meanwhile, Shoji Yamanaka (Kinya Kitaoji) is an ambitious criminal who quickly scales the hierarchy of the Muraoka family, but his fall proves as sudden as his ascent. (All Movie Guide)
film.quote: An improvement on the original because of more focus, less characters -- thus meaning more attention paid to the ones that exist -- and better violence. It's still a little confusing at times because there are still quite a few people, but you get the gist of it eventually. The violence is still incredibly gory and almost disgusting at times, and watching these alliances form and crumble is a treat. Chiba is incredible as an over-the-top killer who is a complete badass.

film.summary: Kinji Fukasaku's violent chronicle of mob warfare in post-war Hiroshima continues with this, the third film in the Yakuza Papers series. Shozo Hirono (Bunta Sugawara) struggles to remain independent and neutral in the midst of an ongoing battle between two mob families, but his drams of brokering a balance between them are dashed when a crime syndicate from Kobe enters the picture. (All Movie Guide)
film.quote: So far I've rated these pretty consistently, with the first being lower because it's ridiculously confusing for a while. I feel like I'm repeating but it is hard to follow this series because the lives of the Yakuza - with all their alliances, betrayals and people - is hard to follow. The movies move at a breakneck speed, are incredibly violent, but extremely fascinating. The quality doesn't really shift, and nothing (in terms of film making) changes from movie to movie, but Proxy War is great.

film.summary: A long-standing gang war on the streets of Hiroshima escalates despite police pressure in this, the fourth film in Kinji Fukasaku's Yakuza Papers series. It's 1964, and with the Tokyo Olympics turning the eyes of the world to Japan, lawmen have set out to keep the Yakuza -- Japan's organized crime system -- out of sight. (All Movie Guide)
film.quote: I've given every film a 90 except for the first, which got an 85, and there's good reason for that. Firstly, the quality is exceptional but secondly, these films don't change from one another very much. They start the same -- explaining what has happened -- and then end with something interesting that makes you want to watch the next. 4 actually has a bit more closure and emotion than the previous ones I felt, and the major conflict between police and Yakuza is thrilling.

film.summary: A little hedgehog, on the way to visit his friend the bear, gets lost in thick fog, where horses, dogs and even falling leaves take on a terrifying new aspect... (imdb)
film.quote: This flick has a real sense of mystery and the animation lends itself well to that. You always want to know what he's going to see next, there are a few moments of intrigue and beauty (like the tree), and I even laughed a couple times.

film.filmname: Zack and Miri Make a Porno (2008)
film.summary: Lifelong platonic friends Zack (Rogen) and Miri (Banks) look to solve their respective cashflow problems by making an adult film together. As the cameras roll, however, the duo begin to sense that they may have more feelings for each other than they previously thought. (imdb)

The action is set in a doll's house mock-up of a Victorian nursery. Cardboard figurines dance, china dolls consume each other, armies of tin soldiers are pummeled to dust by a porcelain baby whilst a large black cat weaves a pathway of destruction through the surrounding chaos. Jabberwocky celebrates childhood, but with its anarchic and violent imagery, it is no sugared idyll.
film.quote: I love how I'm not the only one who wanted to say "oh god that fucking cat" in my criticker review. Anyway, seriously, the cat is amazing and I lost it every time it came on. The surrealism does what surrealism does... it confuses the hell out of me, so I just have to stop and enjoy the images.

film.summary: A bubbly, ambitious TV journalist reports on the seemingly dull sedentary life of an urban fire station and a call to help a strange old lady locked in her apartment hardly seems worthy covering... (imdb)
film.quote: Very fucking scary. That's a enough for a review but since I'm long winded I'll add more. The atmosphere is brilliant, the acting is fantastic, it's got tons of scares and while the idea of it is pretty standard, the things I mentioned really elevate this beyond a typical zombie movie.

film.summary: Adam, a 27 year old man who is otherwise in excellent health, is suddenly diagnosed with cancer. He breaks the news to his girlfriend, his best friend and his mother, who is also dealing with her husband who has Alzheimer's disease. In the middle of it all, Adam also seeks therapy from a young and inexperienced therapist,assigned to him by the hospital, and befriends several older, wisecracking chemotherapy patients.
film.quote: "Hi. I have cancer." Anyway, first off... Anna Kendrick, awesome. Such a cute actress. Gordon-Levitt owned the role again, Rogan did what Rogan does. The movie is very very predictable but I wanted that... honestly I just wanted a feel good moment where he got the right girl, and this is what I got. Plus it's very very funny when it tries to be. It's also emotional when it wants to be. So really it succeeds on all fronts.

film.summary: The lives of screenwriter Charlie Kaufman, author Susan Orlean and orchid poacher John Laroche become strangely intertwined as each one's search for passion collides with the others' in this adaptation of the best-selling "The Orchid Thief."
A lone man fights his way across America in order to protect a sacred book that holds the secrets to saving humankind.
film.quote: Pretty big fan here. From what people were saying on the net, I thought this would be at best an average affair. This went way beyond those expectations. Some things are silly, but the plot definitely isn't... and I saw a lot of people shitting on things elsewhere for no real reason. It has great action, a great script and above all else... fantastic imagery. It also helps that it's smarter than a typical action movie and blends western elements in with a post-apocalyptic world. Underrated.

film.summary: Dr. Caligari&#039;s somnambulist, Cesare, and his deadly predictions. (imdb)
film.quote: The visuals are definitely the best part of this movie. Expressionism at its finest, really. The buildings are distorted which lends to the distorted reality feel of the movie and indeed the plotline. Everything else is rock solid. Definitely a grippin' silent.

film.summary: Lifelong best friends Holden (Affleck) and Banky (Lee) are enjoying success as the creators of the cult hit comic book "Bluntman and Chronic." When they meet fellow comic book artist Alyssa (Adams), Holden's desire for the beautiful charmer is immediate. Alyssa, however, has set her romantic sights elsewhere. (Miramax Films)
A depiction of a series of violent killings in Northern Ireland with no clue as to exactly who is responsible. (imdb)
film.quote: It's powerful. Without knowing a bit about the Troubles and the like, it seems like random acts of violence, but it gives us an unbiased glimpse at the problems, specifically the violence. It feels like a documentary, which helps but I don't know if you'd want to watch it more than once.

film.summary: In a futuristic world, a strict regime has eliminated war by suppressing emotions: books, art and music are strictly forbidden and feeling is a crime punishable by death. Cleric John Preston (Bale) is a top ranking government agent responsible for destroying those who resist the rules. When he misses a dose of Prozium, a mind-altering drug that hinders emotion, Preston, who has been trained to enforce the strict laws of the new regime, suddenly becomes the only person capable of overthrowing it.
film.quote: It doesn't know what dystopian book it wants to be but that's okay because it borrows from classics. Mix in Bale and some nice martial-arts gunplay, and you got yourself a great movie.

film.summary: A look at the early years of boxer "Irish" Micky Ward and his brother who helped train him before going pro in the mid 1980s.
film.quote: Christian Bale was amazing. Wahlberg was also great. In fact, everyone was good. Sure, it doesn't really stray too far from what you expect from a sports movie, but it does it really well.

film.summary: Malcolm and Sofia, two determined teens from the Bronx, are the ultimate graffiti-writers. When a rival gang buffs their latest masterpiece, they must hatch a plan to get revenge by tagging an iconic NYC landmark, but they need to raise $500 to pull off their spectacular scheme. (mubi.com)
film.quote: Didn't really know what to expect. I'm a fan of graffiti but it doesn't put a whole lot of emphasis on it. It's more just a part of their culture and that's great, because it adds more depth to the surprisingly compelling main characters, who hustle and grind and their relationship changes and develops naturally, not movie artificially. Compelling stuff. Fantastic, unexpected yet subtle ending.

film.filmname: Instructions for a Light and Sound Machine (2005)
film.summary: An attempt to transform a Roman Western into a Greek tragedy. (imdb)
film.quote: It's pretty amazing what Tscherkassky can do with footage, how he can alter the atmosphere and mood this well. It feels so otherworldly (I feel like I've said this about some of his other movies as well).

film.summary: A traumatized Vietnam war veteran finds out that his post-war life isn&#039;t what he believes it to be when he&#039;s attacked by horned creatures in the subway and his dead son comes to visit him. (imdb)
Faced with an unplanned pregnancy, an offbeat young woman makes an unusual and bizarre decision regarding her unborn child. (imdb)
film.quote: A while ago I would have given this a 70, but it's grown on me. I don't think the dialogue is as unrealistic as others -- just exaggerated -- and I think it captures the teens who go on the internet really well. I've seen them try to one up each other with things like bands constantly. This is a more realistic film than people say, and it's touching and sometimes funny. It's charming and Ellen Page is convincing in the role, not to mention pretty (it helps).

film.summary: Emile Hirsch plays a desperate Texas debtor who plots to kill his mother, with help of his family (Thomas Haden Church, Gina Gershon). They hire a crooked cop (Matthew McConaughey) to do the job, but Killer Joe asks for their teenage daughter (Juno Temple) as a "retainer." (tiff.net)
film.quote: Extremely gruesome violence, a great Southern Gothic feel, a fantastic performance by McConaughey (and really everyone else, but him being the most important character in the movie, he really shines). I didn't know what to expect going in but Killer Joe managed to be really dark and yet pretty funny at times. If you want an intense movie with pitch-black humor that will probably manage to make you uncomfortable at least once, check this out.

film.summary: Three unhappy teenage boys flee to the wilderness where they build a makeshift house and live off the land as masters of their own destiny. Or at least that’s the plan. (sundance.org)
film.quote: What surprised me most is how funny this is. I didn't even go in expecting much. Expected a slightly humorous indie dramedy, one that throws in a few jokes but is mostly a drama. But nah, this is really funny for the most part. I enjoy the musical choices a lot and of course it pulls on your heart strings like a good coming of age tale does.

film.summary: Little Miss Sunshine is an American family road comedy that shatters the mold. Brazenly satirical and yet deeply human, the film introduces audiences to one of the most endearingly fractured families in recent cinema history: the Hoovers, whose trip to a pre-pubescent beauty pageant results not only in comic mayhem but in death, transformation and a moving look at the surprising rewards of being losers in a winning-crazed culture. (Fox Searchlight Pictures)

After developing an addiction to the substance he uses to kill bugs, an exterminator accidentally murders his wife and becomes involved in a secret government plot being orchestrated by giant bugs in an Islamic port town in Africa. (imdb)
film.quote: Cronenberg takes a confusing novel, takes elements from it and flips it into something else. That's why this works. Adapting the novel for what it was would probably be a jumbled mess.

film.summary: Described as a &#034;fable of innocence,&#034; his latest film allows Todd Solondz to savor the profound flavor of moral complexity. (Wellspring Media)
film.quote: What an excellent idea. Solondz definitely has an imagination. Like his other movies, it dares you to laugh at what's going on but you can't help yourself since it's such good black comedy. Get it for the original gimmick, stay for the black comedy and the themes it explores.

film.summary: Pierrot escapes his boring society and travels from Paris to the Mediterranean Sea with Marianne, a girl chased by hit-men from Algeria. They lead an unorthodox life, always on the run. (imdb)

This film tells the real-life story of U.S. fighter pilot Dieter Dengler, a German-American shot down and captured in Laos during the Vietnam War. Dengler, to be played by Bale, organized a death-defying escape for a small band of POWs, including Duane Martin (Zahn). (imdb)
film.quote: Herzog and Bale are a match made in heaven. Both are willing to take risks and what comes out of it is a great, straight forward tale. It doesn't call too much attention to itself and makes Bale's surroundings the most intimidating character.

film.summary: A young man is confined in a mental hospital. Through a flashback we see that he was traumatized as a child... (imdb)

Based on the true childhood experiences of Noah Baumbach and his brother, The Squid and the Whale tells the touching story of two young boys dealing with their parents divorce in Brooklyn in the 1980's. (imdb)
film.quote: Gotta give lots of lovothe to the script, first and foremost. It is so totally honest it's heart breaking. The acting is all around great. It isn't brought down by typical indie bullshit; you might think it will be (I avoided renting it for a long time because of this) but ultimately it goes above and beyond that.

film.summary: A man and woman are drawn together, entangled in the life cycle of an ageless organism. Identity becomes an illusion as they struggle to assemble the loose fragments of wrecked lives. (sundance.org)
film.quote: When you watch this you can't help but get caught up in the beauty. It drifts through it, every shot is wonderfully staged, the lighting is on point and makes it truly feel special, while the confusing narrative still manages to be emotional. Right from the opening song I was grabbed by it (the soundtrack is fantastic). You honestly can't help but WANT to be poetic when you're talking about it.

film.summary: A lowly cable TV operator begins to see his life and the future of media spin out of control in a very unusual fashion when he acquires a new kind of programming for his station. (imdb)
film.quote: The peak of Cronenberg's body horror phase. This movie is filled with impressive, original imagery and a sense of dread and fear for where we're going in this world, with our obsessions.

film.summary: Based on the real life story of canyoneer Aron Ralston, who in 2003 was forced to self-amputate his arm after being stranded and pinned underneath a boulder inside of Bluejohn's Canyon in Utah.
film.quote: I couldn't help but compare it to Buried so my review will reflect that. This is more stylish and more emotional. I just felt a little more emotionally invested than I did Buried. Buried however, was more intense (because there were no scenes cutting away to help ease what you're watching). Franco also gives a great performance. This is flashier than Buried, with some great camera angles, and ultimately because of the happy ending, it's less gritty and depressing. So it depends on what you want.

film.summary: 5 Centimeters Per Second for the speed at which cherry blossom petals fall, petals being a metaphorical representation of humans, reminiscent of the slowness of life and how people often start together but slowly drift into their separate ways...
film.quote: This is a really gloomy movie, maybe it's because I've felt the long distance pain. Beautiful animation and soulful characters. Some really great scenery. The song at the end, while the lyrics fit, kind of kill the mood a bit. Anti-ending, cruel but affective.

film.summary: A close encounter of the third kind in Johannesburg.
film.quote: A great opening scene especially, with some fantastic, moody music. It's built on an interesting and original idea and it delivers as well. Yeah, the alien suit is a little wonky/fake looking but I'm assuming Neill didn't have a massive budget... and even so, the fact it's so clunky and unlike anything in this world adds to effect a bit.

film.filmname: All Watched Over by Machines of Loving Grace (2011)
film.summary: A series of films about how humans have been colonized by the machines we have built. Although we don't realize it, the way we see everything in the world today is through the eyes of the computers.
film.quote: It throws a lot of information at you, but I feel it does it in such a way that you can understand. It's always interesting, and I know these movies get praised for how informative they are (and it is informative) but I think the soundtrack was a nice touch, especially the NIN song (I'm not even a fan of NIN, but I like the instrumental songs).

film.summary: An assassin hides out in Italy for one last assignment.
film.quote: Thought this was a pretty great movie. It wasn't what I expected. I loved watching how an assassin lives day to day. What really got to me was the paranoia. I've never been an assassin (heh, heh) or anything, but I imagine this movie shows just how one would feel. Clooney is fantastic, his facial expressions tell so much. I also loved how there's very little backstory, it throws you in the here and now and lets you examine the situation without saying much.

film.summary: The setting is on a floating platform where a group of evenly and carefully placed men live. Each man is aware that the platform is not stable and in order not to fall to their deaths, they maintain a careful balance of weight to prevent the platform from tipping too far and cause them all to fall. This reasonably harmonious understanding is lost when one man pulls up a heavy trunk. In the ensuing struggle, balance is lost in more than one sense. (imdb)
film.quote: A very interesting look at greed and power. I like the animation, I like the design of the figures. I like the eerie atmosphere, I love that there are numbers on their backs. It's a very simple idea, and I don't mean that as an insult, because it's done well.

film.summary: Batman is wrongly implicated in a series of murders of mob bosses actually done by a new vigilante assassin. (imdb)
film.quote: The third best Batman movie. The Joker was great, the animation is solid but not amazing (though the atmosphere of Gotham is right on), the script is great. There were a few awkward moments in the voice acting but generally everyone was really good.

film.filmname: Batman: The Dark Knight Returns, Part 1 (2012)
film.summary: Batman (PETER WELLER) makes comeback
film.quote: More streamlined than the graphic novel, obviously, but it nails the neat ideas of it. The news segments, the debate on Batman, Batman being haunted by his past, good animation, everything works. Though some of the voice acting needs improvement, that doesn't really take away from the experience that much. I really like a lot of these Batman animated movies, I think it's kind of cool to see these alongside the more 'realistic' Nolan ones, though the Nolan movies are better.

film.summary: Batman faces his ultimate challenge as the mysterious Red Hood takes Gotham City by firestorm. One part vigilante, one part criminal kingpin, Red Hood begins cleaning up Gotham with the efficiency of Batman, but without following the same ethical code. (imdb)
film.quote: I mean, generally if a movie is at least a competent Batman movie, I rate it highly because I'm in love with Batman, but this is a genuinely good film (but I still rate it a few points higher than I should perhaps because it's Batman). Some of the dialogue is wonky but I enjoyed the action scenes. At the same time, some of the dialogue is badass, and the last fight and the very last scene are epic and touching. The story is well told and interesting, the animation is good.

film.summary: An experimental film, consisting of abstract shapes and colors shifting to the rhythm and variations in the music. This short was made by painting directly onto a film strip. (imdb)
film.quote: Beautiful abstract images leave you with something to think about. How does it fit in with the wonderful score? That's part of the beauty of it. If you didn't know how this was done, especially in this day and age, you may not appreciate it as it should be because it is experimental and artist intent is important here. But even so, as a couple other people said, a great marriage of music and image. Powerful and avant-garde.

film.summary: Craig, a puppeteer, takes a filing job in a low-ceilinged office in Manhattan. Although married to the slightly askew Lotte, he hits on a colleague, the sexually frank Maxine. She's bored but snaps awake when he finds a portal leading inside John Malkovich: for 15 minutes you see, hear, and feel whatever JM is doing, then you fall out by the New Jersey Turnpike... (imdb)

When "The Dude" Lebowski is mistaken for a millionaire Lebowski, two thugs urinate on his rug to coerce him into paying a debt he knows nothing about. While attempting to gain recompense for the ruined rug from his wealthy counterpart, he accepts a one-time job with high pay-off. He enlists the help of his bowling buddy, Walter, a gun-toting Jewish-convert with anger issues. Deception leads to more trouble, and it soon seems that everyone from porn empire tycoons to nihilists want something from The Dude. (imdb)
Harrison Ford stars as former detective Rick Deckard who is on the hunt for "replicants," androids, attempting to pass as humans in technogrunge 2019 Los Angeles.

Set in a small American town, Blue Velvet is a dark, sensuous mystery involving the intertwining lives of four very different individuals. The film&#039;s painful realism reminds us that we are not immune to the disturbing events which transpire in Blue Velvet&#039;s sleepy community. There is a darker side of life waiting for us all. (De Laurentiis Entertainment Group Inc.)

film.filmname: Born on the Fourth of July (1989)
film.summary: The biography of Ron Kovic. Paralyzed in the Vietnam war, he becomes an anti-war and pro-human rights political activist after feeling betrayed by the country he fought for. (imdb)
film.quote: A surprisingly touching film about a soldier. Tom Cruise at his peak.

film.summary: A teenage loner pushes his way into the underworld of a high school crime ring to investigate the disappearance of his ex-girlfriend.
film.quote: This movie is alive. No, not literally (I hope). A hardboiled detective story set in the lives of high schoolers, with outrageous (in a good way) dialogue that owes a lot to the classics. Great film.

film.summary: A nondescript man is trapped in a sinister flat, where nothing seems to obey the laws of nature. (imdb)
film.quote: I'm usually a sucker for surrealism so I'm biased, but I enjoy the idea of a psycho apartment. And the end is classy as hell.

film.summary: In his first mission, James Bond must stop Le Chiffre, a banker to the world's terrorist organizations, from winning a high-stakes poker tournament at Casino Royale in Montenegro.
film.quote: A very good reboot of Bond, tracing his roots.

film.summary: A scientist in a surrealist society kidnaps children to steal their dreams, hoping that they slow his aging process.
film.quote: It's um... interesting. It's definitely completely out there and that makes it fascinating. The set designs are astounding and there are some fantastic ideas in there but like some others have said... it's quite goofy. It's nice to see a movie with such good ideas not taking itself completely seriously and I like ridiculous things, but sometimes it goes too far and you can't get the connection you need. But you need to see it because it's totally original and beautiful.

film.summary: Dave Chappelle returns to D.C. and riffs on politics, police, race relations, drugs, Sesame Street and more. (imdb)
film.quote: Really loved this. I also love how he works the baby from the projects back into it.

film.summary: Post-apocalyptic surrealist black comedy about the landlord of an apartment building who creates cannibalistic meals for his odd tenants. (imdb)
film.quote: This is only my second Jeunet film, so I'm assuming this type of visual style is the norm for him. Which isn't bad, not at all. It's one of those styles where you will always be able to tell it's a Jeunet film. I like musical saws, and there was a lot of weirdness and surrealism. The visual style adds this 'other worldly' feel to it, which makes sense considering what the movie's about. Post-apocalyptic? Goood. Surrealist black comedy? Goood. Cannibalism? Gooood. (Friends reference, I know).

film.summary: A genre-busting fable that blasts the American suburban drama into a wildly imaginative realm of time travel, alternative universes and the manipulation of one's fate.
film.quote: It's still a great movie, even after all the backlash, anti-backlash, anti-anti-backlash, etc. It's not the best movie you'll ever see but it has an inventive plot (although it is confusing) and it's a good experiment from Kelly. The acting is solid, the soundtrack is full of wonderful choices and Frank is an awesome character. The effects also work.

film.summary: It tells three unique stories of human self-destruction in the modern high-tech era. In a hope to restore the humane compassion in the insusceptible modern age, the film displays an alternative form of genuine humanity. (Wikipedia)
film.quote: All 3 segments, which are quite different in tone and plot, share a wonderful atmosphere, which sci-fi movies should. The first segment is a good look at the zombie genre. The second segment (the highlight of the film), is a look at robots and philosophy, an interesting dissection of humans and creation. The third is a pretty silly look at the apocalypse and pool, but after the seriousness in the previous, it was a nice break. All in all the two directors succeed wonderfully in all 3 parts.

film.summary: A nine-year-old amateur inventor, jewelry designer, astrophysicist, tambourine player, and pacifist searches New York for the lock that matches a mysterious key left by his father when he was killed in the September 11 attacks. (imdb)
film.quote: This is a movie I wish I had more space to write about it. First of all, the lead character is wonderful... this movie doesn't just use September 11 as some trite plot device, it's a backdrop and something that affected many. To those critics who actually found that offensive, fuck off. This is a touching tale that actually looks at autism in an interesting way. If the main character is "grating" to some, that's the point. Try living with autism or someone with it.

film.summary: A father says goodbye to his young daughter and leaves. As the wide Dutch landscapes live through their seasons so the girl lives through hers. She becomes a young woman, has a family and in time she becomes old, yet within her there is always a deep longing for her father. (imdb)
film.quote: Incredible animation and it's sad.

film.summary: Two years after Cloud & Co. saved the world from Sephiroth, the citizens of the planet begin suffering from a strange sickness called Seikon-Shoukougun (imdb)
film.quote: Disclaimer: I love FF7. This is for the fans of FF7. While the plot isn't worthy of much and it gets confusing, these are the same characters fans of the game loved to begin with. If I wasn't a fan of FF7, I'd probably say that the CGI is beautiful but that's about it.

film.summary: A comedy that charts the ups and downs of an engaged couple's relationship. (imdb)
film.quote: Segel and Blunt do a wonderful job together. I always like seeing Chris Pratt in anything because I liked Everwood a lot. I thought this was quite enjoyable; the laughs worked, the romance worked. They were a really nice couple that you could feel for. They gelled. There were a couple tone shifts here and there that took me out of it for a bit but in the end, this is one of the better rom-coms I've seen.

film.summary: Devastated Peter takes a Hawaii vacation in order to deal with recent break-up with his TV star girlfriend, Sarah. Little does he know Sarah's traveling to the same resort as her ex ... and she's bringing along her new boyfriend. (imdb)

Four Lions is the tale of four British Islamic jihadists and their bungling plan to detonate a bomb during the London marathon. As things don't go to plan their differing ideological ideals clash and their plans turn to farce. A comedy with tragic overtones about ideologies, terrorism and idiots.
film.quote: Very dry, but ultimately the second funniest movie I've seen from this year, as of December 15, 2010.

film.summary: It's a Bonnie and Clyde for the 21st Century as a 45 year old man and a teenage girl go on a killing spree in comedian Bobcat Goldthwait's angry and bloody black comedy. (tiff.net)
film.quote: It's obvious what the movie is directing its anger at. If you're a cranky old man, and accept that this movie applies to everyone in some way (like either they hate you or you hate something they hate), then you'll have a great time. They tackle bigger issues about America and whatnot, but then they go after little things like obnoxious movie-goers. The first little while is amazing, and while it gets a little more conventional, it stays good. Excellent satire.

film.summary: Abdel, a local hoodlum, is hospitalized after a riot, where a policeman lost his gun. His friend Vinz finds it and claims he will kill a cop if Abdel dies. (imdb)

In this biting romantic comedy, Rob Gordon (Cusack) is the owner of a semi-failing record store in Chicago, where he sells music the old-fashioned way -- on vinyl. His needle, however, skips the love groove when his long-time girlfriend, Laura (Hjejle), walks out on him. As he examines his failed attempts at romance and happiness, the process finds him being dragged, kicking and screaming, into adulthood. (Touchstone Pictures)

Devastated by an unspeakable tragedy while on the job as a hostage negotiator for the LAPD, Jeff Talley (Willis) resigns and accepts a low profile job as the chief of police in a sleepy town. On a slow Monday morning Talley&#039;s job becomes anything but quiet and sets him on a course that could change not only his professional but personal life forever. (Miramax)
A gripping exploration of the American Dream gone awry, House of Sand and Fog is the story of two people driven to desperate measures to claim ownership of a house. (DreamWorks Pictures)
film.quote: Going through this I knew it was depressing, and it definitely dampened my mood but it wasn't until about an hour and a half into it that it really hit me. And now, "I want only my son" is drilled into my head. The acting in this is all great, and while it's a bit slow, it works mostly because it truly builds. The characters are all very human. The movie doesn't choose a side so much as portray it realistically, and it goes to the logical end.

film.summary: A group of people gather at a house in a Copenhagen suburb to bring out the "inner idiot" in themselves.

film.filmname: If A Tree Falls: A Story of the E.L.F. (2011)
film.summary: A rare behind-the-curtain look at the Earth Liberation Front, the radical environmental group that the FBI calls America's 'number one domestic terrorist threat.'
film.quote: It gives you both sides of the story to some degree. Ultimately it comes down to whether you agree with the tactics or not, but it does a beautiful job of at least presenting actual information and not misinformation. The debate of peaceful/non-peaceful protest and "terrorism" will rage on, but viewers should at least be able to see that the E.L.F. aren't just crazies. The ending was perfect and heart-breaking and says that same type of thing.

film.summary: Decades of a love triangle concerning two friends and an impulsive woman.
film.quote: I doubt I can add much to what other people have said. I also really loved the freeze frames. It's impressive in almost every way, it's pure cinema. But I had a hard time really caring about the characters, despite them developing and despite the plot moving in interesting ways. A movie like this really depends on emotional attachment and as much as I appreciate everything else, it loses quite a few points because of this. Everything else is tops, though.

film.summary: A go-for-broke thriller about a professional assassin whose work becomes dangerously personal. Calling himself a "cleaner", the mysterious Leon is New York's top hitman. When his next-door neighbors are murdered, Leon becomes the unwilling guardian of the family's sole survivor - 12-year-old Mathilda.
film.quote: When there's action it's inspired action, but there isn't a lot of it, so you're treated mostly to a drama. And it works. Their relationship is a little odd at times, and you wonder what's going to happen. Luckily THAT doesn't happen. The ending was great, I felt emotional, and was glad Oldman got his.

film.summary: A bullied young boy befriends a young female vampire who lives in secrecy with her guardian.
film.quote: It's Let The Right One In. I'm iffy on giving such a thing such a high rating because it doesn't do much different, but at the same time, more people will be open to see this. If you've seen the original you don't have much of a reason to see it, but at the same time, it IS a great movie. Not as good, but still definitely worth your time.

film.filmname: Lone Wolf and Cub: Sword of Vengeance (1972)
film.summary: The story of a Ronin (i.e. a masterless samurai) who wanders the countryside of Japan with his small child, having various adventures. (imdb)
film.quote: Sometimes it's cheesy but that doesn't really matter to me. The action is great with its buckets of blood. I could say that maybe the story could use a little bit of tightening up because it's a tad confusing but it seems silly to say that when the movie is just so much fun. I don't really go into this genre or any revenge movie for an amazing story. This has a bunch going on in it but ultimately it just has to lead to action to satisfy. And it does.

film.summary: Trevor Reznik has not slept for a year. His every waking minute has become an unremitting nightmare of confusion, paranoia, guilt, anxiety and terror - each of which is part of an escalating series of clues that will lead to the source of his mysterious affliction. (Paramount Classics)
film.quote: This movie feels like the industrial genre in music. It's dark, surreal and slightly off putting. The cinematography succeds because of the oozing atmopshere that it helps create. Bale gives an incredible performance and by the time everything was revealed, I was slightly drained.

film.summary: On one random day in the San Fernando Valley, a dying father, a young wife, a male caretaker, a famous lost son, a police officer in love, a boy genius, an ex-boy genius, a game show host and an estranged daughter will each become part of a dazzling multiplicity of plots, but one story. (New Line Cinema)
A Watts teenager becomes so immersed in his violent world, he can&#039;t get out. (New Line Cinema)
film.quote: It's hard not to think about class when watching this, even though the movie briefly touches on racism. Class is the real issue. This is a great slice of life for gangsters, showing what happens after you've been raised in this kind of environment. Good acting, accurate script.

film.summary: An animator has died and the puppets he has spent his whole life animating, then proceed to animate him instead. It is a very personal experience as they treat him with the same tenderness as an animator would treat his puppets with. (imdb)
film.quote: Really quite touching meditation on what an artist puts into his work and whatnot. And it has a little humour in it too.

film.summary: Dutch (Schwarzenegger) and his elite military unit are recruited to rescue hostages held by guerrillas in the Latin American jungle. But once there, they encounter an enemy more deadly than any on earth! (20th Century Fox)
film.quote: Actually more to this -- possibly symbolically and just how it's made -- than you would think, but still best at being an action film. But the predator (and the Predator itself is awesome) and prey dynamic of it adds genuine drama to go along with the action. There are some really nice shots that I wasn't expecting, some nice cinematography. And now that that's over: "I ain't got time to bleed," "stick around," "If it bleeds we can kill it," "Bleed, bastard," "Knock, knock" etc. BOOM! DEAD TREES

film.summary: After trading in his professional past as a black-ops CIA agent for a new identity, Frank Moses (Bruce Willis) is basking in normalcy. But he's forced to return to old habits when a shadowy assassin puts a target on his back and goes after the woman (Mary-Louise Parker) he loves. Morgan Freeman, Helen Mirren and John Malkovich co-star as former members of Moses's team who reluctantly reassemble to save his life.
film.quote: I really dug it. It's different than the comic book but I felt everyone in this gave a great performance and I thought the movie was really funny.

film.summary: Left alone when her sister goes on vacation, a sexually repressed young beauty goes insane with surreal fantasies of seduction and rape. (imdb)

A father and his son walk alone through burned America. Nothing moves in the ravaged landscape save the ash on the wind and water. It is cold enough to crack stones, and, when the snow falls it is gray. The sky is dark. Their destination is the warmer south, although they don't know what, if anything, awaits them there.
film.quote: I'm not sure why some people criticize it for being too bleak. I mean, what do you expect? Anyway, the atmosphere is right on, the acting is superb. I don't feel like it's detached or unemotional at all. Sure, it's not the book, but at least it stuck true to the tone and the basic idea. That's all I expect, I didn't expect it to get all the critical details of the writing because it's not possible. So it's bleak, and never boring. Suicide party!

film.summary: Pot growers Ben and Chon face off against the Mexican drug cartel who kidnapped their shared girlfriend. (imdb)
film.quote: In the minority I guess but I really liked this. It had its flaws but for the most part were minor. I liked the characters, I liked the atmosphere. I also liked the masks (I know that's pretty shallow but fuck it, reminded me of Army of Two). I liked some of the conventions it broke. I'm iffy at this point on the ending. I thought the violence was actually horrific (in a good way). I don't really see why people don't like it. Because it's "heavy handed?" I thought it was well made.

film.summary: A journey inside the world of real life caped crusaders.
film.quote: I think it's a common reaction for people to think these people are weird, and I feel the movie tackles this well. The main theme is what you'd expect (superheroes saving the world), but it does it in a good way, with a nice narrative. A lot of them have had some troubled past, and this is brought together with a theme of the time the woman was wronged and nobody helped her (I forget her name). They are scoffed by some, embraced by others. Either way they're trying and often do help.

film.summary: Four stand-ups talk about comedy, stand-up and their moments.
film.quote: It's just a shame it's only 50 minutes long. Sitting, listening to these guys talk about comedy and whatnot was interesting, educational and yes, funny. But this isn't just them making jokes: they make them, certainly, but they go into depth about their routines and their philosophy.

film.summary: A Trans-Siberian train journey from China to Moscow becomes a thrilling chase of deception and murder when an American couple encounters a mysterious pair of fellow travelers. (imdb)
film.quote: Brad Anderson is a great American director that doesn't get enough credit. This is a more straight forward flick than anything he's done, but it's so emotional and so thrilling, which great performances all around, with sometimes astounding (a scene with a train through snow, for example) direction and rock solid cinematography.

film.summary: A group of astronomers go on an expedition to the moon. (imdb)
film.quote: It could get by on the fact that it was made in 1902 and has this kind of amazing art-design, but it takes a boring subject like travelling to the moon (though obviously not boring at the time) and makes it cool by fighting moon men who explode. It's actually just a solid short, regardless of age, though I wish I could have seen it in 1902 except for the fact if I had I'd be dead right now, thus robbing the world of this review.

film.summary: An execution takes an unexpected turn…
film.quote: You know what? Really dug this. I really didn't expect this. I knew it was going to be unexpected because of the summary, but not THIS. And it was awesome for it. Also, the ending was classy. Could have just faded to black afterwards but you were able to keep seeing the action for a few more seconds. Great, well shot dark comedy.

film.summary: A day in the lives of Owl, Tigger, Rabbit, Piglet, Pooh, Kanga, Roo, and Eeyore as they set up a trap to capture the evil 'Backson', who supossedly kidnapped Christopher Robin.
film.quote: You know, I didn't expect it to be a 88... it's Pooh so I figured it'd be worth it, but I won't even front, I was smiling a lot during this. You know what to expect, and it does it really well. Pooh made me laugh on numerous occasions. "Oh I don't remember thinking this through," was probably the biggest laugh for me. The movie is so gentle, so charming, so cute, with animation that's alive. The only issue is the length but at least you get a lot of bang in a short period of time.

film.summary: An entomologist searching for insects in the desert is trapped into a large hole where lives a women in an old house... (imdb)
film.quote: I agree with everyone that has said that this is a wonderfully made movie from a visual standpoint. I have no arguments against it... the sand is a character and the movie looks beautiful and dark. The acting was also good, the soundtrack was right-on. Where I feel the movie stumbles a bit is how it tells its narrative. I found it tedious at times. However, there were times I was thrilled by it, and wanted to see more. I was entertained a lot more than I was bored, but still.

film.summary: Five friends who reunite in an attempt to top their epic pub crawl from 20 years earlier unwittingly become humankind's only hope for survival. (imdb)
film.quote: It's not quite as funny as Hot Fuzz (very little is) and Shaun of the Dead but damn it was a good time. It worked as an apocalyptic action movie and obviously a comedy. The plot was pretty interesting though not really the reason I went anyway, and the social commentary was intriguing. It started off a little slow in terms of laughs and I felt like maybe they lost their edge, but as it went on I found myself consistently laughing. And that's all I wanted from the finale in this trilogy.

film.summary: As a serial killer terrifies the San Francisco Bay Area and taunts police with his ciphers and letters, investigators in four jurisdictions search for the murderer. The case will become an obsession for four men as their lives and careers are built and destroyed by the endless trail of clues.
A small-time rancher agrees to hold a captured outlaw who&#039;s awaiting a train to go to court in Yuma. A battle of wills ensues as the outlaw tries to psych out the rancher. (imdb)

Seven years after the death of his wife, company executive Aoyama is invited to sit in on auditions for an actress. Leafing through the resumés in advance, his eye is caught by Yamazaki Asami, a striking young woman with ballet training. On the day of the audition, she's the last person they see. Aoyama is hooked. He notes her number from her file, calls her and takes her to dinner. He hesitates to call again, worried that he'll seem too eager... (imdb)
A man is picked up by a fishing boat, bullet-riddled and without memory, then races to elude assassins and recover from amnesia.
film.quote: An intense, fast paced, urgent thriller from beginning to end and the start of a great action trilogy.

film.summary: Paul is a U.S. contractor working in Iraq. After an attack by a group of Iraqis he wakes to find he is buried alive inside a coffin. With only a lighter and a cell phone it's a race against time to escape this claustrophobic death trap.
film.quote: In a movie like this, obviously you need two things: A great script and a great lead performance. This movie has both. It also makes you feel for Paul, and is the most claustrophobic movie I've ever seen I think. In the vein of the first Saw (though different), where a really simple concept can be executed to perfection. I enjoyed the political content... yeah, it wasn't subtle but I don't feel like enough people think about it anyway.

film.summary: It's the last day of school at a high school in a small town in Texas in 1976. The upperclassmen are hazing the incoming freshmen, and everyone is trying to get stoned, drunk, or laid, even the football players that signed a pledge not to. (imdb)
An inside look at a maximum security prison in Texas featuring interviews with death row inmates. (imdb)
film.quote: Just really interesting stuff, partially because of the subject matter (who doesn't like this true crime shit?) and partially because Herzog is interesting AND knows what questions to ask. While he starts every episode telling you what he thinks, he mostly lets the people interviewed present their cases. Occasionally he makes a remark but it's so fun to hear him talk that it's okay. There is emotional depth here, and the element of "who's telling the truth?" is appealing.

film.summary: A man robs a bank to pay for his lover&#039;s operation; it turns into a hostage situation and a media circus. (imdb)
film.quote: Pacino runs shit in this movie -- he can't be faulted at all (I'm not even a huge Pacino fan). I agree with frederic_g54 that it feels messy and that the editing can get a bit wonky at times. It remains an exciting film based around a simple idea, wrapped in some anti-establishment sentiments (which are always good). It's a great film, it just didn't blow me away like I expected.

film.summary: Eddie Murphy's raunchy, raucous stand-up comedy routine is captured for posterity on this tape. Not for folks who dislike foul language. (imdb)

Tom Stall (Mortensen) is living a happy and quiet life with his lawyer wife (Bello) and their two children in the small town of Millbrook, Indiana, until one night their idyllic existence is shattered when Tom foils a vicious attempted robbery in his diner. (New Line Cinema)
film.quote: While it's pretty linear and predictable, I look at this as more of a character study and a portrayal on how families/towns handle violence. On that level it succeeds tremendously.

film.summary: A drama centered on the obscenity trial Allen Ginsberg faced after the publication of his poem, "Howl".
film.quote: Franco gives a great performance and while I definitely see where doctor7 is coming from about the visuals, I respectfully disagree. I see the visuals as a nice touch, but also, it's the film's creators interpretation of the film. Sometimes I ignored the visuals and listened to the words, other times I paid a little more attention to the visuals. I could be biased though in all this considering I enjoy the Beats and I also write.

film.summary: An honest, heartfelt and often amusing story about the man who wanted it all but got all that he needed. (Miramax Films)
film.quote: It's a simple and generic premise, but it's told so well that I forgive it. I can't believe how often this movie gets crapped on.

film.summary: Kafka, an insurance worker gets embroiled in an underground group after a co-worker is murdered. The underground group is responsible for bombings all over town, attempting to thwart a secret organization that controls the major events in society. He eventually penetrates the secret organization and must confront them.
film.quote: Thought it had a good atmosphere and good use of colour, while using an interesting idea of just "adapting" Kafka as a whole (in ways), and putting a murder-mystery in there. Someone said it's like Cronenberg's Naked Lunch and that's a good comparison, because Soderbergh did something very similar. Enjoyed it a lot, expected to come on here and see more glowing reviews. Don't see the hate.

film.summary: A love story between two people that each have a secret to hide. One a pro-wrestler, the other a Nun. Losing never felt so good. (imdb)
film.quote: Admittedly I'm a big pro-wrestling fan so the idea of love in the squared circle appeals to me. This doesn't have the traditional style of Japanese anime, which is nice, but it tells its tale mostly with visuals as there isn't much dialogue. It's easy to follow, and it's wonderfully insane. I'll probably like this more than a lot of people but there it is.

film.summary: A Hawaiian girl adopts an unusual pet who is actually an notorious extra-terrestrial fugitive from the law. (imdb)
film.quote: I liked this a lot more than I thought I would. Maybe it has gotten lost among other animated movies but you can't go wrong with this. It's funny with heart.

film.summary: Louis C.K.'s follow up to Shameless. (Spunkie)
film.quote: I honestly can't remember if this or Shameless is better. But this is awesome.

film.summary: In this action adventure film a lone Mariachi musician enters a small town at the same time as a hitman. They both wear black and carry similar guitar cases, except the Mariachi&#039;s contains his beloved guitar and the hitman&#039;s is full of weapons--as a result the Mariachi finds himself ushered into a violent underworld of crime. (Sony)
After meeting a group of rebels, a computer hacker who goes by the codename Neo learns that reality is not what it appears to be.

In Paris in the near future. Aging thieves Marc and Hans owe money to a tough American woman who gives them two weeks to pay. They scheme to steal and sell a new serum for a disease that's killing lovers, but they need someone with quick steady hands. They recruit Alex, a disaffected youth who's breaking up with Lise, his 16-year-old girlfriend. In the few days before the theft, Alex becomes enchanted with Anna, Marc's young mistress. They talk, they play, they sing, but she's in love with Marc. (imdb)

High school student Nick O'Leary, bassist of the queercore band The Jerk Offs, meets college-bound Norah Silverberg after a show. She asks him to fake being her boyfriend for five minutes to avoid being alone in front of a girl from school, but complications arise when the girl is Nick's ex, Tris, who's left him heartbroken.
film.quote: Oh my, that was awkward in the sexiest way possible. I'm just a sucker for movies like this I've found out. I don't even care how predictable it is... I was cheering for them from the very beginning and sometimes a happy ending is just necessary. Of course, the music is great and the screenplay is completely solid. Loved this more than I should have.

film.summary: When an alien attack threatens the Earth's existence, giant robots piloted by humans are deployed to fight off the menace. (imdb)
film.quote: Ebert says review based on what a movie is trying to accomplish. I agree. The story is okay, and the characters are compelling enough that you care. It promised over the top robots vs monsters. And it does this. Is the story cliche? Yes. But some people are waaaay too harsh on that. So many movies are cliche and have a focus on story... this isn't focused on that so the story is good enough. Over the top characters in an over the top movie is acceptable. Also the visual design is awesome.

film.summary: "Poslední lup" is a short film involving a young man who is breaking into an old house and stealing valuables that have just been left laying around, and as he is collecting stray pearls he realizes that there are feet and legs at this table, and looks up to find that he's not alone. (imdb comments)
film.quote: Sufficiently eerie, excellent visuals/colour.

film.summary: A young man named Rune is given a two-year sentence in prison, where he is exploited and abused by his fellow inmates, who engage in drug trade and violent conflicts within the prison.
film.quote: I hear that this is a lot like Un Prophete so maybe if I have seen it (it's in my queue), then I'd like this less? I don't know, but as it stands: this is a bleak, gritty story. It's not a real original story but due to the acting of Rune and Rashid (loved Rashid especially), the cinematography, the set design, the intense score, the ending (loved the still shot of the prison to end it), it rises above. Also, like another said, the documentary style approach is great.

film.summary: A woman discovers that her pregnancy is actually part of a satanic ritual. (imdb)
film.quote: This is a good showcase on how horror should be done. It doesn't jump out and scare you but it builds a creepy atmosphere which is usually more satisfying. In this case it definitely is.

film.summary: A misfit reindeer and his friends look for a place that will accept them. (imdb)
film.quote: One of my fave Christmas movies. Rudolph is so cute. Well, that was gay.

film.summary: A former elite agent takes on a two-tier mission: rescue a Chinese girl who's been abducted by the Triads, then use a safe combination to outwit the Russian Mafia, corrupt NYC officials, and the Triads themselves. (imdb)
film.quote: Really liked it. I like that it was so messy. Like Stewball said, there's a 4 sided war, and it's pretty much right from the beginning so instead of just Statham/kid vs Evil Bad Guys, everyone's shootin' at everyone. The little girl gave a good performance, the action was intense and interesting. And honestly, some of the scenes made me crack up (sandwich, running over guy, bashing Russian head in car). Some of these scenes have been done before but Safe handled some differently.

film.summary: A story centered on a man and his teddy bear, who comes to life as the result of a childhood wish. (imdb)
film.quote: Think this was one of the funnier movies of this year so far. Some great lines thrown in there. Even the emotional stuff worked. I like Wahlberg.

film.summary: While attending a party at James Franco's house, Seth Rogen, Jay Baruchel and many other celebrities are faced with the apocalypse. (imdb)
film.quote: At a certain point this was HILARIOUS, and had it kept going like that I could have seen me giving it a 95. But near the end it kind of tapered off a bit so it made me hold the rating back a bit. However... awesome ending, Danny McBride was the star (especially when he was introduced, I watched that scene twice), great music choices, and this should get props just for the self-referential premise, which makes it intriguing, and they pulled it off well. Not quite as good as Worlds End, but close.

film.summary: Harry Morgan and his alcoholic sidekick, Eddie, are based on the island of Martinique and crew a boat available for hire... (imdb)
film.quote: While it's Casablanca-lite, it's still good in pretty much every way, though it doesn't get to the point of being mind blowing, even though I could watch Bogart do just about anything. Including fucking my sister. Did I say that out loud?

film.summary: In a futuristic Bangkok where human cyber modification is the norm, Kaye finds himself on the run for stealing a particular augmentation in this visually stunning science fiction thriller. (Shortoftheweek.com)
film.quote: Very good futuristic short, worthy of the attention it's getting and the feature length treatment it will be getting as well. The visuals are astounding, the effects are truly awe-inspiring. The premise is cool too... an augmented reality where people get robot parts in order to live forever, thus making us no longer natural or organic. The short moves along well, describing the world and ending in a fitting way. Can't wait to see the feature length.

film.summary: A concise look at some of the more bizarre visual aspects of The Shining. Through interviews with collaborators, current filmmakers and authors, we'll examine how Kubrick used his unique brand of visual storytelling to convey madness, evil, and the power of the supernatural without relying on dialog or conventional exposition. As much as any film he ever made, The Shining illustrates Kubrick's talent for using the language of pure cinema to tell his stories. (imdb)
film.quote: Definitely shines even more light (things casual viewers wouldn't know) on a classic. That's what it sets out to do, that's what it does.

film.summary: The film develops into a series of very theatrical sequences which will tell the "story" of a man and his left hand.
film.quote: Not sure I entirely knew what was going on but it had an eerie and odd feel to it the entire time so it hit the right atmosphere. Plus the ending was classy. "I dreamed I was a negro." Done.

film.summary: A balloon wraps itself around a young child&#039;s hand, bringing him higher and higher, much to the child&#039;s delight... but... (imdb)
film.quote: Poor Billy :( This is a short with simplistic animation that's both darkly comic and sad. I enjoyed the 5 minute long one-note joke.

film.summary: On October 21, 1994, Heather Donahue, Joshua Leonard and Michael Williams hiked into Maryland&#039;s Black Hills Forest to shoot a documentary film on a local legend, &#034;The Blair Witch.&#034; They were never heard from again. One year later, their footage was found. The Blair Witch Project is their legacy. (Artisan Entertainment)
film.quote: The gimmick works because it plays on your fears. The less you see, the better. Despite how it was filmed, there actually were some really striking shots. The performances were actually solid and the ending. Oh god the ending. I just peed a little.

film.summary: Near Penn Station, next to the Amtrak tracks, squatters have been living for years. Marc Singer goes underground to live with them, and films this "family." A dozen or so men and one woman talk about their lives: horrors of childhood, jail time, losing children, being coke-heads. They scavenge, they've built themselves sturdy one-room shacks; they have pets, cook, chat, argue, give each other haircuts. A bucket is their toilet. Leaky overhead pipes are a source of water for showers. They live in virtual darkness. During the filming, Amtrak gives a 30-day eviction notice. (imdb)
A mysterious man with superpowers fights criminals, but nobody knows who he is and there is debate on whether what he does is good or bad.
film.quote: Right from the get-go with the news reports, it sets a mood. It's mysterious throughout the whole thing and builds tension really well, to the point where the movie actually really nails the paranoia of a superhero existing. The music is subtle but atmospheric and thoughtful. Even the way he flies sticks out, it's not as graceful and smooth as in some other movies/tv shows. It feels more realistic. I wish this was longer, but the way it ended was classy as well.

film.summary: A true American story of a group of young athletes, their town and their dreams. (Universal)

Gone Baby Gone follows the explosive case of just one missing little girl. But inside this investigation lie secrets and a labyrinthine maze of class and corruption, evil and innocence...all leading up to one man's extraordinary choice in a world where right and wrong have become blurred. (Miramax)
film.quote: The best thing about this movie is the attention to detail of the surrounding area, from the buildings to the way people act. Casey Afleck gives a great performance and the movie ends with a question.

film.summary: Astronauts attempt to return to earth after debris crashes into their space shuttle, leaving them drifting alone in space. (imdb)
film.quote: You definitely see this in a theatre because the visuals and cinematography are outstanding. Everything else about it is decent. There are some real hammy moments, but you come to this to see people lost in space, struggling, and it succeeds at that big time. Space/gravity (or lack of) is the best villain of all time, because some of it was just downright scary. With that said, I'm not feeling it on a personal level like some. It's still a great experience though. Just not quite a 90 for me.

film.summary: A journalist duo go on a tour of serial killer murder sites with two companions, unaware that one of them is a serial killer himself. (imdb)
Stand-up from Kumail Nanjiani.
film.quote: I gotta say, I've never heard Kumail stand-up before. I like the cut of his jib. Whether he's talking about Elephant Man, or Call of Duty, or something up in his attic, he had some really good material, and some of his finishes to his jokes were awesome.

film.summary: A sweeping love story told by a man (Garner) reading from his faded notebook to a woman in a nursing home (Rowlands), The Notebook follows the lives of two North Carolina teens from very different worlds who spend one indelible summer together before they are separated, first by her parents and then by WWII. (New Line Productions)

The Passion of The Christ focusses on the last twelve hours of Jesus of Nazareth's life. The film begins in the Garden of Gethsemane where Jesus has gone to pray after sitting the Last Supper. Jesus must resist the temptations of Satan. Betrayed by Judas Iscariot, Jesus is then arrested and taken within the city walls of Jerusalem where leaders of the Pharisees confront him with accusations of blasphemy and his trial results in a condemnation to death. (imdb)

A small-town sheriffs' department has to deal with an outbreak of murderous, infected people called "sickos." A gun-legged woman named Cherry (Rose McGowan) and her martial arts-wielding partner (Freddy Rodriguez) take on the zombie army. (IMDB)
film.quote: It's trashy and it's fun, with some really ridiculous things going on, but it's what Grindhouse needed.

film.summary: A team of explorers discover a clue to the origins of mankind on Earth, leading them on a journey to the darkest corners of the universe. There, they must fight a terrifying battle to save the future of the human race. (imdb)
film.quote: The first bit of it really captured a sense of awe, the plot moved wonderfully and the visuals helped. Had it continued like this it would be in the 90s. As the movie went on it got more predictable, but still had amazing visuals, and great horror. It lost some of its sense of wonder as it went on, but it was still entertaining. The conclusion wasn't as satisfactory as it could be, but it felt like a real sci-fi movie, not a wannabe, so props to Scott and crew.

film.summary: Charlie Kohler is a piano player in a bar. The waitress Lena is in love with him. One of Charlie&#039;s brothers, Chico, a crook, takes refuge in the bar because he is chased by two gangsters, Momo and Ernest (imdb)

It's the summer of 1994, and the streets of New York are pulsing with hip-hop. Set against this backdrop, Luke Shapiro (Josh Peck) spends his last summer before college selling dope throughout New York City, trading it with his shrink (Ben Kingsley) for therapy, while crushing on his step-daughter (Olivia Thirlby). (imdb)
film.quote: It's pretty standard indie dramedy but it has some heart. It's a really dark looking movie, which makes sense considering it's such a downer a lot of the time. It has excellent excellent music but a pretty generic "live life" message, but I thought the actors and the story was good enough to draw me in, and that's really all I need from a movie to recommend it.

film.summary: When a litter of dalmation puppies are abducted by the minions of Cruella De Vil, the parents must find them before she uses them for a diabolical fashion statement. (imdb)

A DEA agent and an undercover Naval Intelligence officer who have been tasked with investigating one another find they have been set up by the mob -- the very organization the two men believe they have been stealing money from. (imdb)
film.quote: Maybe I'm getting too easy on movies in my old age, but really? I'm one of the few people on here who thinks the movie was just a shit-ton of fun? I mean, Denzel and Wahlberg were just charming as fuck both solo and especially together.
