Does it make you miss those rivalries? The answer to both of those questions is "yes," and that's why it succeeds and is worth a watch.

film.summary: Sixteen years after the Revolution and just days before Christmas, a local television station in Bucharest has invited several guests to share their moments of glory, as they allegedly stormed city hall, chanting "down with Ceasescu!", before Romanian dictator Nicolae Ceausescu, and his wife fled the presidential palace by helicopter so many years ago. (Tartan USA)
film.quote: This was supposed to be a comedy too, right? I definitely found a few parts funny, but as a whole the movie was more clever than humorous. And it was definitely a clever script, so no bones to pick there. The cinematography is beautiful. It was refreshing to see a -- for lack of a better word -- artistic comedy, because I don't see that many of those since comedies focus more on the laughs than anything else (with good reason, y'know).

film.summary: The story of how two men change -- and change each other -- during a tense 16 block struggle between life and death. (Warner Bros.)

28 Weeks Later, the follow up to 28 Days Later, picks up six months after the rage virus has annihilated the Mainland Britain. The U.S. Army declares that the war against infection has been won, and that the reconstruction of the country can begin. As the first wave of refugees return, a family is reunited, but one of them unwittingly carries a terrible secret. The virus is not yet dead, and this time, it is more dangerous than ever. (Fox Atomic)
film.quote: Although I think the fact the father could think fairly logically after being infected is just a cheap way to make suspense (unless I'm missing something here), I still enjoy the rest of the movie. It's scary, hits a right on atmosphere, has great music, and some chilling and memorable scenes.

film.summary: A wealthy playboy and a Chicago cop both return to Gotham City where their lives will intersect in unexpected ways. (imdb)
film.quote: A completely solid telling of a classic graphic novel. It has pretty much everything you want from a Batman animated movie. It's dark, it's got fun action. The only problem is -- as Langelund said -- the uneven storytelling. I feel like it's way too much crammed in. If you could make this another hour longer then I imagine that'd be fixed, but I guess we'll never know.

film.summary: Exposed during an illegal arms trade gone wrong in Berlin, a North Korean "ghost" agent finds himself in the crosshairs of an international manhunt. Was he betrayed by his wife or his country? He must prepare to make the ultimate sacrifice. (imdb)
film.quote: I've seen a bunch of negative reviews about this, saying it's confusing and a mess. It's confusing because it's got a lot of twists and turns, though I will concede that it could have been a little tighter written. The script wasn't bad though. I don't really see how it's a mess, and it had a decent flow to it. Most importantly, when the action came, it was thrilling and well made. I look forward to the sequel.

film.summary: Short, lightning-paced shots of a city accompanied by a jazz number.
film.quote: It's one of those movies that, thank god it's a short. It's only around for 5 minutes and it treats you to good music and some interesting camera angles. I feel like for every minute or two you add onto it, it'd lose a couple points. But that's fine, because the director knew enough to not make it very long... so as it stands now, it's very good, almost great.

film.summary: Death of a President follows the investigation of the fictional assassination of President George W. Bush in October 2007. Combining real archival footage with a credible but fictional story, this film presents a fascinating and thought-provoking political thriller. (Newmarket Films)
film.quote: A mockumentary about Bush getting shot. It tackles the idea of violent protest, among other things. It paints things mostly in a gray area but Bush is actually painted in a fairly positive life, considering the shit that gets said about him. It's true to life in a lot of ways.

film.summary: In a seaside Irish town, a widower sparks with a visiting horror novelist while he also begins to believe he is seeing ghosts. (imdb)
film.quote: Beautiful scenery. It's a slow -- but moving -- movie using ghosts as symbolism for grief and mourning. Not exactly original by any means, but done well enough. I'm giving props to the lead male actor, giving an understated but effective performance. There are a few scares in here but don't go in really expecting a horror movie because ghosts only show up a few times and the rest of it is a drama, basically.

film.summary: A drama centered on the long-term friendship and partnership between two cops. (imdb)
film.quote: I give it props for Gyllenhaal and Pena's chemistry, and there are some great scenes, and I am generally okay with the handheld camera thing... but I don't really see the big deal on this one. It's entertaining, but not mind-blowing. Sometimes the handheld camera aspect breaks the realism a little TOO much. Also, I like to think I'm not knocking it down some points because I hate when people say "bro" all the time, but still, ergh.

film.filmname: Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind (2004)
film.summary: Joel (Carrey) is stunned to discover that his girlfriend Clementine (Winslet) has had her memories of their tumultuous relationship erased. Out of desperation, he contacts the inventor of the process, Dr. Howard Mierzwiak (Wilkinson), to have Clementine removed from his own memory. But as Joel's memories progressively disappear, he begins to rediscover his love for Clementine. (Focus Features)

Michael Moore's view on what happened to the United States after September 11; and how the Bush Administration allegedly used the tragic event to push forward its agenda for unjust wars in Afghanistan and Iraq. (imdb)
film.quote: There are good parts, there are bad parts, there are some exaggerated scenes with Moore shows -- pretty blatantly I might add -- his agenda, there are some scenes where he's right on. I don't disagree with Moore on the points he makes a fair amount of the time, but I'm not also in tune with the ways he goes about expressing them. But this is also entertaining, despite the sometimes awful, maddening, cringe-inducing scenes.

film.summary: On a busy London Street, video installation artist John Smith directs a scene the exact way that he wants it. As his 'cast' come and go in front of his camera he directs them in a constant narration, telling them exactly what he wants them to do. As he moves his camera around he demands increasing control over his environment and obedience from his subjects – be they people, cars, trucks, birds, clocks or buildings! (imdb User Comments)
film.quote: I like it, I think it's interesting and original. There is actually a laugh or two, but it's mostly due to the fact that the director is trying to get birds to do what he wants, or clocks, etc. I saw people saying it's about if life imitates art or the other way around... also about the frustration of artists when things don't go exactly as they wish (uncontrollable happenings). So in this way, the short works, but be warned... it's 12 minutes of a guy telling people what to do.

film.summary: In the year 2035, robots are an everyday household item, and everyone trusts them, except one, slightly paranoid detective investigating what he alone believes is a crime perpetrated by a robot. The case leads him to discover a far more frightening threat to the human race.
film.quote: Yeah there was a lot of product placement and all that, but I really think most people are way too hard on this flick. This flick isn't a super intelligent movie but it does have an idea or two, yeah, the script is a little wonky at times but I actually laughed at some of the jokes in it. Smith does a good job and there were some inspired scenes that really showed the terrors of a robot revolution. I also enjoyed the visuals of it, it s hows an interesting future.

film.summary: Caught in a savage rainstorm, ten travelers are forced to seek refuge at a strange desert motel. They soon realize they've found anything but shelter. There is a killer among them and, one by one, they are murdered. (Sony)
Somiya was an old widower with a daughter, named Noriko, mature for marriage but would rather live with her father... (imdb)
film.quote: It's a well made film but isn't really remarkable in any way.

film.summary: An examination of corruption and class warfare in Brazil as told through the stories of a wealthy businessman, a plastic surgeon who assists kidnapping victims and a politician whose income relies on a frog farm. (IMDB)
film.quote: Had the movie gone into a little more detail, this would be a must see. But it's very close. The interview with the kidnapper is a highlight.

film.summary: David Drayton and his young son Billy are among a large group of terrified townspeople trapped in a local grocery store by a strange, otherworldly mist. David is the first to realize that there are “things” lurking in the mist…deadly, horrifying things…creatures not of this world. Survival depends on everybody in the store pulling together…but is that possible, given human nature? (imdb)
Six years after Earth has suffered an alien invasion a cynical journalist agrees to escort a shaken American tourist through an infected zone in Mexico to the safety of the US border.
film.quote: Once thing I liked was that the aliens weren't really villains. They didn't attack unless provoked. I mean, despite the obvious allegories that that implies, it's just an interesting thing for alien invasion movies in general. I think they could have gone into more depth with the characters but regardless, it's a good movie.

film.summary: A look at the relationship between Mike and Sulley during their days at Monsters University -- when they weren't necessarily the best of friends. (imdb)
film.quote: It's definitely entertaining, still has that Monsters Inc. charm. It wasn't as good, but there were still some funny moments and of course it was heart warming at the end.

film.summary: When Banyan Key, Florida is rocked by a double homicide, chief of police Matt Lee Whitlock (Washington) finds himself in a race against time to solve the murders before he himself falls under suspicion. (MGM)

Perennial survivor Sidney Prescott, now a successful self-help author, returns to her home town of Woodsboro in the fourth act of director Wes Craven's Scream franchise. Sidney's homecoming, however, coincides with a slew of unsettling new murders.
film.quote: The first 10 minutes is incredible, but the ending was a lil wonky (though the very very end with the news was good). I enjoy the meta moments of it. It's pretty predictable and ultimately not real scary, but I actually like the motives of the killer. Some people say it makes no sense but really? The amount of people getting famous for nothing or for vlogs or whatever, and the amount of kids who want that, and you don't think the satire is on point? Not quite GREAT, but very good.

film.summary: A man named Mr. Smith (Owen) delivers a woman&#039;s baby during a shootout, and is then called upon to protect the newborn from the army of gunmen. (imdb)
film.quote: Over the top action done right, with a good choice of songs (Breed!). I don't even want to ruin any of the insane ways that people are killed. But loses some speed on second viewings and when you watch it outside of the theatre. See it once, you don't need to see it again.

film.summary: One-minute short film, used as a trailer for the Vienna International Film Festival (Viennale).
film.quote: I also didn't like school. A nice, odd little minute long short. I actually think I understand this one.

film.summary: Jim (Biggs), Oz (Klein), Finch (Thomas) and Kevin (Nicholas) are four friends who make a pact that before they graduate they will all lose their virginity. The hard job now is how to reach that goal by prom night. Whilst Oz begins singing to grab attention and Kevin tries to persuade his girlfriend, Finch tries any easy route of spreading rumors and Jim fails miserably... (imdb)

Mr Roberts finds himself awoken inexplicably in a white room. A man sits before him at a desk and in between them stands a black button. If Mr Roberts pushes it, he will receive a briefcase filled with millions of dollars. Or he can take the key to the door and leave penniless. The catch? Pushing the button will result in the death of a human being. What would you do?
film.quote: The guy behind the desk did a good job, the other guy's acting was a little wonky. The idea of this is interesting, and I enjoyed the end.

film.summary: A poor, oversized and under-educated teenager is recruited by a major college football program where he is groomed into an athletically and academically successful NFL prospect.
film.quote: It got to me a bit, okay a lot, at the beginning and the end. The middle bit was paced a little poorly but the actors all did a good job.

film.summary: Television made him famous, but his biggest hits happened off screen. This is the story of the double life of legendary showman Chuck Barris - television producer by day, CIA assassin by night.
In Joseph Gordon-Levitt’s charming directorial debut, a selfish modern-day Don Juan attempts to change his ways. (sundance.org)
film.quote: I don't think it quite hits the "great" mark for me. I think it's a bold directorial debut, taking the subject of a sex (more specifically porn) addict guido and making a rom-com out of it. Everyone does well, and the lead characters are interesting enough. It was funny at times, but my issue is that it doesn't reach far beyond "interesting enough" or "good enough." It's not hilarious but has a few great gags, the drama is good but not OVERLY memorable. But props for tackling porn head on.

film.summary: A business commuter is pursued and terrorized by a malevolent driver of a massive tractor-trailer (imdb)
film.quote: Good ideas, slightly above average presentation on all fronts. It's a fairly deep movie but it's not as exciting as I was hoping.

film.summary: A lonely middle-aged catering manager (Bob Hoskins) spends all of his time studying tapes of an eccentric TV chef (Arsinee Khanjian). Meanwhile, a young woman (Elaine Cassidy) is making her way from Ireland to find her boy friend (Peter McDonald), who moved to England to get a job in a lawn-mower factory. On arrival, she makes an early contact with the caterer, who recommends a boarding room to her. Slowly, it is revealed that the caterer has in fact befriended and subsequently abused more than a dozen young women. (imdb)
film.quote: Even though I enjoyed Hoskins and Cassidy, the music and some of the character building, I felt it was paced way way too slowly which put me off a bit. I won't deny that it builds a pretty interesting profile of a serial killer and the ending isn't what you'd expect. He really does show off how disturbed this guy is, while making him completely human.

film.summary: Set on Earth in the year 2065, an invasion threatens to extinguish the remains of mankind and quite possibly every living creature on the planet. The fate of all life on Earth relies on one woman&#039;s determination. But time is running out. (Columbia Tristar)
film.quote: It doesn't feel like Final Fantasy but the CGI was/is great. The plot is engaging enough and so is the voice acting. Fuck it, I like it.

film.summary: Convinced that a series of coincidences involving a doorman hold some secret to life's largest riddles, Albert Markovski seeks the help of a detective agency unlike any other... which leads him down a path that questions the essence of existence itself.
A family looks to prevent evil spirits from trapping their comatose child in a realm called The Further. (imdb)
film.quote: The first half was very well done. It was creepy, oozed atmosphere, etc. The second half I still liked but not quite as much. I enjoyed that they took it in a different route (sort of) by going into The Further, and I liked that there was a story about astral projection because every other movie explains hauntings differently (and generically). Feeling a bit different than a lot of horrors, just like Saw 1 did, this movie rarely falls to stupid cheap scares, and uses its elements wisely.

film.summary: After learning that their handler (Jason Patric) has set them up, a group of disavowed CIA operatives led by Clay -- aka the Colonel bands together to bring down their betrayers in this action thriller adapted from the comic book series by Andy Diggle and Jock.
film.quote: You know, if this movie would have had a better ending and a little more depth it would have been a 90. I actually thought the movie was hilarious... the jokes weren't brain dead, I found them quite funny. But I also have a hard-on for Idris Elba so.

film.summary: As the entire nation watches the presidential campaign hurtle towards Election Day, one soldier races to uncover the conspiracy behind it -- a conspiracy that seeks to destroy democracy itself. (Paramount Pictures)
A camera crew follows two serial killers as they do their thing. (Myself)
film.quote: I think had I not seen Man Bites Dog, this would probably be higher, but I'm still rockin' a 78 because despite the obvious, ahem, &quot;similarities,&quot; it's done well. Opening shot is awesome, everything is directed and framed well. The violence is brutal, the music is great. It is what it is -- a short about watching two serial killers kill people. Merry Christmas.

film.summary: A look at the annual journey of Emperor penguins as they march -- single file -- to their traditional breeding ground. (imdb)

Jones is K, a veteran of a government agency so secretive no one in power knows it exists; Smith is J, a former New York cop turned rookie operative. The two dress like the FBI but better, and drive a Ford that moves like the Stealth bomber. And, when not hanging out in their bachelor pad-cum-mission control, they flex muscle like the INS - albeit toward aliens with multiple, mutating heads.

Amid a semi-documentary portrait of New York and its people, Jean Dexter, attractive blonde model, is murdered in her apartment and homicide detectives Dan Muldoon and Jimmy Halloran investigate. Suspicion falls on various shifty characters who all prove to have some connection with a string of apartment burglaries. Then a burglar is found dead who once had an elusive partner named Willie... The climax is a very rapid manhunt sequence. All filmed on location. (imdb)
Danny Ocean (Clooney) and his team look to burgle three different locations throughout Europe. (Warner Bros.)
film.quote: Here it is in a nutshell: Pitt Clooney Hetero male (me) decent story x rest of Hollywood stars - a little bit of the polish of Eleven = A very good, almost great exercise in wit and charm.

film.summary: Max is a genius mathematician who's built a supercomputer at home that provides something that can be understood as a key for understanding all existence. Representatives both from a Hasidic cabalistic sect and high-powered Wall Street firm hear of that secret and attempt to seduce him. (imdb)
Seeking revenge for the death of his love, secret agent James Bond sets out to stop an environmentalist from taking control of a country's valuable resource.
film.quote: Plot seems a little wonky, but the action is phenominal, first and foremost. Craig shines again as Bond and the best part is the "growth" (if you can call it that) of Bond throughout Casino Royale and now this. Of course he uses tons of violence, he's still pretty green. Eventually we will see more of a Bond that we know, but we have to get there first, and that's the intriguing part about the reboot of this franchise.

film.summary: Upon release from prison, a solitary man known only as &quot;the Rambler&quot; (Dermot Mulroney) embarks on a mysterious journey en route to reconnecting with his long-lost brother. Traversing treacherous back roads, lost highways, and isolated small towns, he unearths a multitude of bizarre and wickedly depraved slices of Americana. (Official promo)
film.quote: The Rambler is a really surreal movie. The Rambler himself is silent but goes through a shit ton of weird stuff. Does it make sense? Only Reeder really knows what it all means. But there are some wonderful (and usually grotesque) images in here, and the style of it is appealing. I was actually sort of connected to the Rambler due to his "relationship" with the girl who keeps dying. Sometimes music is used well, offering an interesting contrast between the weirdness and something more upbeat.

film.summary: Captain John Boyd's promotion stations him at a fort where a rescued man tells a disturbing tale of cannibalism. (imdb)
film.quote: While my memory of this movie is pretty hazy, I remember some decent cinematography, an interesting story and above all else a soundtrack that's really the star.

film.summary: In the early third century, the land of Wu is invaded by the warlord Cao Cao and his million soldiers. The ruler of Wu, Sun Quan, calls on the rival warlord Liu Bei for help, but their two armies are still badly outnumbered. However, the Wu strategist Zhou Yu sees that Cao Cao's army is unused to battling on the sea, which may just give them a chance if they can exploit this weakness properly. (imdb)
film.quote: I didn't get to see the full 4 hour one, I didn't know it existed until after I saw this but at 2 and a half hours it seemed fine. I think it dragged in some places actually, so adding more time probably wouldn't have helped that. But there were some great battle scenes even though a couple parts made me roll my eyes. Still... Dynasty Warriors. Could have used more (or any) Lu Bu.

film.filmname: Something from Nothing: The Art of Rap (2012)
film.summary: A documentary on rap music and its rise to global prominence.
film.quote: A nice look at rap. Sometimes they stuck the camera in some really weird places, but as a documentary on the art form it's good enough. Talks about what rap means to rappers, gets a good diverse look, because Ice-T talked to a lot of different rappers. Not every "style" is represented but it's a decent job.

film.summary: In this psychological thriller, a distraught young man announces to his psychiatrist that he plans to commit suicide in three days. The psychiatrist&#039;s desperate attempts to help his new patient lead him through the city on an incredible, nightmarish trip to the place between life and death. (20th Century Fox)
film.quote: Often it's confusing and I don't know if that makes it a mess or not. The cinematography here is beautiful and there's some gripping scenes with solid acting from the main actors/actress.

film.summary: Two co-dependent high school seniors (Hill and Cera) are forced to deal with separation anxiety after their plan to stage a booze-soaked party goes awry. (IMDB)
Stars Cary Grant as a former thief suspected of a new series of crimes and Grace Kelly as the woman who romances him. (imdb)
film.quote: I waited anxiously to see who the thief was and it was a little disappointing but I enjoyed the scene that it took place in. A couple things didn't flow as smoothly as it should have but Grant and Kelly gave great performances and like others have said, she, and the scenery are both beautiful.

film.summary: The Griswold family's cross-country drive to the WallyWorld theme park proves to be much more arduous than they ever anticipated. (imdb)
Young traveller Allan Gray arrives in a remote castle and starts seeing weird, inexplicable sights (a man whose shadow has a life of its own) (imdb)
film.quote: I wasn't as into what was going on as I could have been. Some parts, sure, but not always. However, this is one of those old horror movies that I feel are actually better due to the black and white, grainy film. It just wouldn't be the same shot today in colour. It adds to the creepy atmosphere and due to the fact you spend time reading a book in the movie, it feels like a documentary of SORTS of someone discovering vampires. Plus the soundtrack is awesome and everything is shot well.

film.summary: Adam, a Jewish teenager and Yasmine, a young Lebanese girl, fall in love. Their relationship is overshadowed by the ongoing feud between their families, but also by the raging conflict in the Middle East. From the heart of Mile End, Montreal's multicultural neighborhood, comes this modern-day story of two lovers fighting against the walls that separate them. (imdb)
film.quote: The acting of the people involved can get a little wonky but generally it's decent enough, though never great. However, the girl who plays Yasmine manages to be really cute and vulnerable while the guy who plays Adam manages to be awkward and charming. It focus on a relationship oppressed by different religions and does a good job showing that we are all people, no matter the religion or even political belief. I really liked the ending as well.

film.summary: Paris, 2010. An isolation wall surrounds the ghetto cities. Without effective law enforcement, with these walls, gang rule is absolute. (Magnolia Pictures)
film.quote: I actually could have used a little more plot, even though I know that's not where the draw is. I enjoy things like this, but I didn't get much of a plot. However, what I did get was some amusing and cartoonish ass kicking and when it was happening it was fun to watch. I kind of liked the ending.

film.filmname: Family Guy Presents: Stewie Griffin - The Untold Story (2005)
film.summary: Stewie, the maniacal baby genius, is distracted from his plans for world domination after a near-death experience... (imdb)

Acclaimed actors Denzel Washington, Clive Owen and Jodie Foster come together to explore the lure of power, the ugliness of greed and the mystery of a perfect robbery in this combustible new crime drama. The powerhouse actors play tough New Yorkers who must outwit one another to protect competing interests in this skillfully penned and tightly helmed thriller.
A riveting thriller set in the drug underworld of the UK.
film.quote: Very Gut Ritchie-like, with a strong performance by Daniel Craig. This movie moves along at a good pace, with some interesting twists and turns along the way. Also; the ending is abrupt and awesome. Some of the musical choices didn't work for me though. Stylish and fun, watch it.

film.summary: An undercover narc dies, the investigation stalls, so the Detroit P.D. brings back Nick Tellis, fired 18-months ago when a stray bullet hits a pregnant woman. Tellis teams with Henry Oak, a friend of the dead narc and an aggressive cop constantly under the scrutiny of internal affairs. They follow leads, informants turn up dead, Nick's wife is unhappy he's back on the street, Henry's protective of the dead cop's wife... (imdb)

Lola receives a phone call from her boyfriend Manny. He lost 100,000 DM in a subway train that belongs to a very bad guy. Lola has 20 min to raise this amount and meet Manny. Otherwise, he will rob a store to get the money. Three different alternatives may happen depending on some minor event along Lola's run. (imdb)

The city stands on the brink of social, economic, and environmental disaster. Southland Tales is an epic story set over the course of three days that culminate in a massive 4th of July celebration. A large ensemble cast of characters includes Boxer Santaros, an action star stricken with amnesia; Krysta Now, an adult-film star developing her own reality-television project; and Roland Taverner, a Hermosa Beach police officer who holds the key to a vast conspiracy. (Samuel Goldwyn Films)
film.quote: How do I approach this? It's a mess, it's really calculated. It depends on whether you agree with "a movie pretending to be bad is good" or not. It definitely has tons to say and for that, good job Kelly, but a lot of people will be and have been turned off by this. From a narrative standpoint, it's a disaster, but maybe that's the point. Everytime I want to hate an aspect of it, I wonder if it's intentional. Frustrating, maybe great, maybe shit, but I'm giving it an 77 regardless. Might change.

film.summary: A detective is trying to find the cause of a string of suicides. (imdb)
film.quote: I think it's safe to say this movie is really militant satire, dressed in horror clothes. I don't know exactly what I just watched but it intrigued me, anyway. I definitely get a theme of conformity. It's true that the production values are less than stellar but there are some genuinely disturbing scenes and just trying to figure out the puzzle (ha!) is fun in itself. Seems more like a "message over plot" type of movie and that's fine.

film.summary: Dramatization of the Starkweather-Fugate killing spree of the 1950&#039;s, in which a teenage girl and her twenty-something boyfriend slaughtered her entire family and several others in the Dakota badlands (imdb)
film.quote: I might be a minority here but I'm not such a fan. I think like all of Malick's films, it's well made and interesting, but it fails to pull me in completely. I'm always almost there but not quite, except for a part or two.

film.summary: A high-velocity look at George Jung's (Depp) spectacular rise and fall -- based on the true story of how powder cocaine turned into America's biggest drug problem and how one man from the blue-collar suburbs became the 35 billion-dollar a-year conduit to the Colombian cartels. Ted Demme directs this riveting look at the manic allure -- and dangerous reality -- of a drug smuggler's everyday life, and unfolds one of the great untold stories from the recent annals of American crime and culture. (New Line Cinema)
film.quote: I thought this was great the first time I saw it a few years ago, but on repeated viewings I've realized that it doesn't hold up. That's not to say that this is a bad film, as the ending is still sad, it just doesn't offer anything to go above and beyond the call of duty.

film.summary: Stranded in the midst of a zombie apocalypse, a man sets in motion an unlikely plan to protect the precious cargo he carries: his infant daughter. (imdb)
film.quote: What Kojiless said, it's clever. It's taking a common movie idea (zombies!!!) and is adding a pretty personal spin to it. I also thought that the beginning was a nice touch, as him and his wife fade into the picture and once the blur disappears it was kinda creepy.

film.summary: Adapted from the novel by John le Carre, this is a gripping romantic thriller that sweeps audiences along one man&#039;s emotional and global journey to uncover the truth behind a personal loss and a worldwide conspiracy. (Focus Features)
Eight strangers find themselves waking up in a strange cube-shaped room with no recollection of how they came to be there... (imdb)
The story centers around a family with three boys in the 1950s. The eldest son witnesses the loss of innocence. (imdb)
film.quote: There are amazing scenes in here. But then the rest of the movie is kind of okay, nothing terribly special. Not quite boring, but not real interesting. When he embraced the surrealism I was more intrigued because the movie didn't hit me on an emotional level. For a movie that tries to be so beautiful (and it succeeds at times, most definitely), I didn't get that feeling of a masterpiece. I did for the first half hour or so though. This was on its way to a 90.

film.summary: Versatile filmmaker Nick Cassavetes directs an impressive group of both young and veteran performers in Alpha Dog, inspired by actual events, a film that follows three fateful days when the lives of a group of Southern California teens suddenly dead-ended. (Universal)
film.quote: Saw this as a last minute switch and it surprised me a few times. It ended up being a solid movie. Justin Timberlake broke my heart near the end, proving he can act (even if he does just act like a thug throughout most of it.) I ended up caring deepy for these people, even though normally I wouldn't. Could have gone wrong but it didn't.

film.summary: Against a backdrop of bizarre shapes and textures, a small organic figure gives birth to the letters of the alphabet while a mixture of children's voices and an operatic tune are singing out. The figure's head collapses causing blood to rain on a girl while she lays in her bed, resulting in the girl violently vomiting blood herself. (imdb)
film.quote: Really like the ending. Interesting idea too.

film.summary: Peter Parker runs the gauntlet as the mysterious company Oscorp sends up a slew of supervillains against him, impacting on his life. (imdb)
film.quote: I think I enjoy it about as much as the last one. It shouldn't have thrown in Harry as a villain and just left it until next time, and that godawful cliffhanger ending actually pisses me off, but I enjoy Garfield as Spidey, and enjoy the two reboots more than the original trilogy. It's dark but still mildly humorous, the action is fun and the visuals are impressive. The Gwen subplot gave some emotional impact, and all-in-all, I had a good time.

film.summary: Peter Parker finds a clue that might help him understand why his parents disappeared when he was young. His path puts him on a collision course with Dr. Curt Connors, his father's former partner. (imdb)
film.quote: The first Spider-Man movie I'd say I really enjoyed. It has its flaws and wank parts, but everyone did well and I like Andrew as Peter Parker much better than Tobey. A darker feel, but keeps the Spider-Man personality in tact. Also for those seeing it in 3D... it's mostly unnecessary but doesn't get in the way like The Avengers did.

film.summary: Provoked by forbidden passions, Lester Burnham (Spacey) decides to make a few changes in his rut of a life, changes that are less midlife crisis than adolescence reborn. The freer he gets, the happier he gets, which is even more maddening to his wife, Carolyn (Bening), and daughter Jane (Birch) --especially when he turns his lustful gaze toward Jane's friend, the sultry Angela (Suvari). (Dreamworks SKG)
film.quote: Maybe it doesn't seem as great as it was when I first saw it, but it's still entertaining and often funny.

film.summary: Generally unheralded at the time, the early 1980s hardcore punk rock scene gave birth to much of the rock music and culture that followed. Hardcore was more than music -- it was a social movement created by Reagan-era misfit kids. The participants constituted a tribe unto themselves -- some finding a voiced, others an escape in the hard-edged music. Ans while some sought a better world, others were just angry and wanted to raise hell. American Hardcore traces this lost subculture, from its early roots in 1980 to its initial flameout in 1986. (Sony Pictures Classics)
film.quote: It's okay, really, could have been tons better. It's good for those who don't know much about it because they can get their foot in the door and learn about some bands but it doesn't really go beyond that in most cases. Still worth a watch, though.

film.summary: A groups of Korean anarchists in 1920s China are determined to overthrow the military and government. (imdb)
film.quote: It's a good time. It only really briefly touches on anarchism but it also doesn't set anarchism back in the same way, say, The Joker mentioning it does. Some decent action, badass characters, some lame parts. Worth a watch.

film.summary: To survive the night, cops and criminals alike will have to unite and fight. A classic head-to-head showdown ignites in this all-new update of the 1976 action thriller of the same name. (Rogue Pictures)

Jim is an average New Yorker living a peaceful life with a well paying job and a loving family. Suddenly, everything changes when the economy crashes causing Jim to lose everything. Filled with anger and rage, Jim snaps and goes to extreme lengths to seek revenge for the life taken from him. (imdb)
film.quote: You know, I gotta say I enjoyed this. The build up wasn't always great, but it was mostly well done and it was a pretty gruesome and dark finale. I would love to sit here and pick it apart because it's Boll, but shit, I had a good time.

film.filmname: Austin Powers: The Spy Who Shagged Me (1999)
film.summary: Austin (Myers) must time travel back to the Swinging Sixties, regain his mojo and save the world from destruction. (New Line Cinema)

film.filmname: Austin Powers: International Man of Mystery (1997)
film.summary: Austin Powers (Myers) is a 60's spy who is cryonically frozen and released in the 1990's. The world is a very different place for Powers. Unfortuantly for Austin, everyone is no longer sex-mad. Although he may be in a different decade, his mission is still the same. He has teamed up with Vanessa Kensington (Hurley) to stop the evil Dr. Evil (Myers), who was also frozen in the past. Dr. Evil stole a nuclear weapon and is demanding a payment of (when he realises its the 90's) 100 billion dollars. (imdb)
Bambi is contentedly nibbling the grass, seemingly unaware of his impending encounter with Godzilla. What will happen when the two finally meet? (imdb)
film.quote: lol Oh c'mon you people who gave it a really low rating. Yeah, it's a simple joke but it uses simplicity to perfection. I don't want to watch it again but oh my god I laughed.

film.summary: The Dark Knight of Gotham City begins his war on crime with his first major enemy being the clownishly homicidal Joker. (imdb)

A 6-story anthology collection in a time-line after "Batman Begins". In "Have I Got A Story For You", 3 kids tell wildly different stories about Batman. "Crossfire" focuses on two policemen who end up getting in the middle of a crime battle. "Field Test" has Lucius Fox creating a new technology for Batman. "In Darkness Dwells" features Killer Croc and Scarecrow. "Working Through Pain" goes through flashbacks of Bruce Wayne's training. "Deadshot" focuses on the titular sniper.
film.quote: 1: Just love Batman so I'm easy to impress. 2: The animation in the first one was awful and didn't work at all. The animation was uneven in general, some was great, some was not. 3: Even so, the story in the first was good. Liked the story in most of them, especially "Working Through Pain." To seasoned Batman fans, the views into his psych aren't original but even so it's interesting. Field Test and "Have I Got A Story For You" are the weakest links. But all in all it's a good watch.

film.summary: As Batman hunts for the escaped Joker, the Clown Prince of Crime attacks the Gordon family to prove a diabolical point mirroring his own fall into madness.
film.quote: The beginning with Batgirl didn't bother me as much as some people, even if it's a little clunky. Once it gets to the actual Killing Joke adaptation it's quite enjoyable. It has good voice acting all around, though some of the lines are wonky. The animation mostly works, but doesn't call much attention to itself. This isn't one of the best animated Batman movies, but it's still fun. The ending is fantastic.

film.summary: The true story of Whitey Bulger, the brother of a state senator and the most infamous violent criminal in the history of South Boston, who became an FBI informant to take down a Mafia family invading his turf. (imdb)
film.quote: I don't think it redefines the wheel in any way, but I dug Depp in the role (great performance, won't and shouldn't win awards though), and for the most part I was engaged. It dragged a little bit here and there, but it covered a fair bit of ground. Could have explored certain parts of Bulger's life better, but it's a completely solid gangster flick.

film.summary: Wesley Snipes returns as Blade, the Marvel Comics half-human, half-vampire character he vividly brought to life in the 1998 hit film of the same name. (New Line Cinema)

Two Irish brothers accidentally killed mafia thugs. They turned themselves in and were released as heroes. They then see it as a calling by God and started knocking off mafia gang members one by one. Willem Dafoe plays the detective trying to figure out the killings, but the closer he was to catching the Irish brothers, the more he thinks the brothers are doing the right thing. (imdb)

Born Villain is a short film directed by actor Shia LaBeouf in collaboration with Marilyn Manson. It was released on August 28, 2011, during its inaugural screening, at the L.A. Silent Theater. Produced as an accompaniment to Marilyn Manson's eighth studio album, the film was intended as the record's promotional &quot;trailer&quot;. (Youtube)
film.quote: A mixture of Manson and Jodorowsky, clearly. While this doesn't really help lend Labeouf his own identity (just like Maniac didn't), it's still well done. It has odd, disturbing imagery, and it really isn't clear what's going on. Not really a fan of the Manson song... he's pretty much past his &quot;prime.&quot; But the video was well done and Shia's directed stuff seems more out there than the stuff he acts in, not that he isn't in some stuff with interesting ideas.

film.summary: The film tells a story of a divorced couple (Ethan Hawke and Patricia Arquette) trying to raise their young son. The story follows the boy for twelve years, from first grade at age 6 through 12th grade at age 17-18, and examines his relationship with his parents as he grows. (Tmdb)
film.quote: I thought I might absolutely love this because the opening scene, with Yellow, was profound to me for some reason. But as it went on, I started to realize I would merely like it. Which isn't bad by any means because I enjoyed myself, but it didn't grab me like it could have and didn't make me feel as emotional as it should have. However, great direction, the "gimmick" of filming these people over 12 years is interesting, and it's impressive that it didn't lose control of itself.

film.summary: William Wallace is a Scottish rebel who leads an uprising against the cruel English ruler Edward the Longshanks, who wishes to inherit the crown of Scotland for himself. When he was a young boy, William Wallace's father and brother, along with many others, lost their lives trying to free Scotland. Once he loses another of his loved ones, William Wallace begins his long quest to make Scotland free once and for all, along with the assistance of Robert the Bruce. (imdb)
A dark spy-comedy in which an ousted CIA official’s memoir accidentally falls into the hands of two gym employees intent on making the most of their find.
film.quote: It must be fun to act like some of these characters, especially the Brad Pitt one. I mean, they really must have had a blast. This is a well made movie, which is typical Coens. It's also typical Coens in that I couldn't really get involved with it. For all the skill and talent on display, it's like it kept a safe distance with me. That's fine, this just isn't for me. The only Coens movie that truly involved me was No Country.

film.summary: George Carlin goes to Carnegie Hall.
film.quote: Not his best but there are some absolutely hilarious moments; he was really good here but became a legend later on.

film.summary: Think before you snap.
film.quote: Haha, this was funny. It escalated nicely, and ROCK BOTTOM, PEOPLE'S ELBOW! You mention pro-wrestling in your video, in a positive way, and you win me over. This short is no different.

film.summary: Cemetery of Splendour is a 2015 Thai drama film directed by Apichatpong Weerasethakul. The plot revolves around a spreading epidemic of sleeping sickness. Spirits appear to the stricken and hallucination becomes indistinguishable from reality.
film.quote: Undeniably gorgeous (a trait that his movies all share), but it's pretty demanding of the audience. Blissfully Yours was boring but this approached tedium, where it really stretched my limits as I waited for something to happen. He brought his A game right at the end but by then it was a little too late. With that said, the talent and filmmaking prowess that he possesses allowed this to be relatively entertaining, albeit incredibly slow. Still a little weird, still the Joe we know, but not great

film.summary: After he reunites with an old pal through Facebook, a mild-mannered accountant is lured into the world of international espionage. (imdb)
film.quote: The action doesn't really work and brings the experience down but the rest of it was better than expected, mostly due to the chemistry of the Rock and Hart. I ended up laughing at jokes that I wouldn't normally laugh at because of them, and even though I've been harsh on the movies Hart has been in (but not him because I like him), he was used well. Funny stuff with some heart.

film.summary: A mother's prayer for her kidnapped son to return home is answered, though it doesn't take long for her to suspect the boy who comes back is not hers.
The story of an obsessively organized efficiency expert whose life unravels in unexpected ways when fate forces him to explore the serendipitous nature of love and forgiveness. (imdb)
film.quote: Definitely, Maybe and this are sort of similar, at least on the outside, and Definitely, Maybe is a better movie by far but I also enjoyed this for reasons I enjoyed that. Ryan Reynolds is great and I like him a lot generally, there are some kind of funny parts but the movie excels when it's being dramatic and by the end I did care about these people and their complex problems.

film.summary: A chef who loses his restaurant job starts up a food truck in an effort to reclaim his creative promise, while piecing back together his estranged family. (imdb)
film.quote: I enjoyed it but wasn't madly in love with it or anything. The chemistry between father and son was there, and even though it really didn't do anything new with the genre (the indie dramedy/feel good story), it did it well. I didn't really find it that funny, but it was interesting and what little drama there was worked for me. The part with the 1 second videos edited together was genuinely touching. Also has a great soundtrack with reworkings of some classic songs.

film.summary: A sex addict pays for his mother's hospital bills by playing on the sympathies of those who rescue him from choking to death.
A documentary on Conan O'Brien's comedy tour of the U.S. and Canada after leaving his post at "The Tonight Show" and severing his relationship with NBC. (imbd.com)
film.quote: I like Conan a lot, so it was an interesting look at him and his comedy tour. There were some funny parts, some more candid moments. All in all, a very good documentary for fans of Conan. I can't see people who don't like him being that interested in this, to be honest, because it's not like he's this larger than life superstar. He's famous, no doubt, but he's no Justin Bieber -swoon-.

film.summary: Concussion is a dramatic thriller based on the incredible true David vs. Goliath story of American immigrant Dr. Bennet Omalu, the brilliant forensic neuropathologist who made the first discovery of CTE, a football-related brain trauma, in a pro player and fought for the truth to be known. Omalu's emotional quest puts him at dangerous odds with one of the most powerful institutions in the world. (imdb)
film.quote: Will Smith does a wonderful job and it is a fairly gripping drama about an important subject. I didn't love it but I was entertained more than I should have been, considering I don't like football. Yes, I know it's about more than just a sport, but the consequences of said sport.

film.summary: Set in the distant future, Connected is a story about survival and greed with a post apocalyptic wasteland as its backdrop. Survivors of an unknown disaster shuffle through a desolate landscape, as it quickly becomes clear that not everybody has the strength to survive.
film.quote: Very solid because of great visuals mostly. However, even though there's literally no back story or dialogue, I felt the ending was still pretty powerful. Plus I enjoy the soundtrack. I'm also a sucker for post apocalyptic stuff, barren fields, dirty air, that kind of stuff.

film.summary: Based on the true story of the first Jamaican bobsled team trying to make it to the Winter Olympics.

In the aftermath of a family tragedy, an aspiring author is torn between love for her childhood friend and the temptation of a mysterious outsider. Trying to escape the ghosts of her past, she is swept away to a house that breathes, bleeds ... and remembers. (imdb)
film.quote: Visually it's hard to find fault, because the building is a character in itself, and there is a rich Gothic aesthetic washing over everything. I also love how it plays out like a soap opera/live theatre show, and I enjoy how the dialogue reflects that. However, the script needs some serious work: there's a bunch of hokeyness here. Most notably, lazy metaphor work and some awkward scenes. The plot unfolds in a predictable way, but it still isn't what you'd expect from the trailer, which is cool.

film.summary: Bogart plays a man convicted of murdering his wife who escapes from prison in order to prove his innocence... (imdb)
film.quote: IT WAS HUMPHREY BOGART??? Anyway, the first person POV was great symbolically though I don't want to use my whole review to talk about that. Aside from that, great acting... not as amazing as some other Bogie and Bacall movies obviously but still thrilling. Ending was kind of rushed like others were saying. Still very entertaining.

film.summary: A hideously scarred and mentally unstable scientist seeks revenge against the crooks who made him like that. (imdb)
film.quote: There are some scenes that don't work, but those are contradicted by some other inspired scenes that do. Darkman as a character is interesting enough and the actors do a fine enough job, outside of a few wooden lines. The script is convincing enough and the direction also works. Plus I like how Darkman dresses.

film.summary: Married, middle-aged and with children is hardly a recipe for romance, but Tina Fey and Steve Carrell are determined to keep the spark alive in this Shawn Levy-helmed comedy about a date night gone horribly awry. Joining Fey and Carrell in this ensemble cast film are Mark Wahlberg, who plays a securities expert, James Franco as a slightly slow con man and Leighton Meester as the couple's babysitter.
film.quote: You aren't going to feel like this revolutionizes comedies and it probably should have been the funniest movie ever considering the cast and it doesn't get to those levels but it's a good movie nevertheless.

film.summary: The chilling story of identical twin gynecologists, suave Elliot and sensitive Beverly, bipolar sides of one personality, who share the same practice, the same apartment, the same women. When a new patient, glamorous actress Claire Niveau, challenges their eerie bond, they descend into a whirlpool of sexual confusion, drugs, and madness. Jeremy Irons' tour-de-force performance (as both twins) raises disturbing questions about the nature of personal identity. (Criterion Collection)
A successful investment banker struggles after losing his wife in a tragic car crash. (imdb)
film.quote: Definitely give props to Jake here, and I gotta say that this movie was not really what I expected. The trailers made it seem tame and it's actually a little unhinged -- which I liked. It was interesting enough to keep me engaged even if it didn't go above and beyond; the transformation of this guy was intriguing. It had reoccurring and powerful symbolism, and the discussion of using the word "fuck" too much was glorious. A surprise for me, even if I'm not madly in love with it.

film.summary: It is 1939, the end of three years of bloody civil war in Spain, and General Franco's right-wing Nationalists are poised to defeat the left-wing Republican forces. A ten-year-old boy named Carlos (Fernando Tielve), the son of a fallen Republican war hero, is left by his tutor in an orphanage in the middle of nowhere. The orphanage is run by a curt but considerate headmistress named Carmen (Marisa Paredes) and a kindly Professor Casares, both of whom are sympathetic to the doomed Republican cause. (imdb)
film.quote: I certainly enjoyed it, but maybe seeing Pan's Labyrinth first spoiled me (since they share some similarities). With that said, it's still a wonderfully crafted movie, pretty touching with some nice visual touches, and good acting from pretty much all the children involved.

film.summary: Middle school isn't all it's cracked up to be for self-described "wimpy kid" Greg Heffley, who discovers a frightening new world teeming with boys who are taller, tougher and hairier than he is -- and decides to document it all in his diary.
Two best friends are filming a comedy about getting revenge on the bullies at their high school. One of them isn't joking. (imdb)
film.quote: Not quite the classic Kevin Smith pimps it as, but still great. I can't help but feel there's heavy Tarantino influence here, which is not weird considering Matt gets called Tarantino in it. The Dirties film they filmed for class was wonderful. The movie as a whole tackles its subject with finesse and the obsession with movies is a nice touch. You can feel for these people, I enjoy the ending and the "we're only here for the bad guy" shirt... because it's oddly fitting.

film.summary: Smart. Daring. Defiant and dangerous. As well as beautiful. This is Domino Harvey and this is her real life story... well, sort of.
film.quote: Really stylish thriller. Ropes you in but doesn't need a second viewing.

film.summary: A clerk in a government agency finds his unenviable life takes a turn for the horrific with the arrival of a new co-worker who is both his exact physical double and his opposite - confident, charismatic and seductive with women.
film.quote: I got a very Lynchian feel in the way the world acts and the visuals. It was dark and wonderfully shot, the office being a character of its own. Eisenberg also does well pulling double duty as an awkward, hard worker and a suave winner who can lie his way through life. But something just left me kinda cold during it. I wasn't able to connect to the plot or characters like I would have liked. And I keep seeing that it was a dark comedy but I didn't laugh.

film.summary: A documentary that explores the downloading revolution; the kids that created it, the bands and the businesses that were affected by it, and its impact on the world at large.
film.quote: Does what it sets out to do. Talks about Napster and gives insight into what took place during that time. Spends a little bit of time on the "other side" that opposed downloading, but seems mostly pro-downloading. Which is fine, I"m just throwing that out there so people realize it.

film.summary: Last night, two party-hearty Dudes had an unbelievably sweet time. Too bad, they can&#039;t remember a thing, including where they parked their car. So, the Dudes embark on a mission: retrace their steps to find out what they did last night (and who they did it to), hoping it will lead them to the missing car. Little do the Dudes know, they&#039;re in for the ride of their lives. (20th Century Fox)

Harry and Lloyd are two brainless losers who try to return a suitcase full of money to its pretty owner. After a journey full of accidents they arrive in snowy Aspen, Colorado and try to find her. But will they succeed? (imdb)
A young woman meets a vital young man, but the love affair is doomed because of the man&#039;s materialistic nature. (imdb)
film.quote: When artists challenge the viewers/consumers to feel things in daring and interesting ways that are out of the ordinary, it can be a wonderful thing if handled correctly. It wasn't here, but it's still a well made movie regardless, with some fantastic cinematography, especially, but it's more often than not boring. I don't mind some scenes that are intentionally boring, I actually appreciate that, but when it's most of the movie it becomes a problem. Still a 75 cuz of how well it was made.

film.summary: Set in the year 2154, where the very wealthy live on a man-made space station while the rest of the population resides on a ruined Earth, a man takes on a mission that could bring equality to the polarized worlds. (imdb)
film.quote: So, I guess I'm the only one who didn't like Copley as the villain. I see some people saying he was hammy but I don't find the rest of the movie that hammy so it's kind of out of place. But the movie is an interesting world with mostly great action sequences, I was never bored, and heavy social commentary has never bothered me because some movies are more subtle than others and both methods are fine. A fun Sci-Fi flick, not amazing but a good time.

film.summary: Mayhem ensues as Stan and Ollie attempt to build a house in one day.
film.quote: Impromptu snowball fight! ... with rocks. I want these people to build my house.

film.summary: After their adoptive mother is murdered during a grocery store holdup, the Mercer brothers -- hotheaded Bobby (Wahlberg), hard-edged Angel (Gibson), family man and businessman Jeremiah (Benjamin) and hard rocking Jack (Hedlund) -- reunite to take the matter of her death into their own hands. As they track down the killer, the four brothers come together to discover that they are bound by ties thicker than blood. (Paramount Pictures)

A comedy about a young wannabe musician, Jon (Domhnall Gleeson), who discovers he's bitten off more than he can chew when he joins an eccentric pop band led by the mysterious and enigmatic Frank (Michael Fassbender). (imdb)
film.quote: I was going to rate it an 80 because I actually really liked the ending (the song and moment was moving), but I waited a bit until I was off the "high" of it and the rest of the movie doesn't really deserve an 80. It's a quirky -- though sometimes seemingly just to be quirky -- and oddball movie, but I didn't find it overly funny or dramatic. It worked though as a satire and bromance, and was an enjoyable movie through and through. Just not a GREAT movie. Still definitely worth a watch though.

film.summary: Based on a popular graphic novel, From Hell puts an intense psychological spin on the horrific legend of Jack the Ripper and unravels a chilling alleged conspiracy involving the highest powers in England. (Twentieth Century Fox)
Deckard Shaw seeks revenge against Dominic Toretto and his family for the death of his brother. (imdb)
film.quote: Terrible script that keeps bluntly telling us how close these people are, also with cheesy dialogue. Over the top and stupid action. Shots of Vin Diesel's face and the city, glitz and glamour. A plot that doesn't matter. Oh yeah, also really enjoyable. It's just junk food, and the silly action is a lot of fun. It rides that line of being a little TOO much at times, but for the most part it is actually a thrill ride despite being a pretty bad movie in a lot of ways. Nice tribute at the end too.

film.summary: April, 1945. As the Allies make their final push in the European Theatre, a battle-hardened army sergeant named Wardaddy commands a Sherman tank and her five-man crew on a deadly mission behind enemy lines. Outnumbered and out-gunned, and with a rookie soldier thrust into their platoon, Wardaddy and his men face overwhelming odds in their heroic attempts to strike at the heart of Nazi Germany. (imdb)
film.quote: The ending is hokey and Hollywood as shit, despite the wonderful last shot that lingers on (in a good way), but the rest of the movie is solidly made. Cinematography, photography, the score, the editing, the acting... all on point. It tells a more personal tale and doesn't get caught up in American Jingoism, which is refreshing. Part character study, part action movie, succeeds at both.

film.summary: A chronicle of the LAPD's fight to keep East Coast Mafia types out of Los Angeles in the 1940s and 50s. (imdb)
film.quote: Just ultimately a good time where everyone is pretty much a badass.

film.summary: In GLOBAL METAL, directors Scot McFadyen and Sam Dunn set out to discover how the West's most maligned musical genre - heavy metal - has impacted the world's cultures beyond Europe and North America. The film follows metal fan and anthropologist Sam Dunn on a whirlwind journey through Asia, South America and the Middle East as he explores the underbelly of the world's emerging extreme music scenes; from Indonesian death metal to Chinese black metal to Iranian thrash metal. (imdb)
film.quote: Better than his first but still doesn't reach the level of awesomeness this kind of subject deserves. It's interesting to see the different political climates and how metal comes into the picture. It could have gone a lot deeper with even another half hour but whatever, as it is, this is a good metal docu from someone who loves metal.

film.summary: Warlord Toyotumi Hideyoshi rises to power in the late 16th century after the assassination of his lord Oda Nobunaga. In these chaotic times, chivalrous bandit Goemon rises as a hero among commoners, stealing from the rich and giving to the poor. In one of his many escapades, he steals a box from a merchant, and passes it off to a street urchin. But this turns out to be no ordinary box as warlord Toyotomi's right-hand man Ishida soon sends ninja and childhood friend Saizo after Goemon. (www.yesasia.com)
film.quote: Very stylish and visually interesting movie with characters who have ninja abilities that are, er, exaggerated a little bit to the point that they can jump in the air and perform video game-like awesomeness. Needless to say, a very good time.

film.summary: Griff, office worker by day, superhero by night, has his world turned upside down when he meets Melody, a beautiful young scientist who shares his passion for the impossible. (imdb)
film.quote: You get these types of movies that try to be quirky and fail, but I didn't ever feel like this was forced. It is very offbeat, in a really good way. I thought the central romance was done well and was really cute. Maeve Dermody is adorable, and Ryan does a good job too. Sure, the meaning can be a little odd... like it's well meaning cuz I think too many people criticize people for being "weird" just cuz they're different. But don't pretend to fight crime, that's actually dangerous to yourself.

film.summary: A pair of aging boxing rivals are coaxed out of retirement to fight one final bout -- 30 years after their last match. (imdb)
film.quote: I thought it was quite funny, and so did the theatre I was in. It's pretty mean-spirited, but I'm not even saying that as a criticism because the digs everyone took at each other made me laugh. I liked watching Stallone and De Niro verbally spar and then actually fight. It was a good time.

film.summary: Follows the life of Roberto Duran, who made his professional debut in 1968 as a 16-year-old and retired in 2002 at age 50. In June 1980, he defeated Sugar Ray Leonard to capture the WBC welterweight title but shocked the boxing world by returning to his corner in the November rematch, saying 'no mas' (no more). (imdb)
film.quote: I enjoy the formula of boxing movies, and so boxing movies tend to get a bit of advantage in my eyes. There's just something about them. This isn't one of the best by any means, but the performances are strong and the plot is interesting. Some of it gets glossed over a little bit too much, but it gave me mostly what I wanted.

film.summary: A 16-year-old who was raised by her father to be the perfect assassin is dispatched on a mission across Europe, tracked by a ruthless intelligence agent and her operatives. (imdb)
film.quote: Great soundtrack, and very very stylish. It's nice to see an action movie (though it's kind of light on action) shot in a pretty original way. It handles the innocence and assassin aspects well. I don't know why they thought the ending was a good idea (I mean the very last like, 5 minutes or something). The action scenes are well shot, though. I wouldn't say the plot itself is anything real special, and due to everything I've talked about... this movie is quite a bit different than I expected.

film.summary: Henry, a newly resurrected cyborg who must save his wife/creator from the clutches of a psychotic tyrant with telekinetic powers, AKAN, and his army of mercenaries. Fighting alongside Henry is Jimmy, who is Henry's only hope to make it through the day. Hardcore takes place over the course of one day, in Moscow, Russia. (imdb)
film.quote: Obviously video games and movies like Crank are the big reference points here, and that's true: HH is a bare-bones FPS with a thin story and little reason to care about the characters, yet, the action is mostly inventive with the gimmick working well most of the time. Occasionally it's really disorienting and stifles the flames of violence, and it feels a little long, but up until it becomes a bit of a drag around the third act, it's a hell of a lot of fun. Doesn't reach 'great' status though.

film.filmname: He's Just Not That Into You (2009)
film.summary: The Baltimore-set movie of interconnecting story arcs deals with the challenges of reading or misreading human behavior. (imdb)
film.quote: Oh, it's funny and even has some heart. It has some cliches but then it breaks some others. Justin Long played the best character, and there are a lot of attractive people in here that, whether you want to admit it or not, helps. I liked it more than I thought I would.

film.summary: Saoirse Ronan (Hanna) stars in this adaptation of Meg Rosoff’s award-winning near-future novel about an American teenager sent to live with her family in Britain on the eve of the Third World War, directed by Kevin McDonald (The Last King of Scotland). (tiff.net)
film.quote: I definitely think it was a solid movie, but not overly memorable. There were moments though (spoilers ahead), like when they started shooting up the house unexpectedly.. and everyone does a good job, with Ronan doing an especially good job. It's an interesting tale of... um, incest, but I guess it's touching. I actually like that it's not real explicit about what's going on, because it ended up not really being about that.

film.summary: Friendless Peter Klaven (Rudd) goes on a series of man-dates to find a Best Man for his wedding. But when his insta-bond with new BFF (Segel) puts a strain on his relationship with his fiancée (Jones), can the trio learn to live happily ever after?
film.quote: Very very very predictable. It's just a chick flick for guys, which is growing more and more in popularity I reckon. But it's also a good movie, with some great laughs, great performances from Paul Rudd and the other guy (can't remember his name).

film.summary: After moving to the suburbs of Tokyo two brothers struggle to fit in at their new school. Their father, who made the move to have more in common with his boss, tries to help them become self assured while encountering similar problems at work.
film.quote: I enjoyed it but didn't quite love it. The last little bit was easily the best part, and sometimes it was interesting watching the kids interact with one another. It's shot well, feels real and has good performances.

film.summary: Set in turn-of-the-centuy Vienna, this supernatural mystery combines romance, politics and magic. (Yari Film Group)

In the future people stop aging at 25 and must work to buy themselves more time, but when a young man finds himself with more time than he can imagine he must run from the corrupt police force to save his life. (imdb)
film.quote: While it doesn't do all it could with a very very cool premise, it's still really good. The acting isn't always great, but Cillian Murphy was a very nice pick. I was impressed with Timberlake in Alpha Dogs but he was only serviceable here, much like everyone else (most of the time). But ultimately it's a fun Bonnie & Clyde in a Dystopian Future movie, and it pretty much accomplishes it. I'm a sucker for Dystopias, period, so I enjoyed it. It's not nearly as bad as critics are saying. Fuck 'em.

film.summary: John Q. Archibald (Washington) is an ordinary man who must face the fact that his health insurance will not pay for the emergency heart transplant that is his son&#039;s only hope. Vowing to do whatever it takes to keep his son alive, John Q decides his only hope is a desperate gamble, and he takes the emergency room hostage. (New Line Cinema)
film.quote: It won't wow you. It doesn't do anything out of the ordinary but it is a solid thriller through and through. Denzel gives another good performance but he won't leave you in wonder of his talent.

film.summary: Beings with supernatural powers join together to fight against supernatural villains. This team of supernatural beings include John Constantine, Zatanna and Jason Blood also known as the demon Etrigran. (imdb)
film.quote: The beginning is sufficiently dark and brooding, and the way it builds into the opening credits (and that excellent song) is superb. It's never a bad movie, the action and animation are both good, but it does lose some of its oomph as it goes. The characters aren't written exceptionally well and lack depth, instead focusing on the violence, and it doesn't do a lot to make these unknown (for non-comic book fans) characters worth cheering for, but hey, it's quite entertaining.

film.summary: A documentary that chronicles Katy Perry's life on and off-stage.
film.quote: I actually like Katy, I think her image is interesting and most of the songs I've heard I like. Sometimes it feels very fluffy... like too staged, but then other stuff comes off as genuine. Plus, this is a classic tale of a struggling artist who goes on and accomplishes her dreams while having some personal problems; this stuff usually draws a person in. It helps that Katy Perry actually seems inspired and has a real vision, unlike a lot of pop stars. Now I'm gonna listen to her music..

film.summary: An HIV-positive skateboarder sets out to deflower as many virgins as possible while a local girl who contracted his disease tries to prevent his next target from suffering the same fate as herself.
In this guerrilla short film, Brian, an obnoxious film reviewer, receives a scary phone call from his number one fan. (imdb)
film.quote: It's a nice little twist on Phone Booth. It was well put together, and the acting was solid. Builds tension about as well as it could, but really I'm not sure the premise of &quot;answer movie trivia&quot; was so great. A little silly, but despite that it's done well. There is no real deeper meaning here, but we on Criticker are all critics to some degree so it's nice to watch with that in mind. Solid flick.

film.summary: A story about the clash between personal desires vs. solidarity and tolerance in a Danish commune in the 70's. (imdb)
film.quote: I don't think that it really lives up to the plot summary because in the idea of personal desires vs solidarity and tolerance, it's pretty thin. It touches on it but it was really more of a story about Emma, Erik and Anna and their triangle (if you can call it that), with everyone else as shallow characters meant to occasionally provide some insight/commentary into the triangle. But I still dug it and was impacted by the emotion and the great performance by Trine Dyrholm.

film.summary: A boy who has a bad Christmas ends up accidentally summoning a Christmas demon to his family home. (imdb)
film.quote: I enjoyed it. It isn't that scary by any means, and definitely leans on the comedic side more... but it was fun. Fun isn't usually a word I use to describe horror movies as the main goal is to terrify, but I just went along for the ride here and got into it. Krampus is a bad mother fucker, and I also love scenes like where he is introduced. Just a good time, ultimately.

film.summary: When two people "connect" the bond between them can be so pure and simple as to stir hearts in heaven. When they connect in all the right places at all the wrong times, heaven weeps for broken hearts. To heal these broken hearts, heaven breaks time. (imdb)
film.quote: A bit of a surprise for me. I ended up getting into this. The plot is wonky at times (dealing with time travel usually is), but it was convincing enough that I was able to get past that. Even two actors that I don't usually like were pretty good. It's a good romance flick.

film.summary: The stork mistakenly delivers Lambert, a baby lion, to a flock of sheep. The mother won&#039;t let the stork take him back, so Lambert is raised as a sheep, but he just doesn&#039;t fit in. He grows up cowardly, until the day his mother is chased by a wolf. (imdb)
Four orphan dinosaurs travel the ruins of their world, while grieving the loss of their families and banding together to face the odds of survival. (imdb)
film.quote: Had a lot of fun watching this as a kid. Truthfully that's all I remember so maybe if I watched it now I wouldn't enjoy it as much... but I probably would. Good stuff.

film.summary: An ordinary LEGO minifigure, mistakenly thought to be the extraordinary MasterBuilder, is recruited to join a quest to stop an evil LEGO tyrant from gluing the universe together. (imdb)
film.quote: I actually thought that a fair bit of the humour didn't work. But there were definitely some great laughs and a bunch of moments where I chuckled lightly to myself. Until the last half hour or so, I would have given a 70. But it kicks it up a notch. The social commentary is there through the whole thing but the way it ties Capitalism and lack of individuality into a child's creativity and an adults obsession with just "constructing" lego is nothing short of amazing.

film.summary: A story set in the Prohibition Era and centered around a group of individuals and their dealings in the world of organized crime. (imdb)
film.quote: When I thought about it a little I realized it's probably the worst movie of Affleck's directing career, but I still liked it a fair bit! It was a little overstuffed, felt a little long since it dragged occasionally, the last 10-15 minutes were rushed and over-the-top, like he just needed to put more in it, but as a whole it explores familiar territory with some flair and intelligence.

film.summary: A chronicle of the life, work and mind that created the Cthulhu mythos. (imdb)
film.quote: It runs down his stories, tells a little bit about his life, people give opinions. It's about what you'd expect, and it does it well.

film.summary: Lucky Number Slevin is a thriller that twists and turns its way through an underworld of crime and revenge. Set in New York City, a case of mistaken identity lands Slevin (Hartnett) into the middle of a war being plotted by two of the city&#039;s most rival crime bosses. (The Weinstein Company)
film.quote: A stylish thriller that tries to be clever but sometimes tries a little too hard. I did find it rather humourous and everybody involved did a good enough job acting. It's not a movie you'd want to see again but as a one time thing it'll do the trick if you want to watch people try to out wit each other.

film.summary: Sarah and her cousin Sarah make their way through rural Chile with Sarah’s boyfriend, his sister, and their strange American friend Brink, Alicia’s insomnia slowly takes control. The difference between what is happening in reality and what is happening in her own mind becomes less and less clear to her. After she takes a stab at hypnosis to help solve the problem, things only get worse. As her waking nightmare continues, will her “friends” be her salvation or her downfall? (Sundance)
film.quote: It's definitely... intriguing. I mean, generally when there's someone going crazy I am into it. I wouldn't call this a horror though. The tone is weird, especially at the beginning, but once you adjust to what the characters are like, it's an entertaining watch. It does a good job of keeping you guessing whether her friends are good or bad, the ending was kind of meh, but the performances were good, especially by Juno Temple. It hits a somewhat eerie atmosphere, and uses the landscape well.

film.summary: Both dumped by their girlfriends, two best friends seek refuge in the local mall.
film.quote: My least favourite Smith movie but still funny enough to give a solid recommendation to.

film.filmname: The Man with the Golden Gun (1974)
film.summary: Bond is led to believe that he is targeted by the world's most expensive assassin and must hunt him down to stop him.

A tangled network woven with tiny particles of movements broken out of found footage and compiled anew: the elements of the "to the left, to the right, back and forth" grammar of narrative space, discharged from all semantic burden. What remains is a self-sufficient swarm of splinters, fleeting vectors of lost direction, furrowed with the traces of the manual process of production.
film.quote: An interesting idea, anyway. It's nice to see how the footage is manipulated and changed, to create something new. It feels otherworldly, for this reason.

film.summary: Three years in the making, this documentary provides a fascinating, in-depth portrait of the most successful heavy metal band of all time, as they faced monumental personal and professional challenges while recording their first studio album of original songs in five years. (IFC Films)
film.quote: More interesting than it had any right to be.

film.summary: In the real-time, high stakes thriller Money Monster, financial TV host Lee Gates (George Clooney) and his producer Patty (Julia Roberts) are put in an explosive situation when an irate investor (Jack O'Connell) takes over their studio. (imdb)
film.quote: Obviously there's an agenda here but I don't mind that because artists are allowed to have their own agendas. So if you take away the fact that yes, it is preachy, it's a pretty thrilling ride. Has some comedy that mostly works, some great performances from Clooney, Roberts and my boy O'Connell, and it actually made me feel emotions in my cold heart. Also, that scene with O'Connell's gf that you see in the trailer is much cooler in the movie. Fun, not great... but definitely entertaining.

film.summary: A suspense-filled thriller about a man (Gere) driven to extremes to investigate the mysterious circumstances surrounding his wife&#039;s death -- and how they might be connected to the strange phenomena in a town four hundred miles away. (Screen Gems)
film.quote: Should have spent more time on the Mothman and less time on the personal relationships and the prophecies. I like emotional connection but it's pretty obvious the Mothman is the most interesting character in the myth/conspiracy/story/truth/whatever you want to call it. Still, it was a solid movie with a few really inspired parts. I enjoyed the direction, as the camera just sort of floated about most of the time.

film.summary: In 1935, when his train is stopped by deep snow, detective Hercule Poirot is called on to solve a murder that occurred in his car the night before. (imdb)
film.quote: They draw it out a little bit, but this is one of those movies that is definitely worth a single watch. Repeated viewings won't encourage a change of opinion, since so much of it is focused on the murder mystery. It has a great ensemble cast and all that, and they do a good job, but Finney is easily the best. It's solid, but was unable to keep me on the edge of my seat, like some of the great films in this genre have.

film.summary: At his new high school, a rebellious teen (Faris) is lured into an underground fight club, where he finds a mentor in a mixed martial arts veteran (Hounsou). (imdb)
film.quote: This movie won't let me hate it. When I first saw it I rated it below average, but now the more I think about it, the more I like it. This is not a great film.
