No, it is a movie that's sometimes nonsensical, sometimes unintentional hilarious, with a possibly hypocritical message. It's like a party that eventualy goes to shit. Could have been better but it's still a party, and they clearly had fun in this stylish film. Almost ashamed to give this a 75 but I was entertained, despite the flaws.

film.summary: When his best friend is murdered by the shadowy Ozunu clan, Raizo (Rain), an orphan raised to be an assassin, vows revenge. But a government agent (Naomie Harris) is also trying to expose the gang, and now, the two must work together to bring the Okunu to justice. Time is running out as the clan's professional killers chase the pair across Europe.
film.quote: I enjoyed it. You could pick it apart and all that but I thought the action was mostly inspired. I didn't even have a problem with the direction/cinematography like others have.

film.summary: A woman with a light sensitive condition sits in her dark room talking on the phone with an unseen man. They talk about the weather and her upcoming flight as we look around her darkened flat... (IMDB Comments)
film.quote: See, I like this more than most people here it seems. It creeped me out (regardless of what it is about), and I was a big fan of the beginning and the end. The middle part wasn't anything that fantastic but considering how short the film is, the middle doesn't have enough time to overstay its welcome.

film.summary: An FBI agent and an Interpol detective track a team of illusionists who pull off bank heists during their performances and reward their audiences with the money.
film.quote: The movie is like a magic trick in all ways. It has you guessing, and it uses the same kind of trickery to fool you. The quick edits, flashy CGI and other tricks makes you indeed look closely to try to figure it out. The leads are all charming and the plot moves around a lot and keeps you on your toes. I'm not sure if the ending really did it for me or not, but I did enjoy it the whole way through. I'm also biased 'cuz I've always had an interest in magic, though I can't do it myself.

film.summary: A self-diagnosed nymphomaniac recounts her erotic experiences to the man who saved her after a beating. (imdb)
film.quote: I enjoy Vol. 1, still have to watch 2. It kind of dragged though, to be honest. The Rammstein song completely killed the mood both times it appeared, and made it feel so so cheesy. I felt like the movie was trying to be more meaningful than it really was, but with that said, watching Joe's sex-filled life unfold is still reasonably interesting, helped in part by Martin being able to both play a bitch and somehow be sympathetic. Shia does a good job as well.

film.summary: A movie about the First World War based on a stage musical of the same name, portraying the "Game of War" and focusing mainly on the members of one family (last name Smith) who go off to war. (imdb)
film.quote: There is a lot to love, such as the visuals and the clever way the camera is used. The songs are entertaining, and the satire is on point. Unfortunately, I felt like it went on way too long and dragged, which made me not appreciate the great scenes as much as I could have. Still definitely worth seeing.

film.summary: Struggling with a marriage on the brink of falling apart, a couple escapes for a weekend in pursuit of their better selves, only to discover an unusual dilemma that awaits them. (imdb)
film.quote: You could see the ending coming. But it's an interesting movie about relationships with a slight sci-fi element. The "why" is never explained, and we're expected to just go along for the ride and see how this married couple deal with the idea of a more perfect doppelganger. I guess it not getting bogged down in the why helps somewhat, and the two leads do a wonderful job. It reveals the twist earlier and instead examines the situation, which was an interesting choice. Didn't find it funny tho.

film.summary: A teenage skateboarder's life begins to fray after he is involved in the accidental death of a security guard. [Originally released in 2007]

After experiencing what they think are a series of "break-ins", a family sets up security cameras around their home, only to realize that the events unfolding before them are more sinister than they seem.
film.quote: The bottom line is that it's lesser than the first in almost every way. I felt the pacing wasn't as good (I appreciated the slow build in the first), and while there were some really good scares, it felt cheaper than the first. I was more invested in the characters this time around. It's still a good movie, for the same reasons as the first but to a lesser extent, though it suffers from lacking the mystery of the first and being redundant.

film.summary: John Skillpa, a quiet bank clerk living in tiny Peacock, Nebraska, prefers to live an invisible life. This might have to do with John's secret: he has another personality no one knows about, a woman who each morning does his chores and cooks him breakfast before he starts his day. Then, in a moment, everything changes.
film.quote: It's not a must see, but it has some good performances and an interesting enough story, though it should have went into maybe a little more detail to flesh out the characters a bit more. But I'm sure some people will appreciate it more for the reason I'm knockin' it down a few points.

film.summary: Alan Squier, a failed, world-weary British writer, hikes into an isolated, weather-beaten desert café in Arizona owned by Jason Marple... (imdb)
film.quote: I liked it but it isn't "great." Bogart showed why he would go on to be such a big start in a rugged performance but it's not really the breakout role that it is seen as now. Howard is the star here. The script is fine and snappy enough to keep me interested, but the movie lacks depth in a visual sense. The direction is just bog standard in all ways, never offering up compelling shots. It's also predictable, though it may not have been so long ago... but I'm not bothered by that. A good time.

film.summary: A talented pool hustler who has stayed out of the game for years, must go back to his old ways when his little brother gets involved with his enemy, the very man who held him back from greatness. (imdb)
A soldier with a mechanical suit must defeat Nazis before they spread a virus. (imdb)
film.quote: I hope there's a part 2. I'm assuming the budget was small, so the special effects were done well. I was hesitant to watch cuz I saw "nazi zombies" and they're overdone but there's more to this than just that. The acting was fine, the Sci-Fi elements were implemented well, and the movie maintained a sense of intrigue throughout the 15 or so mins. The battle in the field left a little to be desired, but all-in-all, the grainy, muted colors add a great sense of atmosphere to this Sci-Fi

film.summary: The Feds try to take down notorious American gangsters John Dillinger, Baby Face Nelson and Pretty Boy Floyd during a booming crime wave in the 1930s.
film.quote: Suffered from some of the things that plagued Miami Vice, though not to that extreme (I'm talking of some awkward edits). The DV mostly works but there are a couple shots where it sticks out like a sore thumb. But the movie generally entertains, has some interesting gunfights (but somewhat repetitive), has great acting from Depp especially, and looks absolutely beautiful most of the time. Some scenes, like the chase in the forest have amazing cinematography.

film.summary: Barry Egan is a small business owner with seven sisters who kept him alone and unable to fall in love. When a harmonium and a mysterious woman enter his life, his romantic journey begins.
A documentary that follows a billionaire couple who live in a 90,000-square-foot mansion inspired by Versailles, built on the success of the time-share industry. (imdb)
film.quote: I feel like it mostly makes you have sympathy for the rich people. I think Jackie in particular is the most interesting. David really gets no sympathy from me. I don't know if that's the movie's fault or just my own personal values. Aside from that, it does a good job of depicting a riches to rags (as David said) type of story. Lauren tried but with these kinds of subjects, it's hard to ignore the class hatred or envy (whatever you feel) and truly care. Valiant effort though.

film.summary: Pierrot waxes romantic, entranced by the moon. Harlequin appears and bullies him, then uses a magic lantern to project an image of Columbine...(imdb)
film.quote: I watched the full version which claimed to be the original soundtrack, and the music certainly wasn't pop tunes. It was more eerie, jazzy, really fitting and compelling stuff. Half of the movie is just repetition and tedium, but the last half when other people start showing up becomes a lot better. I enjoy the story, from what I understand, and the blueness of it all. If it wasn't dragged down by the first 7 minutes this would have been great.

film.summary: A surreal, hyperactive farce in which a bumbling petty thief and the lady cop who keeps arresting him fall in love and decide to start a family. When they discover they can&#039;t have babies, they steal one from a furniture mogul who has just sired a set of quintuplets. The joys of parenthood are soon marred, however, by the difficulties of raising an infant on the run. The none-too-bright couple must flee across the southwestern desert in order to elude the villainous biker that has been hired to retrieve the tyke. (20th Century Fox)
film.quote: Wouldn't say this is the funniest movie ever by any means but there are some really funny parts. Watching the insanity (especially Cage, of course) is always entertaining, though.

film.summary: Vietnam veteran John Rambo has survived many harrowing ordeals in his lifetime and has since withdrawn into a simple and secluded existence in Bangkok, where he spends his time salvaging old PT boats and tanks for scrap metal. Even though he is looking to avoid trouble, trouble has a way of finding him... (imdb)
film.quote: Knock knock. Who's there? It's Rambo. AAAAAAAAAARGH. That's what this movie is, Rambo droppin' in on fools and fucking shit up. It's fun. I like the Rambo in First Blood more and this movie doesn't have the raw emotion of Rocky Balboa but this movie has the raw violence and a little bit of social commentary as well.

film.summary: A young police officer must survive his first day's duty in a small country town. (imdb)
film.quote: Definitely some really wonky parts... like, why did he have a boomerang? I'm not sure why some stuff was included. There were some other parts, like the guy missing a bunch of times but it kind of made Jimmy seem protected by divine intervention so I got over it. Maybe I'm looking too into that but it saves the part. Anyway, good performances, not an original plot by any means but told well. Now that I think about it, I think the film is more surrealist than I initially thought. Nice.

film.summary: Set in ancient China, Zeng Jing is a skilled assassin who finds herself in possession of a mystical Buddhist monk's remains. She begins a quest to return the remains to its rightful resting place, and thus places herself in mortal danger because a team of assassins is in a deadly pursuit to possess the remains which holds an ancient power-wielding secret.
film.quote: Very good. Great sense of style, some great action sequences and The Magician (even though he wasn't in the movie a lot I loved him). The only thing that gets me is that the movie is just about the guy wanting to get his penis back. I shit you not. I mean... what? Really one of the only actually dumb parts of the movie, so for that the movie actually drops a little bit. But the rest of it is worth your time. HIS PENIS.

film.summary: Former college roommates Charlie Fineman (Sandler) and Alan Johnson (Cheadle) meet up again by chance on a Manhattan street corner. Five years after losing his family on 9/11, Charlie has retreated from his life, and Alan is stunned to see the changes in his formerly gregarious friend. At the same time, Alan who should be enjoying his beautiful wife, children and career is overwhelmed by his responsibilities. Their rekindled relationship becomes a lifeline for the two men, who are both in need of a trusted friend at this pivotal moment in their lives. (Columbia Pictures)
Originally released in Norway in 2006. Two competitive friends, fueled by literary aspirations and youthful exuberance, endure the pangs of love, depression and burgeoning careers. (imdb)
film.quote: I enjoyed the unusual way it chose to tell its story and I liked Kari, Phillip and Erik. The rest of the characters were kind of disposable but it's not about them really. There are some inspired scenes but sometimes the movie just plods along and lost me a few times. Still, it's a completely well made movie that could have gone terribly wrong and didn't. 10 points for the dog taking Erik out as well... I laughed really hard.

film.summary: In the 1820s, a frontiersman, Hugh Glass, sets out on a path of vengeance against those who left him for dead after a bear mauling. (imdb)
film.quote: There is no doubt the talent involved here. Inarritu shoots this entire thing well, with expert cinematography and a moody soundtrack. DiCaprio gives a great performance but so does Hardy and everybody else. It's suffering pretty much from moment one, but it lacks a little bit of soul. It's 2 and a half hours and feels a bit long, and like kevinjoseph, it didn't have as much impact on me as it should have. It's hard to hate on anything from a technical standpoint. Respected more than liked.

film.summary: A ritual is an action distinguished from all others in that it seeks realization of its purpose through the exercise of form. In this sense ritual is art; and even historically, all art derives from ritual. In ritual the form is the meaning. More speci fically, the quality of movement itself is not a merely decorative factor; it is the meaning itself of the movement. In this sense, this film is a dance. (Picpal.com)

A group of teenagers including Cindy Campbell (Faris) and Bobby Prinze (Abrahams), accidentally hit a man when driving, and dispose of the body, but now they are being stalked by a very recognisable masked killer. The victim count increases, whilst Cindy must survive the carnage that has she has seen in so many films before. (imdb)

Hell raising guitarist with delusions of grandeur Dewey Finn (Black) has been kicked out of his band. Desperate for work, he impersonates a substitute teacher and turns a class of fifth grade high-achievers into high-voltage rock and rollers. (Paramount)

Mort Rainey is a best selling author whose imagination thrills his reader to the core. But one of his stories holds a secret that comes to life. A secret that even he can&#039;t imagine. (Sony Pictures)

A group of British children aged 7 from widely ranging backgrounds are interviewed about a range of subjects. Director Michael Apted plans to re-interview them at 7 year interviews to determine how their lives and attitudes have changed. (imdb)
film.quote: Like some others have said, it's the first one and as such there probably isn't as much depth. But listening to the kids talk is still interesting, regardless. I'll watch the other ones and see how it goes, but as a beginning this is completely solid. It does examine class structure a bit, and that adds a little bit to it.

film.summary: Two teenage girls in small-town Sweden. Elin is beautiful, popular, and bored with life. Agnes is friendless, sad, and secretly in love with Elin. (imdb)
A group of college students are lured to the middle of the desert by a hacker. (imdb)
film.quote: I think the movie loses some ground as it goes on, but the first half or so is pretty tense. I had no idea about it going in so I didn't see things coming. It had a good atmosphere, and creepy music, and the story was interesting. II was enjoying myself until the main character became Sonic and it ended up getting a little cheesy. However, I don't know if I understand the ending criticisms because I understood what was going on and I'm an idiot.

film.summary: Trapped inside her family's lakeside retreat, a young woman descends into madness. (imdb)
film.quote: I think I'm able to look past some of the illogical and ridiculous bullshit because of the "gimmick." The fact that the movie is made up of 12 minute takes (!) and edited together to seem like it's all one, that's fantastic. I mean, that's awesome. It really made me involved in what was going on. Some of the special effects were straight up some Silent Hill shit, which is cool. Olsen was great, but the dialogue and script needed some real work. That's what is keeping it from being higher.

film.summary: Monsterlike cranes reign over an inhospitable harbour as prehistorical reptiles. The only human being they accept is a lonesome fisherman. He is to witness a strange encounter between a ship's mate and a mermaid. Imagination or reality? (imdb)
film.quote: I don't know if this was intentional or not, but I actually chuckled a couple times at this; probably at the ridiculousness--not in a bad way--of the characters and how they act. There's a message her, though it's not always clear what it is. Even still, it's got pretty inspired imagery so even if you don't get it, it's entertaining for sure, if not a little insubstantial.

film.summary: In this chilling, psychological thriller, 8-year-old Cole Sear (Osment) is haunted by a dark secret: he is visited by ghosts. Confused by his paranormal powers, Cole is too young to understand his purpose and too afraid to tell anyone about his anguish, except child psychologist Dr. Malcolm Crowe (Willis). As Dr. Crowe tries to uncover the ominous truth about Cole's supernatural abilities, the consequences for client and therapist are a jolt that awakens them both to something harrowing...and unexplainable. (Hollywood Pictures)
film.quote: While it has a few good scares and is a great viewing the first time, once you are aware of what happens, it loses its appeal. Way too much emphasis put on the twist (which is a good one, but anyways).

film.summary: A father goes undercover for the DEA in order to free his son who was imprisoned after being set up in drug deal. (imdb)
film.quote: Surprisingly solid and NOT what I thought (expected another Rock ass-kicking vehicle). That's not to say it's bad, because it's really not. The Rock gives a great performance as a fragile man willing to do anything for his son. Snitch moves along at a good pace and is pretty intense as things spiral out of control. Well crafted all around, though by no means original or groundbreaking. But does every movie need to be? Nah. This is just a lot of fun.

film.summary: Susan Cooper is an unassuming, deskbound CIA analyst, and the unsung hero behind the Agency's most dangerous missions. But when her partner falls off the grid and another top agent is compromised, she volunteers to go deep undercover to infiltrate the world of a deadly arms dealer, and prevent a global crisis. (imdb)
film.quote: Enjoyed it quite a bit. Melissa McCarthy can be very hit and miss, especially when she goes overboard, but even when she does that in Spy it's pretty entertaining. Statham is hilarious and a lot of the jokes work. It stumbles occasionally but it's still a good comedy.

film.summary: Alice Howland, happily married with three grown children, is a renowned linguistics professor who starts to forget words. When she receives a devastating diagnosis, Alice and her family find their bonds tested. (imdb)
film.quote: Moore once again nails it, and the movie around her is pretty decent. Though ultimately, the most affecting parts of the film are watching her deteriorate. Wasn't quite as sad as I expected, but it was pretty much impossible to not get sad a few times throughout.

film.summary: After witnessing a mysterious train crash, a group of friends in the summer of 1979 begin noticing strange happenings going around in their small town, and begin to investigate into the creepy phenomenon.

A coming-of-age story that follows 12-year-old Andy Nichol (Chase Ellison), a bright student who, like most kids his age, will do anything to avoid conflict for fear of suffering overwhelming ridicule and punishment from his junior high school peers. Everyone's favorite teacher, Mr. Simon (Ed Harris), pairs Andy with the school's biggest outcast and social pariah, Stanley, aka &quot;Big G&quot; (Alexander Walters) on a critical term project. (imdb)
film.quote: It does a good job of doing what coming-of-age stories are meant to do. I like that even though Stanley isn't the main character, the movie kind of revolves around him, in a sense. I thought it was an emotional movie, tackling the irrational fear of homosexuality, the importance of teachers, and of course, kids growing up. I didn't find it overly funny so it's more of a drama to me than a comedy. I guess since it's classified as a comedy, that's a bit of a fail, but fuck it.

film.filmname: This Film Is Not Yet Rated (2006)
film.summary: Kirby Dick's exposé about the American movie ratings board. (imdb)

Faced with an enemy that even Odin and Asgard cannot withstand, Thor must embark on his most perilous and personal journey yet, one that will reunite him with Jane Foster and force him to sacrifice everything to save us all. (imdb)
film.quote: I was going to rate this a 70 but I rated the first one a 70 and I liked this one more I think. The first little while wasn't great but once Loki got unleashed the entire movie just got better, partially because of him but partially because I just felt everything else got more entertaining and amusing. There's some decent action here, decent acting, decent everything. It's just another comic book movie but those are okay once in a while. I'm not a big Thor fan though.

film.filmname: Trailer Park Boys: Countdown to Liquor Day (2009)
film.summary: Ricky, Julian and Bubbles are released from jail again to find that the Sunnyvale Trailer park has moved along with all the residents and Bubbles' kitties have been taken to the SPCA.
film.quote: Yeah I'm on with TheRealJ-Ro about this. There are some gratifying moments and they're still the same characters you know and love but Bubbles, guys and girls, is not THAT funny. He's funny (they all are) but he's not lead material. The movie's funny, it has some genuinely touching moments but it does suffer from not being as, er, raw as most of the rest of Trailer Park Boys. The ending was a cop out and this movie was not the classic (for NSers, y'know) that it should have been.

film.summary: Five years ago David's life came undone when his young daughter fell victim to a brutal attack. The subsequent emotional fallout cost him his marriage and his job. Handicapped by guilt and anguish David abandoned his past and alienated himself. He took a second rate job as a security guard and plodded on - his wounds concealed but unhealed. All it would take is a scratch for them to open wide and consume him... (imdb)
film.quote: A nice revenge flick, nothing more, nothing less. What you will get is a guy having a reason to get back at people... and he goes out and does it. It's not real violent until the end, so most of the movie is a build-up. I'm a big fan of the ending though, instead of a happy ending the movie shows just how useless his attempts were.

film.summary: In a drab, anonymous gray school governed by a strict authoritarian regime, an apparently unremarkable day is turned on its head following a seemingly ridiculous announcement. Disbelieving at first, the all male, identically uniformed pupils are informed that what they had always been taught as fact is no longer true.
film.quote: Simple concept, but done well. Very Orwellian (to the point that it also uses 2+2=5), but that's not bad because this kind of thing still rings true. I wasn't amazed by it despite thinking it was effective, but I will say that offing a kid like that is pretty ballsy considering so many filmmakers are discouraged from doing that.

film.summary: Until the Light Takes Us is a feature length documentary chronicling the history, ideology and aesthetic of Norwegian black metal - a musical subculture infamous as much for a series of murders and church arsons as it is for its unique musical and visual aesthetics.
film.quote: I disagree with people who say there's no point. From it, one can learn that there's an opposing voice in Norway that gets misunderstood, media twists shit the way they want, and one can learn things about black metal they might not have known. It has a good mixture of ambient music and black metal. It's not perfect by any means, but it has a certain aesthetic, a visual and emotional sense, that is true to the scene and is just interesting on its own. Pretty good for a pointless film.

film.summary: Years after walking away from her past as a teenage private eye, Veronica Mars gets pulled back to her hometown - just in time for her high school reunion - in order to help her old flame Logan Echolls, who's embroiled in a murder mystery.
film.quote: I'm not a massive fan of the series, but have a certain affection for the characters so I went in reasonably excited. I wasn't disappointed. It's a compelling murder mystery with Bell delivering clever and witty retorts to just about everyone... just like the TV show. Maybe it doesn't feel as big as a movie should, but it's a damn good episode, if nothing else. It's not a movie for people unfamiliar with the show, but that should be obvious.

film.summary: A documentary about one of Britain's most dangerous crime families and introduces us to its magnetic, larger-than-life leader, Dominic Noonan (aka Lattlay Fottfoy).
film.quote: It's a subject I know very little about so that works in its favor. I feel like it could have gone into a little more detail but I suppose you can't say everything.

film.summary: A soldier returning from the war in Afghanistan uncovers a conspiracy involving the intelligence services and a gang of drug dealers. (imdb)
film.quote: I'm not really with the bad reviews here. Most of the movie builds, and I feel tries to say a little something, and then I really liked the last 15-20 minutes or whatever. I thought it was extremely well done. I enjoyed it, solid performances, decent script. There are flaws, and this won't be one of the best movies of the year but I did really like it. Sometimes the plot didn't move in the most coherent way, yes, but mostly it was good.

film.summary: A single mother finds that things in her family's life go very wrong after her two young children visit their grandparents. (imdb)
film.quote: I dug it. It's a mess tonally, and sometimes it feels like M. Night is slipping into bad habits, but then some of the writing is some of the most clever stuff he has done since Unbreakable. He's still a talented director, and this is funnier than it is scary. The horror lacks a little, and is sometimes silly, but I laughed a bunch of times.

film.summary: Chris, an elderly Alzheimer's sufferer, is confined to his home. His son, Michael, is his primary caregiver. For months Chris' mind has been fading away and with it his grasp on reality. He is desperately trying to hold onto his mind. Chris is passing further and further from recognition. Michael is left wracked by survivors guilt. But to Chris, the world around him has become nothing more than a waking dream... (imdb)
film.quote: Let's get the bad out of the way. The guy who played the son was bad, the sound editing was wonky at times, and some of the writing was too blunt, especially at the beginning. When you get past that though, there's an incredibly touching movie here as we watch this old man struggle. It is bound to pull on your heart strings, and the last line (before the part in the credits) is very sad. Spoiler: "Can you show it to me again?" Ends up being a very sad movie despite its flaws.

film.summary: New England, 1630: William and Katherine lead a devout Christian life, homesteading on the edge of an impassible wilderness, with five children. When their newborn son mysteriously vanishes and their crops fail, the family begins to turn on one another. 'The Witch' is a chilling portrait of a family unraveling within their own fears and anxieties, leaving them prey for an inescapable evil. (imdb)
film.quote: I thought I'd love it but I only liked it. You can't fault the foreboding atmosphere and the cinematography, along with the wonderful performances. The dialogue is hard to understand at times, but there was a lot of research here. My issue is that for as creepy as it is--not allowing us to feel any sanctuary from the tone--it doesn't have enough moments in it that impacted me. There were a couple, but I wasn't terrified (and I thought I would be). Works more as a drama than a horror.

film.filmname: Yakuza Apocalypse: The Great War of the Underworld (2015)
film.summary: Yakuza vampires battle it out to avenge the death of their boss at the hands of an international syndicate.
film.quote: While FrankHowley is right in the sense it doesn't have a lot of heart, I feel it covers it up by just being batshit crazy. And that's appealing to me, to have such an energetic film. It's not without other flaws -- some of the gags don't work -- but it's an exciting thrill ride full of Yakuza vampires, guys in frog costumes (and a giant frog eater of worlds), and some fun martial arts action. Solid junk food.

film.summary: A computer hacker's goal to discover the reason for human existence continually finds his work interrupted thanks to the Management; this time, they send a teenager and lusty love interest to distract him. (imdb)
film.quote: I actually liked it a bit more than Brazil, and I know that's strange. It might have been my mood when I watched Brazil, but that was so long ago I don't remember. But I love the visuals on display here, and I actually cared a little bit about the main character. The weirdness was appealing, and I generally had a good time watching this man stuck in a world overrun by technology and a job that looks like Minecraft. It's not real deep, but it's good enough to be worth thinking about.

film.summary: Evan Treborn has lost track of time. From an early age, crucial moments of his life have disappeared into a black hole. Determined to do something now that he was incapable of doing then, Evan purposely travels back in time.

Everyone has experienced the mystery of deja vu, but what if the feelings were actually warnings sent from the past or clues to the future? It is deja vu that guides ATF agent Doug Carlin through an investigation into a shattering crime. Called in to recover evidence after a bomb sets off an explosion on a New Orleans Ferry, Carlin is about to discover that what most people believe "is only in their heads" is actually something far more powerful.
film.quote: The technology is really absurd but the action is exciting despite that. Denzel Washington gives another good performance. Just don't expect a plot that makes tons of sense, suspend your disbelief a lot, and this will be an entertaining movie.

film.summary: Neo and the rebel leaders estimate that they have 72 hours until 250,000 probes discover Zion and destroy it and its inhabitants. During this, Neo must decide how he can save Trinity from a dark fate in his dreams.

A secret experiment...a deadly virus...a fatal mistake. Based on the wildly popular video game series, Resident Evil is an action-packed thriller starring Milla Jovovich in a battle of good and evil, human versus computer, the living against the Undead. (Sony Pictures)

Underworld reimagines Vampires as a secretive clan of modern aristocratic sophisticates whose mortal enemies are the Lycans (werewolves), a shrewd gang of street thugs who prowl the city&#039;s underbelly. (Screen Gems)
film.quote: An entertaining enough vampire/werewolves romp with an attractive lead. A really attractive lead.

film.summary: A young man comforts his older brother's wife and children after he goes missing in Afghanistan.
film.quote: It was good. It didn't tug at me like the movieobviously wanted to but it was still pretty sad, with great peformances all around. Still, there were some really wonky parts amongst the great parts and the very last scene was a little uninspired (the scene before it was great though)

film.summary: Born with a gift he didn&#039;t want, the ability to clearly recognize the half-breed angels and demons that walk the earth in human skin, Constantine (Reeves) was driven to take his own life to escape the tormenting clarity of his vision. But he failed. Resuscitated against his will, he found himself cast back into the land of the living. Now, marked as an attempted suicide with a temporary lease on life, he patrols the earthly border between heaven and hell, hoping in vain to earn his way to salvation by sending the devil&#039;s foot soldiers back to the depths. (Warner Bros.)
film.quote: Even though it basically shits all over the comic book, it's a moody thriller that makes you want to smoke. I'm kidding about the smoking thing... sort of. Keanu Reeves gives a decent enough performance and the action is pretty entertaining as well. It's not even close to being a great movie but if you want a religious theme thriller with demon killing, and don't want to have to think, here's a decent enough one.

film.summary: When a secret governmant agency re-programs a criminal named Nikita (Parillaud), she is released to the outside world as their agent. As her missions become more and more demanding, she is torn between her alliance to the agency and her desire to lead, for once, a normal life. (20th Century Fox)
film.quote: Liked it but didn't love it. The psychological elements of it are interesting enough, how Nikita loses her individuality because of a coersive government. I think the blue tint works well enough, but there were some quirky parts I didn't care for that made it all seem just... really silly and it didn't really seem like the right movie for that. The action, when it happens, is pretty good too. Jean Reno = Awesome.

film.summary: Two sisters find their relationship challenged as a nearby planet threatens to collide into the Earth. (imdb)
film.quote: Quite a step down from Antichrist and a little disappointing (expectations reign), but it was still a good movie. The beginning and end = amazing, and are very memorable. Everyone does a really good job acting here, but big big props to Dunst (and her boobies), who I've never seen as a great actress before. Good direction in pretty much every way and incredible music (I like how it's pretty much one song). But I couldn't get engaged, it just kind of plods along.

film.filmname: The Men Who Stare at Goats (2009)
film.summary: A reporter in Iraq might just have the story of a lifetime when he meets Lyn Cassady, a guy who claims to be a former member of the U.S. Army's First Earth Battalion, a unit that employs paranormal powers in their missions.
film.quote: It does feel like The Informant in some ways, like someone else said but I liked this a lot more. Maybe it's because I understood the jokes more, and I understood what they were talking about more often. I love the cast here and without them this would be worse. The problem is that it goes for pretty long stretches without a laugh (but has some great ones) and this movie isn't the most emotional thing ever so you're left with a few too many parts where you feel nothing. Still, a good flick.

film.summary: Three unknowing martial artists are summoned to a mysterious island to compete in a tournament whose outcome will decide the fate of the world (imdb)

A raucous comedy about a trio of thirty-something buddies who try to recapture the outrageous, irrepressible fun of their college years by starting their own off-campus frat house. (DreamWorks Pictures)
After a zombie becomes involved with the girlfriend of one of his victims, their romance sets in motion a sequence of events that might transform the entire lifeless world. (imdb)
film.quote: A few more laughs would have pushed this over into an 80 for me. The beginning I found really funny then the laughter sort of died out for a bit. It's not necessarily bad because the drama took over and it's surprisingly emotional. Still, it just got a few minor chuckles here and there as it went on so while it didn't live up to the standard it started with, this is a movie like Twilight but much much better.

film.summary: Lemmy Caution, an American private-eye, arrives in Alphaville, a futuristic city on another planet.... (imdb)
An experimental short film by Maya Deren.

A boy finds a balloon - or is it the other way around? Together the pair wanders the beautiful streets of Paris, coping with grownups and the local bands of childrens. When one of the pair disappears, the loss is but temporary... (imdb)
film.quote: No don't leave that balloon outside it'll fly away! Wait it isn't? Holy crap! Man, the death of the balloon is gruesome. It's like American History Balloon or something. I think the balloon should have gotten an Oscar. Anyway, you can examine this movie and what it means, but even on the surface... somehow 35 minutes of basically watching a balloon chill out wasn't boring. Wu-Tang is for the kids! Er... sorry, The Red Balloon is for the kids! Seriously, make your kids watch this.

film.summary: When a corrupt businessman and the grotesque Penguin plot to take control of Gotham City, only Batman can stop them, while the Catwoman has her own agenda.

Hsiao-hsien's landmark epic uses the story of a single family to reflect the most chaotic period in Taiwan's history: four years that witness the end of Japanese occupation, mass migrations from the mainland, and the rise of martial law.
film.quote: It failed to really get me involved despite the fact the kind of stuff it tackled really appealed to me. It's solid film making, don't get me wrong, I just failed to get engaged. I wish I could give it a higher store.

film.summary: The last dragon and a disillusioned dragonslaying knight must cooperate to stop an evil king who was given partial immortality. (imdb)
Lancelot falls in love with Guinevere, who is due to be married to King Arthur. Meanwhile, a violent warlord tries to seize power from Arthur and his Knights of the Round Table.
A young writer who follows strangers for material meets a thief who takes him under his wing. (imdb)
film.quote: Really entertaining idea executed well. Story telling can still bloom despite low budgets and this just proves that idea. Though it's not as good as his other films, this is a great beginning point for Nolan.

film.filmname: He Died with a Felafel in His Hand (2001)
film.summary: A search for love, meaning and bathroom solitude. Danny goes through a series of shared housing experiences in a succession of cities on the east coast of Australia. Together these vignettes form a narrative that is surprisingly reflective. (imdb)
film.quote: Definitely a clever movie, had some funny parts, had some good performance and some memorable characters. I wouldn't go as far as to say this is a great movie but it's good.

film.summary: A gang of robbers, lead by career criminal Charlie Croker, create the largest traffic jam in Los Angeles history, giving them time to pull off a theft of gold bullion. They get away in their Mini Coopers, which are small enough to drive on sidewalks so they can make a clean get away before the traffic jam clears.

film.filmname: Pirates of the Caribbean: Dead Man's Chest (2006)
film.summary: Johnny Depp, Orlando Bloom and Keira Knightley reunite this epic tale chronicling the further mis-adventures of Captain Jack Sparrow. (Buena Vista Pictures)
A human drama about the struggle of a true genius, inspired by events in the life of John Forbes Nash, Jr.

Frank W. Abagnale (DiCaprio) worked as a doctor, a lawyer and as a co-pilot for a major airline -- all before his 21st birthday. A master of deception, he was also a brilliant forger, whose skill at check fraud had netted him millions of dollars in stolen funds. FBI agent Carl Hanratty (Hanks) has made it his prime mission to capture Frank and bring him to justice, but Frank is always one step ahead of him, baiting him to continue the chase. (DreamWorks)
film.quote: Solid and above average the entire way through. Not a great movie but good. DiCaprio is wonderful and so is Hanks, though this is really no surprise.

film.summary: Jake Vig (Burns) is a consummate grifter about to pull his biggest con yet, one set to avenge his friend's murder. But his last scam backfired, leaving him indebted to a mob boss (Hoffman) and his enforcer. (imdb)
film.quote: Well Ed Burns oozed charm. In fact, the whole cast was pretty solid. The story is complicated enough to be interesting and require some thought. It's a decent entertainment and that's good enough!

film.filmname: Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas (1998)
film.summary: When a writing assignment lands journalist Raoul Duke and sidekick Dr. Gonzo in Las Vegas, they decide to make it the ultimate business trip. But before long, business is forgotten and trip has become the key word. Fueled by a suitcase full of mind-bending pharmaceuticals, Duke and Gonzo set off on a fast and furious ride through nonstop neon, surreal surroundings and a crew of the craziest characters ever.
film.quote: Despite the imagery (Gilliam seems to be good at that..), I wasn't pulled into the drug fueled world that this created. Depp did well enough and nailed Thompsons mannerisms but this doesn't hit the urgency that the incredible novel does.

film.summary: A romantic comedy set against the backdrop of America's nascent pro-football league in 1925.
film.quote: I went to see it because I was bored and was pretty surprised. It feels like a Coens brother movie, Clooney is charming as usual and does a fine job directing. It also shows how commercialism invaded football.

film.summary: A shy and mute seamstress goes insane after being attacked and raped twice in one day, in which she takes to the streets of New York after dark and randomly kills men with a .45 caliber gun. (imdb)

Special agent Frank Castle had it all: A loving family, a great life, and an adventurous job. But when his life is taken away from him by a ruthless criminal and his associates, Frank has become reborn. Now serving as judge, jury, and executioner, he's a new kind of vigilante out to wage a one man war against those who have done him wrong. (imdb)
film.quote: Sometimes you just want to see someone get revenge. It's not a great film but it's pretty mindless action.

film.summary: Set in the lowlands of North Carolina, this story follows the rite of passage of a jaded, aimless high school senior (West) as he falls in love with a guileless young woman (Moore) he and his friends once scorned. (Warner Brothers)
film.quote: I blubber up.

film.summary: After getting in a car accident, a woman is held in a shelter by two men, who claim the outside world is affected by a widespread chemical attack. (imdb)
film.quote: First thing's first: Goodman is terrifying when he's angry. Winstead is great too but god damn Goodman you're awesome. Besides that, I enjoyed almost the entire time in the bunker, but felt that the final act fell flat. It was incredibly unsatisfying after all that build, and this didn't need to be a Cloverfield "sequel." In fact, I would say that throwing the name on it and forcing it in hurt the film immensely. Still enjoyed the flick though based on the dialogue and strength of the leads.

film.summary: It is 1987 and Jenna is a 13-year-old girl on the brink of womanhood. The problem is that adulthood is just not arriving fast enough. She makes a wish on her birthday: If only she could be all grown up, she'd have the life she's always wanted. Miraculously, her wish comes true. (Columbia Pictures)
film.quote: What? So I liked this. Wanna fight about it?

film.summary: A group of Iraq War veterans looks to clear their name with the U.S. military, who suspect the four men of committing a crime for which they were framed.
film.quote: Does what it sets out to do. It's pretty funny and some of the action scenes (flying the tank) were pretty awesome. In some scenes they really cheaped out but it's forgiven.

film.summary: A drama centered on a troubled young woman who moves to San Francisco, where she gets involved in pornography and aligns herself with a cocaine-addicted lawyer. (imdb)
film.quote: I agree with Rufflesack that the ending felt weird and out of place. In fact, I actually thought the movie was a solid take on the "girl getting into porn" idea... Hinshaw played a tragic character but the movie wasn't just like GIRLS WHO ARE IN PORN ARE DAMAGED, which is nice. I mean, she is, but it isn't her only reason for doing it, and porn isn't treated like the devil in this movie. Good performance by her, rest of the movie was good, but deserved a better ending. Hot sexual scenes too.

film.summary: An unprecedented blend of real-life heroism and original filmmaking, Act of Valor stars a group of active-duty Navy SEALs in a powerful story of contemporary global anti-terrorism. Inspired by true events, the film combines stunning combat sequences, up-to-the minute battlefield technology and heart-pumping emotion for the ultimate action adventure. (imdb)
film.quote: It's really hard to get past the general "yay America and yay the SEALs" feeling, but I mean I knew this going in. I didn't really go in for a super engaging story... I went in for cool action scenes and I enjoyed them all. The movie definitely has its share of lame movie moments that kind of break the realism but for the most part it's gritty and interesting, and the wonky acting can't stop how fun it is. Plus even the FPS moments worked.

film.summary: A Navy S.E.A.L. recounts his military career, which includes more than 150 confirmed kills. (imdb)
film.quote: I enjoyed it, ultimately, but it's flawed. It doesn't spend enough time actually dealing with the issues it sets up. The beginning though is incredible, and that's why they chose to edit that and make it the trailer. At some point though, you realize you're kinda just watching a war movie. It never gets boring, and the action is directed well, but it doesn't have the emotional impact that I hoped for. Cooper put in another great performance, though.

film.summary: The true saga of a working-class Everyman who pursues self-expression without self-censorship -- and finds a grateful audience, critical admiration, and that most remarkable of happy endings, a loving family. (Fine Line Features)
Photo-animated feature documentary, uniquely narrated by the 10 people who knew Bill best. (imdb)
film.quote: Not a bad look into Bill Hicks by any means. That's all it tries to be, except they use an interesting (though sometimes off-putting) visual style. A good documentary for a brilliant comedian.

film.summary: A broken-hearted hit man moves to the desert where he finds skilled swordsmen to carry out his contract killings.
film.quote: I don't know if the fight scenes really work for me here. Not sure. But what I do know is that the movie is absolutely beautiful and it is an interesting take on wuxia. I, like others, found it extremely confusing and I don't know if that's due to the writing or just me being stupid. I also enjoy the score and at the end there was a scene that really involved me but most of the time I was unable to truly get into it.

film.summary: Jacq Vaucan, an insurance agent of ROC robotics corporation, routinely investigates the case of manipulating a robot. What he discovers will have profound consequences for the future of humanity. (imdb)
film.quote: It's refreshing to see a Sci-Fi movie about AI and robots that become self-aware that doesn't actually make them bad guys. The premise of this is interesting because of that. However, there's some hokey acting here, it overstays its welcome a little bit, and the pacing is off on occasion. It's still a well shot movie with nice music, special effects and cinematography, but it doesn't end up being anything incredibly captivating.

film.summary: Lauren Bacall tells the story of her late husband Humphrey Bogart, presenting clips from his movies and interview clips with his peers. (imdb)
film.quote: Probably should have been called, "A rundown of his movies and oh yeah, Bacall talks a little bit about him too," but I suppose that title is too long. However, there were clips from shows and rarely seen other clips so it was cool, and things like the home movies and whatnot were really interesting. You get pretty much all positive things about Bogie, and the end was emotional and very well done. I suppose I just wanted more about him and their life, but it does what it sets out to do.

film.summary: One hundred million dollars worth of confiscated heroin has just been jacked from police custody. Once the career bust of Detective Mike Lowery (Smith) and Marcus Burnett (Lawrence), the missing drugs now threaten to shut down the narcotics division of the Miami Police Department. (Sony)
film.quote: Explosion!

film.summary: Probably no one in the public listening to the orchestra's rendition of Ravel's Bolero notices him but the drummer is a regular hero. For, although his mind is assailed by loads of unsettling thoughts and worries, he tries to keep the rhythm at any cost. He knows all too well that he falls out of time only once all the magic of the piece will vanish. Will the drummer hold on till the end...? (imdb)
film.quote: It's pretty funny and actually kinda made me think: This is one of those things in music that has always baffled me... how somebody can sit there and do something like the drummer in this does, for as long as the drummer does. I won't even say it overstays its welcome (though it's true nothing really happens), because I think this is the point.

film.summary: Michael Keaton is the name in laughter from the hereafter as an obnoxious poltergeist conjured up to bedevil an unwanted family of oddballs. (Warner Bros)
The best-selling mobile game, Rovio's &quot;Angry Birds&quot;, told in the style of Alfred Hitchcock's 1963 classic &quot;The Birds&quot;. (imdb)
film.quote: Nice little homage to The Birds.

film.summary: 123 elite U.S. soldiers drop into Somalia to capture two top lieutenants of a renegade warlord and find themselves in a desperate battle with a large force of heavily-armed Somalis. (imdb)
A lateral descent through the midnight blues and blacks of ice and the refracted colors from absorbed oils. (imdb)
film.quote: I'm not really sure what to say so er... it's kinda pretty. I'm not going to watch it again though.

film.summary: A furloughed convict and his American and Chinese partners as they hunt a high-level cybercrime network from Chicago to Los Angeles to Hong Kong to Jakarta. (imdb)
film.quote: When it's being a cyber-thriller, it's tense and interesting. Mann delivers another street shootout which is not quite Heat but it's great. In fact, the shootouts are a highlight with wonderful music backing them. The soundtrack as a whole is great. It loses its way at the end though, with the way everything becomes a little too convenient and unbelievable. Why can a huge group not see the guns? Shouldn't have made Hemsworth a super badass at everything. Weak writing at times as well.

film.summary: To ruin a western town, a corrupt political boss appoints a black sheriff, who promptly becomes his most formidable adversary. (imdb)
film.quote: It got off to a great start but the quality dipped a lot as it went on, becoming significantly less funny with more jokes that flop. However, I did really enjoy how it wrapped up, so it's just a shame that it is kind of middling for a while.

film.summary: In this follow-up to &#034;Smoke,&#034; it&#039;s nonstop laughs when a wacky group of locals visits the neighborhood cigar shop, looking for good times ... and finding plenty of hilarious fun! But when the greedy owner threatens to close the shop for good -- and turn it into a trendy vegetarian restaurant -- the neighborhood proves they&#039;ll do just about anything to save their favorite hangout! (Miramax)
film.quote: There's some solid acting by everyone involved but I really liked Michael J. Fox and Harvey Keitel. The documentary style parts are pretty interesting, talking about life in Brooklyn. It's not a flashy movie and it's cool that it's mostly improv. There are some funny parts too but it's not overly hilarious.

film.summary: A former journalist injured in the Iraq war is hired by the CIA to track down an Al Qaeda leader in Jordan. Based on the novel "Body of Lies" by David Ignatius
film.quote: It really heavily relies on the actors to make it believable and despite what goes on, you should mostly believe it, or at least suspend your disbelief long enough to enjoy it. DiCaprio impressed me again but everyone was great. There's not much else that's great about it, though. The direction is rock solid, but it's Scott so you can expect that even if he's made some stinkers in his career (who hasn't?). It's a solid political thriller, see it once, never watch it again.

film.summary: A Secret Service Agent is held captive in the trunk of a car and endures high-speed mental and physical torture as terrorists attempt to extract needed information for their sinister plot. (imdb)
film.quote: Not quite a Buried clone, but fairly close. This has more action but the lead performance isn't nearly as strong. The plot in this has more at stake so I think in that way it's a little better, but the writing isn't as strong. It was predictable but I'll admit the last twist got me. Up until then I had pretty much guessed everything. I'm glad that extra twist was there.

film.summary: Brazil is a surrealistic nightmare vision of a &#034;perfect&#034; future where technology reigns supreme. Everyone is monitored by a secret government agency that forbids love to interfere with efficiency. When a daydreaming bureaucrat (Pryce) becomes unwittingly involved with an underground superhero and a beautiful mystery woman, he becomes the tragic victim of his own romantic illusions. (Universal Pictures)
film.quote: Well it's a fantasy movie set in a technological dystopia. It mixes slapstick and a certain sadness of being in a dead end job in a society that is run by poorly maintained machines. It is a really visual movie... often times the stunning visuals actually take over the movie but I didn't really invest much into this movie, except for a couple scenes.

film.summary: An African-American's eyewitness accounts of notable events of the 20th century during his tenure as a White House butler. (imdb)
film.quote: I didn't expect to like this at all and only watched it because it was put on and I happened to be there. While it's not exactly subtle, it was a surprisingly moving tale through a large period of time. Not overly memorable but it made me feel something. Better than expected.

film.summary: This documentary recounts the 90 mile voyage that poet John Clare took in 1841 to find his dead lover Mary Joyce.
film.quote: I enjoy the trickery and images here, and I like the experimental nature. Ultimately I don't think the subject matter is THAT interesting, it is a bit of a slog at times and you could gather more information about the actual walk from reading Wikipedia for 30 seconds. Still not a bad movie by any means... though the &quot;gimmicks&quot; save it admittedly.

film.summary: A lonely and disturbed cable guy raised on television just wants a new friend, but his target, a designer, rejects him, with bad consequences. (imdb)

World Wrestling Entertainment superstar Steve Austin stars as Jack Conrad, a death-row prisoner in a corrupt Central American prison who is "purchased" by a wealthy television producer to take part in an illegal reality game show. Brought to a desolate island, Conrad finds himself trapped in a fight to the death against nine other condemned killers from all corners of the world. (Lionsgate)
film.quote: Meh, fuck it. Watch it, have a good time.

film.summary: A security guard with financial troubles considers a return to his smuggling ways when an associate offers a potentially lucrative opportunity. (imdb)
film.quote: By my scale this is a 'very good' so maybe I'm rating it too high, like Ytadel, but I agree with his/her review. Honestly; this is a fun little, unoriginal, but well acted movie. It does nothing you haven't seen a million times, but most of it is thrilling. It builds some tension, and even though I felt like the whole thing with the wife at the end was kind of wonky, I had a good time. If a movie entertains it gets a recommendation from me, and Contraband does.

film.summary: A love romance between older, respectable engineer that came in the industrial town to do some expert job and young hairdresser in whose house he stayed in and the consequences of that relationship, especially after young driver gets involved. (imdb)
film.quote: I wasn't in love with this flick. I didn't think it was that entertaining or anything or even that amazing from a film making perspective, except for the intelligence behind it, especially given the context of which it was made. It definitely examines the living conditions in a smart way. Oh, there was also a moment of inspired music as well but this is about it. It's not a dig really, everything else is competent just now awe-inducing. Still, it's IMPORTANT.

film.summary: A young man whose job is to watch over the Cube endeavours to rescue an innocent woman trapped in one of its rooms. (imdb)
A hot-tempered farm laborer convinces the woman he loves to marry their rich but dying boss so that they can have a claim to his fortune (imdb)
film.quote: While I think Malick is a talented director I can't say that I got involved in this movie, outside of a few scenes like the locusts or the beginning. It just kind of bored me. Still, it's obvious Malick is a great director so it isn't as low as it could be.

film.summary: Nick Hume (Kevin Bacon) is a mild-mannered executive with a perfect life, until one gruesome night he witnesses something that changes him forever. Transformed by grief, Hume eventually comes to the disturbing conclusion that no length is too great when protecting his family. (imdb)
The devil has a stye in his eye, caused by the purity of a vicar&#039;s daughter. To get rid of it, he sends... (imdb)

Two teens begin to suspect that one of their neighbors is a serial killer. Are their suspicions merely the product of cabin fever and vivid imagination? Or have they unwittingly stumbled across a crime that could cost them their lives? (Paramount Pictures)
film.quote: Solid enough thriller that loses its way at the end.

film.filmname: Don't Be a Menace to South Central While Drinking Your Juice in the Hood (1996)
film.summary: "Don&#039;t Be a Menace to South Central While Drinking your Juice in the Hood" is a parody of a lot of Afro-American movies... (imdb)
film.quote: Was absoulutely hilarious for the first 40 minutes then I only laughed about 3 times the rest of the film. Still, for the first 40 mins which were golden, it gets this rating.

film.summary: Haunted by the disappearance of his father, who vanished with the Roman Ninth Legion on an expedition into the north of Britain, centurion Marcus Aquila (Channing Tatum) sets out to unravel the mystery and recover the legion's eagle standard. But in the wilds of Caledonia, the soldier and his British slave (Jamie Bell) encounter fierce native tribes and other dangers. Kevin Macdonald directs this adaptation of Rosemary Sutcliff's novel.
film.quote: You know, going against what I expected when going in, I thoroughly enjoyed this. I thought it had a great visual sense, and even Mumbles Tatum did a good job. Some parts were by the book but that's not a bad thing if done well, and for the most part it is. I was interested the whole way through. Some of the action scenes were inspired but sometimes I wish these movies wouldn't film everything so zoomed in... zoom out once in a while and let the action breathe.

film.summary: A restaurant opens for the night. The diners include: A man dining alone, who orders a plate of spaghetti that becomes his dining companion. A couple; the woman talks endlessly (and unintelligibly), as her head mutates into a variety of shapes. Her ravenous companion refuses to pay, and the restaurant reclaims its food. A family with two children; they play, rather elaborately, with their food. (imdb)
film.quote: Pretty funny stuff. That's a happenin' restaurant.

film.summary: The spiritual sequel of Dazed and Confused. A group of college baseball players navigate their way through the freedoms and responsibilities of unsupervised adulthood. (imdb)
film.quote: I enjoyed it just fine, but it's not an incredible movie. First of all, it wasn't as funny as I had hoped; it has a few great lines scattered throughout but it needed more consistency. Even though I thought the story was passable, the beginning bit left me feeling cold. It wasn't until I started to gel with these characters that the movie opened up and I became more engrossed. Unfortunately, by that time we were at least halfway through. Finn is fantastic and charming.

film.summary: The Manzoni family, a notorious mafia clan, is relocated to Normandy, France under the witness protection program, where fitting in soon becomes challenging as their old habits die hard. (imdb)
film.quote: I liked it. It was thoroughly enjoyable, but not overly memorable. Good performances all around, with some funny moments (like the reoccurring Fuck gag), but it wasn't hilarious by any means. Solid on all fronts, and I especially liked the song in the final part. I also enjoyed Tommy Lee Jones whenever he talked to De Niro, it was like two grisly vets talking to one another both in the movie and in real life.

film.summary: With her husband away indefinitely, a young mother struggles to nurture her son in the face of poverty, isolation and incarceration. FLUTTER explores the truest love on earth-the love of a mother and child. (imdb)
film.quote: Flutter is a decent enough drama but there are some issues holding it back on its way to greatness, namely, due to the apparent laziness of the mother, it is easy to question the love she has for her son. It is never explained why she has money problems (just throw in a few lines for gods sake), so even though we are bombarded with her love for him, that is an underlying point of contention. It's still a solid drama in every other way though.

film.summary: A treatise about methods of gaining power, the film features characters who are shown from a bird's eye view and resemble pawns on a chessboard more than people.
film.quote: After I read more about this, I started appreciating it more. I do like the birds eye view of the people, I think it's a nice touch. Also, the animation is simple but it gets the point across. The way they walk to the music also enforces the idea that the director was trying to get across (a swipe at the Poland system at the time). I went from not recommending this to giving it a 70 in a pretty short time. I guess I just wasn't sure what I was watching at first. Once you know, it's good.

film.summary: A 9 minute comedy starring Dominique Pinon (Delicatessen). Featuring muted colors with a sepia black and white, Pinon takes the viewer through various examples of what he "likes and dislikes". The music is by Carlos D'Alessio and Special Thanks is given to Claudie Ossard. (imdb)
film.quote: Fun and quirky, some good gags in here. Not especially astounding but entertaining.

film.summary: Craig and Smokey are two guys in Los Angeles hanging out on their porch on a Friday afternoon, smoking and drinking. (imdb)
film.quote: It doesn't astound the audience, outside of Tucker actually being competent and perhaps even a little bit likable, but it's a fun enough comedy about a couple of dudes lazing around, smoking weed and talking shit. Not as funny as it could have been, but some good laughs exist like, "I saw the window open so I said 'fuck it.'" What makes it a little bit better than an average comedy is that I found myself caring for the characters.

film.summary: An Alaska State Trooper partners with a young woman who escaped the clutches of serial killer Robert Hansen to bring the murderer to justice. Based on actual events. (imdb)
film.quote: We've seen this type of movie a million times, but when it's done well, it's a good time. I always enjoy watching Cage, and oh shit that WAS Vanessa Hudgens (I didn't even know). It's an exciting, fast-paced tale of trying to catch a serial killer. Not innovative, not original, not OVERLY memorable, but enjoyable from beginning to end.

film.summary: A man suffering an incredible amount of loss enrolls in a class about care-giving that changes his perspective on life.
film.quote: I love Rudd. I think I say that every time I see a Rudd movie (I CHECKED, in almost every review I've written about a movie he's in I've said it). Aside from that, it's not a remarkable dramedy but it's not a bad one. It has some good laughs, some heart and teaches us--admittedly--the same kind of stuff that this genre is known for. But it entertains, and that's what we want.

film.summary: The G.I. Joes are not only fighting their mortal enemy Cobra; they are forced to contend with threats from within the government that jeopardize their very existence. (imdb)
film.quote: *Shrugs* I thought it was fun, and that's really good enough for me. Sue me.

film.filmname: George Carlin: You Are All Diseased (1999)
film.summary: Legendary comic Carlin comes back to the Beacon theater to angrily rant about airport security, germs, cigars, angels, children and parents, men, names, religion, god, advertising, Bill Jeff and minorities. (imdb)
film.quote: I don't think this hits as hard as the other stuff I've seen by him. That's not to say it's BAD because it isn't. He's still interesting, his rants are mostly on-point, it just lacks the humour to go along with it. I go to Carlin for a mixture of comedy and anger, this has way more anger than comedy. So it's still not boring, but he's done better. A lot better. Because at his best, really no one could touch him.

film.summary: Berke Landers (Foster) has done the impossible and landed the babe of everyone's high school dreams, Allison (Sagemiller). Just as he is really beginning to enjoy his newfound popularity -- he gets unexpectedly dissed for the hot new guy in school. Crushed, he is willing do just about anything to win Allison back. (Miramax)

film.filmname: Ghost Dog: The Way of the Samurai (1999)
film.summary: In Jersey City, an African American hit man follows "Hagakure: The Way of the Samurai." He lives alone, in simplicity with homing pigeons for company, calling himself Ghost Dog. His master, who saved his life eight years ago, is part of the local mob. When the boss' daughter witnesses one of Ghost Dog's hits, he becomes expendable. The first victims are his birds, and in response, Ghost Dog goes right at his attackers but does not want to harm his master or the young woman... (imdb)
film.quote: Well, it's an interesting mix and kind of shows the similarities between being a gangster and samurai. Funny at times. I like Rza a lot and he did the music and the music was oddly fitting, most of the time. Good script. But I wanted to enjoy it more than I did.

film.summary: In the thriller, Rachel (Blunt), who is devastated by her recent divorce, spends her daily commute fantasizing about the seemingly perfect couple who live in a house that her train passes every day, until one morning she sees something shocking happen there and becomes entangled in the mystery that unfolds. Based on Paula Hawkins’ bestselling novel. (comingsoon)
film.quote: Blunt is wonderful, as per usual, showcasing her diversity, this time as she plays a drunk, very damaged woman. The rest of the cast is okay and all, and the direction is also decent... but outside of Blunt, nothing sticks out. With that said, I'm seeing some low scores now and I don't understand because it's an interesting enough genre flick with a few twists and turns, enough to be entertaining. I just wish I had never seen the trailer, and this is kinda like Gone Girl but not as good.

film.filmname: Gonzo: The Life and Work of Dr. Hunter S. Thompson (2008)
film.summary: Fueled by a raging libido, Wild Turkey, and superhuman doses of drugs, Thompson was a true "free lance, " goring sacred cows with impunity, hilarity, and a steel-eyed conviction for writing wrongs. Focusing on the good doctor's heyday, 1965 to 1975, the film includes clips of never-before-seen (nor heard) home movies, audiotapes, and passages from unpublished manuscripts. (imdb)
film.quote: I was hoping to love this docu since Thompson is such a fascinating guy. I learned a few things here and there but some of the presentation choices were lame and dull. Other parts were more inspired. This is a decent doc for people who want to know a bit about the man but don't know tons already.

film.summary: A double-bill of thrillers that recall both filmmakers' favorite exploitation films. "Grindhouse" (a downtown movie theater in disrepair since its glory days as a movie palace known for "grinding out" non-stop double-bill programs of B-movies) is presented as one full-length feature comprised of two individual films helmed separately by each director. (imdb)
film.quote: Planet Terror was a great time, Death Proof was not. Planet Terror had a cheesy narrative with insane action and that was a lot of fun. Death Proof was boring with terrible dialogue. Death Proof was a big disappointment. However, in the theatre it was a fantastic time, with planet terror and the fake trailers. I just wish Tarantino would have made a better film so I could rate this higher. The 70 is misleading when this could have been high 80s, easily.

film.filmname: Hanzo the Razor: Sword of Justice (1972)
film.summary: Hanzo is not your typical constable. He is well known in Edo. He is equal parts Dirty Harry, Robocop, and John Holmes. Hanzo's techniques are far from clean. His ends justify his means. (IMDB Comments)
film.quote: Hanzo is terrible, but that makes him an interesting character to watch. He uses any method available to get what he wants; we've seen plenty of torturing and blackmail in movies, but this dude legit rapes girls and then they fall for him (?). So that's bound to shock people, but to be honest, the second rape is silly, as she is hung up and spins on his weenie. Anyway, ultimately it's an entertaining samurai flick with some cool shots and action, and the blaxploitation soundtrack is unexpected.

film.summary: Irresponsible 20-something Jenny arrives in Chicago to live with her older brother Jeff, a young filmmaker living a happy existence with his novelist wife Kelly and their two-year-old son. Jenny's arrival shakes up their quiet domesticity as she and her friend Carson instigate an evolution in Kelly's life and career. Meanwhile, Jenny strikes up a rocky relationship with the family's baby sitter-cum-pot dealer (imdb)
film.quote: It started off terrible and I thought it would be another Swanberg flop but it turned itself around. At first it seemed like everyone was just overreacting to situations and it didn't seem natural but it became more organic as time went on and though the movie is small, it's a nice look at a specific moment in time with characters that do feel alive. It got a little humorous and believable. The baby kicks a lot of ass too... genuinely funny.

film.summary: From the writer of "Training Day," Harsh Times is a gritty look at friendship, loyalty and ambition on the extremely rough streets of south central Los Angeles. (MGM)
Utilizing state-of-the-art special effects, The Host is both a creature-feature thrill ride and a poignant human drama. (Magnolia Pictures)
film.quote: It's good but it's not amazing. There are a few really good scenes but I had a problem with something a few others on here did: the tone. I don't mind a film that fucks with the tone, but it has to do it well and I think this gets bogged down in that instead of excelling at it.

film.summary: Robert Neville is a brilliant scientist, but even he could not contain the terrible virus that was unstoppable, incurable...and manmade. Somehow immune, Neville is now the last human survivor in what is left of New York City...and maybe the world. But he is not alone. (Warner Bros.)
film.quote: Built up a really compelling world/atmosphere, only to destroy all it did in the last 1/4. I'd hate to rate this movie only a 70 based on a bad 1/4 but it really destroyed it. Could have been at least a 90

film.summary: John is an extraordinary teen, masking his true identity and passing as a typical high school student to elude a deadly enemy seeking to destroy him. Three like him have already been killed ... he is Number Four. (imdb)
film.quote: There's some wonk in this movie... actually probably more than I initially thought, but you know what? Despite all that, it's still a fun romp, though I'll never watch it again, nor do I want to. The movie does have some funny parts, and I did care about them... and when it finally got to the big action part, it was kickass. Though I do have some difficulty accepting some of the movie logic concerning the Numbers, and I don't know why the bad guys rely on guns... I like it.

film.summary: Like Polanski&#039;s heroine in Repulsion, Susannah York&#039;s character is one that is seemingly haunted by memories of undisclosed magnitude... (imdb)
An emotionally crippled man struggles to break the cycle of his social isolation and in the process finds love in a broken city. (imdb)
film.quote: I liked it. It did a good job of building tension to the end... it probably helps that the main dude looks kinda creepy. It's a good short about social isolation/fears and being put in a situation to face that fear. That can be difficult, but the film ends on a positive note. It's not that it goes into great detail, but the short tells you enough about the main character just based on the opening shot and his actions.

film.summary: Interpol Agent Louis Salinger and Manhattan Assistant District Attorney Eleanor Whitman are determined to bring to justice one of the world's most powerful banks. Uncovering illegal activities including money laundering, arms trading, and the destabilization of governments, Salinger and Whitman's investigation takes them from Berlin to Milan to New York and to Istanbul.
film.quote: A solid conspiracy thriller with ideas I can sort of get behind. Decent everything, with an inspired shoot out. There's nothing bad about this except for a few wooden lines and the like, but very little that's great. Except for Naomi Watts, and the movie could have used more (any) of her naked since she's my celeb crush but yeah, I digress. Decent flick.

film.summary: A thriller of international intrigue set inside the political corridors of the United Nations and on the streets of New York.
A group of explorers make use of a newly discovered wormhole to surpass the limitations on human space travel and conquer the vast distances involved in an interstellar voyage. (imdb)
film.quote: I give props to the soundtrack, the performances and the visuals. Also the science because I don't care if it's pseudo-science or accurate because fiction is allowed to take an idea that is based in reality and do fun things with it. I even enjoyed the plot twist. What I'm not into is how dull it can be, how it drags, the unnecessary shots that get in the way of the flow, and how it comes off like it's trying to say something but it's not really saying much. Good flick... just not great.

film.summary: In the not too distant future, two young women who live in a remote ancient forest discover the world around them is on the brink of an apocalypse. Informed only by rumor, they fight intruders, disease, loneliness & starvation. (imdb)
film.quote: I think it's a fine apocalyptic movie that doesn't do anything abnormal for the genre. The regular tropes apply, the same tragedies that generally occur show up here, and it's not boring. What puts this a little above average is the strong performances and chemistry between the two sisters, played by Wood and Page. Let's just be honest here: seeing Page tits after all this time is nice too.

film.summary: Left overs from Jackass 3-D
film.quote: As I see more and more Jackass, I'm less amused by some of the shit they pull. I actually find myself liking some of the simple things that aren't even as dangerous but are funnier. Don't get me wrong, sometimes I think "holy shit how are they not dead?" I like that this is a documentary, and that's the reason this even gets to a 70. Otherwise, I'm just not as thrilled by it as I was by the first movie (I never really watched the show much... once in a while).

film.summary: Laced with dark wit, honest inquisition and episodes that are at once surreal and poignant, tragic and absurd, Jarhead is the film adaptation of Marine Anthony Swofford's bracing memoir that took readers into his disorienting firsthand experience in the Gulf War. (Universal)
film.quote: The premise, while itself being an interesting idea for a movie, is unfortunately also one with a big chance of failure. It's more interesting than it has any right to be but that's about it. Still, it's worthy enough to recommend.

film.summary: Jason Bourne, now remembering who he truly is, tries to uncover hidden truths about his past. (imdb)
film.quote: The Bourne movies with Damon are all entertaining to various degrees. This one is simply "good" while the series has seen greatness, but if you want an action movie with some twists and turns, some cool action and Alicia Vikander, then here you go.

film.summary: A mountain man who wishes to live the life of a hermit becomes the unwilling object of a long vendetta.
In the future, a young destitute human woman gets targeted for assassination by the Queen of the Universe, and begins her destiny to finish the Queen's reign. (imdb)
film.quote: I enjoyed it. Great visuals, except Tatum looked goofy. The dialogue is pretty poor generally, the story is interesting but not communicated well, with some predictability (Kunis interacts with someone, gets in trouble, Tatum swoops in), but I did enjoy the action, the anti-gravity boots, the energy shield, and that long chase scene. Takes a lot of influence from a lot of things and manages to be entertaining despite deep flaws in its storytelling.

film.summary: Bobby Earl is facing the electric chair for the murder of a young girl. Eight years after the crime he calls in Paul Armstrong, a professor of law, to help prove his innocence. Armstrong quickly uncovers some overlooked evidence to present to the local police, but they aren&#039;t interested - Bobby was their killer. (imdb)
Q&A with Kevin Smith.
film.quote: I like the Evening With stuff more than this, because I kinda feel like the stories drag at times. Don't get me wrong, some of it was really great, with a lot of laughs, but I did feel it was a little long. But I love just listening to Kevin Smith talk, and I think the Evening With series are all really funny stuff. The Wayne Gretzky thing was nice (I Am Canadian).
