film.summary: A disillusioned assassin accepts one last hit in hopes of using his earnings to restore vision to a singer he accidentally blinded, only to be double-crossed by his boss.
film.quote: Whereas I enjoyed Hard-Boiled and was quite forgiving of the cheesiness, and thus willing to get right to the violence, this is a little much. The story is just not interesting, and while the shootouts are certainly entertaining, it's not enough to make this a great flick. It's enjoyable though, and there are moments--such as when he does accidentally shoot the singer--that flirt with some severity, only to squander that with tedium. But, shooting!

film.summary: Jackie Cogan is a professional enforcer who investigates a heist that went down during a mob-protected poker game. (imdb)
film.quote: I liked it but I feel disappointed. It's definitely not on the level of Jesse James. I appreciate the satire, and there are moments I love (beginning, end, some other parts). The slow pace mostly works but sometimes I found my mind wandering. I enjoyed the dialogue sometimes but it lacks 'oomph' sometimes: a reason to want to listen. When the movie is on it's ON. But what bothers me the most is that I thought this would be a movie that haunts my mind after, and it's not.

film.summary: Eight kidnapped women. All beautiful. All talented. All in danger of having their lives cut cruelly short if police detective Alex Cross (Freeman) and key witness Kate McTiernan (Judd) can't locate the elusive "collector" who calls himself Casanova.
A thriller in which a battle of philosophies between a fundamentalist Christian and an atheist escalates into a lethal battle of wills.
film.quote: This was pretty solid. Some of it was a little wonky and didn't go in such a great direction, but when it comes down to it... I could appreciate that it wasn't totally black and white in how it portrayed Christians OR atheists. Usually it's easier to just stereotype so film makers cheap out and do that. But these people really exist, and there's good and bad in both of them. Ultimately, the one character becomes the villain, but that's fine. It also didn't cheap out on the ending!

film.summary: Jim Carrey stars as a fast-talking attorney and habitual liar who, forced by his son&#039;s birthday wish, must tell the truth for the next 24 hours. (Universal)

A former valedictorian quits her reporter job in New York and returns to the place she last felt happy: her childhood home in Connecticut. She gets work as a lifeguard and starts a dangerous relationship with a troubled teenager. (sundance.org)
film.quote: Every review I've read about this is basically people hating on it because of their own morals. They throw criticisms like "poor script" around but it's not a poor script. It's good and the characters are decently fleshed out. Reviewers feel uncomfortable with the romance because it's a 29 year old and a teenager. They judge the characters without realizing that these "cliches" exist, the troubled kid who skateboards exist. The movie isn't groundbreaking, but it's a good hour and a half.

film.summary: In the most brutal and often most misunderstood sport in the world, becoming a champion takes more than just blood, sweat, and tears. Like Water follows middleweight Ultimate Fighter Anderson Silva as he prepares to crown his four-year run as the unbeaten king of the sport with a record 12th straight win in the UFC. With intimate access to Silva and his intense training, the surprising and inspiring man behind one of the greatest mixed martial artists of all time emerges. (imdb)
film.quote: Nice idea in putting Explosions in the Sky music in there somewhere... usually adds some weight to scenes. Why am I reviewing EitS? This doesn't go into much detail about Anderson Silva but briefly touches on who he is and why he does what he wants... instead it focuses on the lead-up to the Chael Sonnen fight. I think I wanted it to examine him more than it did, but oh well, it was still entertaining. Plus we got to listen to Sonnen and that's always fun.

film.summary: On the July 4th holiday, an attack on the vulnerable United States infrastructure begins to shut down the entire nation. The mysterious figure behind the scheme has figured out every modern angle - but he never figures on an old-school "analog" fly in the "digital" ointment. Bruce Willis is John McClane. No mask. No cape. No problem.
film.quote: Good enough to see in a theatre once, but it doesn't hold a candle to the others in the series. Don't get me wrong, though... it's an adrenaline rush and it's Die Hard. Just could have been a lot better.

film.filmname: Lo and Behold, Reveries of the Connected World (2016)
film.summary: Herzog explores the existential implications of a 21st century defined by technological innovation through interviews with industry pioneers and others whose lives are entwined with the Internet.
film.quote: It didn't hit me like I had hoped. It seems to want to tackle a lot of issues but does so in a very obvious and simple way, for the most part. There are times when it shines, when Herzog is reaching and asking for deeper content, and I love the music throughout... but it doesn't feel cohesive. With that said, some great stories are still told.

film.filmname: Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels (1998)
film.summary: A collection of law-dodging characters in London are brought together by coincidence when a streetwise young man loses half-a-million pounds in a card game.
Lucy (Scarlett Johansson) becomes the first human to use 100 percent of the brain's capacity.
film.quote: It's a good, kinda dumb time, ultimately, even if it's trying to be smart. Once she gets involved with the drug it becomes pretty intense and nuts, and really visually appealing. The beginning with the animals was a little blunt and unnecessary (we GET it Luc), but that's minor. Even if it doesn't make a lot of sense at times, it's still an interesting look at what would happen if we used all of our brains. Kinda felt like there wasn't much of a conflict, but that's minor too.

film.summary: In a dystopic future Australia, a vicious biker gang murder a cop&#039;s family and make his fight with them personal (imdb)
film.quote: It's a good movie. Hell, a 70 just hits very good for me, but it's not a great film. It's very spotty as doctor7 said, and it's a big build up (that isn't really well done but not poorly done neither), for a little bit of action. The cheese sometimes works, it didn't really bug me, but I had a hard time really getting connected. It didn't have the emotional oomph it should have.

film.summary: A noirish tale set in 1949, about a dissatisfied barber who hears from a customer about a speculative business venture. The barber, Ed Crane, is prompted to reflect on the direction he wishes his life to take, and on what he might do to change his current direction.
film.quote: Though it's a well crafted film with nice photography and some good acting, I was actually pretty bored by it. It's a shame, really, because I wanted to like it a lot.

film.summary: An ancient mask transforms a mild-mannered bank clerk.
film.quote: I liked it a lot as a kid, maybe not as much now but it's still funny and like some have said, probably Carrey's best comedic performance. It kind of creeped me out as a kid too but I can't explain that one.

film.summary: Coming together to solve a series of murders in New York City are a DEA agent (Wahlberg) whose family was slain as part of a conspiracy and an assassin (Kunis) out to avenge her sister's death. The duo will be hunted by the police, the mob, and a ruthless corporation.

Sam sets out on a global journey to find out why this music has been consistently stereotyped, dismissed and condemned and yet is loved so passionately by its millions of fans. Along the way, Sam explores metals' obsession with some of life's most provacative subjects - sexuality, religion, violence and death - and discovers some things about the culture that even he can't defend. (imdb)
film.quote: Really, this is just a beginners look into metal. I agree with the person who said you'd need hours and hours to really get into the genre (but you can say that about most genres). It's clear that Sam loves metal so in that way it's very much a love letter and it speaks the language of a lot of metalheads, but there just isn't a lot of information there -- it just scratches the surface most of the time. There are some great parts, and it's decent all around so it's worth a watch.

film.summary: A detective runs through a list of bizarre criminals with a prisoner.
film.quote: Thought it was a good look at Mortal Kombat. I don't really see the problem with it. A full movie might end up being shit but the short is entertaining.

film.summary: Anna Fitzgerald looks to earn medical emancipation from her parents who until now have relied on their youngest child to help their leukemia-stricken daughter Kate remain alive. (imdb)
film.quote: I don't really get how being an orchestrated tear-jerker, as one reviewer said (I'm not picking on him/her, it was just worded well) is a bad thing. Sometimes people just want to cry. And if you want to cry, you should watch this. It really does hold your hand but it gets you involved emotionally. Decent performances, decent music, decent questions asked. No, it's not amazing but it's damn good.

film.summary: From Preston, Idaho comes Napoleon Dynamite (Heder), a new kind of hero complete with a tight red &#039;fro, some sweet moon boots and skills that can&#039;t be topped. (Fox Searchlight Pictures)
A couple with a newborn baby face unexpected difficulties after they are forced to live next to a fraternity house. (imdb)
film.quote: It wasn't quite as funny as I had hoped, but they still sprinkled some legit great gags throughout the entire thing, like the airbag one. I dug that. It's just a silly movie about old people vs young people, parents vs frat. Won't blow minds, but will be enjoyable if you let it.

film.summary: A married couple's life is turned upside down when the wife is accused of a murder.
film.quote: Thought it was good the whole way through but there are definitely some things I'd change. I feel like the movie tried so hard to make them the "good guys," and they should have cut that shit out. The flashback explaining that she's innocent was unnecessary... the movie became more about his desperation and the murder was like the money in No Country, it didn't really matter at the end of it. The family was definitely wronged, no doubt, but let's call a spade a spade. But it's very thrilling.

film.summary: The Four Horsemen resurface and are forcibly recruited by a tech genius to pull off their most impossible heist yet. (imdb)
film.quote: These movies kinda just set it up like they really know magic with elaborate things, such as insane hypnotism or the fact that they handle cards like a prime Gambit, and then it strikes a weird balance by explaining that it's not real magic... just illusion. It's weird sometimes, a little off-putting, but I enjoy the movies because the cast is fun, I have a thing for magicians (not sexually, don't be a perv), and it's just pure entertainment. Not great movies but I dig 'em.

film.summary: An actress suffers an emotional uproar in her personal life after a fan dies trying to see her. (imdb)
film.quote: Cassavetes has made a very realistic, well made movie about theatre. It's very slow paced. Good usage of minimal music and good camera work. Also has good performances. But ultimately I admire this film more than I enjoy it.

film.summary: While an elite pair of New York City cops (Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson and Samuel L. Jackson) nabs headlines for their amazing heroics, fellow boys in blue Allen (Will Ferrell) and Terry (Mark Wahlberg) toil in obscurity as lowly desk jockeys, until a big break finally gives them a chance to tackle real police work.

Recently divorced Meg Altman (Foster) and her daughter Sarah (Stewart) have bought a new home in New York. On their tour around the mansion, they come across the panic room. A room so secure, that no one can get in. When three burglars break in, Meg makes a move to the panic room. But all her troubles don't stop there. The criminals know where she is, and what they require the most in the house is in that very room. (imdb)
Hernan leaves his former life and joins a survival group to prepare for an apocalypse that may or may not be coming.
film.quote: I'm willing to give it a 70 because of the few great scenes (the beginning, the unexpected killings and the ending) but the rest of it is an example of arthouse trickery that hides something... possibly shallowness. The camera often lingers, but it's too much and actually disengages us, and the minimalist, almost non-existent, dialogue between the characters makes it hard for us to know or care. This is a case of going for TOO much mystery, but you have to let us in sometimes.

film.summary: An FBI agent goes undercover to catch a gang of bank robbers who may be surfers. (imdb)
film.quote: Hahaha, what a great time! Someone said it gets better after Hot Fuzz and that's probably true. It's got a dumb premise... surfing and bank robbing, but if you can accept the fact that it is ridiculous than you can have a good time. Keanu works on one note: fantastically over the top! On a serious note, I did like the idea of bank robbers being Ex-Presidents and there could have been great commentary there if this movie wasn't so cheesy.

film.summary: When his new album fails to sell records, pop/rap superstar conner4real goes into a major tailspin and watches his celebrity high life begin to collapse. He'll try anything to bounce back, anything except reuniting with his old rap group The Style Boyz. (imdb)
film.quote: It's funny and there are some interesting swerves when it comes to the plot and the jokes, but it isn't as funny as is required to be a truly great comedy. This is their Youtube brought to life and demonstrates all the pros and cons of The Lonely Island: some fantastic gags, a bunch of poor ones that don't use absurdism well, and some ripping on typical conventions, where it goes down a path that isn't quite expected. Results are mixed in Popstar but I'm glad I saw it.

film.summary: Two highway road workers spend the summer of 1988 away from their city lives. The isolated landscape becomes a place of misadventure as the men find themselves at odds with each other and the women they left behind. (sundance.org)
film.quote: I am so conflicted. On one end, some of this just dragged hard. Not a lot happened, and I felt the movie sometimes tried too hard to be atmospheric and beautiful. On the other end, the Explosions in the Sky OST helped tremendously (though one particular scene I thought the music was great but was used poorly and the scene was cheesy), and I always enjoy Rudd. By the end of the film, it gave me a feeling that maybe I witnessed something important, despite the flaws. So I guess I liked it.

film.summary: If on one night every year, you could commit any crime without facing consequences, what would you do? Over the course of a single night, a family will be tested to see how far they will go to protect themselves when the vicious outside world breaks into their home.
film.quote: Rhys Wakefield was the MAN in this. What a creepy and wonderful performance. I think the premise works as a decent talking point, not that a purge would ever actually happen. I went to see it because it isn't just another "family moves into haunted house" horror movie. The beginning up to a certain point I thought it was wonderful, but the last quarter or so, it flip-flopped on silly or good. Heavy social commentary? Yes, but that's not even a problem.

film.summary: An explosive thriller starring Al Pacino and Colin Farrell that for the first time opens the CIA&#039;s infamous closed doors and gives an insider&#039;s view into the Agency: how trainees are recruited, how they are prepared for the spy game, and what they learn to survive. (Touchstone Pictures)

A timeless, comedic tale that pushes the boundaries of animation while introducing characters rich with humor and soul, and a heart-warming story proves that a robot can shine no matter what he is made of. (Twentieth Century Fox)
A contemporary action-comedy set against the raw, untamed landscape of the Amazon. (Universal)
A former S.W.A.T. team member, along with his partner, is thrown off the team in the aftermath of a controversial decision they made during a robbery/hostage standoff.

Austere direction, stark imagery and magnificent performances combine in a memorable portrait of a vulnerable and humane young man, blossoming in the toxic soil of a devastated country. This beautiful and moving feature, set in modern-day Kazakhstan, depicts the hard choices a young man makes when he&#039;s caught between poverty, crime and love, guided only by his wits and his better nature. (Picture This! Entertainment)
film.quote: Some interesting visuals with a couple nice, atmospheric shots of Kazakhstan. A slow plot where very little happens, but it shows the conditions of rural Kazakhstan. Surprising to me since I'm not aware of them but to anybody who is, then it probably isn't. Acting is solid but not amazing. Fight scenes are pretty gory and realistic. It's pretty clean too, meaning, it doesn't beat you over the head with anything. Kind of like Elephant, it just examines the situation.

film.summary: The first of a three-film series known as the Black Society Trilogy. Corrupt cop Tatsuhito disregards any and all regulations in his attempt to bring down Wang, an inhumanely cruel criminal who lords over an empire that makes its fortune from the debasing of human beings. (All Movie)
film.quote: In a day and age where Hollywood action sequences are shaky cams and quick cuts, it was nice to see the brother v brother fight be more restrained. I really dug that, along with the last 20 minutes as a whole. I liked the music that kept playing during the final act. The rest of the movie is definitely enjoyable with a few good moments but it lost me sometimes. Still, Miike was showcasing some directorial charm here even if it's fairly average up until a certain point.

film.filmname: Sky Captain and the World of Tomorrow (2004)
film.summary: Famous scientists around the world have mysteriously disappeared, and reporter Polly Perkins (Paltrow) along with ace aviator Sky Captain (Law) are on the investigation. Risking their lives as they travel to exotic places around the world, can the fearless duo stop Dr. Totenkopf, the evil mastermind behind a plot to destroy the earth? Aided by Frankie Cook (Jolie), commander of an all-female amphibious squadron, and technical genius Dex (Ribisi), Polly and Sky Captain may be our planet's only hope. (Paramount)
film.quote: The usage of monochromatic properties is both a blessing and a curse. It has a very distinct visual style and I embrace it for that, but unlike something like Sin City, which also has a unique digital backlot style, the visuals don't always pop. It's kind of hard to see things once in a while. Low on story, interesting blend of genres like action, adventure, pulpy film noir, sci-fi. Ultimately, a fun family adventure with a few laughs here and there.

film.summary: A fast food restaurant mini variant of Buzz forcibly switches places with the real Buzz and his friends have to deal with the obnoxious impostor. (imdb)
film.quote: Funny and entertaining. A nice little warm-up for the awesomeness that came after (The Muppets). Fans of Toy Story will enjoy this... I wouldn't call myself the biggest Toy Story fanatic (enjoy the characters and whatnot but don't get as excited for it as other people) but I did quite like this.

film.summary: A documentary on the fabled recording studio that was located in Van Nuys, California. (imdb)
film.quote: I enjoyed the history of Sound City more than the second half, even though the second half started having more of the music that I grew up with and whatnot. I peaced out of it mentally a fair bit when they were just standing around playing the music. It didn't grip me so much. However, the first half was interesting and when they talked about how digital killed SC, that is fascinating documentary material. Movie was a bit long, but obviously Grohl was passionate so I can't blame the guy for that

film.summary: A cryptic message from Bond's past sends him on a trail to uncover a sinister organization. While M battles political forces to keep the secret service alive, Bond peels back the layers of deceit to reveal the terrible truth behind SPECTRE. (imdb)
film.quote: I like it but I think the Craig version of Bond is running its course. That's not the fault of Craig, it is just becoming familiar and predictable. It starts out on a high note, with the excellent Day of the Dead atmosphere, but it doesn't maintain that. Waltz does a good job but they try WAY too hard to make him seem like an evil evil bad guy, and I didn't feel like the action sequences always worked. Could have been trimmed a bit too... that may have helped it.

film.filmname: Star Wars: Episode II - Attack of the Clones (2002)
film.summary: Anakin Skywalker shares a forbidden romance with Padmé Amidala while his teacher, Obi-Wan Kenobi, makes an investigation of a separatist assassination attempt on Padmé which leads to the discovery of a secret Republican clone army.
film.quote: Much better than The Phantom Menace. Some great action in the last half hour, and the previous problems aren't quite as bad (Portman is better but not great, dialogue is still hokey but not as bad, script is not great but you get the picture). This was just a clear upgrade in every way, polishing up the flaws while not entirely erasing them.

film.summary: Nathan, a lad in his teens, is driving alone through a winter landscape. His pill bottle is beside him; he pops a few. He&#039;s almost out of gas. He reaches a town, and while staring at someone sitting at a bus stop, he runs over someone. He gets out of the car: it seems to be a lifeless mannequin. He goes for help to a café; everyone&#039;s a mannequin, and when he looks away, they move their positions. He hears sirens. He runs home. What&#039;s he to do; is it a nightmare? (imdb)
film.quote: Cool concept, mannequins are kind of scary. Not really that much of a twist, but even so, it's entertaining.

film.summary: After India's father dies, her Uncle Charlie, who she never knew existed, comes to live with her and her unstable mother. She comes to suspect this mysterious, charming man has ulterior motives and becomes increasingly infatuated with him. (imdb)
film.quote: More inventive in an editing/style sense than most of the movies I've seen in 2013, with the hair to field transition being incredible, but I have to admit... the first half or even a bit more just didn't overly do it for me. But despite the wonderful American Gothic atmosphere, I wasn't gripped by it. Honestly, some of it was just cheesy. The last buncha movie was more compelling though. It's a good, stylish movie though.

film.summary: After returning from a wedding reception, a couple staying in an isolated vacation house receive a knock on the door in the mid-hours of the night. What ensues is a violent invasion by three strangers, their faces hidden behind masks. The couple find themselves in a violent struggle, in which they go beyond what either of them thought capable in order to survive. (imdb)
film.quote: This could have been great. The first 30 minutes or so were really intense, with some really memorable scenes, but then it just kept getting worse and worse. Still, it is a nicely directed movie from a first timer, and this is better than a lot of popular horror movies in the last few years, if only because of the beginning.

film.summary: Set in a futuristic world where humans live in isolation and interact through surrogate robots, a cop (Willis) is forced to leave his home for the first time in years in order to investigate the murders of others’ surrogates.
film.quote: Works as entertainment, I wasn't bored. So that right there is enough to give it a 51. But throw in Willis, some ideas (whether they were worth exploring is up for debate though) and an interesting enough world, and you got a good flick. No, it's not fantastic, but it's still a lot of fun both as just a thriller and a sci-fi flick with a little something deeper (though not too deep).

film.summary: Desperate to be rid of her toddler, a dissatisfied Beverly Hills housewife hires a stranger to babysit and ends up getting much more than she bargained for. (imdb)
film.quote: It takes some pretty wild leaps in logic on occasion to get to where it has to and instill some drama, but it's still not a bad movie. Ellen Page has done another good job here with her performance and boobs (see Into the Forest). It tackles bad mothering pretty hard and isn't subtle about it: that may turn some people off but I've said in other reviews that I'm okay with militant approaches so long as they're done well. Both subtle and blunt can work.

film.summary: Gripped by the fear of possible repercussions and tortured by the guilt of his violent actions, Taylor seeks to hide his sins in hopes that they will go unnoticed and become no more than a dirty little secret. (imdb)
Retired NFL Linebacker, "Terrible" Terry Tate enforces the office rules at the Felcher and Sons' headquarters... (imdb)
film.quote: Meh, I still think it's funny.

film.summary: At the edge of adolescence, Tracy is a smart straight-A student--if not a little naive (it seems...she smokes and she cuts to alleviate the emotional pain she suffers from having a broken home and hating her mom's boyfriend, Brady.) When she befriends Evie, the most popular and beautiful girl in school, Evie leads Tracy down a path of sex, drugs and petty crime (like stealing money from purses and from stores)... (imdb)
The powerful but arrogant warrior Thor is cast out of the fantastic realm of Asgard and sent to live amongst humans on Earth, where he soon becomes one of their finest defenders.
film.quote: By the numbers, but entertaining. Unnecessary characters abound, but at least they got a good cast to do it. Which I guess speaks to the philosophy of the movie: make a good time. Who cares if the character played by Kat is unnecessary and the character played by Portman is very very simplistic? It doesn't matter! It's Kat and Natalie! I don't give a shit and neither should you, go see it because it's entertaining. I don't even like Thor as a character, for the record. But he's done well.

film.summary: A factory worker, Douglas Quaid, begins to suspect that he is a spy after visiting Rekall - a company that provides its clients with implanted fake memories of a life they would like to have led - goes wrong and he finds himself on the run. (imdb)
film.quote: I was entertained by it. Is it a masterpiece of modern cinema? No. Why did I even ask that question? Pretentious... anyway... it's all done competently. Always nice seeing Beckinsale. It built a nice sci-fi world that oozed atmosphere. Had a decent plot with some nice twists and turns and some tense moments.

film.filmname: TPB AFK: The Pirate Bay Away from Keyboard (2013)
film.summary: A documentary on the world's largest filesharing network, The Pirate Bay.
film.quote: I pretty much agree that as strictly a documentary it is very biased and fails on that level but I don't have a problem with it picking a side. However, I found the 3 dudes interesting because from what I can gather, one does it for fun, the other is political and the other is um... angry and likes the more technical side. It kind of tackles all the sides of why people do this stuff. Would it have been better if it tackled the issue with more depth? Yeah, but it is what it is.

film.summary: 15-year-old Tracey Berkowitz is naked under a shower curtain at the back of a bus, looking for her little brother Sonny.
film.quote: Somebody likes the PiP option in Power Director. But seriously; some people are being way too hard on this. Obviously the fragmented images are experimental and usually work (although sometimes it's a burden), Page gives a great performance, it has good music and it's pretty dark. Script could have used some work but I wasn't disappointed by this movie.

film.summary: Decepticon forces return to Earth on a mission to take Sam Witwicky prisoner, after the young hero learns the truth about the ancient origins of the Transformers. Joining the mission to protect humankind is Optimus Prime, who forms an alliance with international armies for a second epic battle. (imdb)
film.quote: Its plot is lesser than the first and it's not as funny but I enjoyed it more than the first. Optimus Prime was more badass in this and really that's what I wanted to see. The robot fights were incredibly entertaining and again you get a love story that's predictable but it helps hold whatever narrative this has together. So meh, I just won't watch this a second time like the first one so my opinion on it stays the same.

film.summary: Ex-Special Forces operator Frank Martin lives what seems to be a quiet life along the French Mediterranean, hiring himself out as a mercenary "transporter" who moves goods - human or otherwise - from one place to another. No questions asked. Frank's newest transport seems no different from the countless ones he's done in the past. He has been hired by an American known only as "Wall Street" (see Rule Two) to make a delivery, but when Frank stops along route, he notices his "package" is moving... (imdb)
A deaf mute teenager struggles to fit into the boarding school system. (imdb)
film.quote: The silence is awesome and I enjoy the idea of a film shot entirely in sign language. There are some raw scenes and I like how it's filmed and how it looks... but the story is only decent, and -- like Ofterdingen -- I doubt it would have been as interesting has it been more normal. I question why there aren't subtitles as it doesn't seem to have the intended effect... just muddles things needlessly.

film.summary: A gang of criminals and corrupt cops plan the murder of a police officer in order to pull off their biggest heist yet across town. (imdb)
film.quote: There's not a lot going on under the surface, it doesn't give its talented cast a lot to do, and it reminded me a lot of Training Day -- but I can't deny that it's a fun little genre piece that entertained me. Sometimes that's enough; not every movie needs to have a lot depth. On a side note, I'm pretty sure that everything I've seen Aaron Paul in involved him crying for most of the duration.

film.summary: At the start of his senior year in high school, Morgan's father has lost his company, so the family moves from Connecticut, where they've been in the yacht club, to an apartment in the San Fernando Valley. Morgan has grown up in the shadow of his high-achieving older brother, and he seems to have a knack for getting into trouble... (imdb)
film.quote: Yeah, definitely messy as already stated, but I'd be lying if I said I wasn't quite entertained by this. It is so 80s in probably the worst way, with the expected visual style and numerous dance/music numbers. But then it tries to be a high school drama and a gang movie at the same time? Then there's the last act, which has some completely ridiculous action going on. There's some unintentional comedy like Robert Downey rollin' in with dogs, and... well, it's fun.

film.summary: Following a truck hijack in New York, five conmen are arrested and brought together for questioning. As none of them is guilty, they plan a revenge operation against the police. The operation goes well, but then the influence of a legendary mastermind criminal called Keyser Söze is felt. It becomes clear that each one of them has wronged Söze at some point and must pay back now. The payback job leaves 27 men dead in a boat explosion, but the real question arises now: Who actually is Keyser Söze? (imdb)
film.quote: It's a great movie the first time you read it, with an interesting, smart twist. But I feel like after you know the twist, it loses a lot of it's oomph. Still, 70 isn't bad as it's above average.

film.summary: Based on actual events, a plot to assassinate Hitler is unfurled during the height of WWII. (imdb)
film.quote: It's solid the whole way through and Cruise gives a good performance, not that that's a surprise. There isn't anything that special about it but it's worth a watch.

film.summary: A stranger arrives in a little village and soon after a mysterious sickness starts spreading. A policeman is drawn into the incident and is forced to solve the mystery in order to save his daughter. (imdb)
film.quote: What hurts this is what TrixRabbi said: there's a lot of dead weight. Scenes could be shorter, and therefore crisper, and there are moments that didn't need to exist. It's two and a half hours and would have a wonderful plot if it was trimmed quite a bit. There's a lot of talent on display here though, such as the mixture of comedy and horror (early on, mostly). It's also gorgeous with a foreboding atmosphere. The ending would be really crushing if it didn't take way too long to get there.

film.summary: A retired U.S. Special Forces soldier returns to his hometown to renew old relationships and make a new life for himself. But while he was away, his boyhood town wasted away to a dilapidated, crime-ridden shell of itself. (MGM)

The peaceful realm of Azeroth stands on the brink of war as its civilization faces a fearsome race of invaders: orc warriors fleeing their dying home to colonize another. As a portal opens to connect the two worlds, one army faces destruction and the other faces extinction. From opposing sides, two heroes are set on a collision course that will decide the fate of their family, their people, and their home. (imdb)
film.quote: The CGI was fun, I cared more about the orcs than the humans and found their politics more interesting, the theme song is awesome, the action is entertaining, and while the plot and characters aren't incredibly deep... they're good enough. I really liked Durotan. The reason this doesn't get a higher score is because the final battle is messy with terrible logical, rushing too much and doing stupid things. Shame because the rest is good with some unexpected twists.

film.summary: A gang called The Warriors are framed for killing a gang leader trying to unite all the gangs in the area. With other gangs gunning for them they must get back to the home turf of Coney Island... Alive. (imdb)
Three 12 and 13-year-old girls decide to form a punk band in 1982 Stockholm. (imdb)
film.quote: Hate the sport! I enjoyed my time here, watching these 3 little girls (THAT DIDN'T SOUND CREEPY) act up, form a punk band and have fun, because they did have chemistry together. It was pretty lighthearted but I wasn't as into it as I wish I could have be. I don't even know if there's a specific reason why it left me feeling a little more cold than it should have; maybe because I didn't find it that funny nor did the drama overly engage me. Still a well acted and shot movie.

film.filmname: What Do We Have in Our Pockets? (2013)
film.summary: A most unusual love story unravels when the objects in a young man's pockets come to life. (imdb)
film.quote: I wasn't really sold on the animation at first. Then the movie won me over in those couple minutes. It's a charming, slightly amusing, well done short film.

film.summary: In Bodeen, Texas, an indie-rock loving misfit finds a way of dealing with her small-town misery after she discovers a roller derby league in nearby Austin.
film.quote: It's fun. Pretty forgettable but not a waste of time or anything. Ellen Page is always adorable. It has some heart in it, the roller derby scenes are entertaining. Watch once.

film.summary: Intricately moving back and forth in time and revealing the story from each character&#039;s perspective, Wicker Park is an intense psychological drama about a man (Hartnett) caught in an obsessive search for a woman he fell deeply in love with -- a woman who then vanished without a trace. (MGM)

A mystery of deceit, sex and greed as unpredictable as a hungry gator, this is the swamp-steamy thriller about two high school students, the guidance counselor they accuse of rape and the detective who knows there&#039;s more to the story. Â (Sony)
film.quote: It gets rather ridiculous pretty quickly but the absurdness of it all entertained me enough to give this a recommendation.

film.summary: Summoned to Japan by an old acquaintance, Wolverine becomes embroiled in a conflict that forces him to confront his own demons. (imdb)
film.quote: At least I enjoyed this. I detested Origins. Honestly I'm also a little burnt out on Wolverine. He's an interesting and wonderful character but there's so much focus on him (understandably, but still), that it kind of takes me out of it a bit. Oh well, this is a solid flick, good comic book entertainment. Interesting, good action sequences, and Wolverine -- despite what I just said -- is still a badass.

film.summary: Franz Woyzeck (Kinski) is a hapless, hopeless soldier, alone and powerless in society, assaulted from all sides by forces he cannot control. (imdb)
film.quote: Solid Herzog. You can tell it was thrown together quickly. If I have to come up with a flaw I'd say it's a tad boring, and if I had to come up with something really positive, I'd agree with the people who said the score.

film.summary: Harry Kilmer returns to Japan after several years in order to rescue his friend George&#039;s kidnapped daughter - and ends up on the wrong side of the Yakuza, the notorious Japanese mafia... (imdb)
film.quote: The violence works, the acting is good, and the plot picks up as it goes on, culminating in a very touching ending. But the first little bit is not that compelling, and it's not always the most engaging film. Still entertaining.

film.summary: The story revolves around former Yakuza underling Kiryu Kazuma, who has recently been released from prison after a lengthy incarceration, and is trying to piece his life together and distance himself from his Yakuza past. Along the way he encounters Haruka, a distressed young girl who is trying to find her lost mother. Unfortunately Kiryu's problems slowly escalate as he is pursued by a former associate, the baseball bat-wielding psycho Majima Goro who has a grudge to settle with Kiryu. (imdb User Comments)
film.quote: As a film it leaves a little to be desired. I feel like being a Yakuza fan is a must (i am), otherwise its hard to follow because the movie doesnt go into any depth about who these people are. But its got good action and the Yakuza charm without the necessary depth that the video games give you to push the story even further. Still, I had a good time even if the source material gave Miike a lot more to work with than he used.

film.summary: American Pie 2 finds the original characters back in their Michigan hometown, rounded up for the first time since leaving for college. It's been a year since their famous prom night of sexual misadventure, and they still haven't fully recovered. (Universal Pictures)
A post-apocalyptic tale based on a novella by Harlan Ellison. A boy communicates telepathically with his dog as they scavenge for food and sex... (imdb)
film.quote: Some of the dialogue between the dog and the main character was interesting. I like the weird as hell premise, like talking to the dog, but the movie has terrible pacing that makes you go "huh?" But if you're in the mood for an odd post-apocalypse, this isn't bad. The two halves of the movie are quite different from one another, but honestly, the movie was more interesting to me in the first half (even if it was never actually great).

film.summary: Sacha Baron Cohen returns to the big screen to offer yet another stinging dose of sociopolitical satire in this comedy that finds him assuming the persona of gay fashionmonger Bruno, the self-proclaimed "voice of Austrian youth TV." (imdb)
film.quote: I don't know if this stays in high-mediocre or actually goes to good but it's definitely not Bruno. How much of this is staged? It seems like a lot of it. It's definitely got some good jokes but judging from the reactions of people in the theatre, a lot of laughs seemed to come from shock and I just wasn't shocked.

film.summary: Dan Burns (Carell) is a single father who dedicates his life to his children, but one day he meets Marie (Binoche) at a bookstore. They get to know each other, but then Dan finds out that Marie is actually dating his brother, Mitch Burns (Cook). (imdb)

Charles Schine (Owen) and Lucinda Harris (Aniston) have noticed each other on the commuter train before. One morning their conversation leads to a flirtation which turns into an evening drink and then, before either one can stop it, a passionate one-night stand. But suddenly a stranger explodes into their world, threatening to expose their secret and lures them into a terrifying game with more surprises then they saw coming and more danger then they may survive. (The Weinstein Company)
The heroic story of a dictator who risks his life to ensure that democracy would never come to the country he so lovingly oppressed. (imdb)
film.quote: I'm in the camp of "when it hits it hits hard," like a lot of people seem to be. In the beginning I thought this would be ranked higher because it was very funny. The story doesn't really matter. Too few of the jokes land to make this "very good" or "great," but yeah, when it's funny it's very funny (and clever). I do like the running gag of executions, however.

film.summary: After losing contact with Earth, Astronaut Lee Miller becomes stranded in orbit alone aboard the International Space Station. As time passes and life support systems dwindle, Lee battles to maintain his sanity - and simply stay alive. His world is a claustrophobic and lonely existence, until he makes a strange discovery aboard the ship.
film.quote: Pretty solid. Has a great soundtrack, gotta admit. It's very arty and uses its images and metaphors to examine communication and love and whatnot; to what extent it succeeds is up for debate. I think it does a good job, but this isn't a movie that's going to blow your mind by any means. The beginning and end are inspired but the movie suffers throughout the middle. It's in that area where it just reeks of thinking it's deeper than it is, but it ultimately isn't awful or anything.

film.summary: A hard-hitting Southern drama tempered by a story of powerful, life-changing love. It is the story of Hank (Thornton), an embittered prison guard working on Death Row in rural Georgia. He begins an unlikely but emotionally charged affair with Leticia (Berry), the wife of a man he has just executed. (Lions Gate Films)
A hotshot television producer is set the challenge of reviving a struggling morning show program, despite the constant feuding of its high-profile anchors. (imdb)
film.quote: Not quite good enough to get to the "very good" classification, but haterz gon hate. I like this, I thought it was quite hilarious at times. McAdams was good, charming as hell and really played the role well.

film.summary: A trio of bodybuilders in Florida get caught up in an extortion ring and a kidnapping scheme that goes terribly wrong. (imdb)
film.quote: The problem for me is that as it went on I cared less and less. If I would have rated it at its early stages, then it might have gotten an 8. I felt like it just went on way too long for what it was trying to do. With that said, it did have some really funny parts, and the Rock especially was golden. Hell, the other two were fantastic as well but the Rock stole the show. A few more jokes here and there, a little more excitement, and this could have been great. Asitstands, it's fun and that's it.

film.summary: Four guys, one camera, and their experience chronicling the exhilarating and terrifying rite of passage: losing your virginity. As these guys help their buddy get laid, they'll have to survive friends with benefits, Internet hookups, even porn stars during an adventure that proves why you will always remember your first (imdb)
film.quote: I enjoyed this. If it wasn't shot the way it was shot I probably would have enjoyed it less so, but it was pretty funny at times, and had some emotion to it as well. Maybe I'm just overly sensitive but when certain things are found out, it made me feel really bad. Some parts reeked of trying too hard, but ultimately the movie succeeds a hell of a lot more than it fails.

film.summary: The misadventures of Will, a struggling professional clown, determined to make a living performing at kids&#039; parties. Downtrodden in every respect, Will reinvents himself as Vulgar, the transvestite clown, improving his fortunes with his shock performances at bachelor parties. (Lions Gate Films)
film.quote: It's not a great film by any means, but there are a few dark, possibly even disturbing (though I don't get disturbed really) scenes.

film.summary: A young man (McAvoy) finds out his long lost father is an assassin. And when his father is murdered, the son is recruited into his father's old organization and trained by a man named Sloan (Freeman) to follow in his dad's footsteps.
film.quote: It's a shame that they didn't take the main idea from the comics, at least. Super villains killing off all the super heroes is a good idea. But this movie, separated from the comic, isn't bad but it's not great. Everything in it is passable and while it goes too far sometimes with its commentary, it is an action movie that kind of makes you think. But not too much, because the emphasis is on action. Sometimes the slow mo is too much but all in all it's a fun movie.

film.summary: Hour long stand-up special by Aziz Ansari.
film.quote: A few really good jokes where I laughed out loud but when compared to some other comedy specials I've seen and loved, this isn't anything real special. Still not a waste of time by any means, though.

film.summary: In the remote sands of the Moroccan desert, a rifle shot rings out -- detonating a chain of events that will link an American tourist couple's frantic struggle to survive, two Moroccan boys involved in an accidental crime, a nanny illegally crossing into Mexico with two American children and a Japanese teen rebel whose father is sought by the police in Tokyo. (Paramount Vantage)
film.quote: I couldn't get into this as much as I wanted to. That's not to say this movie is without merits, because it does have some good aspects to it but not enough to make it anything more than almost good.

film.summary: A brutal murder. A brilliant killer. A cop who can&#039;t resist the danger. Michael Douglas and Sharon Stone co-star in this thriller about a man who finds within himself an instinct more basic than survival. [Artisan]
film.quote: My, this movie comes on TV a lot. Anyway, this is pretty good all around. The nudity helps.

film.summary: Terrified of leaving his tiny town for the first time, sheltered insurance salesman Tim (Ed Helms) nervously sets out for the bright lights of bustling Cedar Rapids, where he attends a chaotic insurance convention and learns how to survive in the real world.
film.quote: Any movie that mentions the Wire is okay with me. At first I thought this was only an okay comedy, and in some ways it is: cliches, Tim wasn't really that funny (it was mostly stupid). But I enjoyed it more than I first realized... it's a charming little comedy, the actors play off each other well. It's not consistently funny, and you might go long portions without a laugh, but there were some really good laughs in there.

film.summary: Indifferent even to the prospects of inheriting his father’s estate, Swanson has been insulated his whole life by the bubble of privilege. He and his hipster friends live in a tepid social paradise, a.k.a. Williamsburg, where their good fortune breeds indifference and recreational cruelty. They pacify their discontent with games of mock sincerity and irreverence, as though humor itself were dying and had nothing left to do but turn on itself. (mubi.com)
film.quote: The movie didn't really make me feel uncomfortable, but I get it. It does a good job of showing us a guy who's detached from everything. Ultimately I just didn't really care about what was going on. I guess it was kinda boring, it didn't strike a fun balance of pointlessness like a Korine movie does. Sometimes it just feels like a bad indie movie... yeah perhaps it was satirizing some of that, but other times it just messed with whatever flow the movie had. I give it props for being challenging.

film.summary: On the eve of WWI, Zurich and Vienna are the setting for a dark tale of sexual and intellectual discovery. Drawn from true-life events, the film takes a glimpse into the turbulent relationships between fledgling psychiatrist Carl Jung (Fassbender), his mentor Sigmund Freud (Mortensen), and Sabina Spielrein (Knightley), the troubled but beautiful young woman who comes between them. Into the mix comes Otto Gross (Cassel), a debauched patient who is determined to push the boundaries. (beyondhollywood.com)
film.quote: It is what it is. Almost at a "very good" but not quite. I enjoyed the dynamics between everyone. Really I don't have any serious complaints, as I felt the writing was fine and even though philosophically, it's fascinating stuff, I felt like it's about two dudes and a damaged chick who sit around talking about stuff average people don't understand, and it accomplishes this. At the risk of sounding ignorant, what else could be done with this besides what was done?

film.summary: Daniel Tosh's 2011 stand-up special.
film.quote: My first Tosh stand-up. It definitely had some funny moments but I felt too many jokes fell flat. Kind of reeked of trying too hard at times. But then, everyone is saying Completely Serious is better so I'll have to check it out.

film.summary: Based on Kubrick&#039;s pictorial for Look Magazine (January 18, 1949) entitled "Prizefighter," "Day Of The Fight" tells of a day in the life of a middleweight Irish boxer named Walter Cartier, particularly the day of his bout with black middleweight Bobby James... (imdb)
film.quote: As a boxing fan it appeals to me. It's not a mind-blowing short, but it's solidly made.

film.summary: Tells the story of a city girl who moves to a small town and becomes entangled in a love triangle between her high school teacher and a stoner classmate. (imdb)
film.quote: It kind of flip flops around. Like, the plot is all over the place. There's a serial killer, but there's a love triangle, and there's young love, and etc. I don't think the serial killer thing was AT ALL necessary, luckily it doesn't take a whole lot of time. When it settles down, it tackles a subject well enough but it needed tighter writing. The performances were good and the music was good, but the mish mash of stuff didn't always work. Still, it's entertaining.

film.summary: Tom Everett Scott and Mark-Paul Gosselaar play new roommates Josh and Cooper. Josh is the studious type, Cooper&#039;s the nothing-succeeds-like-excess guy--a lifestyle that rubs off on Josh and soon has both in danger of flunking out. But there&#039;s a catch: a clause in the schools charter awards A&#039;s to students who suffer the trauma of a roommate&#039;s suicide. So Josh and Cooper set out to find a suicidal roomie who is, uh, Most Likely To Succeed. (Paramount Pictures)
A lawyer becomes a target by a corrupt politician and his NSA goons when he accidentally receives key evidence to a serious politically motivated crime. (imdb)

Every village has its band of fools, trying to get to the top, following their idols in drug habits, but staying losers till the end of their pathetic days. They all do this in the name of rock & roll. Three disabled rock musicians are looking for a drummer. Dries, a well known writer, seems the right guy for the job, were it not for the fact that his only handicap is that he can't play the drums... (imdb)
film.quote: Soundtrack is right on, and I really things like the guy living upside down. The "gimmicks." The images in this can be pretty incredible at times as well. With that said, the movie left me cold a lot. I understand that these people are supposed to be unlovable scum, and they are, but where's the motive to give a shit what they do next? I only cared occasionally. The plot was okay but not great. Still, recommendation due to the other things I praised. And points to it going as far as it did.

film.summary: Uptight FBI special agent Sarah Ashburn is paired with testy Boston cop Shannon Mullins in order to take down a ruthless drug lord. The hitch: neither woman has ever had a partner -- or a friend for that matter. (imdb)
film.quote: I enjoyed it but didn't love it. I definitely see the criticism that it tries too hard, but that doesn't mean it's not funny sometimes. I think it'd be better if they didn't make Melissa McCarthy swear every second word. I get it, she isn't filthy on TV but in movies she is. Sometimes it works well, and there are some great laughs here. I don't care that it's by the books in every other way, because the blueprint works. I just wish it was more consistently funny, that's all. Still, surprising.

film.summary: A wholesome, Midwestern woman accidentally gets involved with an international super spy and is forced to flee the country with him while he protects a dangerous new piece of technology.

film.filmname: The Man with the Iron Fists (2012)
film.summary: In feudal China, a blacksmith who makes weapons for a small village is put in the position where he must defend himself and his fellow villagers. (imdb)
film.quote: I enjoyed it, but not as much as I would have hoped... loving Rza so anticipating this. It has a fun rap soundtrack, and some nice visual flair. I don't even care about the story, I didn't really think the point was to tell an amazing one. I figure the point is to introduce badass characters (it succeeds) and put them into badass fights (well...). That's the problem, outside of the end, which has some beautiful scenery and fun action, the fights aren't that memorable. Still a fun movie.

film.summary: Young journalist, Alex Luna, is interrogated by a criminal psychologist after he and his family are attacked by a masked intruder. (imdb)
film.quote: It's not great. The acting really isn't that solid, which is a problem considering the actors have to hit a fairly wide range of emotions. The story is interesting enough, if you like these &quot;whodunnit&quot; type of horror/mysteries. I enjoyed it, and the plot twist was relatively unpredictable. The movie has a pretty decent atmosphere and I give props for the music that plays in the credits. It has a few creepy scenes of people looking right at you (always gets me)... solid short film.

film.summary: This irreverent comedy shows no mercy as it skewers the conventions and cliches of the genre you hate to love. (Columbia Pictures)

A bluntly satiric look at the iconography of pornography narratives, this video reconstitutes typical porn dialogue into deadpan banter, devoid of passion, calling attention to the absurdly constructed nature of the sex film and its audience&#039;s subsequent desensitization. (imdb)
film.quote: It's pretty funny. I know it's satire, but I don't think it's exactly the deepest of satire. I mean, it's nice that the film is saying it, and I enjoy how it does it, so I guess I shouldn't complain.

film.summary: Hand-painted film.
film.quote: It is what it is, a pretty marriage of colours and of course like pretty much every Brakhage I've seen, I enjoy the ideas behind it... even if I don't necessarily enjoy the movies themselves that much.

film.summary: Hand-painted film.
The story of an archer in the army of Richard Coeur de Lion who fights against the Norman invaders and becomes the legendary hero known as Robin Hood.
film.quote: Sometimes odd placing of music makes some of the scenes more silly than they should be. We're never really sure why King John is so bad and the ending is rushed as hell, like they forgot Robin Hood had to be set up as an outlaw and threw it in at the last minute. There are some other story telling flaws but some plot points are decent enough. It also has good acting, some humour and when the movie cuts the shit and focuses on action, it does it quite well. Now put on this bandit mask.

film.summary: In 1980 Miami, a determined Cuban immigrant takes over a drug empire while succumbing to greed. (imdb)

Lynch's first film project, it is basically an endlessly repeating film of people vomiting with their heads on fire projected on to a special sculptured screen featuring twisted three-dimensional faces in various states of puking. (imdb)
film.quote: Though the repetition can get a tad boring, it's interesting to see where Lynch started, and while I won't pretend to understand exactly what he was trying to say, I saw a good review somewhere that shed a little light on what it could mean. The rather simple animation and the siren work together well to create something bizarre that almost makes you forget that you're watching six figures getting sick six times.

film.summary: Peter Parker is juggling the delicate balance of his dual life as a college student and a superhuman crime fighter. His becomes even more complicated when he confronts a new nemesis, the brilliant Otto Octavius, who has been reincarnated as "Doc Ock."
He just wanted to be awesome in space! (imdb)
An urban couple branches out to live a more counter-culture lifestyle. (imdb)
film.quote: I always love watching Rudd. I like Aniston as well for whatever reason. This is a few really good jokes away from being "very good." It dragged a little bit here and there but there were definitely some really good jokes in there. Even though it goes by an obvious formula, it's still entertaining and is a nice surprise for me because honestly I expected it to be terrible (despite having Rudd).

film.summary: After a wisdom tooth operation a man decides to let his friend pull out one of the stitches.
United Nations employee Gerry Lane traverses the world in a race against time to stop the Zombie pandemic that is toppling armies and governments, and threatening to decimate humanity itself. (imdb)
film.quote: I can't say I remember the specifics of the book, but I remember the style and what it wanted to do. I've never felt it would make a good movie (at best a good TV show if done right), so they took the source material and made it... a normal zombie movie. Does it have some of the social commentary? Yeah, fragments. But it lacks. However, I was never bored, and it was pretty thrilling, flaws aside. I have fun, what can I say? It's not great but it's entertainment.

film.summary: Perseus embarks on a treacherous quest into the underworld to rescue Zeus, who has been targeted for capture by his traitorous son, Ares, and his brother, Hades. (imdb)
film.quote: I felt basically the same while watching this as I did when watching Clash. I had a lot of fun. I won't remember or give a shit about this after right now. It's a CGI fest with big monsters and Gods. All I wanted was a little entertainment and it delivered. It doesn't do anything exceptionally well but isn't poor either. Sure there are things it COULD do, but it didn't... so as is, it was an entertaining little romp through Greek Mythology.

film.summary: John Travolta is back as Chili Palmer in Be Cool, a sequel to the comedy smash Get Shorty. This time, Chili becomes a different kind of "hit" man -- he abandons the movie industry to bring his wiseguy skills and negotiation tactics to the music business. (MGM)

Two friends spend all their free time building flame-throwers and weapons of mass destruction in hopes that a global apocalypse will occur and clear the runway for their imaginary gang "Mother Medusa". While waiting for the world to end, their call to excitement comes unexpectedly when one of them meets a charismatic young woman and falls hard in love. Quickly integrated into a new group of friends, they set off on a journey of betrayal, love, hate, infidelity and extreme violence. (imdb)
film.quote: The director is talented and it has pretty cool cinematography. Its creative and gives you something to think about. But the screen writing is sub-par and the acting is shaky. You have actors who are average most of the time but occasionally BELOW, delivering crappy lines and saying dude too much. So when the drama hits, it's like "meh" cuz it's so silly. Over the top to the point of stupid sometimes. With that said, it's still pretty entertaining, even if I think it doesn't all gel.

film.summary: Wesley Snipes returns as the iconic vampire hunter Blade in this third installment of the hit film series. (New Line Cinema)

As a homicide detective, Thomas Craven has seen the bleakest side of humanity. But nothing prepares him for the toughest investigation of his life: the search for his only daughter Emma's killer. Now, he will go to the edge of darkness to uncover the disturbing secrets surrounding her murder, including corporate corruption, government collusion and Emma's own secret life.
film.quote: I wasn't really completely clueless throughout the entire thing so it was predictable at times but the way it presented itself made up for it. Ultimately though, this probably won't stick in your head for years to come but, decent enough comeback for Mel.

film.summary: A love letter to the resilience of the life force, Elizabethtown is a charming, music-filled journey that proves amazing things can happen when you least expect them. (Paramount Pictures)

film.filmname: The Girl from the Naked Eye (2012)
film.summary: When Sandy, a call girl at &quot;The Naked Eye&quot;, ends up dead, her friend and only ally in the world, Jake, goes on a manhunt to find out who killed her. (imdb)
film.quote: Pretty solid indie noir. The good: pretty good visuals, decent acting , inspired Oldboy influenced (clearly) hallway brawl, chemistry between Jake and Sandy surprisingly nice, good fight scenes in other places as well. The bad: some parts are unintentionally bad, I thought maybe the movie was going for some comedy but I'm not really so sure now. I think maybe they failed when they were trying to be hardcore sometimes. But fun, moody film, mostly succeeds but doesn't blow minds.

film.summary: In this terrifying adventure in survival horror, a deadly virus has been unleashed on the population of Raccoon City. (Sony Pictures)
Based on the 1968 film of the same name, this sophisticated thriller combines the action of an art heist and an intense love story. (MGM)
Five contemporary stories weaved together into a single tale that examines the dramatic impact people have on one another. (Sony Pictures Classics)

A thriller seen through an eye-popping new lens - that of the media&#039;s hunt for shocking imagery, no matter the cost. In 15 Minutes, as the cops chase the murderers, the media chases the cops, and the whole thing fuels an escalating firestorm. (New Line Cinema)
film.quote: It was pretty decent. It's a fun concept that isn't done as well as it coulda been, but DeNiro was entertaining and so was Burns. Some of the action is good as well, but the movie just never really clicks like it should. The ending was uninspired and just blah, some of the music usage was just awkward and made serious scenes silly.

film.summary: 9to5 - Days in Porn focuses on the people behind a controversial and multi-billion dollar industry "The Adult Entertainment industry"...
film.quote: Wouldn't say it says a lot to people who know a little bit about porn, but to those who don't it's probably more useful. This doesn't go into tremendous detail even though it's 2 hours, and sometimes the narrative is wonky. But with THAT said, it's very interesting hearing different sides tell how they feel, and the objectivity of the movie will lead to discussion. Also a good idea to allow Sasha Grey to talk a fair amount considering she's probably the most interesting girl in porn.

film.summary: A Princeton admissions officer who is up for a major promotion takes a professional risk after she meets a college-bound alternative school kid who just might be the son she gave up years ago in a secret adoption. (imdb)
film.quote: Went in for a comedy, considering who stars in it, got a drama. So no, it's really not funny, but Fey does a good job in a dramatic role and I always like Rudd, regardless, because dude is charming. It does have an interesting premise, but I really just wish their were some laughs, because it's such a waste when it's not funny and it's marketed as a comedy AND you had Rudd and Fey. Decent flick though, really.

film.filmname: All the Boys Are Called Patrick (1959)
film.summary: Students Veronique and Charlotte meet the same man separately, who makes a date with each of them separately the next evening. When they both show up, he shows up, too, with a third women... (imdb)
film.quote: In english, we have a saying for people like the man in this short: Douchebag. The 20 minutes or so zoom on by. It's a simple film, and at first I felt like it was anti-climatic. Upon thinking about it some more, I can appreciate the ending. If there was a little more to this, I might give it a higher rating, but as it stands now... it's an entertaining but insubstantial short.

film.summary: In Aloha, a celebrated military contractor returns to the site of his greatest career triumphs - the US Space program in Honolulu, Hawaii - and reconnects with a long-ago love while unexpectedly falling for the hard-charging Air Force watchdog assigned to him. (imdb)
film.quote: Really, how often do you see a movie marketed as a romantic comedy also be about putting weapons in the sky? Some see "quirky," some see "incoherent," and I'm in the former. I laughed, I got invested. The three leads were good together, Baldwin was a gem. Now, I can't speak for how accurately represented the culture is by any means, I think the script needed work (or perhaps just be left alone to breathe), and Aloha is by no means a GREAT movie, but I still enjoyed myself.

film.summary: At a 1962 College, Dean Vernon Wormer is determined to expel the Delta House Fraternity, but those roughhousers have other plans for him. (imdb)
film.quote: I liked it, there's an endearing quality to the craziness on display that keeps it from being boring, but I didn't laugh nearly as much as some. It got a couple chuckles out of me but it needed more of that to be a good comedy.

film.summary: A drunken playboy stands to lose a wealthy inheritance when he falls for a woman his family doesn't like.
film.quote: First of all, Greta won me over. Consider me a fan. Cute and charming as hell. Besides that, this is actually a pretty solid movie. I really didn't wanna see it, but I was bored today and it was there so I watched it. At first I was thinking, "This will be a 30 on Criticker" but then as the movie went on, I bought into it. At first the jokes didn't work, it was too many, too often. As the movie went on, the jokes got funnier... I started to chuckle, and then eventually laugh out loud.

film.summary: A thriller centered on two archaeologists in search of a lost treasure in the catacombs below Paris. (imdb)
film.quote: The found footage gimmick doesn't really work in this movie, but I'm a fan of the style generally. I give horror movies that aren't just about haunted houses more recognition than maybe I should because I'm so sick of those types. I give props to this because at least it's different with a cool setting and some intrigue. It doesn't reach its potential and loses some steam once it becomes very obvious which direction this is going. It's still a good time with some good scares and claustrophobia.

film.summary: Three assassins deal with life, love, addiction and trust as each tries to find the answers to a better life. Together, they prove to be the most trustworthy in this tangled web of murder, greed, friendship and betrayal. (imdb)
film.quote: Inconsistent but ultimately a good time. I like Hitman movies, and the 3 main were fairly fleshed out with different personalities and dilemmas. Sometimes the stylish transitions and quirks just didn't flow and some of the music choices just took me out of it. The movie has a pretty thoughtful plot with a bunch of twists and turns so that's fine, but sometimes the dialogue felt like it tried way too hard to be clever and Tarantino-esque. Like they ramble about breakfast, but it's not cool.

film.summary: Three friends are asked to be bridesmaids at a wedding of a woman they used to ridicule back in high school. (imdb)
film.quote: Pretty by the books. Not as funny as Bridesmaids last year, but not terrible either.

film.summary: A slobbering St Bernard dog becomes the center of attention for a loving family but its vet secretly wants to kill him.
film.quote: Haven't seen it since it was a kid so my memory is a little bad now. But as a kid, I loved it.

film.summary: This film focuses on a Burmese refugee whose fate has linked him to the lives of two Thai women in a border town. (Kick the Machine)
film.quote: Really the only Weerasethakul movie I found boring. It's not that it doesn't have merits... it's beautiful like his films always are. This just didn't do it for me. Not a bad movie, as I said it's still well made, and that's why it's got a 65.

film.summary: Famed documentarian Michael Moore returns with his first feature film in five years, as he tackles the issue of America&#039;s unique obsession with firearms.
film.quote: It's an entertaining movie but it fails as a documentary due to his blatant manipulations to make his point. I don't mind some bias since we all have it, but this is taken to the extreme and the movie suffers because of it.

film.summary: Bruce is a local news reporter who is discontented with nearly everything in his life, and rarely misses an opportunity to complain about it. Until one day God endows Bruce with all of his powers and challenges him to take on his job and see if he can do any better. (Universal Pictures)

Hanks stars as Chuck Noland, a FedEx systems engineer whose personal and professional life are ruled by the clock. His manic existence abruptly ends when, after a plane crash, he becomes isolated on a remote island - cast away into the most desolate environment imaginable. (Twentieth Century Fox)
A group of teenagers encourage each other's bad behavior.
film.quote: Not a bad film. I didn't know that the movie was gonna be like this... somewhere I read it was a comedy. Jokes on me. Anyway, the choice to make the internet physical was a great one, and so the movie had some nice cinematography. I like the look into the seedy part of the internet, though the movie could have used some more work in a bunch of different ways. Still, an interesting idea about a good subject... the idea may turn off people who LOLZ INTERNET.

film.summary: In 2027, in a chaotic world in which women have become somehow infertile, a former activist agrees to help transport a miraculously pregnant woman to a sanctuary at sea.
film.quote: While the long tracking part at the end is fantastic, and this movie is well made, I failed to get emotionally invested in anything that was going on.

film.summary: A doctor hires an escort to seduce her husband, whom she suspects of cheating, though unforeseen events put the family in danger (imdb)
film.quote: I'm given props to a few things. The trio of actors (I think Moore gives the best performance, really.. but she's pretty underrated in general), and the music. There are some really inspired scenes, and the movie never bored me. I felt that some scenes were a little silly and I didn't really like the ending. But it does do a good job mostly at examining these characters. I flip flopped on 65 (pretty high end good) or 70 (very good). Some moments of weakness but all in all, good stuff.

film.summary: The mortal son of the god Zeus embarks on a perilous journey to stop the underworld and its minions from spreading their evil to Earth as well as the heavens.
film.quote: It was a lot of fun! I pretty much got what I expected and I'm happy with that. The monster designs are awesome, and there are a few really good scenes that made me go yeeeeees! The ending was bullshit, though.

film.filmname: A Complete History of My Sexual Failures (2008)
film.summary: Independent filmmaker Chris Waitt attempts to interview his ex-girlfriends to find out why they dumped him. This revealing and humorous documentary sees the slacker filmmaker go on a sexual and emotional odyssey in a desperate quest to solve his innumerable problems. (imdb)
film.quote: I'm like many others where I think part of it is fake. And I've looked around a bit on the net and don't know what to think. Oh well. So, if it's fake at all it kind of loses some appeal but even if it's completely real, it's not an amazing movie or anything. It's good. The ending is actually really genuine and memorable but some parts were just godawful.

film.summary: When a plane crashes in a small town, it releases a secret biological weapon. As the toxic substance infiltrates the local water system, some residents become gravely ill, while others descend into homicidal madness. The sheriff attempts to set things straight, but soon the military becomes involved in trying to contain the killer virus.
film.quote: Competent but not especially special. Not really much to add. There's little to complain about but little to praise. Entertaining, though.

film.summary: On a daredevil caving holiday six girls are trapped underground when an unexpected rock fall blocks their exit. Searching the maze of tunnels for a way out, they find themselves hunted by a race of fearless, hungry predators, once humanoid but now monstrously adapted to live in the dark and with murder and mayhem on their minds. (20th Century Fox)
film.quote: While it does succeed on creating an claustrophobic environment for its characters to go crazy in, I just didn't find this movie all that scary or daring. Still, it's not a horrible movie so it gets a recommendation.

film.summary: Four young men and a young woman sit in boredom. She smokes while one strums a lute, one looks at a magazine, and two fiddle with string. The door opens and in comes a young man, cigarette between his lips, a swagger on his face. The young woman laughs. As the four young men continue disconnected activities, the other two become a couple. When the four realize something has changed, first they stare at the couple who have kissed and now are dancing slowly...
film.quote: I enjoyed the soundtrack, the noise of it all didn't really bother me any. There are some good images here and there and the end was a little creepy.

film.summary: Based on a story by M. Night Shyamalan and directed by the brothers Dowdle (Quarantine helmers Drew and John Eric), this edgy thriller is set in an elevator, where a group of passengers are trapped with none other than the king of the underworld. Luckily for them, a homicide detective (Chris Messina) is on board. Not so luckily: the cop has issues of his own, including a not-so-long-ago-kicked addiction to alcohol.
film.quote: Not that it's the most amazing movie ever but I saw it getting shat on by a lot of people and I don't see the reason for hating it. Like I said, it's not amazing but it's a solid murder mystery.

film.summary: In a city ravaged by violent crime, the police department&#039;s anti-gang task force uses any means at its disposal to get the bad guys off the streets, with cops often acting as judge, jury and executioner. AS the unit&#039;s self-justifying brutality and corruption spiral further out of control, gang member turned cop Armando Sancho (Collins Jr.) begins to question the life he and his partner (Gooding Jr.) have chosen. (Silver Nitrate)
film.quote: Ah, this was a solid movie. Sure, it's a bit of a rip-off but it was surprisingly entertaining and not so bad.

film.summary: A long series of unrelated images, revolving, often distorted: lights, flowers, nails. A lightboard... (imdb)
film.quote: Better than Le Retour à la raison, but I wasn't such a fan of that anyway. It was okay. This is more of the same though slightly better because it has a little more going on. I can admire it but don't overly enjoy it.

film.summary: Robert McCall is a man who believes he has put his mysterious past behind him and dedicated himself to beginning a new, quiet life. But when he meets Teri, a young girl under the control of ultra-violent Russian gangsters, he can't stand idly by. He has to help her. (imdb)
film.quote: It was fun, but honestly the hardware store scene (where he never even picks up a gun) kinda got to me. I know it's nit-picky, but for some reason it bothered me. The attempt at "original" kills didn't have the same effect on me that it might have had on others. Still, Denzel is great, and it's always a little satisfying watching a movie like this. Stereotypical villains, slowmo explosions, lots of action... follows a formula, does it pretty okay.

film.summary: A climbing expedition on Mt. Everest is devastated by a severe snow storm. (imdb)
film.quote: Ultimately it's entertaining with a little bit of emotional engagement, especially with Hall's phone calls with his wife. Wonderful cinematography really brought the movie to life. It wasn't the greatest thing ever by any means but it was better than I thought it would be.

film.summary: Mr. Church reunites the Expendables for what should be an easy paycheck, but when one of their men is murdered on the job, their quest for revenge puts them deep in enemy territory and up against an unexpected threat. (imdb)
film.quote: While I absolutely loved the first one, I thought this one would be better because it just has more badass people. The first one was cheesy and so is this, only I don't think the cheese works as much. It seems way too forced. It's not that it's bad by any means, it's an entertaining enough action flick with a great beginning and end, but some of it just felt ridiculous (not in a good way), like the Norris entry. I felt like the first did everything better. I'm prolly alone in this.

film.summary: Joel, the owner of an Extract plant, tries to contend with myriad personal and professional problems, such as his potentially unfaithful wife and employees who want to take advantage of him.
film.quote: "I'll be the laughing stock of the grindcore community." I loved that line. But there were very few parts that I actually laughed. The plotline is dull. The acting is definitely passable and all that. It's a decent movie, and pretty clever, but it's not really a good movie. Pretty close though.

film.summary: Capturing life on the Italian island of Lampedusa, a frontline in the European migrant crisis. (imdb)
film.quote: A tale of two movies. One is a dull life of a kid (and his family) doing dull stuff like firing a slingshot and getting his eyes checked. It's so mundane that it hurts. The other movie is the gripping story of migrants who suffer trying to cross an ocean to escape tragedies. This part is painful and effective. I do respect what Rosi has done, however, with excellent direction. Unlike other docs, there's nothing to really sway you; the distinct lack of music (unless naturally there) is important.
