film.summary: A veteran grifter takes a young, attractive woman under his wing, but things get complicated when they become romantically involved. (imdb)
film.quote: It's entertaining, but a little predictable. Robbie and Smith have good chemistry, both of them being charming. The plot doesn't unfold in any deep, meaningful way, but hey, it's a pretty funny romantic comedy about con artists.

film.summary: A tale of a boy trapped in an abandoned fridge at the back of a housing estate and the attempts of an alcoholic couple to free him. (Cinema16.org)
film.quote: While I like it and there are definitely some compelling and intense parts, and I give props to the music that is simple, yet beautiful... sometimes I just feel like the tone is all messed up. I'm all for adding conflicting tones and whatnot in movies, to make a point (see something like, a Korine film), but I don't feel like Mullan was attempting that here. So some parts don't gel well with the rest of the film, but the parts that do -- which, honestly, is most of them -- are good stuff.

film.summary: Friends with Kids revolves around a pair of best friends in their 30s who observe the effect of having kids has taken on the couples they know. To avoid that toll, the best friends resolve to have a child and then date other people.
film.quote: Quite by the numbers. It'd be nice to see more rom-coms that try to innovate the genre but I mean, this kind of thing is what the main audience wants, not overly critical people like us. They want two people who should be together to get together. Cue some drama, and then it happens. Though I didn't find the movie funny and the drama was only okay. The acting was fine, the script brought up some nice issues about relationships. Ultimately forgettable but not bad in the least.

film.summary: This update of the 1985 horror comedy focuses more on terror than laughs when teen Charley Brewster (Anton Yelchin) suspects that his new neighbor, the sinister Jerry Dandrige (Colin Farrell), is a vampire, and turns to a self-styled vampire expert, Peter Vincent (David Tennant), for help. Las Vegas magician Vincent proves useless, and it's up to Charley to save his mom, Judy (Toni Collette), and girlfriend, Amy, from the seductive bloodsucker.
film.quote: Yeah, it's good. It's tongue-in-cheek in ways and I suppose that makes it a bit satirical, but it's still a vampire movie, which -- at this point -- takes a lot more to impress me. It's solid and a decent time, but really nothing more than that. Everything is competent, though I don't feel like it was that funny.

film.summary: As Johnny Blaze hides out in Eastern Europe, he is called upon to stop the devil, who is trying to take human form. (imdb)
film.quote: One of the only pleasures I get in this world is watching Nic Cage act crazy. And he does not disappoint here. This movie is silly, campy, cheesy and occasionally dark, and it's better for it. It's batshit insane. While some things were wonky, I mostly had a good time here. It was fun and mindless with cool action.

film.summary: Eighteen-year-old Matthew Kidman (Hirsch) is a straight-arrow over-achiever who has never really lived life, until he falls for his new neighbor, the beautiful and seemingly innocent Danielle (Cuthbert). When Matthew discovers this perfect &#034;girl next door&#034; is a one-time porn star, his sheltered existence begins to spin out of control. (20th Century Fox)

film.filmname: A Good Day to Die Hard (2013)
film.summary: John McClane travels to Russia to help out his seemingly wayward son, Jack, only to discover that Jack is a CIA operative working to prevent a nuclear-weapons heist, causing the father and son to team up against underworld forces. (imdb)
film.quote: Nah td888, you aren't the only one who enjoyed it. While Die Hard has certainly "lost its way," and it is certainly illogical, I don't even care because it's a Hollywood action movie. Things blew up and Brucey murdered dudes. Yes, some of it is STUPID and I certainly mentally rolled my eyes (cuz rolling eyes physically is for losers!), I still ultimately had a good time. Die Hard will never be like the first few, but they don't have to be (tho it'd be nice). Just entertain me.

film.summary: A cat-and-mouse psychotic thriller as incisive as it is stylish, Hard Candy delivers a provocative take on the revenge drama while jangling nerves at every turn. The film plunges us into an unstable universe where we cannot readily identify the "good guy" in the tense confrontation between a 14-year-old girl and the 32-year-old man she suspects of pedophilia and murder. (Lionsgate)
film.quote: While Ellen Page does what she can with the material, there isn't a lot in terms of material here.

film.summary: A gun-for-hire known only as Agent 47 is ensnared in a political conspiracy, which finds him pursued by both Interpol and the Russian military as he treks across Eastern Europe. hired by a group known as "The Agency" to kill targets for cash.
film.quote: Maybe it's because I needed to be cheered up after watching Cries and Whispers, but I enjoyed this. It's not exactly high art or even that faithful to the game, but it's worth a watch if you want something mindless.

film.summary: Mia Hall thought the hardest decision she would ever face would be whether to pursue her musical dreams at Juilliard or follow a different path to be with the love of her life, Adam. But what should have been a carefree family drive changes everything in an instant, and now her own life hangs in the balance. Caught between life and death for one revealing day, Mia has only one decision left, which will not only decide her future but her ultimate fate. (imdb)
film.quote: Watch Chloe's ghost eerily creep up on people who think they're having a private moment. Seriously though, it's very sappy. However, I've always maintained that there's nothing wrong with a tearjerker and I'm not sure why melodrama is seen as bad by default for some people. There is some hokey stuff scattered throughout, and the spirit stuff is a little silly a times, but it's pretty good at what it does. Chloe is instantly likeable and god damn that crushing scene with Keach.

film.summary: A U.S. Customs official uncovers a money laundering scheme involving Colombian drug lord Pablo Escobar.
film.quote: It kind of takes a while to get going but by the end of it I actually felt for the characters and the relationships that Cranston's character cultivated throughout. The plot is written well enough. Doesn't do anything especially fantastic, nor does it do anything poorly. Cranston is one in a fairly small group of actors who can do nice one second and then absolutely terrifying the next, though I wouldn't say this role is award worthy or anything.

film.summary: 70-year-old widower Ben Whittaker has discovered that retirement isn't all it's cracked up to be. Seizing an opportunity to get back in the game, he becomes a senior intern at an online fashion site, founded and run by Jules Ostin. (imdb)
film.quote: I liked it. It was kinda funny and didn't rely so much on 'LOOK AT YOUNG PEOPLE AND INSTAGRAM' as poorly as some other films do. Had some decent jokes for sure. The drama was mostly effective, though the way this handled its subject matter (gender politics, old vs young) was not in the least bit subtle, in both the dialogue and the way the scenes were staged. De Niro and Hathaway are good together. The script flirted with flipping conventions around but ended in a Hollywood way.

film.summary: An elite hitman returns to erase his past only to find that somebody has messed with his future. (imdb)
film.quote: This movie rests almost entirely on Goss and his performance. He does a really good job of playing a mostly cold-blooded Hitman. But the rest of the movie just needs work. I understand that the budget probably wasn't real high, but the sound mixing is terrible, the script is pretty thin, and some of the acting is really bad. The events aren't told the best. However, the climax did make me a bit emotional, and all-in-all, it was an entertaining movie. Touch it up, and it becomes easily an 80.

film.summary: Jack Ryan, as a young covert CIA analyst, uncovers a Russian plot to crash the U.S. economy with a terrorist attack. (imdb)
film.quote: It's pretty good. I think it's about what I expected, not what I hoped -- a fun, reasonably thrilling thriller, nothing overly memorable but something I'd watch a sequel of to pass some easy time. At times it feels more like the first Mission: Impossible than the MIs afterward, which is nice, because it adds some mystery and suspense, and doesn't rely on action all the time.

film.summary: Johnny Knoxville -- the original Jackass himself -- returns after a long hiatus and subjects himself to all-new stunts involving wild animals, dangerous heights and other perils guaranteed to do him bodily harm. "Jackass" regulars Bam Margera and Steve-O also endure their share of punishment in this collection of stomach-churning, don't-ever-try-these-at-home acrobatics that time and again blur the line between hilarious and tasteless.
film.quote: Clever social commentary.

film.summary: A newly possessed cheerleader turns into a killer who specializes in offing her male classmates.
film.quote: Am I the only one who sees this movie as a big, elaborate criticism of indie rock bands? Probably. Oh well. I enjoyed the movie. It was entertaining, campy, kinda sexy, with some capable cinematography (some nice shots like when the goth kid goes to meet Megan Fox... the street looked nice and properlys cary). Some of the dialogue was awful and Cody's style fit more with Juno but still, entertaining flick. Not amazing but well enjoyable.

film.summary: A neo-noir revenge thriller centering on Julia Shames, who after suffering a brutal trauma, falls prey to an unorthodox form of therapy to restore herself. (imdb)
film.quote: Has a sense of style without being flashy. Williams was wonderful in the main role despite the director wanting her to stare off into the distance way too often in order to show her pain. Killings lacked significant oomph and the psychological aspects weren't explored enough. The script also needs some tidying up. But despite the problems, I enjoyed myself. I'm also just a fan of the genre, however, and would never recommend this as a shining example of it. A good time, though.

film.summary: When his mentor is taken captive, a retired member of Britain's Elite Special Air Service is forced into action. His mission: kill three assassins dispatched by their cunning leader.
film.quote: I've said I haven't been a huge fan of Statham's action movies but I've liked a few, and this is one. I don't love 'em, but I do think he's a great action star who doesn't pick the best of movies. But enough of that... it's pretty clever, has an interesting subject matter, but it's all about the action, and some of the action is pretty cool. Clive Owen, Statham, De Niro... it could have been amazing but hell, it's fun, I'll take it.

film.summary: After spending years in California, Amir returns to his homeland in Afghanistan to help his old friend Hassan, whose son is in trouble. (imdb)
film.quote: It was one of those movies that I'd see if someone paid but I won't rent or download it. But it was above average and although some of it was predictable, it still told the story well and had some emotion in it. Mild recommendation.

film.summary: During an unfortunate series of events a friend of Kung Fury is assassinated by the most dangerous kung fu master criminal of all time; Adolf Hitler, a.k.a Kung Führer. Kung Fury decides to travel back in time, to Nazi Germany, in order to kill Hitler and end the Nazi empire once and for all. (imdb)
film.quote: I enjoy it but I'm not getting the hype for it. The visual effects are great, the soundtrack is nice, the action is ridiculous and entertaining, and it's funny sometimes, but it just couldn't grab me like it should. Was it just too random? Maybe they didn't play it straight enough? There's almost too much winking at the camera but it's still a fun example of schlocky crap. I think I'm just kind of over a few of the things the net still loves, like Hitler appearing in everything.

film.filmname: The Last House on the Left (2009)
film.summary: After kidnapping and butchering two teenagers, a gang unknowingly finds refuge with the parents of one of the victims -- hosts who devise gruesome revenge.
film.quote: I stopped seeing this as a horror flick and more as a revenge flick. That's not to say that there wasn't some suspense because there was, and there was some decent horror because of that. This movie doesn't rely on cheap jump scare tactics nearly as much as a lot of modern movies. It's not really that scary in general but it's an entertaining flick that has some OH HELL YES moments. A bit of surprise for me.

film.summary: The paths of two warriors converge when the Emperor of Japan hires a Civil War veteran to train Japan's first modern army. As he encounters the Samurai traditions, the troubled American soldier finds himself at the center of a violent and epic struggle between two eras and two worlds, with only his sense of honor to guide him.
film.quote: It just kind of exists. It's not bad, it's not good. I wouldn't mind watching it again but I won't seek it out.

film.summary: In London for the Prime Minister's funeral, Mike Banning discovers a plot to assassinate all the attending world leaders. (imdb)
film.quote: I might as well be honest, I liked it, just like I enjoyed Olympus Has Fallen. The script sucks, though some of the humour worked, and most of the cast is misused (Butler is fine in this role). There's blatant xenophobia and Jingoism, but I'm more forgiving of that. Ultimately, it's just an action movie, and it takes more for action movies to leave me feeling like I wasted my time/money. It's fun and stupid, I had a good time.

film.filmname: A Man Walks Into a Bar (2013)
film.summary: After an awkward exchange, two strangers realize that picking up a member of the opposite sex can be a tricky business. (imdb)
film.quote: Oh so this is what Rhys does when he isn't purging. Anyway, this isn't bad, I chuckled once or twice, and it has a fun little premise.

film.summary: A family learns important life lessons from their adorable, but naughty and neurotic dog.
film.quote: I thought it was really sad. So what? Wanna fight about it?

film.summary: During a manned mission to Mars, Astronaut Mark Watney is presumed dead after a fierce storm and left behind by his crew. But Watney has survived and finds himself stranded and alone on the hostile planet. With only meager supplies, he must draw upon his ingenuity, wit and spirit to subsist and find a way to signal to Earth that he is alive. (imdb)
film.quote: I enjoyed the science and a bunch of the jokes worked (some were really forced), but I had a hard time with this one. It wasn't bad by any means, but it felt too lighthearted to the point that I never felt any risk, and I didn't sense any chemistry among the actors (even though it's a great cast). Competently shot but unremarkable, I'm destined to be the contrarian with this one.

film.summary: The human city of Zion defends itself against the massive invasion of the machines as Neo fights to end the war at another front while also opposing the rogue Agent Smith.
film.quote: It doesn't hold a candle to the first or even the second but it's still entertaining enough to give a mild recommendation too.

film.summary: After having escaped the Maze, the Gladers now face a new set of challenges on the open roads of a desolate landscape filled with unimaginable obstacles.
film.quote: Outside of an excellent scene when one of the characters dies, it's not a movie that does anything exceptionally well or poorly. It's one of those movies where everything is competent; the acting, directing, cinematography, music, etc is all decent. There are some wonky leaps of logic and the lightning scene is bullshit "tension" but I had a good time.

film.summary: Marital infidelity, religion, a guy in heaven wearing a Wizards jersey, anal fetishes, cigarettes and schizophrenia, ghosts, and how it's going to get worse before it gets better.
film.quote: Really simple concept with convincing acting. It's terribly short and I'm not sure if that's a blessing or a curse. Do you like people sitting around and talking? Well that's what this is. I liked it. I don't think it's even close to being necessary viewing but it's pure film making, anyway.

film.summary: As thirty-something divorced pre-school teacher Sarah Nolan (Lane) braves a series of hilariously disastrous mismatches and first dates, she begins to trust her own instincts again and learns that, no matter what, it&#039;s never a good idea to give up on love. (Warner Bros.)
film.quote: Mainly 'cuz I'd mate with Cusack. However, despite my seemingly not-so-hetero-yet-still-hetero love for him, this is a pretty solid movie.

film.summary: Vada Sultenfuss is obsessed with death. Her mother is dead, and her father runs a funeral parlor. She is also in love with her English teacher... (imdb)
film.quote: I'm not going to watch this again because I don't want to taint my original opinion of the movie: This shit is sad.

film.summary: A high school senior finds herself immersed in an online game of truth or dare, where her every move starts to become manipulated by an anonymous community of "watchers." (imdb)
film.quote: A surprisingly entertaining and stylish thriller about the dangers of attention seekers and social media. The two leads were good together, and despite the logistics of the game Nerve (seriously, you have to suspend your disbelief hard), it was exciting to anticipate the "why" of its existence. Ultimately, the ending falls flat because the why is not that exciting and it wraps up way too neatly, but I enjoyed myself as a whole.

film.summary: Angela Bennett&#039;s a software engineer type who works from home and has few friends outside of cyberspace... (imdb)
In the dreams of his victims, a spectral child murderer stalks the children of the members of the lynch mob that killed him.
film.quote: I'm not huge on it, but I do remember turning on the TV late at night when I was a kid (I couldn't sleep) and seeing the famous Depp part. Scared the shit out of me. That counts for something. But when I came back and re-watched it... it's good, I don't love it.

film.summary: An air marshall must spring into action aboard an international flight (imdb)
film.quote: Despite any wonkiness that exists -- and believe me there is some head-scratching to be had here -- I had a good time. It maintained its mystery pretty well until the end. Neeson kicks some ass and that's usually entertaining. Not incredible, but a sometimes silly, sometimes intense suspense/thriller that is worth watching if you just wanna kill a little time with something that isn't mindblowing but is still satisfying.

film.summary: A former black ops agent and the young woman he's assigned to protect fight for survival after a surprise attack.
film.quote: Fun way to pass some time. Malin is cute as almost always, and I do enjoy Cusack. It's another by-the-numbers flick, where enemies lay siege to a building and the hero has to save the day, but oh he's cold and damaged, but this girl is more positive and shit. Was I entertained? Yeah, I was. Was I surprised at all? Nope. Text book movie, but you know that's not always a bad thing.

film.summary: Disgraced former Presidential guard Mike Banning finds himself trapped inside the White House in the wake of a terrorist attack; using his inside knowledge, Banning works with national security to rescue the President from his kidnappers. (imdb)
film.quote: It's been done a million times but it's still entertaining. While I understand that the Americanism of it all may turn off some, if you're an action movie fan you're going to see this type of movie a million more times so you might as well get used to it. Die hard in the White House, it's still a good time but obviously it isn't as good as Die Hard.

film.summary: Paradise Now is the story of two young Palestinian men as they embark upon what may be the last 48 hours of their lives. (Warner Independent Pictures)
In 1988, young sisters Katie and Kristi befriend an invisible entity who resides in their home. (imdb)
film.quote: Probably would have been about as good as the second if it wasn't for the godawful ending and stupid twist. It's hard to deny that the formula is over staying its welcome a bit, but at the same time... at least the film makers get that sometimes it's what doesn't happen that's scary. That's pretty much the premise of these movies. Still, this can be tense, and enjoyable, and scary, and I loved the first one. Just please, don't make anymore. It's unnecessary.

film.summary: A man tries to buy kiddie porn. (Myself)
film.quote: Funny, but not that funny. Like Michael C. Hall though.

film.summary: Retired black-ops CIA agent Frank Moses reunites his unlikely team of elite operatives for a global quest to track down a missing portable nuclear device. (imdb)
film.quote: I loved the first one. I thought that the first one was incredibly funny, everyone did a great job and the action was on point. The sequel seems more dry and not as funny, as I only laughed a couple times, the action is fine but not amazing and the cast does a good job but they don't really have as much to work with this time around. But still, it was an entertaining action comedy.

film.summary: Two Veteran New York City Detectives hunt a vigilante who may be one of their own.
film.quote: Pacino and DeNiro together makes this interesting. It isn't a horrible movie besides them, but they definitely elevate it to the point that it can be recommended. Without them, it'd be a rather generic crime drama.

film.summary: Despite his conviction that demonic possession is just so much supersitious mumbo jumbo, Catholic priest-in-training Michael Kovak (Colin O'Donoghue) journeys to Rome to attend a special exorcism school being taught at the Vatican. Before long, true-believer Father Lucas (Anthony Hopkins) introduces the young cleric to the devil's power firsthand.
film.quote: I enjoyed the whole, dude is confused about his faith angle, and how other characters talk about it. The rest of the movie was solid in pretty much every way, though not anything extravagant and overly memorable. A horror flick that's at the high end of good but not very good. I also like seeing Ciarán Hinds.

film.summary: Josh and Tiffany have been together since they were kids. ENTER Beth, a sexy blonde going to college with Josh. One night, Josh and Beth hook up and make a videotape the same day that Josh plans to mail a video to Tiffany of him talking about college life. The wrong tape gets sent, forcing Josh, along with a few pals, to go to Austin, where Tiffany is, and stop her from seeing the tape. Full of laughs, you'll be sure to enjoy Road Trip. (imdb)

In 2028 Detroit, when Alex Murphy (Joel Kinnaman) - a loving husband, father and good cop - is critically injured in the line of duty, the multinational conglomerate OmniCorp sees their chance for a part-man, part-robot police officer. (imdb)
film.quote: Admittedly I don't remember the original that much, and I'm sure that this tamed the original. But this isn't bad. It's a solid action movie that isn't that original. I don't really like Joel in the lead most of the time, but sometimes he was okay. The opening segment is intense and pretty awesome, and the social commentary is there, while not being overly militant. So, it was a good time but will I remember it years from now? Nope.

film.summary: The incredibly spoiled and overprivileged students of Camden College are a backdrop for an unusual love triangle between a drug dealer, a virgin and a bisexual classmate. (imdb)
A suspense-thriller about a high-priced and ruthless jury &#034;consultant&#034; (Hackman) who will stop at nothing to secure a verdict on an explosive trial. (Fox)
Set in a pro-wrestling alternate universe, Glen Matthews' &quot;SAVING FACE&quot; tells the story of the downfall of a tag team when one of its members decides that he wants to be a bad guy.
film.quote: I enjoy the concept and like pro wrestling, but I wasn't really feeling it as much as I thought I would. Still an entertaining short.

film.summary: A radio talk show host unravels a conspiracy about encounters with mysterious beings known as The Shadow People and their role in the unexplained deaths of several hundred victims in the 1980s (imdb)
film.quote: I don't love it but I do enjoy it and think people should watch it. It mixes "found" footage into it and I think that makes it strong. Maybe it's just because I like when movies try to pass off what happens as real, but I got into it for the most part. Besides, I see lots of people on the net looking into this as if it IS real, so that lends some mystique to the entire experience. It's not as creepy as I would have liked, however. Could have been more with this premise.

film.summary: A hurricane composed of sharks, attack Los Angeles.
film.quote: Well considering the movie is supposed to be schlocky, I think it was fun. They don't wink at the camera, they just seriously made a bad movie. So really, it comes down to... was it entertaining? Did it amuse? Yeah sort of. I actually think something called Sharknado could have been fucking awesome, like holy shit this is as memorable as The Room. It didn't reach heights that will make it a classic bad movie, and I know others won't appreciate it, but it was entertaining for an hour and a half.

film.summary: When he starts dating drop-dead gorgeous Molly (Alice Eve), insecure airport security agent Kirk (Jay Baruchel) can't believe it. As his friends and family share their doubts about the relationship lasting, Kirk does everything he can to avoid losing Molly forever.
film.quote: I actually found it pretty funny. I don't know what else to say really, it was more amusing than I thought it would be. Star my review.

film.summary: A young girl's "sweet sixteenth" birthday becomes anything but special as she suffers from every embarrassment possible. (imdb)
film.quote: It's okay. Most of the jokes don't actually work, but despite that, there is some charm to most of the main characters. I was entertained because of that, but this is definitely not a great movie or a classic in my eyes. It's really rough around the edges, but Hughes does display some pretty good directorial skills on occasion when he lines up some decent shots/scenes.

film.summary: In a twist to the fairy tale, the Huntsman ordered to take Snow White into the woods to be killed winds up becoming her protector and mentor in a quest to vanquish the Evil Queen. (imdb)
film.quote: Actually thought Theron kind of over-acted certain lines (but mostly did a good job), and I bought Stewart in the role until she became Xena: Warrior Princess. Sure the movie does a lot of movie things to progress the plot, cliches we've seen a million times, but great art/set design and good CGI helped create an interesting and alive fantasy world. People said this sucks shit, but despite it's few flaws, it's a good movie.

film.summary: Michael Jordan agrees to help the Looney Toons play a basketball game vs. alien slavers to determine their freedom. (imdb)
film.quote: If Bugz don't make you hop, you're buggin'.

film.summary: Peter Parker (Maguire), after being bitten by a genetically altered spider, becomes Spider-Man, a hero of superhuman strength with the ability to cling to any surface. He dedicates himself to a life of fighting crime, while living a double life as a superhero and working student. (Sony)

Tom Ludlow is a veteran LAPD cop who finds life difficult to navigate after the death of his wife. When evidence implicates him in the execution of a fellow officer, he is forced to go up against the cop culture he's been a part of his entire career, ultimately leading him to question the loyalties of everyone around him. (imdb)
The coming of age summer-camp saga of four best friends who hate each other. (imdb)
After his wife falls under the influence of a drug dealer, an everyday guy transforms himself into Crimson Bolt, a superhero with the best intentions, though he lacks for heroic skills. (imdb)
film.quote: I enjoyed Kick-Ass more than this. I don't know, it sometimes worked for me and other times it didn't. The dark comedy didn't really succeed, but when it stopped and showed how disturbing the violence of a superhero could be, then it worked. Always like Ellen Page (and not just because I'm from NS ;)), but this movie went from an 80, to a 40, back to an 80, and I'm settling on 65 because it mostly is a good movie.

film.summary: Bryan Mills, an Ex-government operative is accused of a ruthless murder he never committed or witnessed as he is tracked and pursued, Bryan Mills brings out his particular set of skills to find the true killer and clear his name. (imdb)
film.quote: I know Taken 3 is inevitably going to get a lot of hate but it's really not a bad movie. Most action movies are stupid, so I don't care if the action is silly sometimes because I'm going to this movie to see someone kick ass. There are no gaping plot holes that make it unforgivable, and it does a decent enough job giving Neeson a reason to be a badass. It's better than the second. The series is getting tired, but it's still mildly enjoyable. A pretty good action flick, ultimately.

film.summary: A working girl tears through Tinseltown on Christmas Eve searching for the pimp who broke her heart. (imdb)
film.quote: Tangerine is a brave film in the way it embraces ostracized transgender people, and being filmed on iPhone 5s equipped with an anamorphic adapter lens is an interesting gimmick. However, its attempts at humor fall flat with amateurish writing and shallow jokes, and the drama just doesn't quite work. I appreciate the set-up of the film more than I actually liked the execution.

film.summary: After her mother dies from a heroin overdose, Jeliza-Rose is taken from the big city to a rural farmhouse by her father. As she tries to settle into a new life in a house her father had purchased for his now-deceased mother, Jeliza-Rose&#039;s attempts to deal with what&#039;s happened result in increasingly odd behavior, as she begins to communicate mainly with her bodiless Barbie doll heads and Dell, a neighborhood woman who always wears a beekeeper&#039;s veil. (imdb)
film.quote: Interesting imagery but that's about it. Not a fan of this one.

film.summary: Aliens make Earth their final battleground. As the forces of evil seek the key to ultimate power, Earth's last chance for survival rest in the hands of young Sam Witwicky. (Paramount Pictures)
film.quote: You want explosions and robots and you get it. You also get a decent enough love story between two humans. I actually found this movie pretty funny as well. There's even a scene or two with some emotional weight. The CGI is also well done. It's worth seeing this once.

film.summary: A man is captured by a maniac and tortured, physically and mentally, into becoming a walrus. (imdb)
film.quote: Parks and Long were awesome. 40 minutes (or so) in - Really creepy, great dialogue, some genuinely funny parts. Walrus reveal is gross and demented (great). Should be an 85 at least. Rest of movie - "Cameo" seriously hurts film, so weird-for-the-sake-of-weird . Rest of film is uneven. Tone shifts aren't done that well, comedy sometimes falls flat, becomes a little dull, horror doesn't work mostly, doesn't commit to anything. The end - oddly moving though, and definitely original. Also well shot.

film.summary: A thriller centered on a con artist, his wife, and a stranger who try to flee a foreign country after one of them is caught up in the murder of a police officer. (TMDb)
film.quote: Pretty good thriller, with solid performances. It's nothing remarkable in any way, but due to the atmosphere and especially the music, it feels like an old thriller/drama from the earlier days of cinema. It's got decent enough drama and suspense all the way through, and it's shot well.

film.summary: A chronicle of the life of Louis Zamperini, an Olympic runner who was taken prisoner by Japanese forces during World War II. (imdb)
film.quote: It just really needed to be tightened up. O'Connell is going to make a name for himself, so I don't fault him with anything here. It just kinda goes on and on. At some point you stop being like, "oh those bastards, this is disgusting" and you start going, "whatever." There were moments of real emotion, but then the momentum goes and it slows down too much. A slow movie is fine but there's gotta be something there to grip you and sometimes Unbroken forgot that. Still decent, great story.

film.summary: When human forces discover the existence of the Vampire and Lycan clans, a war to eradicate both species commences. The vampire warrioress Selene leads the battle against humankind. (imdb)
film.quote: Kate Beckinsale, vampires, werewolves, cool action scenes, pretty good visuals and atmosphere... check. But then I felt like the movie fucked me because the movie set up a sequel in the worst possible way ever... by lacking content. I mean c'mon, you were doing SO GOOD, add another half hour onto this short as hell movie and then I probably have no complaints. Entertaining but that really irked me. Still see it, though.

film.summary: Underworld: Evolution continues the saga of war between the aristocratic Death Dealers and the barbaric Lycans (werewolves). The film traces the beginnings of the ancient feud between the two tribes as the beautiful vampire heroine Selene (Beckinsale) discovers that she has been betrayed by her own kind and seeks her revenge.

When Martin (Liam Neeson) emerges from a coma following an auto accident in Berlin, nothing is as it should be: Not only does his wife (January Jones) no longer recognize him, but a stranger (Aidan Quinn) has apparently taken over his identity. With assassins chasing him and the police unsympathetic to his story, Harris must reassemble his world piece by piece, helped only by the one person (Diane Kruger) who seems able to grasp his plight.
film.quote: While it was so easy to see the twist coming a mile away, I thought it was still a pretty thrilling er, thriller. Mind you, once the twist happens, it loses some steam, but up until then, it's tense and well made. Even afterwards, it's perfectly watchable, just not great.

film.summary: Hoping to bring his family closer together and to recreate his childhood vacation for his own kids, a grown up Rusty Griswold takes his wife and their two sons on a cross-country road trip to the coolest theme park in America, Walley World. Needless to say, things don't go quite as planned. (imdb)
film.quote: I liked it! It wasn't this incredible experience but there were some really good jokes scattered throughout. I mean, it reeked of trying way too hard a lot of the time, the youngest son's bullying got old (but still had some laughs like "Don't say weird shit!"), and some of the situations aren't just funny.. but I can't sit here and say I didn't get some enjoyment out of it regardless.

film.summary: a feature length documentary, aims to educate & entertain audiences about how video games are made, marketed, and consumed by looking back at gaming history and culture through the eyes of game developers, publishers, and consumers. (imdb)
film.quote: Unfocused and doesn't add a lot to the conversation. I know games, been playing for a long time so it doesn't tell me much. It's an entry-level documentary but tries to convince us that it's more. It's still pretty decent even if it jumps around way too much and juxtaposes things that shouldn't be. The tone is off because of this, and it's a little dry (especially when it's info-dumping) but like I said, it's a mildly entertaining watch.

film.summary: A journalist recounts her wartime coverage in Afghanistan and Pakistan. (imdb)
film.quote: It's pretty lightweight with nothing to say outside of telling a personal story, but Fey outright said that in interviews. It was pretty funny on occasion but certainly took a more serious slant, and it's always lovely seeing Fey because she's incredible and so charming. It doesn't end up being a very memorable film, but I will admit that the end--as neat as it is--ended up being a little emotional; just a smidge.

film.summary: A community activist, student researcher, and several artists raise the question: does graffiti lead to crime or do the laws against it create criminals? (facebook.com)
film.quote: It's kind of an insignificant short film. I mean, it brings up a question but there really isn't enough time to truly evaluate and discuss the question. It talks briefly about the "other side" that may not like street art, but it doesn't go into a lot of depth and is mostly an endorsement of it. It gets some points though because I actually love graffiti so the fact we got to see some was pretty awesome.

film.summary: With the emergence of the world's first mutant, Apocalypse, the X-Men must unite to defeat his extinction level plan. (imdb)
film.quote: I enjoyed it, but as a big X-Men fan I (sadly) have to admit that I didn't outright love it. Definitely suffers from being more of the same in a lot of ways, and some parts were hammy. But at the same time, there were plenty of great scenes that make the filler ones forgivable. X-Men movies don't lack destruction, but rely less on fight scenes as a whole than the MCU, making them deeper and more substantial... like they have something to say. I've always admired that, still do here.

film.summary: In the climax of the X-Men trilogy, a "cure" for mutancy threatens to alter the course of history. For the first time, mutants have a choice: retain their uniqueness, though it isolates and alienates them, or give up their powers and become human. (20th Century Fox)
film.quote: The first two movies were really good superhero flicks that examined serious issues, but this is just a cash-in. That's not to say that there aren't redeeming qualities, because there is one heart wrenching scene. But this ultimately is just not a fitting closer to a trilogy that could have been great.

film.summary: In the wake of a disaster that wipes out most of civilization, two men and a young woman find themselves in an emotionally charged love triangle as the last known survivors. (imdb)
film.quote: I like the actors involved, specifically Robbie, and it's certainly shot well; nature is awesome and Zobel wanted to document that. But it's a little tedious and the lackadaisical ending renders the rest of it kind of dull. It doesn't have a good payoff so I was left a little apathetic, despite the excellent music. Decent flick, nothing more.

film.summary: Follows a teenager named Justin, his 3 friends, and his deadbeat father.
Set in 1898, this movie is based on the true story of two lions in Africa that killed 130 people over a nine month period... (imdb)
The son of the Greek Gods Zeus and Hera is stripped of his immortality as an infant and must become a true hero in order to reclaim it. (imdb)
A documentary about branding, advertising and product placement that is financed and made possible by brands, advertising and product placement
film.quote: I think the movie will appeal to those who don't really look at marketing as the evil that I already thought it was. It doesn't really tell you a whole lot, in depth, but then I'm not sure what it could really tell you anyway. It goes out to show how marketers think, and I already believed that marketing is a misuse of intelligence (though arguably necessary in this fucked up society). I'm kind of ranting, sorry, the movie was decent, not great. Maybe a stepping stone to something more.

film.summary: Incredible technology wielded by a mind of infinite evil is threatening the safety of the entire world. To fight the unthinkable, the British government will have to mobilize the extraordinary. This team -- The League of Extraordinary Gentlemen -- is the only thing standing between the future and total destruction. (20th Century Fox)
Shakespeare&#039;s famous play is updated to the hip modern suburb of Verona still retaining its original dialogue. (imdb)
The lone inhabitants of an abandoned police station are under attack by the overwhelming numbers of a seemingly unstoppable street gang (imdb)
film.quote: It's pretty entertaining but so uneven. I give props to the score though and a few scenes are gripping but meh, it can't save it. The cheese is there but it's not even as charming as other Carpenter movies because this movie seems lazy. It's a shame, I love the premise. I actually prefer the remake to this, which is odd.

film.summary: Marvel launches another super franchise with this action-packed origin story, which follows Steve Rogers (Chris Evans) as he volunteers for a secret experiment during World War II. Transformed into a superhero named Captain America, Steve goes after the Axis. With his perfect physique and heightened reflexes -- and his sidekick, Bucky (Sebastian Stan) -- Steve battles the Red Skull (Hugo Weaving), a super soldier created by Italian fascists.
film.quote: Yeah America! I'm not really a fan of Captain America, so I didn't really expect to go into this and love it. I wish I liked the character. But to me Captain America is just lame anyway. I mean, he does good things, he's a superhero, but meh. So the movie doesn't do a whole lot to make that better for a person like me, with an okay script, okay action, okay everything else. It was pretty fun but not exactly a great movie. Except I did like the ending, the last line was a nice touch.

film.summary: A career criminal (Gibson) nabbed by Mexican authorities is placed in a tough prison where he learns to survive with the help of a young boy. (imdb)
film.quote: It is an entertaining movie but it's also really forgettable. With that said; I enjoyed myself well enough but man shit just comes together a little TOO neatly, even in movie land. Yeah sure there's some struggle but it's minimal and shit happens that just boggles your mind. Thought the set-up (like, of the actual prison) was a col idea, though.

film.summary: A young playboy who learns he has one month until he becomes infertile sets out to procreate as much as possible.
film.quote: Entertaining and everyone does a decent enough job. Completely by the books though. I suppose this genre is often by the books, but yeah, this doesn't go above and beyond in any way whatsoever. I also didn't find it funny. Except the ending which was nice.

film.summary: With his new apprentice Amanda (Smith), Jigsaw, the puppet-master behind the cruel, intricate games that have terrified a community and baffled police, has once again eluded capture and vanished. While two city detectives scramble to locate him, they are unaware that they are about to become the latest pawns on his vicious chessboard. (Lionsgate)

Young Ursula plays in a tree and ruins her fancy dress. Her elderly mother teaches her a cruel lesson about whether things can ever be mended; what Ursula learns about how to behave may not be what her mother intended. (imdb)
film.quote: Kind of expected more from it. There's some creepy dialogue and the movie has a definite dream-like feel so the insanity of it is pretty atmospheric for that reason. But I dunno. Looked cheesy at times which took me out of it a bit and failed to truly grip me and terrify me.

film.summary: Nicholas is a nice dentist living in suburban Montreal. His new next door neighbor, Jimmy, is a hit man hiding out from a dangerous Chicago crime family. Despite their differences, Oz and Jimmy have one thing in common: someone's trying to kill them both.

Chili Palmer (Travolta) is a Miami loan shark who&#039;s sent to Los Angeles to collect on a gambling debt from film producer Harry Zimm (Hackman). Chili soon discovers that loansharking was the perfect training ground for making movies...though you have to be ruthless to make it in Hollywood. (MGM)

When the heir (Ryan Gosling) to a New York real estate fortune becomes entangled in the mystery surrounding the disappearance of his lover (Kirsten Dunst), he might lose everything in this drama set in the 1980s and inspired by the true story of real estate scion Robert Durst. While the detective on the case (Jeffrey Dean Morgan) discovers unexpected evidence -- which turns up the political heat -- people with ties to the case begin to die.
film.quote: Thought that it built up really well to a certain point and then lost its way. It was so tightly edited and made, and then I just started wondering what the hell is going on? It was at this point that the movie lost like 20 points for me. It's sad really because Gosling did a great job, and I even liked Kirsten Dunst.

film.summary: Successful and single Kate Holbrook has long put her career ahead of a personal life. Now 37, she's finally determined to have a kid on her own. But her plan is thrown a curve ball after she discovers she has only a million-to-one chance of getting pregnant...
film.quote: Fey and Poehler are awesome together and make this entertaining. It doesn't do anything amazing but it was reasonably charming and funny.

film.filmname: The Batman vs Dracula: The Animated Movie (2005)
film.summary: Gotham City is terrorized not only by recent escapees Joker and Penguin, but by the original creature of the night, Dracula! (imdb)
film.quote: This movie wasn't that bad. It didn't do anything especially well but it was entertaining and as long as they show Batmans' origins and show him brooding, USUALLY he's fun. The Joker was awful all around, some of the voice acting was sub-par and there were a couple scenes that made me cringe but this is yet another entertaining Batman flick. Worth one watch (I mean c'mon, Batman vs Dracula) but you'll never want to watch it again.

film.summary: The Broken Lizard comedy group returns to the big screen in a new comedy that proves revenge, like beer, is best served cold. (Warner Bros.)

Vince Vaughn and Jennifer Aniston star in The Break-Up, which starts where most romantic comedies end: after boy and girl have met, fallen in love, moved in to start their happily-ever-after -- and right when they wind up driving each other crazy. (Universal Pictures)
film.quote: While the ending isn't amazing or anything, it's truthful, and for Hollywood flicks like this it's a nice change. Jennifer Aniston gives a solid performance, Vince is okay, but not quite up to par. But is this really a comedy? It felt more like a drama... really threw me for a loop, much like a movie like The Weather Man did. So once I adapted to it and took it more as just a drama, I enjoyed it more than I thought. The writing, direction, cinematography... all of it is okay but not great.

film.summary: Nev, a 24-year-old New York-based photographer, has no idea what he's in for when Abby, an eight-year-old girl from rural Michigan, contacts him on MySpace, seeking permission to paint one of his photographs. When he receives her remarkable painting, Nev begins a friendship and correspondence with Abby's family. But things really get interesting when he develops a cyber-romance with Abby's attractive older sister, Megan, a musician and model (imdb)
film.quote: I'm so conflicted. Like a lot of people, I was told how amazing the twist is. Because of events in my life, it just really isn't that surprising, and I can't see how it is to anybody with the net. It's a good movie up until the twist... it's interesting, kind of creepy at one point. After it, it loses a lot but is still decent. Ultimately the movie goes from probably what could have been an 80 to a 60. But expectations really killed this.. the twist is not that interesting. It's obvious.

film.summary: A dispossessed, violent man who's life is a disastrous attempt to exist outside the social order. Successively deprived of parents and homes and with few other ties, Ballard descends literally and figuratively to the level of a cave dweller as he falls deeper into crime and degradation. (imdb)
film.quote: It's not really entertaining as it is a little uncomfortable because unless you're like me and hump corpses all day, then it's pretty hard to watch. Mostly we watch Ballad run through the woods with a gun, mumble incoherent sentences, occasionally murder someone and have sex with said corpses. It's pretty good at hitting a Southern Gothic feel, but it isn't the most thrilling watch. This works better in novel format, I believe.

film.summary: A savage and satiric morality play centering on Alex, who fights, robs, rapes and kills like any conscienceless predator. Captured and imprisoned, he undergoes treatment to condition him "safe", a "clockwork orange" healthy and whole on the outside - but crippled within by reflex mechanisms beyond his control.
film.quote: It's another impressively crafted movie from Kubrick but it just didn't click with me at all.

film.summary: Inspired by a true-life story, Coach Carter is an inspirational account of a controversial high school basketball coach, who received both high praise and staunch criticism when he made national news in 1999 for benching his entire undefeated basketball team for poor academic performance. (Paramount)

A comic series of short vignettes in which Jarmusch delves into the normal pace of the world from an extraordinary angle, showing just how absorbing the obsessions, joys and addictions of life can be.
film.quote: There are maybe 4 or 5 shorts that I really like, with the highlight being Gza and Rza (because Rza does no wrong). A couple are only okay but worth watching and some bore me. So judging by that... this movie is worth seeing and while I enjoy the black and white motif and the idea, it doesn't reach greatness (or even come that close) like I had expected.

film.summary: An African prince goes to Queens, New York City to find a wife whom he can respect for her intelligence and will. (imdb)
film.quote: Meh, whatever. It was really setting itself up at the beginning to be very funny and then it just stopped being funny almost entirely. I mean, the romantic side of it feels genuine and was decent written and acted. I just didn't find the movie that funny.

film.summary: When a prank caller convinces a fast food restaurant manager to interrogate an innocent young employee, no-one is left unharmed. Based on true events. (imdb)
film.quote: At first I thought, "Who could be THIS stupid?" I mean, there's movie stupid, which you kind of expect, but then there's going beyond that. But really, authority and conditioning really affect how people react to certain situations. Plus I then read the accounts of this happening. It's a tad different. It's still not a great movie, wish we could have actually gotten to know the people more (so their reactions would make more sense), it was drawn out too much, not much of an ending. But yay tits.

film.filmname: The Day the Earth Stood Still (2008)
film.summary: A remake of the 1951 classic sci-fi film about an alien visitor and his giant robot counterpart who visit Earth.
film.quote: There's a lot you can hate here, but really, it's pretty standard blockbuster stuff and that's not so bad. Keanu fits, I like Connelly, and it kept me entertained for the hour and 35 minutes. You could pick apart the script (there are some awful lines), and you could pick apart how hamfisted the message is or you could just enjoy the ride because it at least gives you that and special effects/visuals.

film.summary: A man (Khabensky) who serves in the war between the forces of Light and Dark comes into possession of a device that can restore life to Moscow, which was nearly destroyed by an apocalyptic event. (imdb)
film.quote: This movie is pretty ridiculous a lot of the time. Some of the visuals really are impressive but I feel like it spends way too much time going for the "OH SWEET, MAN, YA SEE THAT!" reaction without the real chops to do so. It doesn't have an engaging plot or characters, really. Where Shoot 'Em Up got silly action right, this falls flat on its face too much. Still worth a watch but never a second.

film.summary: Set in beautiful Vancouver, four friends set out on an everyday errand and end up in a fight for their lives when they discover the body of a dead hooker left in their trunk... (imdb)
film.quote: Sometimes Idon't know if a movie is just BAD or self-aware bad, and that changes my view on a movie. This movie seems very self-aware, a grindhouse flick, so the lines become more clever. This is summed up in the end with a line I was a big fan of, &quot;I can't believe there were no repercussions for what we did&quot; (possible mis-quote). Anyway, decent acting, though I feel the script could have been a bit tighter. Cheesy effects (that's to be expected) and it's an entertaining black comedy/h

film.summary: Set in a future version of America, a prisoner (Statham) who is weeks away from being released is forced by his warden (Allen) to compete in a brutal, deadly car race alongside his fellow inmates.

From the visionary mind of acclaimed musician Rob Zombie comes the follow-up to his smash hit &#034;House of 1000 Corpses.&#034; Written and directed by Zombie, this film further explores the Dr. Satan Cult Murders by blending traditional horror elements with the Western genre to paint a shocking portrait of vigilante justice. (Lions Gates Films)
film.quote: Disappointing. I was excited for this and it was just average in every way.

film.summary: When he finds out that his work superiors host a dinner celebrating the idiocy of their guests, a rising executive questions it when he's invited, just as he befriends a man who would be the perfect guest.
film.quote: First off, I love Paul Rudd. I always enjoy watching him. He also delivered a great line at the beginning. I'm not really a fan of Zach G, I've learned. I expected a lot more due to the great beginning. But then it lost itself a bit, for a little too long. Then the dinner came and it was a great movie again.. it was a little too late to make me give this at least a 70, but these really really low reviews I'm seeing disappoint me, regardless.

film.summary: Authorities brutally quarantine a country as it succumbs to fear and chaos when a virus strikes. The literal walling-off works for three decades until the dreaded Reaper virus violently resurfaces in a major city. An elite group of specialists is urgently dispatched into the still-quarantined country to retrieve a cure by any means possible.
Nadja and Rainer are having an argument in a small flat when Rainer takes a gun out of the bedside table... (IMDB Comments)
film.quote: It's good. Though it comes to an end obviously, and does what it has to do, I feel like there could be more. There are a few visual moments (mostly things moving by themselves) that make this a little more interesting than what is normal, and those few things are what make me ultimately recommend this.

film.summary: Twenty years after Britain's most notorious gangland murders, the next generation of Essex Boys vie for control as revenge is sought by all sides. (imdb)
film.quote: It's not great by any means, but it's a pretty lightweight crime drama with a little bit of humour here and there to lighten the mood. Ultimately pretty forgettable, and sometimes it's a little silly, but it's not bad and I was entertained.

film.summary: The defiant leader Moses rises up against the Egyptian Pharaoh Ramses, setting 600,000 slaves on a monumental journey of escape from Egypt and its terrifying cycle of deadly plagues. (imdb)
film.quote: I don't have any giant issues with it but there isn't anything to give a lot of praise to either. It drags a bit, but the vengeful God parts are fun. Decent flick.

film.summary: Barney and his team, known as "The Expendables", come into conflict with ruthless arms dealer Conrad Stonebanks, the Expendables' co-founder, who is determined to destroy the team. (imdb)
film.quote: I still think these movies are entertaining and have no shame in saying I love the first, but it's hard not to feel like the novelty is wearing off a bit. They add more badasses, but the content gets more shallow and uninspired with each new entry. It's still fun because it's explosions, silly action and cheese, but it doesn't do any of that as well as the first. What was once funny isn't. Mindless entertainment, but there's better entertainment of this type out there, despite the ppl involved.

film.summary: A horror-thriller centered on a woman living with &quot;face-blindness&quot; after surviving a serial killer's attack. As she lives with her condition, one in which facial features change each time she loses sight of them, the killer closes in. (imdb)
film.quote: An interesting concept done in very cliche ways, with a pretty good performance by Milla. Nothing really sticks out but I don't think anything really disappoints... unless you're extremely bothered by cliches. I'm not generally, unless it makes the movie really terrible. This is pretty good and it's one of those movies where it's sort of fun to guess who the killer is.

film.summary: An unemployed defence worker frustrated with the various flaws he sees in society, begins to psychotically and violently lash out against them. (imdb)
film.quote: Wait, I'm supposed to cheer for this guy? You know, I can get behind certain ideas that he expresses... but then he's an angry guy who verbally abuses his ex-wife and makes his kid do things she doesn't want to do, and gives normal people a hard time for no reason (like the breakfast part). Even when he says things you can agree with, he deals with the situation so awfully that it is pointless. But besides his morality, the movie is pretty silly but you know, pretty entertaining regardless.

film.summary: With his family held for ransom, the head security executive for a global bank is commanded to loot his own business for millions in order to ensure his wife and children's safety. He then faces the demanding task of thwarting the kidnapper's grand scheme, which makes him look guilty of embezzlement. (imdb)
film.quote: Ah, it was entertaining enough to recommend but it's ultimately pretty forgettable.

film.summary: A man caught in the middle of two simultaneous robberies at the same bank desperately tries to protect the teller with whom he's secretly in love.
film.quote: I don't think the comedy works most of the time but I'll be honest: I thought the twists and turns were interesting. The script could use some work and I think the writers might have thought that the excessive swearing was needed but it wasn't. It's not going to blow your mind by any means, but as an interesting little take on the bank heist genre, it's really not bad. It's definitely not as bad as Metacritic and Rotten Tomatoes would have you believe.

film.summary: Four assassins meet in a hotel suite to resolve unfinished business. A tense drama set in the cosmopolitan world of Hong Kong. (imdb)
film.quote: For whatever reason I had fairly high hopes. I actually like the idea of 4 assassins in a room talking. I feel like there can be a lot of great tension there, plus assassins are cool. However, this doesn't live up to its potential; with shady acting from 2 of the assassins, and weird reactions from certain characters that breaks the flow and makes me go CMON. It's not a bad movie if you're into this sort of thing though.

film.summary: Amos Gitai&#039;s beautiful new film is a quietly sweeping movie about intersected lives in transit. (New Yorker Films)
film.quote: While the beginning scene is quite inspired, I feel like the movie never lives up to that. Putting image over image like the film liked to do was a bad choice. I didn't care that much about anything going on. Portman is nice to look at but when is she not? The ending was mildly amusing though... so basically the beginning and end are both good but the rest is decent at best.

film.summary: Following a ghost invasion of Manhattan, paranormal enthusiasts Erin Gilbert and Abby Yates, nuclear engineer Jillian Holtzmann, and subway worker Patty Tolan band together to stop the otherworldly threat. (imdb)
film.quote: It's not very funny, only having a spot or two where I mildly chuckled, and there are certainly some TERRIBLE gags that make me question everything. There's also the dreadful FoB theme. The original Ghostbusters implemented its amazing theme poorly (sorry), but I dig the updated version of it here and think they used it well in the final action sequence. That chick got badass! It's actually a fairly entertaining flick with a little heart. Certainly flawed, but not bad. I enjoyed it.

film.summary: In a modernistic city, three odd fellows seem to worship a small bird-like statue when a fourth bizarre person steals it. They give chase on their motorized flying brooms. One by one, the thief eludes or dispatches his pursuers as they zoom through the cityscape. (imdb)

This supernatural thriller is the chilling tale of a brilliant psychiatrist (Berry) who experiences an unwelcome awakening when she is accused of committing a heinous murder she cannot remember. (Warner Bros.)

From the acclaimed director, Takashi Miike, comes a Yakuza/horror film to shock and amaze audiences everywhere. When Minami is sent to kill his mentor, Ozaki, who is in the midst of a nervous breakdown, he embarks on a journey of unexplained natural phenomenon. (Pathfinder Pictures)
film.quote: Should have been right up my alley, but it wasn't. Some of the scenes are awesome -- the last 10 minutes, the cow-man, a couple other scenes -- but I felt it dragged! I'm sure this movie is saying something... someone said repressed homosexuality and I can see that, but I had a hard time getting into it. Not because of the weirdness, just because that for every weird moment, there was a couple not so fantastic moments. Oh well, original and twisted... worth a watch.

film.summary: Seth Rogen and writing partner Evan Goldberg (Superbad) apply their trademark humor to the superhero genre in this big-screen action-adventure about a newspaper-publishing playboy (Rogen) who dons a disguise to fight crime after hours. As the Green Hornet, Britt Reid's power is no longer limited to the printed page -- and thanks to a nimble martial-arts expert (Jay Chou), he has the skills to expose the city's roughest criminals.
film.quote: Thought it was quite funny at the beginning but as the movie went on it drifted away from comedy and more into an action movie. That's kind of normal these days for this genre, but it entertained both as a comedy and an action. Not a movie you gush over or anything, but a fun romp, and well worth your time.

film.summary: A former Special Forces soldier and military contractor suffering from PTSD tries to reconnect with his long time love, but first must go on the run from London to Barcelona and across Europe in order to clear his name. (imdb)
film.quote: I like the premise of the flick because it seems to have more going on than a typical action movie. However, it doesn't do well by its premise and just shoehorns in a message at he end. It tends to drag a little bit, but I did enjoy watching Penn kick some ass because the sequences were choreographed well. It ends up being a pretty forgettable action flick when all is said and done, but it was an okay time.

film.filmname: Harold & Kumar Escape from Guantanamo Bay (2008)
film.summary: Follows the cross-country adventures of the pot-smoking duo as they try to outrun authorities who suspect them of being terrorists when they try to sneak a bong on board their flight to Amsterdam.
film.quote: Not nearly as good as the first but it still has a few choice laughs. It's disappointing though because it could have been much more.

film.summary: The Hipster's join the Tea Party
film.quote: I only like this short ironically. (But seriously... even though hipster jokes are kind of old, it's pretty funny).

film.filmname: How We Got Away with It (2014)
film.summary: A young man and his friends react violently to a sudden, unexpected tragedy during their annual all-weekend summer party. (imdb)
film.quote: It's not a bad little mystery film that plays with something we've seen quite often. There are a few problems though. The movie takes way too long before it reveals much of anything, no scraps thrown to us, where it reveals every single thing at the end. Not the mark of a great mystery. Actors are okay usually but have some bad moments. Script needs tightening up, some characters are useless or just plain uninteresting. The ending doesn't hit home like it's supposed to.

film.summary: A young journalist (Eisenberg), a seasoned cameraman (Howard) and a discredited journalist (Gere) embark on an unauthorized mission to find the no. 1 war criminal in Bosnia; they find themselves in serious jeopardy when they are mistaken as a CIA hit squad and their target decides to come after them. (imdb)
The haunted Lambert family seeks to uncover the mysterious childhood secret that has left them dangerously connected to the spirit world. (imdb)
film.quote: It does do a decent job of hitting atmosphere and the story is a little intriguing. It's definitely a step down (or 3) from the first one, which had its own problems but I rated close to an 80. The acting in this was downright terrible sometimes, and some of the cheese was a bad cheese since obviously the movie wasn't going for it.The music was too loud sometimes to try to be scary but I did enjoy the title screen for that, and it did feel like an old movie AT TIMES. At it's best its only okay.

film.summary: In The Interview, Dave Skylark (James Franco) and his producer Aaron Rapoport (Seth Rogen) run the popular celebrity tabloid TV show "Skylark Tonight." When they discover that North Korean dictator Kim Jong-un is a fan of the show, they land an interview with him in an attempt to legitimize themselves as journalists. As Dave and Aaron prepare to travel to Pyongyang, their plans change when the CIA recruits them, perhaps the two least-qualified men imaginable, to assassinate Kim Jong-un. (imdb)
film.quote: It was okay. I found the very beginning with Eminem to be the highlight, and the rest of it was decent. At first you feel like you're watching something due to all the drama behind it but it does everything it can to quickly unravel that and show that it's just an average Rogan/Franco comedy. Their chemistry is great, and both of them have done much much better, but the Interview is still entertaining. A lot of the jokes feel juvenile which doesn't seem to fit this particular film.

film.summary: Wealthy inventor and former weapons maker Tony Stark (Robert Downey Jr.) continues to fight crime as his alter ego, Iron Man, taking on villains intent on destroying humanity in Jon Favreau's action-packed superhero sequel based on Marvel comic book characters. But Stark's battle with the bottle may be his toughest challenge yet. Don Cheadle co-stars as Col. James Rhodes, with Samuel L. Jackson reprising his role as Nick Fury.
film.quote: Ultimately it's a serviceable action movie. It's just above mediocre (based mainly on performances), so I'd call it a low-end "good." They needed to put a lot more care into the script because, while there were some great lines, apparently the writer forgot to write a compelling narrative.

film.summary: Big city lawyer Hank Palmer returns to his childhood home where his father, the town's judge, is suspected of murder. Hank sets out to discover the truth and, along the way, reconnects with his estranged family. (imdb)
film.quote: It's shot really well, with picturesque cinematography, with great performances from the two leads... but god damn is that script ever sloppy. Talk about throwing every single cliche at you that they possibly can. Estranged family, big shot lawyer returning to his old roots (that he hates), seeing his childhood sweetie, incest?, riding his bike to feel FREE MAN, etc... it's just too much. I still enjoyed the movie, but that was despite how much it tried to make me cry (does work sometimes).

film.summary: The costumed high-school hero Kick-Ass joins with a group of normal citizens who have been inspired to fight crime in costume. Meanwhile, the Red Mist plots an act of revenge that will affect everyone Kick-Ass knows. (imdb)
film.quote: It was entertaining but it's definitely a lesser Kick-Ass 1. The Hit Girl sub-plot was fine, and when the action came it was pretty entertaining. However it suffers from no Big Daddy, and Carrey's character really couldn't replace that. There aren't any memorable scenes like the first, and even though I didn't find the first one THAT funny, it was funnier than this. Suffers from 'SWEAR WORDS ARE FUNNY' syndrome. Chloe is a great young actress though.

film.summary: Adam and Mary have been married for over thirty years; they have spent more than half their lives together. Their children left home long ago; it seems as though Adam and Mary have enjoyed and endured all of life's ups and downs together and are now looking forward to what should be a quieter phase in their lives. But then, gradually, certain irritations begin to creep into their lives and both are obliged to acknowledge that the years are now taking their toll. (berlinale.de)
film.quote: Entertaining, never above and beyond.

film.summary: Andy London is haunted by the events of his 18th birthday. In this animated autobiographical short, he writes a letter to Colleen in an attempt to make peace with his demons. (imdb)
film.quote: I wish it clicked with me more. I appreciate the art style, it lends itself well but ultimately the movie left me wondering... what's the point? Maybe I missed something.

film.summary: A fireman rushes to save a girl trapped in a burning house.
film.quote: It is what it is, mostly interesting to watch to see the early days of film. Although I did think that watching the house from the outside at the end was nicely done.

film.summary: A copywriter discovers a top-secret drug which bestows him with super human abilities. (imdb)
film.quote: I enjoyed it but didn't think it was terribly special. Interesting idea, and executed pretty well.

film.summary: Centers on a young girl who has been murdered and watches over her family - and her killer - from heaven. She must weigh her desire for vengeance against her desire for her family to heal.
film.quote: I'm always really thrilled by visuals like this. You put images like that on the screen and I'm usually in love. It's just sad that the rest of the movie isn't so great except for some good acting by some of 'em. The movie fails to hit that emotional ground that it really has to. But god... the way the killer died? Ugh.

film.summary: A documentary about the American lottery and some of the industry's biggest winners (and losers). (imdb)
film.quote: Yeah, not bad. Not terribly interesting... some of the facts made me go, "Oh, that's cool," because luck and coincidence is fun, but ultimately this isn't a very gripping documentary. I mean, the subject matter really isn't from the get-go... the people have decent stories, some are more interesting than others. Some peoples comments make me go, "huh?" Like, why the hell would you feel that way? I don't really believe anybody who says they wouldn't want to get that money. Sorry.

film.summary: In Paris, the great surgeon Dr. Gogol falls madly in love with stage actress Yvonne Orlac, and his ardor disturbs her quite a bit when he discovers to his horror that she is married to concert pianist Stephen Orlac...
film.quote: While I agree that Lorre gave a great performance, I just think the movie is a little silly. There are definitely good elements, and some great scenes, but -- even among the short running time -- I think those great scenes are too few. There are some funny parts and some parts of horror, however, so it's a good movie... just has a long way to go before being a classic.

film.summary: An FBI agent must go undercover in the Miss United States beauty pageant to prevent a group from bombing the event. (imdb)
Morgan is about a corporate risk-management consultant who has to decide and determine whether or not to terminate an artificial being's life that was made in a laboratory environment. (imdb)
film.quote: The first half when it's more of a suspense movie is actually quite enjoyable, though obviously familiar. Still, they build some emotional connections between the characters and you want to see how it unfolds. Then it turns into any number of super soldier action movies and in this case, that's an unfortunate change. It was more compelling when it was the first half. Plot twist adds nothing; Mara's character would actually be more memorable without it, because now it's just another convention.

film.summary: Upon taking her vows to become a nun, Sister Sarah is abused, brainwashed and drugged into submission by the corrupt clergy. On the verge of death from a lethal dose of drugs, Sister Sarah receives a message from GOD telling her to take vengeance on all those who did her wrong. Armed with God's will and an arsenal of big guns, she dispenses Judgment Day on her former tormentors. (imdb)
A couple find themselves lured into a Russian oligarch's plans to defect are soon positioned between the Russian Mafia and the British Secret Service, neither of whom they can trust. (imdb)
film.quote: I think it looks good and has some good, but not great, performances, but it's basically an average espionage thriller with a Russian mafia that seems a little declawed. It's fine, ultimately, even if the plot can get a little silly, but there's better out there.

film.summary: Nick Frost and Simon Pegg star as two science-fiction freaks who, while on a quest to discover what lies at the heart of Nevada's infamous Area 51, cross paths with an alien (voice of Seth Rogen) on the run from earthly authorities.
film.quote: On one end, the trailer didn't look good. But on the other end, it's fucking Nick Frost and Simon Pegg so I hoped for the best. I got a serviceable film, with a few laughs and nerdy references and whatnot, but this is not even close to the greatness of their other team ups. I felt like it actually relied way too much at some points on just being vulgar, which honestly, I don't find that amusing. When it settles down and crafts actual jokes, it's funny. Though I do like the "three tits" gag.

film.summary: Berta, a naive young maid, searches for love when the army engineers come to town to build a bridge. (imdb)
A priest disobeys church law to track down the vampires who kidnapped his niece. (imdb)
film.quote: Not really sure why they even bothered getting the rights to adapt the comic, because it's so far from the original source. The comic is probably my fave comic of all time, this ends up being a pretty good vampire movie with some cool action scenes. I don't get the hate, because it's really not that bad. It's fun, it has an interesting look and while the script (and some other things) could have used some work, I had a good time.

film.filmname: Prince of Persia: The Sands of Time (2010)
film.summary: When an evil nobleman threatens to enslave the world by obtaining the Sands of Time -- a mystical hourglass that gives him control over the flow of time -- Prince Dastan (Jake Gyllenhaal) and spunky Princess Tamina (Gemma Arterton) must join forces to stop the madman. Mike Newell directs this sweeping live-action adventure based on the popular video game.
film.quote: I expected this to be awful, especially since I'm not a fan of the games. Jake did a good job, even though I think the casting was wrong. Everyone else mostly did a good enough job. The visuals were pretty awesome though, I especially liked watching time go back. The action scenes were entertaining. As someone said, pure popcorn flick, but I enjoyed my watch and I'll never watch it again.

film.summary: The action packed sci-fi thriller involves a group of young American ex-pats with telekinetic and clairvoyant abilities, hiding from a clandestine U.S. government agency. They must utilize their different talents and band together for a final job enabling them to escape the agency forever
film.quote: Plot moves too conveniently a bunch of times. Don't really like Evans, and Fanning was pretty annoying, though to be fair that was probably more of her character than her. Script had a couple okay twists, but didn't go into enough detail and abandoned what made the movie good a bunch of times. The ending, meh, not fulfilling thematically or emotionally. However, I like the concept of the movie, with the battling between different types of psychics, just wish it would have been handled better.

film.summary: Refused are dead. They spent their last year in existence touring godforsaken hellholes scattered around the western world. This is their testament! (imdb)
film.quote: Solid, nothing to write home about. Refused were an incredible band, and they deserved an incredible documentary. This isn't it, but you do learn some stuff (especially if you're not a fan). They went out like champs, though.

film.summary: Set in the near future when artificial organs can be bought on credit, it revolves around a man who struggles to make the payments on a heart he has purchased. He must therefore go on the run before said ticker is repossessed.
film.quote: It's fun. There's a little bit of social commentary but nothing massive. Mostly it's just made to be an entertaining action/dark comedy film. What I'm torn on is the twist. Thematically, it makes all kinds of sense and I didn't see it coming. But to basically watch, what, half an hour or more of a movie and then have that twist kind of renders it null. I'm not sure a twist that lasts 5-10 minutes can make up for how stupid the last while of the movie got.

film.summary: Experimental film, white specks and shapes gyrating over a black background, a light-striped torso, a gyrating eggcrate. One of the first Dadaist films. (imdb)
film.quote: Tits.

film.filmname: Rock, Paper, Scissors: The Way of the Tosser (2007)
film.summary: This hilarious genre-bending comedy follows Gary Brewer, along with girlfriend Holly Brewer (no relation), and best friend Trevor Morehouse as Gary quests to reign supreme at the 2006 Rock, Paper, Scissors World Championships. (imdb)
film.quote: I enjoyed the idea of a mockumentary about rock, paper, scissors. I appreciated some of the jokes but I didn't really care about the characters. They were going for weird but I didn't even find them interesting. One just reminded me of Napoleon Dynamite for some reason. And the &quot;tosser&quot; joke got really old. Meh.

film.summary: When a poor college student who cracks an online poker game goes bust, he arranges a face-to-face with the man he thinks cheated him, a sly offshore entrepreneur. (imdb)
film.quote: It's generic but relatively interesting. Just a movie to pass an hour and a half, where I'll never talk about it again. I like Timberlakr and Afleck though.

film.summary: A fisheries expert is approached by a consultant to help realize a sheik's vision of bringing the sport of fly-fishing to the desert and embarks on an upstream journey of faith and fish to prove the impossible possible.
