film.quote: For a movie with good performances, and an original idea (salmon fishing in the yemen along with some of the other things the movie tries to incorporate like assassination attempts, faith, etc), it somehow ended up being bland. It's not bad. It's not especially good. It's forgettable and would be even worse if it wasn't for the believable chemistry between the two leads. Some of the more out there stuff it attempts just doesn't work.

film.summary: This is a comedy about being dumped. Sandra&#039;s boyfriend&#039;s gone up north for a job so she&#039;s putting together a care package for him and making a video letter to send with it. Everything in the video short is Sandra addressing the camera for this "letter"... (imdb)
film.quote: Good short, nothing incredibly amazing and not really overly funny. Though the angry part, going into drunk angry, with the sirens over it... that was funny as hell. You know, the movie isn't around long enough and doesn't do a whole lot so there isn't much to say, but it's decent enough at what it is.

film.summary: When a man inadvertently injurers Santa on Christmas Eve, he finds himself magically recruited to take his place. (imdb)
film.quote: Probably just because of the memories with my family and the fact I actually like Tim Allen.

film.summary: Traces the misadventures of buddies J.D. (Black) and Wayne (Zahn), who begin to suspect that their best friend, Darren Silverman (Biggs), is going to allow himself to be badgered into marrying Judith (Peet), a woman he doesn&#039;t love. They decide to reunite him with his long lost love from their school days (Detmer) -- even if they have to kidnap Judith to do it. (Columbia Tristar)
film.quote: Pretty average. That is all.

film.summary: After surviving the events of the first movie, Fin and April now face a new shark storm in New York City. (imdb)
film.quote: I think Sharknado is losing its c harm for me already. The first was a bit of fun but not as awesome as I would have liked... and this has a bigger budget and more cameos but it didn't do it for me even as much as the first. That could be just because the novelty is wearing off, or maybe it's just not as good. Or maybe this concept relies so heavily on the novelty that it's part of the quality. Yeah, probably that. Silly fun though, regardless.

film.summary: Presents a day in the life in Austin, Texas among its social outcasts and misfits, predominantly the twenty-something set... (imdb)
film.quote: I give props to what Linklater was trying to accomplish here, and I enjoy some movies that lack a traditional narrative, but as Landstander so expertly put it: it's dull. I'm not bothered by the dialogue because he was trying to portray a certain thing, and some of it was interesting, but the drifting style only worked for a little while. Just a really hard movie to truly get into, despite how inventive it is.

film.filmname: Star Wars: Episode I - The Phantom Menace (1999)
film.summary: When the evil Trade Federation plots to take over the peaceful planet of Naboo, Jedi warrior Qui-Gon Jinn and his apprentice Obi-Wan Kenobi embark on an amazing adventure to save the planet.
film.quote: It's okay. The acting is anemic (Portman is amazing now but terrible in this, and young Anakin is just bad). Dialogue is sometimes really hokey. I actually don't mind the more political aspects, nor do I mind the plot about trade. Some of it is very cheesy, and Jar Jar is shitty -- though he bothers me a little less than most people -- but I'd be lying if I said I didn't enjoy it a little bit.

film.summary: A secret government agency recruits imprisoned supervillains to execute dangerous black ops missions in exchange for clemency. (imdb)
film.quote: Deadshot was just kinda Smith, Robbie was good as Harley even though they had her saying some awful stuff (the script is bad and not funny), Diablo was interesting, Waller was fine, the others were kinda meh and this was a C-grade Mafioso Joker that didn't work. Action was fine, story was fine, a lot was fine but not great.I liked it but I would really like to see the first version of it before the reshoots because I liked it when it was darker, since the comedy sucked.

film.summary: When Federal Officers Elizabeth Anderson and Sam Hallaway arrive at Captain Billing's office, they have three sets of stories to figure out and a string of vicious murders to consider.
film.quote: I loved the line, "That's twice I've knocked him out... you'd think he'd see me coming by now." I wonder the same thing as jacob1313 does... is Pullman acting manic or hamming it? It's a mystery to me. There were parts that just dragged on way too long, and added nothing. But the film had a decent look, and a decent twist that took it in a different route than just a mystery/whodunnit. Not amazing by any means but a thriller at least worth a watch.

film.summary: In Istanbul, retired CIA operative Bryan Mills and his wife are taken hostage by the father of a kidnapper Mills killed while rescuing his daughter. (imdb)
film.quote: Fun enough but really nothing on the original, which was fantastic and adrenaline filled (and badass). Taken 2 stretches the boundaries of what's okay with movie logic, to the point that is there really a struggle? Everything is pretty easy for him, and the villains are dipshits. This suffers from familiarity as well, a sequel that does very little different than the first but not as well either. But I do like the premise.

film.summary: Louise is not very popular at her highschool. Then she learns that she&#039;s descended from the witches of Salem and has inherited their powers... (imdb)
film.quote: Well, it's certainly not an astonishing display of direction but it's a comedy so as long as it's funny it's worth seeing. Is it funny? Well, sometimes. The rap /other musical scenes and a couple other scenes are funny or pretty hilarious but the jokes are too far away from each other. I don't really buy into whatever drama is in this movie and as a coming of age tale it doesn't work. The acting fairly horrible but it makes the funny parts funnier.

film.summary: Centers on a large 15-year-old boy in a small town as he struggles to adjust to his difficult life. (imdb)
film.quote: Pretty typical indie fare. Terri is having problems with his life, gets to know someone who helps him through, all while being a dramedy. There's nothing special here but there's nothing truly awful either. What these types of movies need to do most of the time -- for me, at least -- is have a few really funny moments (this had minor chuckles here and there) and some really emotional parts (nothing really got me that much). So hence, it's pretty good, not very good or great.

film.filmname: This is Where I Leave You (2014)
film.summary: When their father passes away, four grown siblings are forced to return to their childhood home and live under the same roof together for a week, along with their over-sharing mother and an assortment of spouses, exes and might-have-beens. (imdb)
film.quote: An okay movie in almost all ways. The only place it shines is in the casting because most of them are charming (I love Tina Fey). We've seen this before; family gets together, mulls over their problems, bickers, figures things out, we're expected to cry. It does it pretty well, but with a lesser cast it may not have worked because some of the script is wonky. It's also not actually that funny. I chuckled a couple times.

film.summary: Beginning with genuine footage of the departure of the Titanic, this film tells the events of that night from the perspective of fictional survivor Rose. As an old lady of 100 she recounts her story of duty, love and disaster to a salvage crew searching for a lost gem.
An automobile mechanic and his daughter make a discovery that brings down the Autobots - and a paranoid government official - on them. (imdb)
film.quote: Probably the weakest of the bunch but it's really not a terrible movie. The bad part is the same thing the other movies suffered from, but I noticed it more this time: too much human. I know there should be a human story, and I'm cool with that, but we go for robots fighting and in such a long movie we see very little of it. I forget that some of the movie is dull when the big fights happen. The movie is wonky too, but it is still an entertaining ride.

film.summary: The third installment in Michael Bay's trilogy travels back to 1969's historic moon landing, when Neil Armstrong and his Apollo 11 cohorts touch down in the Sea of Tranquility ... and discover what appears to be a downed Transformers craft. Flash forward to the present, and the Decepticons are ready to exact revenge on Optimus Prime and the rest of the Autobots. Shia LaBeouf returns as Sam Witwicky, the Autobots' human ally.
film.quote: AMERICA FUCK YEAH! Anyway, this is about on par with the first one for me, but keep in mind I'm one of 3 people (me, Bay and Bay's wife) who prefer the second one. The first hour kind of lost me; I thought it was silly and kinda dumb, and yes I am aware that they've all had a human narrative, this one didn't do it for me. It wasn't put together well. Then after an hour, the robots start fighting and that's when you remember you're watching a Transformers movie and it actually gets good.

film.summary: A family on a road trip is stalked by criminals who stashed stolen money in their car. (imdb)
film.quote: It's probably what you expect. It isn't ground breaking in any single way but everything is decent enough. One of those movies where it's not a waste of time but if you only want to watch great movies, then you should skip it. Otherwise, just go along for the ride... typical Hollywood thriller-fare.

film.summary: Four friends set out on a motorcycle adventure weekend, clocking up miles in an attempt to outrun their age and urban lifestyles. After bartering with a local land owner for a place to set up camp, they spend the night reminiscing over their wasted youth. The following morning they spot an ominous looking caravan, and decide to investigate. Within minutes, an idiotic prank leads to a series of brutal events and a deadly race for survival... (imdb)
film.quote: I found the end kind of a mess stylistically, but for a movie with a small budget, this has some surprising beautiful shots. It tells a gritty tale coherently, some of the acting is wonky, there's a little social commentary, some of the music is good.

film.summary: A pair of cops investigating a drug invasion stumble upon a mysterious bank vault. (imdb)
film.quote: I actually enjoyed it, which is nice. I like Cage a lot and think his knack for being ridiculous is endearing, and Wood did a good enough job. It's not original material by any means, but there's very little to actually hate here.

film.summary: Dancers, shown in photographic negative, perform a series of ballet moves, solos, pas de deux, larger groupings. The dancers glide and rotate untroubled by gravity against a slowly changing starfield background. Their movements are accompanied by music scored for a small ensemble of woodwind and percussion. (imdb)
film.quote: Author intent: Great. The Film: Not so great. Really, I appreciate what's going on here, but it's just not that entertaining. So keep that in mind. Technically I'm recommending it, though.

film.summary: Private investigator Matthew Scudder is hired by a drug kingpin to find out who kidnapped and murdered his wife. (imdb)
film.quote: Pretty average but not bad. It's just very by the books, very formulaic, but I was entertained by. I have seen better and Neeson has done better.

film.summary: This outrageous comedy stars Vince Vaughn and Owen Wilson as divorce mediators and lifelong friends who have never met a wedding they couldn&#039;t get themselves into. (New Line Cinema)
film.quote: I don't understand why people loved this so much. I really didn't find it that funny and I felt the plot pretty generic.

film.summary: A young couple is forced to deal with an embarrassing problem when they are invited to stay overnight with family. (Youtube)
film.quote: It didn't overly do it for me, but I will say that the ending when the dog just rolls over while the chick is screaming is funny, because animals are funny. Not a waste of time by any means, especially considering it's only 7 mins and I did sort-of like it.

film.summary: Young lawyer Arthur Kipps travels to a remote village to organize a recently deceased client's papers, where he encounters the ghost of a scorned woman set on vengeance.
film.quote: It uses every horror movie rule in the book, but it's entertaining. There are genuine creepy moments and the atmosphere is wonderful. But ultimately this is another haunted house movie, you've seen it a million times. Ghosts stalk people in the house, doing random things just to get some jump scares. I liked the ending, though.

film.summary: Winter, Cobble Hill, Brooklyn. It's gray. Felix, a high school student, lives with his inattentive mother. The cupboards are bare, she watches TV constantly, he's on his own. The owner of a convenience store in the neighborhood asks Felix if he'll feed the dog at the store for a few days while he's on vacation; he gives Felix a key to the store. Felix invites a couple of his friends to celebrate their access: TV dinners and bottles of malt liquor beckon... (imdb)
film.quote: It's solid, it doesn't overstay its welcome or anything but there isn't a whole lot here to go ape-shit over neither. It tells a simple story of a kid who steals from a store, is given a key and told to look after the dog. At first he ignores the dog, then he "comes around." It's subtle and doesn't make a big deal of itself, but it's also not necessary viewing... maybe for that reason.

film.summary: 51 chronicles what happens after political pressure from the American public forces the Air Force to provide a few well-known reporters with limited access to the most secretive base on the planet: Area 51. When one of the base's hidden 'long term visitors' exploits this unprecedented visit as a chance to liberate himself and his fellow alien captives, Area 51 turns from a secure government base to a horrifying destination of terror. (imdb)
film.quote: It's not that bad. It's a TV movie with very little budget, so the expectations of certain elements are lower. It's a pretty entertaining movie, obviously the visuals aren't great but they're pretty good with what they had. It doesn't do anything overly cool and some parts look more low budget than others. Acting was poor to good, depending. The script needed work, that's unforgivable, and the ending was awful. Had it succeeded in the writing I would have given it a much higher rating.

film.summary: A young couple leave a lake campsite on motorbike at the same time as a bus full of youths. The boy accidently loses a tent along the road which is picked up by those in the bus who offer a trade of the tent for his girl. (imdb)
film.quote: Well made, not that interesting. However, I like the last couple minutes quite a bit.

film.summary: A spaceship arrives in Arizona, 1873, to take over the Earth, starting with the Wild West region. A posse of cowboys are all that stand in their way. (imdb)
film.quote: I give it some extra points because of an interesting premise. As I've said in some other reviews, we should be easier on certain movies for that reason. Not saying it's exempt from criticism or anything, because as my 59 says, this isn't a great or even good movie. It's serviceable, and it's mostly fun. It's bogged down by some tedium and silliness on occasion, and doesn't have any amazing moments but it's entertaining most of the way. The interesting premise takes it up a few points.

film.summary: A crash landing leaves Kitai Raige and his father Cypher stranded on Earth, 1,000 years after events forced humanity's escape. With Cypher injured, Kitai must embark on a perilous journey to signal for help. (imdb)
film.quote: It's not a terrible movie though it drags a bit here and there. The opening few seconds is intense, but then the narration right after is kinda cheesy. After that you have a decent but not great movie, though I really didn't like Jaden's acting at times. The movie looks nice, and everything is staged well. I maintain that Shyamalan is a talented director, and this is a step in the right direction to get his career back on track. It's really not as bad as people are saying.

film.summary: Ernest helps Santa Claus as he searches for his successor. (imdb)
The iconic monsters from two of the scariest film franchises ever battle each other for the first time on film. (Fox)

A chance encounter between a travelling salesman and a lonely hitman triggers a strangely profound relationship which provokes each to act in ways neither would have imagined possible. Fate steps in to form a friendship between two men from irreconcilable worlds that will alter the lives of both forever. (imdb)

A post-apocalyptic western, in which a lone gunman must deliver a woman with mythical powers to an evil Governor. Unfurling against the backdrop of a frozen, inhospitable earth, Snowblind is Germany’s first full-blown green-screen movie. (Viewclips.net)
film.quote: I can appreciate the effort here, and while it's obvious it was all done with green screen, the effects themselves aren't awful, especially given the budget. It's still painfully noticeable and that may bother people. The acting is average to good most of the time, the script/plot needs work. Really, they should have focused more on just giving this a great story, great characters, then everything else would be more forgiveable, because story is one thing you don't need a budget for.

film.summary: Lindsay Anderson and Shelagh Delaney's The White Bus is a surrealistic film about a secretary who takes a strange trip, part of which takes place on the eponymous vehicle. The nameless girl has a seemingly dull life, which is interrupted by periodic flights of fantasy involving suicide, recreations of paintings, and pieces of meat that suddenly run blood-run. (Fandango.com)
film.quote: I actually thought it was pretty dull a lot of the time. However, there were a few scenes that helped push this past a 50 for me, namely the end, and a couple little laughs here and there (like at the very beginning). Visually it's interesting, I mean, a 1967 movie that mixed colour and B&W footage was a nice touch. Hell, that's a nice touch even today. I'm not sure what the movie meant but like I said, there were some good scenes, though I wouldn't give it a strong recommendation.

film.summary: When Prince Fabious's bride is kidnapped, he goes on a quest to rescue her... accompanied by his lazy useless brother Thadeous.
film.quote: Oddly enough, while I can play a game like Shadows of the Damned, I sometimes have a hard time going through a movie that basically operates on a one-joke premise: sex. Don't get me wrong, there are some really funny jokes in here, and the cast is good. Portman showing up is the best part but I just feel like a bunch of the jokes are flaccid (yeah I can do it too!). Not a bad movie by any means, just not good, and with the cast involved, I expected more.

film.summary: Two fledgling criminals kidnap a pizza delivery guy, strap a bomb to his chest, and inform him that he has mere hours to rob a bank or else... (imdb)
film.quote: A mild action-comedy, not overly funny, but an okay ride anyway. My lack of anything to say pretty much says it all: I won't remember this movie 5 minutes from... wait what was I talking about?

film.summary: Pet detective Ace Ventura comes out of retirement to investigate the disappearance of a rare white bat, the symbol of an African tribe (imdb)
A young woman, born at the turn of 20th century, is rendered ageless after an accident. After years of a solitary life, she meets a man who might be worth losing her immortality. (imdb)
film.quote: Not enough happens to keep this from occasionally being bland, which is a shame because this kind of concept always gets me. It should have made me feel more than it did but I don't blame Lively for that. I'm not a big fan of her but she did a good job. It just wasn't a very exciting movie though it gets significantly better once Ford shows up and complicates everything.

film.summary: After the earth-shattering revelations of Insurgent, Tris must escape with Four beyond the wall that encircles Chicago to finally discover the shocking truth of what lies behind it. (imdb)
film.quote: This has got to be the most average series that I keep following. I'm already knee deep though so I might as well. It's mediocre on all fronts, but not especially bad. There are a couple moments where it strives for more, but those are few and far between. There are also some silly moments to counterbalance those. Mildly entertaining but forgettable.

film.summary: 4 uninspired friends try to come up with a terrific idea of how to spend their Saturday afternoon. The Apocalypse. (imdb)
film.quote: Gets points for um, originality. And the fact that when the first head explodes you just don't see it coming. Dumb people will rule the world, I get it, not exactly uncommon territory but hey, I have an idea... *head explodes*

film.summary: Three high school virgins, suspended from school on a bogus graffiti charge, flee to the inner city in an attempt to live out the plot of The Catcher in the Rye... (imdb)
film.quote: I enjoy the premise quite a bit, and there is undeniably some amusing parts in this where the vulgarity and satire work well together. Unfortunately there's too much where it just doesn't, where it becomes unfunny and boring. It gets a pass on the premise and the funny parts here and there, and the acting is okay, but don't rush out to see this. If you want to see an indie flick that's not horrible, and fairly original within the genre, check it out though. Very mild recommendation here.

film.summary: An undercover cop tries to take down a ruthless crime lord with access to a neutron bomb by infiltrating his gang. (imdb)
film.quote: It's one of those "nothin' better to do on a slow day" kinda movies, meaning, if you want to just kill an hour and a half with something that isn't really that good but still ends up being mildly entertaining... then this is a movie you can go to. The plot is silly, with how a drug lord ends up becoming the hope for the people, but the parkour-action scenes are pretty decent and while it doesn't work real well, it works enough to be a bit of fun. You have to ignore the many shortcomings though.

film.summary: In a last-ditch effort to stop a diabolical plot, a dead CIA operative's memories, secrets, and skills are implanted into a death-row inmate in hopes the he will complete the operative's mission. (imdb)
film.quote: Despite all the flaws--bad script, bad logic, action that isn't so inspired, some wonky acting--I was still entertained. Mildly. That's about all I have to say. Oh wait, it's too long... this movie doesn't have enough content to warrant the length.

film.summary: Beatrice Prior, a teenager with a special mind, finds her life threatened when an authoritarian leader seeks to exterminate her kind in her effort to seize control of their divided society. (imdb)
film.quote: I like Woodley a lot even though I felt she was a little misplaced in this role. Maybe I just have a hard time separating her from her EXCELLENT performance in Spectacular Now. She's talented and makes it more watchable than it should be. Aside from that, it's a pretty generic dystopian YA movie. Decent idea, decent talking point, but nothing really sticks out and the end was a little anti-climatic (JUMPING ON A TRAIN). Actions scenes were uninspired. Fear drug scenes were okay. Average flick.

film.summary: A young slacker and a single mom get tangled up in a terrorist cell plotting a political assassination.
The employees of an independent music store learn about each other as they try anything to stop the store being absorbed by a large chain. (imdb)
An insurance agent is sent by her employer to track down and help capture an art thief.
Runs exactly three minutes and features all sorts of strange colors, shapes and objects.
When her sister disappears, Jill is convinced the serial killer who kidnapped her two years ago has returned, and she sets out to once again face her abductor. (imdb)
film.quote: Up until the ending, probably about a 65 or so. I was just left wondering, "So?" after it, which you should never do. I waited for something really interesting to happen and it didn't. However, while you wait it's pretty entertaining. Generic, yes, but decent. The end is bad, but isn't enough to completely tank this one.

film.summary: Insurance investigator Maindrian Pace and his team lead double-lives as unstoppable car thieves. When a South American drug lord pays Pace to steal 48 cars for him, all but one, a 1973 Ford Mustang, are in the bag. As Pace prepares to rip-off the fastback, codenamed "Eleanor", in Long Beach, he is unaware that his boss has tipped off the police after a business dispute. Detectives are waiting and pursue Pace through five cities as he desperately tries to get away. (imdb)
film.quote: Admittedly I'm harder on car movies because I'm not much of a fan of cars in general.

film.summary: A failed American businessman looks to recoup his losses by traveling to Saudi Arabia and selling his idea to a wealthy monarch.
film.quote: It's really slow but there are some good gags and some interesting subject matter. I don't really buy into whatever drama exists here, and the ending is weird; it's like two completely different movies and even by Hollywood standards the romance was abrupt and rushed. Ultimately entertaining but not enthusiastically so.

film.summary: As two evil sisters prepare to conquer the land; two renegades - Eric the Huntsman - who previously aided Snow White in defeating Ravenna, and his forbidden lover, Sara set out to stop them. (imdb)
film.quote: There's a part where Theron answers a question with "Yes... no" and that sums up my main criticism: the characters have weird motivation, the screenwriters couldn't make up their mind what they wanted. Besides that, it's kind of enjoyable with a sense of humour. Not great, but not dreadful. Decent visuals and Emily Blunt doing what she can. Remember girls: all you are supposed to do is find love and not be ugly... that's what the movie is telling you.

film.summary: Beatrice Prior must confront her inner demons and continue her fight against a powerful alliance which threatens to tear her society apart with the help from others on her side. (imdb)
film.quote: Woodley is still miscast but is a good actress, and everyone else does a good job (Watts was a welcome surprise 'cuz I love her). It's a dystopian film with very little to say and tries to hide that with action sequences that are mildly entertaining. It has the worst usage of slomo that I've seen in a while in one particular scene, and I would have liked the movie a little more if it wasn't for the final act. Very predictable with slow world-building, but I kinda liked it anyway.

film.summary: Two salesmen whose careers have been torpedoed by the digital age find their way into a coveted internship at Google, where they must compete with a group of young, tech-savvy geniuses for a shot at employment. (imdb)
film.quote: For whatever reason I actually wanted to see this. Wilson and Vaughn prove again that they have great chemistry, but unfortunately this comedy isn't that funny. There are a couple jokes that made me go "heh" but not many that actually really made me laugh. There's a lot of heart here, a ton of motivational speeches so at least you'll feel inspired, so it's not a terrible movie, just a decent one. Also, heart warming ending. Everyone else is doing it so I want to too, google google google.

film.summary: Former undercover police officer Jack Adleth returns to London seeking those who tried to have him killed in Amsterdam. (imdb)
film.quote: It was okay. It ripped off a couple other films and did nothing remotely original with the ideas, but it also wasn't a complete waste of time because ultimately you get a film noirish flick with a decent story and some decent scenes. Don't get me wrong, it uses the black and white with some colour thing really poorly, and would have been a stronger film without it, but if you can forgive its flaws and that it never reaches a high level... like I said, it's okay.

film.summary: A suburban couple becomes embroiled in an international espionage plot when they discover that their seemingly perfect new neighbors are government spies. (imdb)
film.quote: It basically gave me what I wanted this evening. I just wanted something easily digestible, with maybe a couple laughs and Gal Gadot. I got Gal Gadot, less laughs than I may have hoped for, and it was certainly inconsequential. I can understand not giving it a passing grade because it's just kinda there, but it was satisfying enough--at least at this point in time--to get a slight pass.

film.summary: An everyday guy decides to take justice into his own hands after a plea bargain sets his family's killers free. His target: The district attorney who orchestrated the deal. (imdb)
film.quote: It was pretty decent until it got to the explanation of who's doing what and how. Won't ruin it but it's ridiculous in a bad way. That, and the ending, is just crap and knocks a 75 down to a 55. You cheer for him at the beginning and then you get a lot of gray area and then he's a bit of a knob than he's an asshole. And yet he still doesn't work as a great villain. A very minor recommendation because it's not a complete waste of time.

film.summary: When former black ops operative Tom Steele (Seagal) and his partner Manning (Austin) are assigned to decommission an old prison, they must oversee the arrival of two mysterious female prisoners. Before long, an elite force of mercenaries assault the prison in search of the new arrivals. As the true identities of the women are revealed, Steele realizes he's caught in the middle of something far bigger than he had imagined. (imdb)
film.quote: I'm not going to try to pass this off as anything more than what it is... it's an alright action movie that I figure people on here will end up hating. I kind of dug it. I mean, Seagal is really old, and some of the dialogue is just bad, and the action scenes do nothing that hasn't been seen a million times before. But I liked it. Also, I just like Stone Cold.

film.summary: A secret agent is sent to Sydney, to find and destroy a genetically modified disease called "Chimera" (imdb)
film.quote: An attempt to Bond up Ethan Hunt, this is nothing compared to the very good first MI. Yeah, sure, the action scenes can be entertaining but we've seen it all before and what made Mission Impossible 1 so good is that it was a smartly crafted thriller. This is just action.

film.summary: A redemption tale, the story of a man stepping from darkness into to light...
film.quote: As Kasper said, some good imagery. Meth played a decent weirdo, but some of the acting (and writing...) was wonky. The musical choices were cool, as they didn't rely just on rap because Meth is in it, but instead they picked some downright folky, moody music for most of it. The ending wrapped up in an anti-climatic, predictable way and was too abrupt. They could have done more with the idea, but I still enjoyed myself despite the average story and whatnot.

film.summary: As the dots collide, expand and merge there is a timed beat rhythm that builds throughout and creates a soundtrack that would not be out of place in many a modern club. Created by scratching directly onto the film the soundtrack combined with the visuals are amazing in consideration of the fact that this was made in the 60's. (imdb)
film.quote: Context tells me that the visuals and especially the music were nifty back then. Enjoyment now tells me I don't need to watch this again because these days it's just lines and some, as other users have said, "primitive electronica."

film.summary: In their new overseas home, an American family soon finds themselves caught in the middle of a coup, and they frantically look for a safe escape in an environment where foreigners are being immediately executed. (imdb)
film.quote: I enjoyed my time but it was inconsistent. It had some really stupid scenes like the rooftop jumping, humour where it shouldn't have, and wonky dialogue, along with a terrible ending, but the cast did a decent job and it's shot pretty well. It could have explored its subject matter more and been better, but it's still a relatively entertaining thriller.

film.summary: An ex-CIA operative is brought back in on a very personal mission and finds himself pitted against his former pupil in a deadly game involving high level CIA officials and the Russian president-elect. (imdb)
film.quote: It's a passable thriller/action movie. There were some parts that seemed out of place, and some of the movie just didn't work for me, but Brosnan is charming. It was entertaining... there just really wasn't enough to put it above being average.

film.summary: A spacecraft traveling to a distant colony planet and transporting thousands of people has a malfunction in its sleep chambers. As a result, two passengers are awakened 90 years early.
film.quote: There are boring parts, but it's generally a fairly entertaining movie. There's always a bit of horror in a movie where people are trapped in space because it's hard not to project yourself into that situation, and the movie briefly wrestles with its own moral dilemma. Unfortunately, while I don't think it's necessarily sexist, it gives people ammo to think so, and they have material to justify it... which is problematic, obviously. Ultimately it's a kinda pretty, decent, shallow movie.

film.summary: Paul Blart is headed to Las Vegas to attend a Security Guard Expo with his teenage daughter, Maya, before she departs for college. While at the convention, he inadvertently discovers a heist -- and it's up to Blart to apprehend the criminals. (imdb)
film.quote: It's not close to being a great comedy by any means, but it made me laugh a few times and I wasn't bored. That's good enough for the most minor of recommendations.

film.summary: A recently slain cop joins a team of undead police officers working for the Rest in Peace Department and tries to find the man who murdered him. (imdb)
film.quote: This movie never sinks itself, because just when it does something that I think it stupid and shitty, it cracks a joke that actually makes me chuckle and it brings the movie back up. The problem is, it then does something crappy, like try to hard for the joke, and it knocks it back down. I didn't find the action that exciting, and I actually don't love Bridges in this (though it could be the script). Always love Parker though. At its peak I would have rated it 65, but it's inconsistent. Decent.

film.summary: A short by Tashio Matsumoto involving the ocean and fancy editing techniques.
film.quote: You know, I haven't been a fan of the Matsumoto shorts I've seen at all because the editing used just doesn't do it for me in this day and age, but I'm giving this one a pass because the hand is kinda cool and the music/images blend together to make something as calming as the ocean into something sort of menacing. I can't explain it. It's almost creepy.

film.summary: A couple roleplayers have a hard time getting people to roleplay with them. What will happen? Will these roleplayers be able to continue on with their imaginary worlds?
film.quote: It was okay, the girl is cute as hell and I gotta admit, that one scene was kind of sexy, haha. But besides that, it has a laugh or two but is nothing terribly special. A movie about a roleplay that goes wrong... turned into a PSA. Not bad.

film.summary: An extremely wealthy man, dying from cancer, undergoes a radical medical procedure that transfers his consciousness into the body of a healthy young man. But all is not as it seems when he starts to uncover the mystery of the body's origin and the organization that will kill to protect its cause. (imdb)
film.quote: What starts on an interesting note reveals itself to be a pretty generic action movie. Though competently created on most fronts, Self/less squanders its potential. It lacks a lot of the flair that Singh is known for.

film.summary: Everything that farmer Graham Hess (Gibson) assumed about the world is changed when he discovers a message - an intricate pattern of circles and lines - carved into his crops. (Touchstone Pictures)
When her father disappears, Heather Mason is drawn into a strange and terrifying alternate reality that holds answers to the horrific nightmares that have plagued her since childhood (imdb)
film.quote: I don't feel like this was an awful movie. I'm an apologist maybe (I was for the first one, I loved that shit), but I don't see the INTENSE hatred. It doesn't hit anything as well as the first (like atmosphere), but it doesn't fumble it completely. CGI was alright. Didn't set up its jump scares that well but one or two got me. The script was wonky. It doesn't need to copy characters and plots from the games but hit the feel at least, this doesn't completely but it does ok.

film.summary: Batman learns he has a violent, unruly pre-teen son, secretly raised by the terrorist group the League of Assassins. (imdb)
film.quote: In terms of Batman animated movies it's sub-par, but it's still a mildly ok. The voice acting is bad, and Batman never changes his tone, nor does he seem to give a shit that he has a son. Deathstroke is a badass... only he isn't in the movie. Spoilers, but, am I alone in wanting an epic Batman/Deathstroke confrontation instead of a little Batman/Deathstroke? I just don't buy that he beats some of these people. Deathstroke is forgettable and that's a shame.

film.summary: There's trouble brewing in Bikini Bottom! Someone has stolen King Neptune's crown. Though he's just been passed over for the promotion of his dreams, SpongeBob stands by his boss and along with his best pal Patrick sets out on a treacherous mission to Shell City to reclaim the crown and save Mr. Krab's life. (Paramount)
film.quote: There's definitely something to SpongeBob. It's pretty clever but like some others, it never really caught on with me. This is a decent flick with some intelligence for children and adults.

film.summary: The turtles find themselves transported back in time to ancient Japan. (imdb)
James Bond heads to stop a media mogul's plan to induce war between China and the UK in order to obtain exclusive global media coverage.
film.quote: Bond is still cool. I like Brosnan as Bond, but aside from that completely average.

film.summary: Frank Martin is the most highly-skilled transporter money can buy. The stakes are greater and technology better, but the same three simple rules apply: never change the deal, no names and never open the package. When Frank is hired by cunning femme fatale Anna and her three stunning sidekicks, he quickly discovers he's been played. (imdb)
film.quote: For every bit of good there's bad. A great fight scene may be brought down later in the same fight scene by a stupid contribution to it. Ed Skrein does his best Statham impression but isn't Statham, the music is oddly placed and kinda weird but some of it is cool. It's a typical action movie all around, and the villain has the worst taste in rap imaginable.

film.summary: A young married couple becomes stranded at an isolated motel and finds hidden video cameras in their room. They realize that unless they escape, they'll be the next victims of a snuff film.
film.quote: Meh, I go easy on flicks. It did nothing out of the ordinary and lived up to every horror cliche you can imagine. But it does have some good scenes, like the first time they watch the snuff. I wasn't bored and it was relatively short anyway, so give it a go even if you'll forget it shortly after.

film.summary: Rose Hathaway is a Dhampir, half human/vampire, guardians of the Moroi, peaceful, mortal vampires living discretely within our world. Her legacy is to protect the Moroi from bloodthirsty, immortal Vampires, the Strigoi. This is her story.
film.quote: I very mildly liked it, at least enough to recommend seeing it. The dialogue can be very corny and stupid, but there are some funny parts. The action is terrible. The mystery of it all is fairly entertaining. It is a little more than just a bland vampire movie and subverts that on occasion, but this could have been a genuinely clever movie had it really tried. But looking at Zoey Deutch for the entire movie helps.

film.summary: The thrilling tale of an isolated village confronting the astonishing truth that lies just outside its borders. (Touchstone Pictures)
film.quote: The first half was good, the last half was not. The twist was lame but the music was good. Love/hate relationship with it.

film.summary: While on a tour of the White House with his young daughter, a Capitol policeman springs into action to save his child and protect the president from a heavily armed group of paramilitary invaders. (imdb)
film.quote: Meh. I think when it got more serious it was pretty fun but the attempt at humor and tone changes turned me off. It just didn't accomplish what it set out to do. Still, the action can be fun, and... blowing stuff up. I actually like Olympus has Fallen more, but neither movie is incredible by any means.

film.summary: From the moment Zia (in his late 20s) cuts his wrists and enters a bizarre afterlife reserved for suicides, this film becomes a strangely uplifting, comic tale about a journey through the hereafter. It is a world where everyone still bears the scars earned from the manner in which they "offed," and the everyday reality is a twisted mirror image of our own mortal world. (Halcyon Pictures)
film.quote: I mostly agree with Shmendrek, though I liked this a bit more. It isn't really a great movie but the concept IS interesting... the execution is just a little blah. Obviously a movie like this will be kind of low key but this goes further than that in a bad way. Still, it's got a decent script and all that.

film.summary: Cameron Diaz stars as Elizabeth Halsey, a scheming and coarse-tongued middle school teacher who gets dumped by her wealthy boyfriend and rebounds by sinking her claws into a handsome substitute teacher (Justin Timberlake). There's just one problem, though: He's already dating Amy Squirrel (Lucy Punch), the most revered teacher on campus. And Ms. Squirrel is not at all eager to hand over her beau, who is slated to inherit his family's fortune.
film.quote: It's unfortunate that the biggest laugh, for me, was right at the beginning (the part about if we lose Opera we're fucked). That was a great exchange. After that, there weren't a lot of laughs, but it was entertaining enough regardless.

film.summary: A suspenseful drama about a young couple on a road trip who get caught in the midst of a worldwide gas shortage. (imdb)
film.quote: I like what it's trying to say. Acting and script are both hit and miss. Character development needs more work, but I did like the ending even if they didn't build up to it that well. It's low budget so you expect certain things. Music is hit and miss. The one guitar part they play a lot is good, but the one that has the other sounds is just silly. Basically the movie is hit and miss in a lot of ways. It's not bad, it's pretty decent, but don't rush to see it. And proceed with caution if you do.

film.summary: A goofy detective specializing in animals goes in search of a missing dolphin mascot of a football team.
A man plucks a hair from his nostril. The hair wants back in. (imdb)
film.quote: Yeah. He pulls the hair and then goes on an adventure.

film.summary: A woman kidnaps puppies to kill them for their fur, but various animals then gang up against her and get their revenge in slapstick fashion. (imdb)
film.quote: Pretty sure I liked it as a kid so fuck it, it gets a mild pass (if you're a kid, or an idiot, in which I was both).

film.summary: High school senior Bartleby "B" Gaines is on his way to scoring eight out of eight rejection letters from colleges, which isn&#039;t going to go over big with Mom and Dad. At least he&#039;s not alone in the exclusion. Several of his crew of outcast friends are in the same, college-less boat. So how does a guy facing a bleak career please his parents and get noticed by dream girl Monica? Simple. Open his own university. (Universal Pictures)
film.quote: I actually kinda laughed at this. It's definitely not a great comedy but it was entertaining enough to not be a waste of time.

film.summary: This high-stakes action comedy begins where most great heist movies end - with a pair of master thieves escaping to a tropical paradise to enjoy the spoils of their labor. But when an FBI agent, who has pursued them for seven years, becomes convinced that they are actually plotting to pull off a million-dollar theft from a nearby "diamond cruise," a riveting game of cat and mouse begins.

Jacob, a young man armed with a deadly sword, saves Sarah, a teenage girl, from Mathias, a malevolent evil that has begun plaguing a small farmland town while in search of an ancient necklace that had belonged to Sarahs Uncle. (imdb)
film.quote: I know it's an indie movie, that's why I forgive the CGI. In fact, I actually liked some of the undead/servant designs. That isn't really what got me about this flick. When you know the CGI isn't going to be great, you need to work on the plot/story/script. There's a great, interesting idea buried here, underneath awful writing (really should have said more about the characters and the story in general), and really poor acting. Also, the fight choreography was mostly stupid. Still see it tho.

film.summary: This film turns the microscope on Alfred Kinsey (Neeson) in a portrait of a man driven to uncover the most private secrets of a nation. (Fox Searchlight)
film.quote: The subject matter is interesting, Neeson does a great job, but the pace is much too slow and it stretches things too thin and ultimately ends up being boring when it could have been a big statement.

film.summary: A thief with a unique code of professional ethics is double-crossed by his crew and left for dead. Assuming a new disguise and forming an unlikely alliance with a woman on the inside, he looks to hijack the score of the crew's latest heist. (imdb)
film.quote: Statham is enjoyable. He pretty much always is, even if sometimes his choice in post-Guy Ritchie movies leaves a lot to be desired. I enjoy watching him as an action hero, but there just isn't much in Parker to thrill you. It's not bad, it's just not overly good. It takes a while to get exciting, and the stuff when it's not is okay. It's just a lot of meh.

film.summary: In 14th-century Europe, a courageous knight (Nicolas Cage) leads a group of weary warriors across impossibly treacherous terrain in order to transport a suspected witch (Claire Foy) believed to be responsible for spreading the devastating Black
film.quote: It wasn't awful. It was pretty entertaining the whole way through, but not a good movie. Kind of decent in every way, but if you just need an hour and a half killed, this isn't a bad (or good) way to do. Ultimately, because I was entertained by it, I forgive the flaws and give this a very minor recommendation.

film.summary: A stranger with mysterious intentions comes to stay the night at a secluded country home, but what he finds inside is a family torn apart by a violent past and a secret more deadly than he expected. (imdb)
film.quote: The acting is okay most of the time, but sometimes poor. This movie suffers from awful 'movie logic.' You know the kind... characters doing stupid shit just to make it 'scarier.' I understand a lot of horrors have this, but TBH relies too much on it. However, I think the villain guy was pretty decent, and the interesting idea of the girl being kind of the 'real' villain was nice. It had a decent atmosphere, some nice claustrophobia since it all takes place mostly in the house.

film.summary: Jordana Brewster is here to introduce you to her new scent, &quot;Hot Dog Water&quot;. For when you want to be treated as a professional and smell like a hot dog. (Funny or Die)
film.quote: At first I was going to give this a 40, which is a fail. But then I realized that it's only a minute long and I laughed twice, like when she first splashed herself with the hot dog water. Hot dog water is kind of a funny 3 word combo too. Fuck it, mild recommendation.

film.summary: Catherine and Rebecca are two Catholic School girls going door-to-door selling Religious paraphernalia in order to pay for their books and education. Things go horribly wrong when they knock on the wrong door in the wrong neighborhood. Run! Bitch Run! is a throw back to the classic 1970's Rape and Revenge films like 'Last House On the Left' and 'Ms. 45. (imdb)
film.quote: I suppose if it's trying to be a throwback, then well done. I still wouldn't give it a strong recommendation though it is kind of funny.

film.summary: Balthazar Blake (Nicolas Cage) is a master sorcerer in modern-day Manhattan trying to defend the city from his arch-nemesis, Maxim Horvath (Alfred Molina). Balthazar can't do it alone, so he recruits Dave Stutler (Jay Baruchel), a seemingly average guy who demonstrates hidden potential, as his reluctant protégé. The sorcerer gives his unwilling accomplice a crash course in the art and science of magic, and together, these unlikely partners work to stop the forces of darkness.
film.quote: Think it accomplishes what it sets out to do. Cage is as enjoyable as always. I thought some of the vibe of the movie was pretty direct-to-tv, but you know what? I enjoyed this enough to say people should give it a go. It's light fantasy, but it's not without it's charm. And it definitely doesn't deserve all the hate it's getting... save it for a truly offensive movie that tries to offer more than just a decent time.

film.summary: Ben Cronin has it all: the admiration of his many friends, a terrific girlfriend, and an appointment with swim scouts from Stanford. It's not easy; Ben must train for countless hours in the pool for a critical swim meet, work at the local hospital and find quality time with his high school sweetheart, Amy. His wonderful life is disrupted by the arrival of Madison Bell. The new girl in town quickly sets her sights on the impressionable Ben. While their first few meetings are innocent enough, the seductive Madison wants more. (imdb)

A reporter stumbles upon the journal of a murderer replete with plans to butcher specific people, and investigates on his own, finding that every trail leads to a 9-year-old orphan living in a group home.
film.quote: If the movie had continued on with how it was going, I'd be rating right along side the awful scores on here. The beginning was just terrible. The script remained terrible to decent (at best), and the acting was never great or anything... but I appreciated the movies willingness to say 'fuck it' and just throw some crazy shit at you. I actually expected this to go one way (which would have been awful) but it went another. I actually think the twist saves it, just 'cuz it's so out there.

film.summary: Jason Statham returns in his signature role as ex-Special Forces operative Frank Martin, aka &#034;The Transporter.&#034; Now retired in Miami, Martin makes a living driving for a wealthy family, including the young son, with whom he has unexpectedly bonded. But when the boy is abducted, Martin must use all his skills to bring him to safety and discover the kidnapper&#039;s master plan. (20th Century Fox)

As a string of mysterious killings grips Seattle, Bella, whose high school graduation is fast approaching, is forced to choose between her love for vampire Edward and her friendship with werewolf Jacob.
film.quote: I think the quality is about the same as New Moon so you could probably just read my review for it. Simply put: There's not much here to offend or to make you love the movie. It just exists, and is sometimes good, sometimes bad. If you're as ugly as Robert Pattinson (trust me, I'm no stud myself), you probably shouldn't turn down sex with Kristen Stewart. Just sayin'.

film.summary: When Edward leaves Bella, her whole world is turned upside down. With Bella's heart broken, she turns to Jacob, her best friend to fill the void that was left by Edward. As Bella spends more time with Jake, she learns that there's more than vampires in the town of Forks. (imdb)
film.quote: Yes, a recommendation, although very slight. We won't kid ourselves and say this is a great movie. But it's worth a watch if you have nothing better to do. Maybe the next one will be an actual good movie instead of not just a waste of time. This had fewer wonky moments than Twilight, the acting was kinda crap but I was actually involved at some points. So at least the series is improving.

film.summary: Based on the 1941 classic, this werewolf-themed horror film set in Victorian England centers on Lawrence Talbot (Benicio Del Toro), an American man who, upon a visit to London, gets bitten by a werewolf. Talbot had come to England to make amends with his estranged father (Anthony Hopkins), but after a moonlight transformation leaves him with a savage hunger for flesh, family harmony is the least of his worries.
film.quote: It's really not memorable in any way besides the goth imagery which is nice. So some good cinematography. Everything else is passable. You don't even need to see this but I'm giving it a 51 because if someone asked me, I'd say, "Yeah sure, see it" instead of "No, rent something else." But expect the ending to be bullshit.

film.summary: Bond uncovers a nuclear plot when he protects an oil heiress from her former kidnapper, a terrorist who can't feel pain.
film.quote: I don't think i've ever seen a Bond movie that wasn't entertaining (though I'll admit I haven't seen that many). That's about all I can say for this.

film.summary: When an asteroid is headed for Earth the world's best deep core drilling team is sent to nuke the rock from the inside.
A tough cop is dispatched to take down a serial killer who has been targeting police officers.
film.quote: As much as I appreciate that Statham is this generations action hero, and I appreciate that he does his own stunts n'shit, I haven't actually really liked any of his action movies... but I've really liked his Guy Ritchie rolls. What I'm saying is, I like him as that, but I feel he has bad taste in the action movies he does. This is really basic, but is more thriller than action, so that's okay. But ultimately it's just kind of 'meh' and doesn't do anything great. Passable.

film.summary: New York radio host Erica Bain has a life that she loves and a fiancé she adores. But all of it is taken from her when a brutal attack leaves Erica badly wounded and her fiancé dead. Unable to move past the tragedy, Erica begins prowling the city streets at night to track down the men she holds responsible. Her dark pursuit of justice catches the public's attention, and the city is riveted by her anonymous exploits... (imdb)
film.quote: Pretty mediocre. Some good things, some bad, they cancel each other out and you're left with an entertaining but forgettable movie. Some of the psychological elements were interesting but then some lines were really forced. Things happened way too conveniently. Plus, did Jodie Foster really say "Who's the bitch now?" Seriously? Pass or skip, it doesn't really matter.

film.summary: Chev Chelios (Statham) is about to begin his morning with an unexpected wake-up call. Groggy, practically unable to move and with a heart that's barely beating, he hears the voice of thug Ricky Verona, who reveals Chev has been poisoned in his sleep and only has an hour to live. As it turns out, Chev is a hit man who freelances for a major West Coast syndicate... (Lionsgate)
film.quote: It started off promising with the really out of place, but still awesome, placing of New Noise by Refused. It went for over the top, adrenaline pumping action but it actually kind of bored me. I also think that while Statham is a decent enough action star, he belongs in more low key roles.

film.summary: What if you were told that every moment you experienced and every memory you held dear never happened? In this psychological thriller, Telly Paretta (Moore) is tormented by the memory of her eight-year-old son&#039;s death in a plane crash 14 months ago. While trying to work through her grief, she is informed by her psychiatrist (Sinise) that she is suffering from delusions, that her son never existed and she is fabricating his memories. (Revolution Studios)
film.quote: Very good until the plot twist/explanation. Then it got horrible.

film.summary: Get ready for the ultimate showdown! Freddy Krueger, the psychopath from the "Nightmare on Elm Street" series resurrects Jason Voorhees, the equally iconic madman from the "Friday the 13th" film series. With a terrified town in the middle, the two titans of terror enter into a horrifying showdown of epic proportions, alternating between the world of dreams and the harsh reality of the living world. Who will win and who will lose in this battle to end all battles? (New Line Cinema)
film.quote: I just had a change of heart. It's an entertaining novelty but it's nothing more than that. Watch once, discard.

film.summary: While the rest of his high school graduating class is heading to the same old grind of college, skateboarder Eric Rivers (Vogel) and his best friends, Dustin (Brody), a goal-oriented workaholic, and misfit slacker Matt (Vieluf) have one last summer roadtrip together to follow their dream of getting noticed by the professional skateboarding world - and getting paid to skate. (Warner Bros.)
film.quote: Painfully average, just like the skater community. I'M JOKING! But seriously, now, settle down. It's not a bad movie and it's not good. It is pretty predictable and it was probably made for skaters.

film.filmname: Home Alone 2: Lost in New York (1992)
film.summary: Kevin McCallister is back. But this time he's in New York City with enough cash and credit cards to turn the Big Apple into his very own playground. But Kevin won't be alone for long. The notorious Wet Bandits, Harry and Marv, still smarting from their last encounter with Kevin, are bound for New York too, plotting a huge holiday heist...
Three different men, three different worlds, three different wars - all stand at the intersection of modern warfare - a murky world of fluid morality where all is not as it seems. (imdb)
film.quote: Bland, ultimately. It doesn't say anything we haven't heard before, and the script is completely by the books. I didn't care about the characters, some of the conflict was okay, but the good scenes were few and far between. The Ghost was an awesome character, though. I was a little bored throughout.

film.summary: The U.S. government decides to go after an agri-business giant with a price-fixing accusation, based on the evidence submitted by their star witness, vice president turned informant Mark Whitacre.
film.quote: Wow, judging from what other people think, I feel like I missed something. Regardless, while I do agree that the writing was clever and there were a few funny moments (like someone said -- good reaction shots), I was really bored by most of it. It just felt really really dry. Not dry funny, dry bland. Maybe a repeat watch will shed some light on it for me.

film.summary: Once there was a young prince whose father, the king of the East, sent him down into Egypt to find a pearl. But when the prince arrived, the people poured him a cup. Drinking it, he forgot he was the son of a king, forgot about the pearl and fell into a deep sleep. (imdb)
film.quote: Malick has been one of the best directors that I consistently find a little tedious. I have yet to love any of his movies, but respect the fuck out of him. Here we have unconventional editing, short scenes, and an observational and drifting style that is the very definition of "artistic." This looks wondrous, and yet this is a slog too. It could have been a lot shorter, and watching Bale mope around is not enthralling. Very shallow but pretty, and not in an engaging way.

film.summary: In a world ravaged by the Fire nation's aggression toward the peaceful Air, Water and Earth nations, reluctant youth Aang (Noah Ringer) learns that he's an Avatar -- a rare being who can manipulate all four elements and restore peace to the planet. Now Aang must join with his pal Katara (Nicola Peltz) and other allies to fulfill his destiny. M. Night Shyamalan directs this live-action adaptation of the animated series "Avatar: The Last Airbender."
film.quote: I don't know shit about the source material. I watched maybe 10 minutes of an episode once, so going in I wanted some action and bending elements. The action can be a bit hit and miss, when it's good it's great though. The acting is pretty poor, the CGI is great, the script is average. Some of the editing is awful, like, there are times where it's just not cohesive at all. Seeing the show would have probably made me hate this, but as it stands now, I don't. I also don't recommend it.

film.summary: After a bitter divorce, an actor disguises himself as a female housekeeper to spend secret time with his children held in custody by his Ex. (imdb)
Nicholas Cage stars as the brilliant treasure hunter Benjamin Franklin Gates in who discovers a secret from our nation&#039;s past that will lead to the greatest adventure in history. (Disney)
film.quote: I can't really hate or like this movie. It just exists. It doesn't do anything really well but it doesn't do anything badly. The direction, acting, cinemtography, script, etc is all passable. An average flick.

film.summary: Two assistant managers of a corporate grocery store vie for a coveted promotion.
film.quote: Reminds me a lot of Employee of the Month only better. I chuckled a few times, laughed out loud a few times. For that it's at least worth a watch if you got nothing better to do.

film.summary: Fast-talking security guard Ben joins his cop brother-in-law James on a 24-hour patrol of Atlanta in order to prove himself worthy of marrying Angela, James' sister. (imdb)
film.quote: Hart and Cube have chemistry and I did chuckle a few times. Mostly though, it's a pretty unoriginal time. It could have been worse, however. I can't give it a pass or a rejection because it just kind of exists to be watched some evening when you got nothing better to do... or you're waiting to go do something better.

film.summary: When detective Eric Matthews (Donnie Wahlberg) is called to a crime scene of a victim of Jigsaw (Tobin Bell), he finds a lead to the place where he is hidden. Once there, he realizes that Jigsaw trapped his son Daniel Matthews (Erik Knudsen) with three women and four men in a shelter, and they are inhaling a lethal nerve gas. If they do not use an antidote within two hours, they will die. Eric follows with increasing desperation the death of each member of the group in monitors, while trying to convince Jigsaw to release his son. (imdb)
While "Scary Movie" targeted the onslaught of teen horror film flicks, the sequel takes aim at the root of the great classic horror movies. (Dimension Films)
film.quote: Not that bad. Still kinda funny but you can definitely see the downfall.

film.summary: Away at college, Sidney Prescott (Campbell) thought she'd finally put the shocking murders that shattered her life behind her ... until a copycat killer begins acting out a real-life sequel! Now, as history eerily repeats itself, ambitious reporter Gale Weathers (Cox), deputy Dewey (Arquette), and other SCREAM survivors find themselves trapped in a terrifyingly clever plotline where no one is safe -- or beyond suspicion! (Dimension)
Rookie cop Denny Colt returns from the beyond as The Spirit, a hero whose mission is to fight against the bad forces in Central City.
film.quote: Pros: Pretty funny stuff, nice cinematography and style, Samuel L. Jackson, Gabriel Macht. Cons: Emotionless, action was completely average, from what I know about the comics - it completely pisses over the character. It's a 50/100 because you could go either way with it very easily, like or dislike, though I don't think it's inspired enough to love or hate. Definitely not the worst movie of the year.

film.summary: Within the FBI, there exists a division dedicated to investigating and prosecuting criminals on the internet. Welcome to the front lines of the war on cybercrime, where Special Agent Jennifer Marsh has seen it all......until now. A tech-savvy internet predator is displaying his graphic murders on his own website -- and the fate of each of his tormented captives is left in the hands of the public: the more hits his site gets, the faster his victims die. (Screen Gems - Sony)

Just an oddball mama&#039;s boy from the back bayous of Louisiana, Bobby Boucher (Sandler) never wanted anything more than to quench the thirst of the dehydrated athletes who treat him like dirt! But when Coach Klein (Winkler) makes the call that allows Bobby to finally stand up for himself, it unleashes a torrent of bottled-up frustration ... and exposes a talent for tackling that transforms him from a meek &#034;water distribution engineer&#034; into the hardest hitter ever to roam the gridiron! (Buena Vista Entertainment)
A New York nightclub manager tries to save his brother and father from Russian mafia hit men. (imdb)
film.quote: Just average. But I like Mark Wahlberg in this type of role.

film.summary: While recovering from a tragic accident on the road, the patrolman Edward Malus receives a letter from his former fiancée Willow, who left him years ago without any explanation, telling that her daughter Rowan is missing. Edward travels to the private island of Summerisle, where Willow lives in an odd community that plant fruits, and she reveals that Rowan is actually their daughter... (imdb)
film.quote: New perspective: It's a great comedy. I'm not sure if Cage was the only one who thought it was a comedy or not, but I'll take his word for it that it's not an unintentional comedy. It's worth a watch cuz it's bad and funny.

film.summary: Set in Boise, ID, on the football field of Bronco Stadium. There, a flock of stewardesses and showgirls converge, forming intricate dance/movement patterns both on the field and in the sky, their actions dictated by Goodyear, a goddess hovering overhead, simultaneously occupying two Goodyear blimps. While surveying her subjects, each version of Goodyear arranges grapes in a formation on the floor, which are then carried out by the dancers below.
film.quote: Like a few people said, this is boring. 40 minutes of similar shots over and over and over again. But, the imagery is gorgeous and uses some pretty interesting things to make it's point. I especially like the blue football field. It's clear what it's about, and the music especially pushes the idea forward (makes it feel joyous). I'm torn on it. If you can seperate yourself from how dull it is, and appreciate the imagery it's probably worth a watch at least once.

film.summary: Set in modern-day Manhattan, this is an adaptation of &#034;Les Liaisons Dangereuses,&#034; the classic and scandalous Pierre Laclos novel of sexual manipulation and romantic war games first published in 1782. (Columbia TriStar)
film.quote: In your FACE Cruel Intentions, you damn movie I rented because I was a horny teenage boy!

film.summary: The residents of a rural mining town discover that an unfortunate chemical spill has caused hundreds of little spiders to mutate into the size of SUVs. And they're hungry. (Warner Bros.)
film.quote: I'm glad that it didn't take itself too seriously, just unfortunately a lot of the jokes fell flat for me, for at least half the movie. It redeemed itself a bit after but it's a too little too late. But I do really like the conspiracy theory guy, he gave the movie most of its humour. Almost a recommendation.

film.summary: In the future, the popular game is called Gene-Fusion... where people mix up DNA and create animals that then fight one another. Four kids are chosen to be 'Fusers' and they are involved in trying to save the world from aliens. (Myself)
film.quote: Props for an interesting idea. There is potential here for good commentary and excitement. It doesn't really deliver. I don't know how much it cost but the animation isn't very good. The character models are serviceable (reminds me of Timesplitters and Team Fortress 2, actually), but it doesn't look good in action a lot of the time, which takes away oomph of things like battle scenes. And everything else is by the books and some of the voice acting is lame. Not awful, but skip it.

film.summary: The U.S. military makes a scarred bounty hunter with warrants on his own head an offer he cannot refuse: in exchange for his freedom, he must stop a terrorist who is ready to unleash Hell on Earth.
film.quote: Underwhelming. I wanted to love it because it's a comic book movie and comic books haven't been represented well in movies, generally. But this isn't worth your time. It's not awful it's just kind of there and it doesn't need to be there. It lingers like the relative you don't like.

film.summary: Raw. Honest. Naked. "Kissing on the Mouth" is post-college life in close-up. Ellen is sleeping with her ex-boyfriend while trying to ignore the fact that he's looking for more than just sex. Her roommate, Patrick, isn't helping matters with his secretive and jealous behavior. The small cast served as the only crew on this intimate and humorous film featuring real interviews with recent college graduates and a documentary approach to the graphic sex and conversations. (imdb)
film.quote: Needed to go deeper, some legit characters in here, acting was decent at best, camera work kills most of the good things about it. I admire certain aspects of the actual production, and I appreciate the willingness to go the whole way and show jerking off in the shower and cumming. Ellen is cute so her naked is good but the scenes get ridiculous. Not worth a watch but almost.

film.summary: It's a nail-biting race against time as an unmanned train carrying a load of lethal chemicals speeds out of control, and a conductor and engineer do everything in their power to keep it from derailing and killing tens of thousands of people. Denzel Washington leads the cast in Tony Scott's tough-minded thriller, in which a terrible circumstance forces a couple of ordinary men to become extraordinary heroes.
film.quote: I saw people saying that this is Scott's best film and I don't know where that's coming from. I actually like him, I like how stylish he is. I like Denzel Washington too. But besides the last little bit, I wasn't really that involved with what I was watching. It was just loud and kind of tedious. Not a movie I hate but I'm not giving it a recommendation either. Close but no train. Oh wait, that didn't work... I suck at this.

film.filmname: Blue Collar Comedy Tour: The Movie (2003)
film.summary: The comedic stylings of four sort-of famous funnymen are brought to the big screen courtesy of this 2002 documentary. (imdb)
film.quote: 1 of them is really funny. Two of them are not. 1 is okay. That's all you need to know, really. (Ron White is the funny one and he's not THAT funny).

film.summary: Two rival North Carolina politicians with presidential aspirations tangle with one another. (imdb)
film.quote: I suppose you could say the movie is a critique on the absurdity of politics, but I'm not even sure the makers of it wanted it to be anything more than a Ferrell/Galifianakis comedy with a political backdrop. Meaning it makes fun of politics but doesn't tackle it in any real meaningful or militant way. My brother really liked it, I'm mostly indifferent. I don't recommend it but it does have a few good laughs. Too few and far between, however. Also not a huge Zach or Will fan for what it's worth.

film.summary: Forced underground by the next ice age, a struggling outpost of survivors must fight to preserve humanity against a threat even more savage than nature. (imdb)
film.quote: I almost gave it a pass because the atmosphere is fine, it looks chilly throughout, and I know it's all cliche but I feel a lot of movies are so as long as it's done well it's okay. It was... an alright movie. There's just little things that keep me from giving this even a minor recommendation. Stupid logic. They could have made these baddies legit intimidating but they don't, and they want us to believe they are.

film.summary: Owen Wilson stars as a married man whose spouse (Jenna Fischer) grants him the right -- for just one week -- to pursue as many extramarital affairs as he can. His best buddy (Jason Sudeikis) receives an identical "hall pass" from his wife, and off the guys go. The hubbies soon discover, however, that picking up girls isn't as easy as they recall, while their better halves embark on their own erotic adventures.
film.quote: Not quite a recommendation. The jokes don't work nearly as often as they should, it's cliche, blah blah blah, and it's only mildly entertaining, but it's not even mildly entertaining all the time. There are tits and attractive women, though.

film.summary: A black ops super soldier seeks payback after she is betrayed and set up during a mission. (imdb)
film.quote: Really disappointed. I expected good things considering the talent involved. The movie gets props for trying to do something a tad different than the normal action-thriller, but I felt like a lot of it didn't work. The chases were lame, I didn't feel the music fit the atmosphere and even the MMA type fight scenes didn't have the energy they should have. Mediocre acting and script as well. It had the makings of something amazing buried in there but failed.

film.summary: Four fighters from different backgrounds come together to train under an ex-MMA rising star and then ultimately have to fight each other and the traitor in heir midst. (imdb)
film.quote: Train MMA for 3 or 4 days and you will be awesome! They take real MMA stuff and then add typical movie martial arts to it. I don't even mind that, it's nice seeing some basis in MMA reality. Acting is bad, the movie is more serious. The first had cool music and was pretty people havin' a good time with the whole production, this didn't feel like that, and it didn't do what it did real well. And they seem to just namedrop MMA things in order to be seen as 'legit.' At least Machida is in it.

film.summary: Wes Craven presents a suspense thriller at 30,000 feet. Lisa Reisert (McAdams) hates to fly, but the terror that awaits her on the night flight to Miami has nothing to do with fear of flying. Moments after takeoff, Lisa&#039;s seatmate Jackson (Murphy), menacingly reveals that he is an operative in a plot to kill the Deputy Secretary of Homeland Security -- and Lisa is the key to his success. (DreamWorks Pictures)

While acclimating to campus life, college freshman Sara (Minka Kelly) begins to realize that her new roommate, Rebecca (Leighton Meester), is becoming obsessed with her. When the unhinged Rebecca starts targeting Sara's friends and loved ones, can she save them -- and herself?
film.quote: There are some unforgivable moments when a normal girl has superpowers, and it's almost completely by the books. At the same time, sometimes it's pretty inspired (mostly when it just sticks to making her creepy). I guess ultimately, even though I feel that they did a decent enough job making her creepy, I can't give this a recommendation based on the fact it makes you feel "meh." It doesn't thrill because it's predictable, it doesn't make you feel and it's mostly generic (few scenes excluded).

film.summary: A congressman (Matt Damon) who's a rising star on the political scene finds himself entranced by a beautiful ballerina (Emily Blunt), but mysterious circumstances ensure that their love affair is predestined to be a non-starter. Screenwriter George Nolfi (The Bourne Ultimatum) makes his directorial debut with this romantic adaptation of Philip K. Dick's classic sci-fi short story "Adjustment Team."
film.quote: It's not a recommendation from me but it's not awful. It's just really shallow... I don't know why people are saying it's deep at all. Any movie can throw out an idea and not explore it with any depth. This would be forgivable if I felt there was some great quality, like an interesting story. There isn't. It plods along, generally being decent, never being amazing. Damon and Blunt are good (they're the highlight though I wouldn't say they're dazzling the audience), but the movie just falls flat.

film.summary: An epic adventure about a global cataclysm that brings an end to the world and tells of the heroic struggle of the survivors.
film.quote: It's not really that I hated the movie, I just don't think you need to see it. Some of the disaster scenes are beautiful and, dare I say, gripping, but at some point you stop caring. I get that it's a disaster flick and it achieves that, with a little bit of emotion and John Cusack, but it's just so typical I don't see the point. It also drags at the beginning and the end... so the middle is pretty much what gives this a 45. And stop using these stupid cliches.

film.summary: A ferocious retelling of the ancient Battle of Thermopylae in which King Leonidas (Butler) and 300 Spartans fought to the death against Xerxes and his massive Persian army. Facing insurmountable odds, their valor and sacrifice inspire all of Greece to unite against their Persian enemy, drawing a line in the sand for democracy.
film.quote: Visuals were nice, too much slow motion, boring action.

film.summary: A forensic accountant un-cooks the books for illicit clients (imdb)
film.quote: It's cool to have an autistic person as the main character, and Affleck does a good enough job. Bernthal was good, as well, and the other people were just kinda there. And the movie itself was fine up until a certain point, where it seemingly shifted into another movie and they started forcing emotion in there. It just got kinda stupid so I can't recommend it, and apparently autism gives you super strength. HE ONLY KICKED HIM ONCE!

film.summary: A dramatized account of a great Russian naval mutiny and a resulting street demonstration which brought on a police massacre.
film.quote: Pretty much in agreement with Anomaly1 on this one. Before the steps, it was okay, and then the steps were great, especially seeing a kid die (because even movies today seem to be scared of showing it). Then the next part isn't even okay, it's a yawn fest. It's well made, especially for its time, and it's important, definitely, but it's pretty boring a lot of the time. And at such a short run time, that kinda sucks that it feels longer than it is.

film.summary: An heiress who's been shut inside her apartment building for nearly two decades is forced to confront her fears after one of her neighbors is killed and a detective arrives to begin the investigation. (imdb)
film.quote: Not bad, but not worth seeing. Some of the time they just seem to throw shit out the window for the sake of moving the plot along, and yeah it's pretty ridiculous sometimes. But it's fairly entertaining regardless.
