film.summary: Buster is playing golf with Sybil when he gets knocked out. An escaped prisoner changes clothes with him. Buster goes to prison and learns that he is to be hanged. He changes clothes with a guard just as prisoner Roberts attacks all the guards. (imdb)
film.quote: I think it just takes a lot for me to really like Slapstick and find it hilarious. It is what it is. It's just not for me but for big fans of slapstick, maybe you'll like it more.

film.summary: A mild-mannered radio executive strives to become the best stepdad to his wife's two children, but complications ensue when their freewheeling and freeloading real father arrives, forcing him to compete for the affection of the kids. (imdb)
film.quote: Gotta be honest: not horrible. I don't recommend it unless you're desperate for a comedy, but there are some actual laughs here and a slightly touching story. It still fails more than it hits, but there's a certain cameo that was really awesome. Wahlberg is just great in comedies even if the material isn't always solid... still charming as hell.

film.summary: Fate deals young orphan Matt Murdock a strange hand when he is doused with hazardous waste. The accident leaves Matt blind but also gives him a heightened "radar sense" that allows him to "see" far better than any man. Years later Murdock has grown into a man and becomes a respected criminal attorney. But after he's done his "day job" Matt takes on a secret identity as "The Man Without Fear," Daredevil, the masked avenger that patrols the neighborhood of Hell's Kitchen and New York City to combat the injustice that he cannot tackle in the courtroom. (imdb)
film.quote: The 45 mainly comes about because of a few really good, powerful scenes. Ben Afleck isn't to blame here, though, the script and the effects are.

film.summary: A young man encounters a mysterious woman in his house.
film.quote: I don't think I see the appeal. I guess it was supposed to be funny? I didn't find it funny at all. The drama was alright though, the "I think so" was well played by Cera, and that's the reason I give it a 45 instead of like a 30. It's not a terrible short, but I just don't see it as much at all. I didn't really even feel the awkwardness that I was supposed to.

film.summary: Jerry's inept crime falls apart due to his and his henchmen's bungling and the persistent police work of pregnant Marge Gunderson.
film.quote: I know this is a great movie and I should love it but I don't. I really don't have a good reason why.

film.summary: La Fée aux Choux is sixty seconds long, possibly making it the earliest known film with a running time of at least one minute. (Wikipedia)
A pointless animated short.
film.quote: Did you just kick that fucking dog? What the hell man? Ah, this short is okay. The animation isn't anything great, but when he kicks the dog and the music starts, shit gets real. I'm not going to recommend it because it really is "a pointless animated short," so I don't know why I even bothered watching it. I saw some animal cruelty though.

film.summary: Brent Magna must get behind the wheel and follow the orders of a mysterious man to save his kidnapped wife. (imdb)
film.quote: Criticker says I'd give this a 0 but damn it's not that bad. In fact, it's not really bad, it's just not recommended. There are better movies to watch. It kind of reminds me of Saw but in a car... meaning when the twist comes around it's kind of like Jigsaws intentions in Saw, if you think about it. Selena Gomez is lovely, Ethan Hawke was fine, and there were some decent moments here and there, but it really just didn't feel like it had a lot of life most of the time and felt a lil silly.

film.summary: Maximus is a powerful Roman general, loved by the people and the aging Emperor, Marcus Aurelius. Before his death, the Emperor chooses Maximus to be his heir over his own son, Commodus, and a power struggle leaves Maximus and his family condemned to death. The powerful general is unable to save his family, and his loss of will allows him to get captured and put into the Gladiator games until he dies.
A group of 30-year-olds who have been friends since high school attempt to throw an end-of-summer orgy.
film.quote: Not the worst movie by any means, and the fact there's tits helps the (straight) guys out. But really this isn't funny in the least. There's like one or two moments where I sort of chuckled. I have been watching a bunch of these raunchy comedies over the past couple years and they just aren't amusing me that often. It's like, HEY LET'S SAY WHAT TEA-BAGGING IS AND IT'LL BE FUNNY! It's not. It might help if I actually got shocked into laughing but I just don't.

film.summary: Rodin's sculpture The Thinker is a sentient being. (imdb)
film.quote: I adore the movies I've seen from Carax (Mauvais Sang and Holy Motors), and I have every intention of visiting more of his filmography, but what? I mean, it starts out with a naked girl which is probably 40 points of this, but this is really just a very miniscule, uninteresting short. Carax can be pretty odd but this isn't appealing odd... listening to the short conversation between The Thinker and the girl isn't that amusing but I think it wanted to be (or philosophical).

film.summary: A Hollywood fixer in the 1950s works to keep the studio's stars in line. (imdb)
film.quote: The Coens have this issue where they have a great setup with quirky characters and an intelligent script, and yet they leave me feeling really cold sometimes. This is one of those cases: HC is not terrible, but it failed as a comedy and while I think the premise is fine, the direction is solid and the love of the '50s shines, I just couldn't care about what was going on. The offbeat tone suffocates it and becomes awkward, and it's like they can't strike the balance.

film.summary: Right after the bachelor party in Las Vegas, Phil, Stu, Alan, and Doug jet to Thailand for Stu's wedding. Stu's plan for a subdued pre-wedding brunch, however, goes seriously awry. (imdb)
film.quote: I think I rated the first one like an 80 or something because I could see the appeal. With that said, I didn't lose my shit over the first one like a lot of people seemed to. There were a few really funny parts, like "Nigga please, we're both dead inside," but the first movie wasn't good enough for the second to rely on the same shit. Tyson is always nice to see, but it wasn't great. Stu's song wasn't great. They 'upped' all the stuff the boys go through, but it wasn't half as funny.

film.summary: A paranoid thriller about a family on the run from a natural crisis that presents a large-scale threat to humanity. (imdb)

HOLIDAYS is an anthology feature film that puts a uniquely dark and original spin on some of the most iconic and beloved holidays of all time by challenging our folklore, traditions and assumptions. (imdb)
film.quote: I don't think I'd give this a pass because it's so inconsistent, even though I like the idea of anthology films. Valentine's Day was kinda funny, St. Patrick's was kinda boring, Easter was entertaining, Mother's Day was bland, Father's Day was excellent with some real tension until it fell apart at the end, Halloween was unsatisfying and below Smith, Christmas was forgettable and New Year's Eve was the best of the bunch with a fun twist and character. As a collection it doesn't really add up.

film.summary: New York City is full of lonely hearts seeking the right match, and what Alice, Robin, Lucy, Meg, Tom and David all have in common is the need to learn how to be single in a world filled with ever-evolving definitions of love. (imdb)
film.quote: You might be asking, why is a single 30 year old watching this? Alison Brie, that's why. But in all seriousness, not enough of her. But Johnson does a good job. It's not really a good movie, as it falls into familiar trappings of the genre and doesn't bring much to the table besides a fun cast. There were a couple funny moments but not enough, and the message was muddled and unfocused. But still not a dreadful flick.

film.summary: Two decades after the first Independence Day invasion, Earth is faced with a new extra-Solar threat. But will mankind's new space defenses be enough? (imdb)
film.quote: Generally an okay action movie gets a passing grade from me because I'm easier on the genre and find a lot of them to be an entertaining way to pass the time, even if they're insubstantial. This follows all of the formulaic elements that the genre is known for, but I didn't ever feel like the world was at risk. I know, there was no way that Earth didn't win, and there's a lot of disaster but it didn't feel it ultimately. That makes it hard to forgive the wonkiness in other areas.

film.summary: THE LONGEST RIDE centers on the star-crossed love affair between Luke, a former champion bull rider looking to make a comeback, and Sophia, a college student who is about to embark upon her dream job in New York City's art world. As conflicting paths and ideals test their relationship, Sophia and Luke make an unexpected and fateful connection with Ira, whose memories of his own decades-long romance with his beloved wife deeply inspire the young couple. (imdb)
film.quote: It's too long and wouldn't have had any emotional punch had Ira not been in it (let's be honest, his love story is more compelling because he's old). Despite it being manipulative, I can't deny that there weren't moments that got me... even though I knew it was trying to play me hard. The ending was stupid, but this isn't the worst romantic movie I've ever seen. 45 places it in a "close but no cigar" type of category.

film.filmname: The Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers (2002)
film.summary: In the second chapter in J.R.R Tolkien's epic trilogy, the Fellowship faces unimaginable armies and deception while also witnessing ancient wonders and the untapped strength of their people. (New Line Productions)
film.quote: More action makes this a more enthralling experience than the Fellowship of the Rings while still maintaining the Tolkien (almost) level of detail to the sets/surroundings. I still don't like it.

film.summary: A tour into the heart of a Hollywood family chasing celebrity, one another and the relentless ghosts of their pasts.
film.quote: The worst Cronenberg movie I've seen, but it's still almost passable. Julianne Moore was wonderful yet again, and it offers an off-kilter look at the Hollywood lifestyle. I reckon the satire is on point, even if it's nothing original, but it left me feeling cold. Cosmopolis did that too but I was more into it and enjoyed it quite a bit, but the detached dialogue, the sometimes stiff acting and general weirdness didn't do it for me this time around. Competently made but wooden and unappealing.

film.summary: The most dangerous hitman in the world, Arthur Bishop thought he had put his murderous past behind him when his most formidable foe kidnaps the love of his life. Now he is forced to travel the globe to complete three impossible assassinations, and do what he does best, make them look like accidents. (imdb)
film.quote: These movies aren't BAD, but they're not worth seeing either. There are some good action sequences, and I enjoy Statham in action roles, even if the movies themselves aren't always good. That's about it really: this might appeal to those who just want a silly action film, but this one wasn't good enough to recommend.

film.summary: A couple has checked into a nondescript hotel, video camera in hand, to make their very first sex tape. He starts shooting; the camera is date stamped January 3, 2003, at 3:23 in the afternoon. He&#039;s excited, he gets the lens cap off, but soon he seems to be getting more than he bargained for. She turns out to be pretty accomplished at this, an argument ensues, and the camera may be recording something completely different from what was planned. (imdb)
film.quote: Not a fan. But I don't completely hate it either. It just leans slightly into "non-recommendation" territory. I actually believed the people but just, blah. It isn't enough, somehow.

film.summary: A retired assassin is drawn back into the life he gave up when his daughter is kidnapped. To rescue her, he must confront his former rival. (imdb)
film.quote: It's not terrible, just a little dull and uninspired. The shoot outs really aren't that exciting at all, and many will say it's a lesser 'Taken' (it is), but it's not without its good parts. Cusack/Willis r underused but r seemingly just phoning it in anyway. It's a nice touch that the main character actually goes and buys bullets.. it shows some attention to detail that quite a few movies lack. But there's no oomph to anything. The final shootout isn't thrilling and the last showdown is stupid.

film.summary: This spooky reimagining of the classic dark-woods folk tale stars Amanda Seyfried as Valerie, a village girl who's confronting a tumultuous romantic situation when a legendary werewolf slaughters her sister. Valerie enlists the help of a veteran demon hunter (Gary Oldman) to destroy the creature, but as each cycle of the moon brings fresh deaths, Valerie begins to realize that the murderous beast may be closer to her than she'd ever dreamed.
film.quote: I thought it was better than expected, up until a certain point, and then it just became stupid and shitty. Honestly, quite a bit of it is pretty decent, with good art design, and decent performances. Sometimes the script is wonky, but that's forgivable in the beginning. But then maybe the last half hour or a little bit more, the movie tanks really badly and I just can't bring myself to recommend it. It ends up not satisfying you.

film.summary: When a weapons multi-national Palisade Defense reward their European sales division with a team-building weekend in the mountains of Eastern Europe, comedy blends with horror as the team fight first amongst themselves, and later for survival against a group of war-crazed killers intent on revenge. (imdb)
film.quote: A comedy horror that isn't really that scary but is dark and comedic. It focuses a lot on arms manufacturers and is set up like a slasher flick. So you get really absurd shit going on because that's what you expect from the genre. It does twist a few cliches on their head like naked (or at least half naked) chicks not dying. I liked it but I won't recommend it. But it comes close.

film.summary: A high school jock makes a bet that he can turn an unattractive girl into the school&#039;s prom queen. (imdb)
When a worldly singer witnesses a mob crime, the police hide her as a nun in a traditional convent where she has trouble fitting in. (imdb)
When missile technology is used to enhance toy action figures, the toys soon begin to take their battle programming too seriously. (imdb)
Col. Guile and various other martial arts heroes fight against the tyranny of Dictator M. Bison and his cohorts. (imdb)

Ray Liotta (Goodfellas) delivers an intense, electrifying performance in this explosive follow-up to the gritty urban crime thriller Street Kings. Liotta plays Detroit detective Marty Kingston, the leader of an undercover narcotics team, whose members are being systematically murdered one by one. To solve the brutal killings, Kingston joins forces with a cocky, young homicide detective. But neither of them is prepared for the shocking corruption their investigation will uncover — stunning secret (dvdactive.com)
film.quote: It's just really uninspired. I actually liked the first one (not a lot but still). This is just not as good, but Ray Liotta gives another fine -- even though he's on autopilot... he's just a master of this kind of role -- performance. I won't recommend it because it's generic, the twists are obvious, and it doesn't do anything real well, but it's also not complete dogshit, so if you do go against what I say and rent it... I'm man enough to admit you might just enjoy it, all things considered.

film.filmname: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Out of the Shadows (2016)
film.summary: As Shredder joins forces with mad scientist Baxter Stockman and henchmen Bebop and Rocksteady to take over the world, the Turtles must confront an even greater nemesis: the notorious Krang. (imdb)
film.quote: I enjoy the first, this is a mess. I still have an intrinsic adoration for the mutants so merely seeing them on screen makes me a little happy, but there's too much crammed in here and it's not satisfying enough. The action is still pretty fun but this is a lot more hammy; everybody is corning it up and it becomes too much. I enjoy when the Turtles crack lame jokes but nobody else works... it's just not as funny as the first one. Wasted potential because so many iconic characters are present.

film.summary: A small business owner is about to lose her shop to a major corporate development. (imdb)
film.quote: It tries to parody rom-coms but it just doesn't do a good job, ultimately. It sucks because I love seeing Rudd because he's charming as shit. I hate seeing him be in crap. It's almost a little too winky-winky to be that funny, and honestly, a lot of the more over-the-top shit doesn't work, like the dreadful part about wanting to fuck his grandma. It keeps piling up joke after joke that mostly don't work (though I chuckled a couple times) and doesn't really build a compelling narrative. Shallow.

film.summary: Spinal Tap, the world's loudest band, is chronicled by hack documentarian Marti DeBergi on what proves to be a fateful tour (imdb)
film.quote: Meh. A few lines did it for me and got a smile, but I never outright laughed. I don't know if it's my general disinterest in this era of rock/metal that made me uninterested in this as well, but I just didn't find it that humorous. There are certainly some fine moments so I wouldn't say it's terrible, but this is one widely praised film that I'm just not into.

film.summary: Justin throws himself and everyone around him into chaos when he attempts to break free from his addiction to his thumb.
film.quote: The film is well crafted, especially the acting performances but that's all it really was to me. This would get an even lower score if it wasn't for those things but I can appreciate a competently made movie, but I couldn't get involved in this. Really, the only flaw is a bit one... it wanders around the point it's trying to make and never engaged me so I found myself getting bored and struggling through it. Others have clearly found more, but that's my word, yo.

film.summary: When the Russian mob kidnaps the daughter of a reformed criminal, he rounds up his old crew and seeks his own brand of justice. (imdb)
film.quote: Maybe this is blasphemy but I actually didn't mind the movie until the last 15 minutes, where it ended up falling really flat. Yes, it is wonky, Cage acts in weird ways (RAAAAAAAT), and the script is terrible. But I'm kind of a sucker for Cage, and I'm a sucker for movies where criminals reunite to kick ass. I can even stand how tripe and cliche it is because I just enjoy this kind of movie, but some scenes were so bad that it hurt the decent parts. This script needed a lot of work.

film.summary: Six years have elapsed since Guantanemo Bay, leaving Harold and Kumar estranged from one another with very different families, friends and lives. But when Kumar arrives on Harold's doorstep during the holiday season with a mysterious package in hand, he inadvertently burns down Harold's father-in-law's beloved Christmas tree. To fix the problem, Harold and Kumar embark on a mission through New York City to find the perfect Christmas tree, once again stumbling into trouble at every single turn. (imdb)
film.quote: I think this is the first in the series that I don't recommend. I really really like the first one, because it was clever and hilarious... this... not so much. Outside of a couple laughs, this really has nothing going for it. It tries way too hard and it fails 90% of the time. If it wasn't for the fact I like the characters and the claymation it'd be lot lower.

film.summary: U.S. Marshal Carrie Stetko tracks a killer in Antarctica, as the sun is about to set for six months.
film.quote: It's not the abortion that apparently RT (according to what another user says) thinks it is, really. There's very little great about this besides a hot view of Beckinsale, and some decent views of Antarctica. But it's not awful. It was entertaining enough despite how inconsistent it was and how little you could invest yourself in these people.

film.summary: Two teenage yoga enthusiasts team up with a legendary man-hunter to battle with an ancient evil presence that is threatening their major party plans. (imdb)
film.quote: I actually enjoy Harley and Lily-Rose together; the chemistry is obvious, and they do have some funny moments. In fact, I'd say without them this is significantly worse. Guy isn't as intolerable this time around because he doesn't come along and RUIN a decent horror flick. But this ultimately just isn't that humorous and comes across as try-hard. I almost want to give it a pass, but it can't quite get there. Also, we get it: Canada. Pucky Charms isn't funny.

film.filmname: I Know What You Did Last Summer (1997)
film.summary: After an accident on a winding road, four teens make the fatal mistake of dumping their victim&#039;s body into the sea. But exactly one year later, the dead man returns from his watery grave, and he&#039;s looking for more than an apology. (Sony)
film.quote: This is a pretty by the numbers Scream-wannabe. Not much else to say really. It's not offensively bad but it's not good.

film.summary: Meet Samuel, Jeffrey and Michael Douglas! Their grandfather, Mori Tanaka, is highly skilled in the fields of Martial Arts and Ninjitsu... (imdb)
film.quote: Liked it as a kid. I was also a stupid kid.

film.summary: Experimental film in which the camera acts as a subjective observer. (BFI)
film.quote: Trees! I can appreciate what it's trying to do. I am bias towards experimental films most of the time. There are even some nice images of trees... but this doesn't stop me from being really, really bored by it all.

film.summary: Tom Welles (Cage) is a family man with a modest home-based private investigation business living a simple life in Pennsylvania -- until a reel of crudely shot eight millimeter film sends him down a gritty and frightening path into society&#039;s darkest corners. (Sony)

George, a lonely and fatalistic teen who's made it all the way to his senior year without ever having done a real day of work, is befriended by Sally, a popular but complicated girl who recognizes in him a kindred spirit. (imdb)
film.quote: Isn't really a lot to write home about but I wouldn't go and say it's awful. I think what jhmclellan says is true, "movie is forgettable." It doesn't really do anything. It tries to tell a heart-warming story of love and I suppose it does, but the idea is kind of silly. The main character is kinda wonky. No real scenes stick out, and you know what's going to happen. We've seen it a million times, and we've seen it done better. But still not awful, just not worth seeing.

film.summary: After arrogant teenager Kyle Kingson (Alex Pettyfer) humiliates a Goth classmate (Mary-Kate Olsen), she puts a curse on him that transforms him from a hunk into a hideous creature. To break the hex, Kyle must find someone who loves him for what he's become. Living with a housekeeper after his heartless father (Peter Krause) throws him out, he connects with an addict's daughter (Vanessa Hudgens) in this contemporary take on Beauty and the Beast.
film.quote: I wouldn't call it offensively bad or anything, but it's very rushed. I know a bunch of time goes by in the movie, but it feels unnatural. And it's cheesy, not in a good way. -whispers- I love you. Yeah, we get it, the words are powerful. And the way dude handled himself in a fight was like he got super powers all of a sudden. What a hero. But seriously, it's like at the beginning they make the worst possible guy ever just to show you just how quick a man can transform.

film.summary: A champion high school cheerleading squad discovers its previous captain stole all their best routines from an inner-city school and must scramble to compete at this year's championships. (imdb)
Based on skin-curdling tales of the real life "flesh eating virus," Cabin Fever blends the elements of classic horror films of the 70's and 80's with modern day medical terror. (Lions Gate Films)
film.quote: Almost, but not quite.

film.summary: A prison parolee (Cage) on his way to freedom faces impossible odds when the maximum security transport plane he's on is skyjacked by the most vicious criminals in the country. (Buena Vista Entertainment)

Bruce Willis pairs with Tracy Morgan in this Kevin Smith-directed buddy flick about two cops trying to track down a stolen mint-condition (read valuable) baseball card from the 1950s. Along the way, the guys tangle with the mob, a Mexican beauty and countless other characters in this comedic action flick co-starring Adam Brody, Jason Lee, Michelle Trachtenberg and Seann William Scott.

Based on Dan Brown&#039;s popular and controversial novel, The Da Vinci Code begins with a spectacular murder in the Louvre Museum. All clues point to a covert religious organization that will stop at nothing to protect a secret that threatens to overturn 2,000 years of accepted dogma. (Sony)
film.quote: It's boring. There are other issues with it but that's definitely the main one.

film.summary: A cop is brought out of suspended animation in prison to pursue an old ultra-violent enemy who is loose in a nonviolent future society.
A special message for roommates everywhere.
film.quote: I learned a lot from this. But seriously, you look at the title and you know what the joke is, and it's not overly funny to be honest. It's a satirical look at... oh whatever, I can't do this. Don't touch my shit.

film.summary: High-strung father-to-be Peter Highman is forced to hitch a ride with aspiring actor Ethan Tremblay on a road trip in order to make it to his child's birth on time.
film.quote: The part with Rza was cool because like someone said, "Rza makes things cool." The rest of the movie was kind of bland, with a few scattered laughs here and there.

film.summary: A comedy about a video store clerk Ed (Matthew McConaughey) whose life is thrown into chaos when he agrees to let an executive of a televison studio (Ellen DeGeneres) film him for 24 hours. (imdb)
When comedian George Simmons learns of his terminal health condition, his desire to form a genuine friendship cause him to take a green performer under his wing as his opening act.
film.quote: Kinda boring, really. Unlike another review, I thought the Eminem part was the funniest. There were a couple other jokes scattered along the way but it's really not a funny movie and the main story has some heart but isn't as good as other Apatow stories. He's been declining in quality, plus I don't like Adam Sandler generally, as a rule, it turns out.

film.filmname: Il Giorno della prima di Close Up (1996)
film.summary: The owner of a small cinema in Italy is going through the figures for the most recent blockbusters in his town and is irritated to see that the advertising space for the new Iranian film showing at his cinema (Close-Up) is significantly smaller than that of American films. He tries to promote the smaller works at every chance he gets but will it ever be able to compete with the Lion King? (imdb)
film.quote: I can get behind the message: I've ranted that amazing flicks make no money. But, why would you pick The Lion King? First of all, it's an incredible movie. Second, it's a kids movie that adults can enjoy so of course it'll stomp over everything. It's like, this flick has its heart in the right place but goes about it the wrong way. Not really an easy thing to explore in a few minutes, and the movie is too shallow and misguided in how it does it anyway. Classy ending though, nice touch.

film.summary: Laurie Strode struggles to come to terms with her brother Michael's deadly return to Haddonfield, Illinois; meanwhile, Michael prepares for another reunion with his sister
film.quote: Meh. It's not completely terrible. It throws you a bone once in a while, but it really doesn't do anything special and relies way too heavily on old cliches. I'm aware that the slasher genre is ripe with cliches anyway and it's hard to avoid but you can still be clever. There were no real memorable scenes, which sucks because Myers is such a great villain. The symbolism seemed really tacked on a lot of the time and the ending sucked. But it had a lot of attractive girls. And Weird Al.

film.summary: On the way to California, a family has the misfortune to have their car break down in an area closed to the public, and inhabited by violent savages ready to attack. (imdb)
An assassin teams up with a woman to help her find her father and uncover the mysteries of her ancestry. (imdb)
film.quote: Fuck the film makers for that complete shit "hey we're making a sequel" ending. You introduce one of the cooler moments in the movie and then cut away and expect us to pay for a sequel. It's disgusting. Besides that, the plot is pretty banal but it has a few fun moments and action scenes. Also has some really dumb ones. Another poor example of how to adapt a video game adaptation but I think this is a weird series to do that to anyway cuz of the freedom of the game, which movies can't achieve.

film.filmname: Jay and Silent Bob Get Irish (2013)
film.summary: Jason Mewes and Kevin Smith sit around and talk in Ireland.
film.quote: As much as I like hearing Kevin Smith talk (the Evening With... dvds are fantastic), I just really wasn't into it. Maybe it's just the fact that while Mewes is funny, too much of him really just starts getting boring. I did laugh a few times, but I can't really recommend this one.

film.summary: A genetic anomaly allows a young man to teleport himself anywhere. He discovers this gift has existed for centuries and finds himself in a war that has been raging for thousands of years between "Jumpers" and those who have sworn to kill them. (imdb)

India in the new millennium is faced with corruption, unemployment, crime, and all-round insecurity. Many want to travel abroad to better their lives. Rashid Khan is an individual who assists them, albeit illegally, by taking huge amounts, and then transporting them to their choice of destinations... (imdb)

Cleveland Heep, a stuttering apartment superintendent, encounters a girl named Story swimming in the complex's pool. He soon learns that she comes from the Blue World, and has a message for mankind. Will he be able to help her complete her mission?
film.quote: At least M. Night tries. It tries to be an interesting fairy tale and while some of it is wonky, it's really not as offensive as people think. Yes, he kills a critic and yes, he put himself as the character whos writing will inspired the world. But the direction is solid like almost always and the script is pretty bad or at most, mediocre. That's what he does usually. But I liked the beginning part and a few parts. The acting had its ups and downs.

film.summary: The fate of mankind rests in the hands of one Lara Croft (Jolie), a twenty-first century heroine inspired by the most popular interactive video character in history. (Paramount Pictures)
Four losers are thrust into the position of saving the world when they stumble upon a UFO crash site and become genetically equipped to the battle suit on board. (imdb)
film.quote: One critic called it &quot;the anti-Pixels&quot; but it's really only a few steps above the typical Adam Sandler trash. I like Rooster Teeth but this is NOT Red vs Blue any shape or form, except for the fact that they're both sci-fi comedies. A few gags worked, like with the stereotypical redneck Woody, but the laughs didn't come often. I had to wade through a lot of shit to find any gold nuggets. The special effects were totally competent though.

film.summary: Lillie runs a boarding house full of young bachelors. A friend writes to say she's sending her little darling daughter for a visit. The bachelors all buy toys for a little girl, but an attractive young woman gets off the train instead. (imdb)
film.quote: It's not really awful, it's just not worth seeing. What I learned from this film is that in 1909 it was okay to be a pedo. The real tragedy of the film is that the young, attractive woman has no idea how close she was to being in a really gross gangbang. But aren't we all clueless to that, really? I think so.

film.summary: A man wrongly convicted of conspiracy to commit espionage against the U.S. is offered his freedom if he can rescue the president's daughter from an outer space prison taken over by violent inmates. (imdb)
film.quote: I like Pearce and I believe him in this roll. The idea is just kind of stupid, why space? I like how it said "original story by Luc Besson." If you ignore John Carpenter maybe... but anyway, it just kind plodded along. It actually started off pretty promising but the action wasn't exciting and no characters were memorable. Escape from Space doesn't work.

film.summary: Jason Statham stars as an experienced hit man who decides he's ready to retire his weapons once and for all -- after he finishes training eager young apprentice Steve McKenna (Ben Foster) in the ways of the professional kill. But the assassin's bosses are not pleased when they discover their man is giving away his trade secrets. Simon West directs and Donald Sutherland co-stars in this action-packed remake of the 1972 Charles Bronson thriller.
film.quote: Awful awful ending, it's so abrupt. They could have put an extra 10 minutes in between the two things that happen, something to make it seem to matter. Besides that, there are a couple good action scenes but nothing amazing. For it not doing anything that well, and for there being so many movies like this, you don't need to see it. It's not shitty enough to run away from it like it's a zombie, but it's also not good enough to recommend.

film.summary: A Jewish male nurse (Ben Stiller) plans to ask his live-in girl friend (Teri Polo) to marry him. However, he learns that her strict father (Robert DeNiro) expects to be asked for his daughter's hand before she can accept. Thus begins the visit from Hell as the two travel to meet Mom (Blythe Danner) and Dad, who turns out to be former CIA with a lie detector in the basement. Coincidentally, a sister (Nicole DeHuff) also has announced her wedding to a young doctor (Thomas McCarthy)... (imdb)
A poignant look at the many ways that the internet has changed the relationships between teenagers and their parents. (TIFF)
film.quote: A movie about the digital age that wants to say something incredible but can't. Same ol', the net doesn't connect us like it should. We text too much. Props to the actors who try and almost succeed in making you care a lil, but it fails as a drama and comedy. It's worst case scenario over and over for each character. I'd like to see a movie that says that we should still connect with IRL friends but that you can have a meaningful community online as well. But no, that would be too complicated.

film.summary: Based on the graphic novel, a police officer who can't be stopped by death returns to the streets time and time again to fight crime.
film.quote: I never would have checked this out if I wasn't curious to see what Crahan could do with a feature film. It's not even that it's terrible. I would have given this a passing grade because of how gleefully violent and silly it is, but what fails it is that the action sucks. Most of the time it's just Downe standing still and shooting people, with some painfully uninspired and boring camera work. It's stylish with lots of flashing everythings coming at you, and it is entertaining sometimes.

film.summary: Robert Neville, due to an experimental vaccine, is the only survivor of an apocalyptic war waged with biological weapons.
film.quote: I wish I could like this. I like the premise, that's about it. I can enjoy cheese but this didn't do it for me, and some of the scenes were just so poorly done. The ending was awful. I wish I could have seen this back in 1971. Usually I can take into consideration that a movie is old and so I don't expect certain things, however, this movie is really dated. A good script is something that doesn't age, and this movie doesn't have it. I could have forgiven a lot had it had that one thing.

film.summary: On the day of their Father's 70th birthday party, four siblings come to terms with the publication of a novel written by the youngest sibling, that exposes the family's most intimate secrets...
film.quote: This was very by the books, but not a bad movie. It felt like a typical indie dramedy, where a family is fucked up, some 'quirky' things happen (in this case, porn shops and RAGING BONERS), and everyone eventually lets out how they feel at the end. It's depressing that it's so impressively average though, considering C. Hall is always a pleasure, Silverman is funny, Mara is gorgeous, and Greer has a charm about her. Talent doesn't lead to much here though. Again, not awful, just 'normal.'

film.summary: A tale about a family whose suburban home is invaded by angry spirits. When the terrifying apparitions escalate their attacks and take the youngest daughter, the family must come together to rescue her. (imdb)
film.quote: Upon a little more consideration, I dropped this from a 45 (which is close to recommending). It just wasn't that scary and when I think about it; isn't that the point? I give it some props for a little humour and some fun scenes. I wasn't bored, but the script needed major work.

film.summary: Strange lights descend on the city of Los Angeles, drawing people outside like moths to a flame where an extraterrestrial force threatens to swallow the entire human population off the face of the Earth. (Universal Pictures)
film.quote: Theory: The character played by Zayas was taking anger management, it got cancelled because of aliens, and he was angry cuz of it... that's how I explain his needless aggression. Awful character. The rest of the movie was actually decent... the first half an hour/40 mins was good then it got a little wonky. That would have been forgiven if the ending wasn't one of the worst endings ever. You build up to that and you don't give me at least 15 minutes of CGI ass-kicking? You suck.

film.summary: Into the life of a widowed professor comes a new love and an unexpected visit from his adopted brother. (imdb)
film.quote: Unfortunately I just didn't feel a thing while watching this. Ellen Page was good and I've always enjoyed her, but that's about it. I didn't find the movie funny, I didn't find it dramatic, I didn't think the romance was interesting, it wasn't a clever movie. It was just kind of there, kind of blah, so I don't really HATE the movie... just not worth seeing because it's just another film like this in a huge sea of them.

film.summary: The film&#039;s soundtrack is an original musical composition produced with synthetic sound - through photographing unusual geometric shapes and running them through an optical sound head. The images are an artistic rendering of this soundtrack. (imdb)
film.quote: I try to review movies based on whether it accomplishes what it sets out to do or not. That's a pretty decent way of rating things, and this certainly does accomplish what it sets out to do. It's neat for 1971 but now I feel like I'm watching Windows Media Player. I don't recommend it because I didn't like it, though yes, if this is what you want from a film, it will work for you.

film.summary: FBI profiler Special Agent Illeana Scott (Jolie) suddenly finds herself on a twisted and terrifying journey, surrounded by suspects in a case that has become chillingly personal. (Warner Bros.)
Two people attempt to get into a relationship, while exiting the multiple relationships they were each managing through their Blackberries before they met. (imdb)
film.quote: I have a really hard time with these texting/internet comedies where things pop up on the screen, I don't know why. I think maybe because it's cheesy, but not in a good way. But as cute as Simone is, this full time vlogging shit is bad. She's the worst kind of vlogger, those really vague posts that don't really say anything. Ergh. But anyway, related to the actual MOVIE, it's just inoffensive. It's really neither good or bad, it just kind of is. Performances, script, everything... meh.

film.summary: Federal Agent Elliot Ness sets out to take out Al Capone; because of rampant corruption, he assembles a small, hand-picked team. (imdb)
film.quote: The worst offender here is the terrible music that feels out of place at least 85.324242242123% of the time. It made it very hard to get into it, and it wasn't helped by an awful script and performances that range from mediocre but passable (Connery, De Niro, Garcia I guess) to outright bad (Costner). "Cartoonish" is a word that has been thrown around and it's fitting. There could have been some emotional resonance here but the silliness trampled all over it. I dislike the train station scene.

film.summary: Intertwining couples and singles in Los Angeles break-up and make-up based on the pressures and expectations of Valentine's Day.
film.quote: It wasn't godawful or anything but it was a little bland. There were a few good parts but some of it just didn't work. There are better rom-coms out there so I'm not going to recommend it... though you could also do a lot worse.

film.summary: Six tourists hire an extreme tour guide who takes them to the abandoned city Pripyat, the former home to the workers of the Chernobyl nuclear reactor. During their exploration, they soon discover they are not alone (imdb)
film.quote: I wonder how much say Peli really had in this. You look at the other two writers and they're known for "mockbusters" (read: shit), and this movie, specifically the dialogue (read: WE GOTTA GO BEFORE THE RADIATION KILLS US), definitely feels similar at times. Now, there is some tension, I agree with TheRealJ-Ro that there is good minimalist tension but ultimately, who gives a fuck? Plus, there is some terrible acting here and there.

film.summary: This retelling of the critically acclaimed 1955 comedy stars Hanks as Goldthwait Higginson Dorr III, Ph.D., a charlatan professor who&#039;s assembled a gang of &#034;experts&#034; for the heist of the century. (Touchstone Pictures)
film.quote: It's the only Coen brothers movie I've seen that has bored me. It doesn't have any of the magic of their other films.

film.summary: In small-town Texas, high school football is a religion. The head coach is deified, as long as the team is winning and 17-year-old schoolboys carry the hopes of an entire community onto the gridiron every Friday night. In his 35th year as head coach, Bud Kilmer (Jon Voight) is trying to lead his West Canaan Coyotes to their 23rd division title... (imdb)
A sheriff's deputy fights an alternate universe version of himself who grows stronger with each alternate self he kills. (imdb)

A political satire set in Turaqistan, a country occupied by an American private corporation run by a former US Vice-President (Aykroyd). In an effort to monopolize the opportunities the war-torn nation offers, the corporation's CEO hires a troubled hit man (Cusack), to kill a Middle East oil minister... (imdb)
film.quote: Meh. I like John Cusack and I like satire but this just didn't do it for me. Satire doesn't have to be funny but this was obviously trying to be and I only laughed twice. It gets props for being relevant, by showcasing the corporatization of things, mainly war. The plot was really predictable in a lot of ways, though. Didn't really keep me into it like it should have. The action scenes weren't too bad and they had some pretty nice choreography. It needed to try harder.

film.summary: Socially inept and saddled with a miserable job, Willard shares a powerful bond with the rats who dwell in his basement. When Willard&#039;s world is turned upside down by tragedy, those responsible must answer to his rapidly growing pack of ravenous, fearsome friends. (New Line Cinema)
The Greek general Themistocles battles an invading army of Persians under the mortal-turned-god, Xerxes. (imdb)
film.quote: Eva Green (and her titties) is the only redeeming quality of this movie. The slow-mo is excessive and boring, the visual style is wasted on bland environments and the action got tedious. There was a lot of bad, cheesy moments too. Why was he on a horse on a ship?

film.summary: Four waves of increasingly deadly alien attacks have left most of Earth decimated. Cassie is on the run, desperately trying to save her younger brother. (imdb)
film.quote: Spoilers: So Moretz looks out her window and sees her savior chopping wood and then sees his chiseled physique as he bathes in the lake, splashing water on himself... ahhh, I get it, I'm watching porn. One of the worst love stories in recent memory, and it helps tank an otherwise somewhat interesting movie. Up until a certain point I was into it mildly, even though most of the actors -- including Moretz who I love -- phoned it in. But then it went down badly and I just wanted it to be over.

film.summary: A spelling bee loser sets out to exact revenge by finding a loophole and attempting to win as an adult. (imdb)
film.quote: The premise is kinda neat. I don't mind "mean-spirited" comedy if done right, but Bad Words didn't do that. I laughed ONCE, and was most entertained by the final spelling bee, but the rest of the movie was just cruel and unfunny. If a middle-aged guy swearing and being mean to everyone is funny to you, then seriously, power to ya, but -- at least in this case -- it didn't do it for me. Deserves props for the premise, but not even Bateman's charm (which he has in spades) can't save his own movie.

film.summary: A middle aged farmer, living with his old and bedridden father, tries to find truth in life. (imdb)
film.quote: It's possible I just wasn't in the mood. It's also possible that this is just a generic foreign movie. From the unnecessary "artsy/atmospheric" shots (like the beginning and other parts throughout), to the slow-pace, it was a boring movie. I'm not saying that it wants to do a Tarkovsky movie, but they didn't have the same understanding of grace and beauty that he did. You also see a lot of side-face "emoting" with minimal dialogue most of the time, which isn't thoughtful... it just drags on.

film.summary: An experimental short by Toshio Matsumoto.
film.quote: I suppose the images on the screen are okay, especially in 1981, but I didn't really care that much.

film.summary: When they find a frozen caveman in their backyard, two high school outcasts thaw him out and introduce him to modern day life while he in turn, gets them to actually enjoy life.

Fantastic Four centers on four young outsiders who teleport to an alternate and dangerous universe, which alters their physical form in shocking ways. Their lives irrevocably upended, the team must learn to harness their daunting new abilities and work together to save Earth from a former friend turned enemy. (imdb)
film.quote: Dark and gritty didn't really work. I appreciate the efforts to make it a bit of a sci-fi horror movie at times, but the cheesy dialogue, sub-par visual effects (in comparison to other movies, still not completely terrible as a whole), and the way they punked Doom in about 20 minutes or so... just a bad time. There were a couple scenes like when Doom first awakens, and when the F4 are first dealing with their problems, but it's too little in a movie that overstays its welcome. Slow and boring.

film.summary: Twenty years after an accident during a small town high school play results in death, students at the school resurrect the failed stage production in a misguided attempt to honor the anniversary of the tragedy - but ultimately find out that some things are better left alone. (imdb)
film.quote: I like found footage movies but this is a really poorly done one. Bad acting, a reliance on jump scares that don't work (quit panning the camera back and forth to make us anticipate a scare, you're doing it to death), and off-putting visuals. It has a few good moments and I'm torn on the ending because it's a little too convenient, but it also has the scariest part (outside of the one scene that's in the trailer). Meh.

film.summary: Maxwell Smart, Agent 86 for CONTROL, battles the forces of KAOS with the more-competent Agent 99 at his side.
film.quote: Started off funny and i thought it might be the funniest movie of '08 (as of June), but then I didn't find it funny after the first 20 minutes, except for a few laughs here and there. Direction is solid, nothing amazing. Great theme song though. Action parts didn't excite me but they were well made. Casting was good, though.

film.summary: An eight year-old, who is accidentally left behind while his family flies to France for Christmas, has to defend his home against idiotic burglars. (imdb)
film.quote: A movie aimed mostly at kids, it succeeds on that level. I remember enjoying it a lot growing up. However, the slapstick gets old now and I just can't recommend it. An 85 for kids but my rating is 35.

film.filmname: How to Make Love to a Woman (2010)
film.summary: How to Make Love to a Woman explores one man's journey to save a relationship by attempting to improve his sex skills instead of communicating what he really feels. (ineedsexadvice.com/home.html)
film.quote: Think it relies too much on bringing celebrities in, like just having them there makes everything better. There's a good way to do this and a bad way, this movie is a bad way. I only laughed a few times and they weren't much in the way of laughs, and the emotional stuff was very up and down. At one point I felt for them, then the formulaic ending didn't make me feel like it should. I don't know if that was the scripts fault or the actors, probably the script.

film.summary: Friends hatch a plot to retrieve a stolen kitten by posing as drug dealers for a street gang. (imdb)
film.quote: I have tried really hard to get into Key and Peele and I can't do it. On their show they occasionally came out of the gate with a great skit, but here there's very little of that. I chuckled a couple times but that is not enough to carry a comedy that doesn't have a whole lot else going for it. However, that song that plays when they see the cat adds some levity to it and awwwww kitty.

film.summary: Last Days is filmmaker Gus Van Sant&#039;s fictional meditation on the inner turmoil that engulfs a brilliant, but troubled musician in the final hours of his life. (Picturehouse)
film.quote: The thing is, Kurt Cobain was an interested (and talented, I don't give a fuck what the haters say, he was) man. This is not that interesting, and I didn't even feel like it was a great meditation at all. There were a few great scenes (mostly music related), and then a lot of poor scenes. I tend to like movies like this, but there's a movie like Elephant which is like poetry, and then there's this. The few great scenes can't make up for the rest.

film.filmname: The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring (2001)
film.summary: An epic adventure of good against evil, a story of the power of friendship and individual courage, and the heroic quest to pave the way for the emergence of mankind, J.R.R. Tolkien's master work brought to cinematic life. (New Line Cinema)
film.quote: Agreed with TheRealJ-Ro that it's true to Tolkien. It's a gorgeous film, no doubt, but I was bored to tears. Still, it's an accomplishment and I would think Tolkien would be proud.

film.summary: Murphy, an American studying in Paris, is living with Omi, with whom he has a child. At the beginning of the new year, he receives a phone call from the mother of his ex-girlfriend, Electra, which sends him on a course of reminiscence about his previous relationship.
film.quote: Usually I'm that guy who embraces challenging films because we should praise really creative people that show no fear. Noe is likethat, but Love is a slog. Terrible acting most of the time with a few moments of redemption, and bad writing. I think Murphy reminds me a lot of Edward Cullen. Sex bored me. It was too much and there was nothing really behind it because the characters weren't interesting. Also, a couple good musical choices but also strange a lot of the time.

film.summary: The story revolves around a new high school student, Jo (Meaghan Jette Martin) , who agrees to befriend an outcast, Abby (Jennifer Stone), at the urging of Abby's wealthy father in exchange for paying all of Jo's costs for the college of her dreams. Jo and Abby team up to take on the school's mean girls, the Plastics, Mandi (Maiara Walsh), Hope (Nicole Anderson) and Chastity (Claire Holt). (Wikipedia)
film.quote: If the movie was like the first half or so, this would be one of the worst movies ever. At about the halfway mark, it becomes tolerable, a little funnier and a little more emotional. Sure, it's a shitty version of the first Mean Girls (which was pretty funny), but at least it redeems itself a little bit. The principal was hilarious though, so it's nice to see that there's at least one awesome character in a crappy movie. Don't bother with this.

film.summary: A young Oriental man with a headscarf and bare torso shadowboxes indoors in front of a series of unadorned walls, light, dark, both shades. He is then shown exercising outside with a sword in an area surrounded by a low stone wall and overlooking a river, before there is a return to the first sequence. (imdb)
film.quote: The way the young man moves is certainly poetic and a meditation, but unfortunately that can't save how boring this is. It needed to be a little shorter.

film.summary: A story centered on a proper elementary school teacher who moonlights as a vigilante. (imdb)
film.quote: As referenced in a line in the movie (so we don't miss it?), it is Mary Poppins (her name is actually Mary too) killing people. It's very strange in tone and mood, never working as satire or straight vigilante movie. The idea of twisting Poppins like this is appealing, and Holmes is an in interesting choice for the lead, but it all just seems too convenient, even for a movie, and doesn't gel. Tries for dramatic and quirky but it's just awkward more than compelling.

film.summary: Some 15 years after the presumed death of a vicious serial killer, children whose birthdays match his supposed "deathday" start to disappear. But whether the killer -- or his tortured soul -- is responsible remains to be seen. One boy (Max Thieriot) knows for sure, but his own connection to the horrific crimes is far too terrible to imagine.

What are the odds of getting even? Danny Ocean (Clooney) and the gang would have only one reason to pull off their most ambitious and riskiest casino heist -- to defend one of their own. But they're going to need more than luck on their side to break The Bank. (Warner Bros.)
film.quote: As much as I like watching a bunch of Hollywood's biggest stars be as cool as they possibly can, unfortunately this is just too much. I liked Oceans Eleven and Twelve but this is an unnecessary sequel that doesn't have half of the wit or entertainment value of the other two. I was actually bored.

film.summary: Pearl Harbor is a romantic tale set during World War 2. Childhood friends Rafe and Danny become Navy pilots and meet Evelyn, a Navy nurse. Rafe falls for Evelyn, before volunteering, while Evelyn and Danny are transferred to Pearl Harbor.
film.quote: Really, it's not as bad as people seem to think, but it's certainly not good. It's below average but the explosions and action sequences are what you'd expect from Bay. Besides that, well, there isn't too much, as it just recycles ancient cliches and does nothing remotely interesting with them.

film.summary: After she's accused of being a Russian sleeper spy, rogue CIA agent Evelyn Salt (Angelina Jolie) goes on the run, using every tactic, accent and disguise she knows to elude her pursuers, clear her name and protect her husband. Her supervisor, Winter (Liev Schreiber), buys her story, while counterintelligence officer Peabody (Chiwetel Ejiofor) decidedly does not and will do anything to stop her in this fast-paced, intrigue-filled spy adventure.

Special Agent Pete Garrison is convinced that a Neo-Nazi Aryan Disciple has managed to infiltrate the White House. When a White House Agent is murdered, Garrison is framed and blackmailed over an affair with the First Lady Sarah Ballentine. He is relieved of his duties, but Garrison won't stop in trying to prove his innocence, and save the life of the President. While attempting to uncover the person behind it all, he comes into confrontation with his protege, Agent Breckinridge. (imdb)

During a championship baseball match, the three brothers hear that their grandfather in Japan is in trouble, and head out to help him, conceding the match. When they arrive in Japan, they must use all their powers to defend him against his ancient enemy, who has returned to exact revenge. (imdb)

A new take on Wes Craven&#039;s 1977 film of the same name, The Hills Have Eyes is the story of a family road trip that goes terrifyingly awry when the travelers become stranded in a government atomic zone. Miles from nowhere, the Carters soon realize the seemingly uninhabited wasteland is actually the breeding ground of a blood-thirst mutant family -- and they are the prey. (Fox Searchlight)
film.quote: Outside of a scene or two of genuine terror, it's mostly an exercise in brutality and gets boring pretty quick. The sequel is even worse.

film.summary: Doom, the landmark videogame that electrified a generation, leaps from the computer screen to the big screen as a terrifying sci-fi horror action adventure, transporting audiences to a dark and disturbing future with all the visceral excitement and horror that made its gaming predecessor a global phenomenon. (Universal)

Alice, now in hiding in the Nevada desert, once again joins forces with Carlos Olivera and L.J., along with new survivors Claire, K-Mart and Nurse Betty to try to eliminate the deadly virus that threatens to make every human being undead... and to seek justice.
film.quote: Okay, I actually like the first two. This one not so much. A decent idea ruined.

film.summary: Surrounded by limber, wanton women on a booze-soaked island resort owned by rock star has-been Coconut Pete (Paxton), a non-stop party takes a turn for the weird when dead bodies start turning up faster than you could drink a rum punch. (Fox)
film.quote: Eh. What a disappointment.

film.filmname: Angry Video Game Nerd: The Movie (2014)
film.summary: The AVGN must overcome his phobia of the worst video game in the world to save his fans.
film.quote: I really wanted to like this, but unfortunately it was a reminder of why I only watch AVGN casually. I don't like his videos where he makes plots and stuff, and when he chains together swear words it isn't funny like something like Trailer Park Boys. His reviews are great and clever, the rest isn't. It was too long and while there were good moments (like the credits and the ending in general), and it was a nice piece of indie film making with a lot of passion and love. Just wasn't for me.

film.summary: High-school student Ed Wallis enters into a friendship with his neighbor, Ashby, a retired CIA assassin who only has a few months left to live. (imdb)
film.quote: Mickey Rourke is pretty good in this, but the "student meets assassin" thing falls flat. The concepts are just at odds with one another and it fails as both a comedy and a drama. It meanders on and on and on.

film.summary: A story of love, sex... and high school tuition. Meet Sam Lowell. Friend, lover, student, teacher... and owner of his very own escort service. Along with his &quot;mother's little helpers&quot; Sam learns about love and life in this sophisticated take on the classic high school sex comedy that explores a generation of kids growing up too fast and their parents who are desperately trying to stay young.
film.quote: Pretty much fails as a comedy, succeeds at cougars. And yet I still can't recommend it. Who woulda thunk it?

film.summary: An assassin is hired by a businessman to avenge the murder of his daughter by white slave traders in Thailand. (imdb)
film.quote: I liked a few of the action scenes, but mostly this was a below average action movie. The dialogue especially is awful, and the lead guy gives an amazingly bad performance. And he sweats a lot needlessly. What is up with Bacon in this? I don't know. It's a mystery.

film.summary: Literature student Anastasia Steele's life changes forever when she meets handsome, yet tormented, billionaire Christian Grey. (imdb)
film.quote: Fifty Shades is not the embarrassment that it could have been. It substantially improves upon the source material but it's still not a good movie. It is a perfect example of how not to write a script and of the two leads, only Dakota seems to be interested. It's a bit of a slog and feels longer than it is while being decently photographed. It doesn't really matter at this point, nor did it ever, because it has made its money. We will see sequels and we will have the same discussions.

film.summary: A romantic comedy that explores the adult film industry through the eyes of an idealistic 25 year-old award winning film school grad
film.quote: The main character ends up being an editor for a big porn flick. The funny thing is, Finding Bliss is edited so poorly at times it's just lame. There are times when this movie hits a high note and examines "serious" films and porn, and the reactions to it... but most of the time the movie is just a really uninspired rom-com, and there wasn't really a whole lot in it to overly like. They also took the easy way out by making most porn people look stupid, like no movies have ever done that before.

film.summary: Two days in the life of priest Father Fred Stadtmuller whose New Mexico parish is so large he can only spread goodness and light among his flock with the aid of a mono-plane. The priestly pilot is seen dashing from one province to the next at the helm of his trusty Piper Club administering guidance (his plane, the Flying Padre) to unruly children, sermonizing at funerals and flying a sickly child and its mother to a hospital. (imdb)
film.quote: Yeah, I can see why Kubrick called it 'silly.' It is. I mean, it's obvious it doesn't take itself so serious... from the cheesy narrator, to some of the things said, it's pretty silly, which is funny considering what it's about. But it's also pretty flat, as someone said in the Criticker reviews. And thus, boring. I said thus, that's right.

film.summary: When millionaire James King is nailed for fraud and bound for San Quentin, he turns to Darnell Lewis to prep him to go behind bars. (imdb)
film.quote: Hart and Ferrell have decent chemistry, and I chuckled a bunch of times (mostly at Hart who makes the most out of his time), but this operates on one or two notes for an hour and a half. Penis jokes abound, and very little else, with too much emphasis put on raunch and throwing swear words at the wall to see what sticks. The premise could have worked but it's a wasted opportunity. They can't be forgiven for their misuse of The Bomb by Pigeon John, which is a wonderful and upbeat song.

film.summary: This time, there's no wedding. No bachelor party. What could go wrong, right? But when the Wolfpack hits the road, all bets are off. (imdb)
film.quote: It gets points for going the logical route and going more big and epic because it's closing out the trilogy. It's just painfully unfunny and I wasn't a huge Chow fan to begin with and there was too much of him (and some shit he said was just terrible). It can become a heist thriller/comedy and that's wonderful but it would have helped if it was funny. As an action movie it's okay, as a comedy it is not.

film.summary: After a family is forced to relocate for their son's health, they begin experiencing supernatural behavior in their new home, which turns out to be a former mortuary. (imdb)
film.quote: You know, I didn't care about very much in this movie. Mildly entertaining and that's about it. It was a bit interesting when they played with imagery but even so, how many times did we have to see that the cancer kid was JUST LIKE THE KID WHO TRIED TO STOP THE PEOPLE BEFORE. Mind blowing. Anyway, I liked the credits (the only genuinely creepy part) but it was too short to really knock this up. Too many bullshit jump scares and not enough atmosphere or anything else.

film.summary: A prequel set before the haunting of the Lambert family that reveals how gifted psychic Elise Rainier reluctantly agrees to use her ability to contact the dead in order to help a teenage girl who has been targeted by a dangerous supernatural entity. (imdb)
film.quote: I quite enjoyed the first, and mildly enjoyed the second. The best part of the third was the first 30 seconds, where the title screen harkened back to old suspense/thriller/horror movies. I still like the astral projection thing the series has going on since most horror movies are so generic, but what was going on here? It was all just silly. Had a reliance on jump scares at first (which is... forgivable) but then near the end it changed tones completely and shit the bed.

film.summary: At the age of ten, Henry James Hermin, a boy who was conceived in a petri-dish and raised by his feminist mother, follows a string of Post-It notes in hopes of finding his biological father. (imdb)
film.quote: There's no emotional depth until the end when they start shoving it down your throat. The cause of pain in Patricia's life is just so silly it's hard to feel for her. The characters are forced and don't appeal to me at all. It doesn't work as a drama for the most part and as a comedy there's one or two laughs. It's one of those movies that force that indie feel instead of a movie like Little Miss Sunshine which just works. Really, very little actually works in this.

film.summary: In a standard comic book dystopian near-future Americans are ensconced in mega-cities which protect them from the desolation of the world outside, and the peace is kept by The Judges. This elite group who upholds "The Law" is police, jury, and executioner all in one. Judge Dredd, the most formidable and revered of the Street Judges, is convicted of the murder of a snooping reporter (imdb)

After commitment-phobic Dr. Danny Maccabee (Adam Sandler) falsely tells his young girlfriend (Brooklyn Decker) that he has a wife and family, she eventually grows suspicious and demands that he provide proof of his purported wedded state. Backed into a corner, the doctor recruits his divorced office manager (Jennifer Aniston) and her kids to perform as his wife and family -- generating a flood of farcical results and unintended consequences.
film.quote: The two kids and Sandler's cousin are the funny parts. The rest is not funny nor entertaining, and some scenes go on way too long. Mostly meh, with some really funny parts few and far between.

film.summary: The relationships of three men are examined through their use of technology.
film.quote: I have yet to see a mumblecore movie that did it for me. Now, I've only seen two and they've both been Swanberg movies, so I haven't exactly dug deep. Kissing on the Mouth was an almost recommendation, but this just sucked. I don't know what it is, I did not remotely care about these characters, so it kind of fails in what mumblecore is normally known for: character studies.

film.summary: The cocaine cowboys of the 80's are gone, but Miami's Casablanca allure, the undercover cops and the attitudes of Michael Mann's culturally influential television series have been enhanced by time in the feature film version of Miami Vice. (Universal Pictures)
film.quote: This wouldn't have gotten even a 30 if I didn't laugh so much at how bad it is. I just can't bring myself to rate it lower because of the cheesy (not in a good way) editing, the poor performances and everything else that makes me and my friend laugh whenever we think of it.

film.summary: Young Frank and his pals get an idea for the ultimate in excitement. They decide to pool their savings, bicycle to the nearby Big City, and hire some woman of the streets to strip for them. (imdb)

Tom Cruise returns as Special Agent Ethan Hunt, who faces the mission of his life and a new villain (Hoffman) in Mission: Impossible III. Director J. J. Abrams ("Lost," "Alias") brings his unique blend of action and drama to the billion-dollar franchise. (Paramount Pictures)
film.quote: The final nail in the coffin for the original movie, which I liked a lot. This is a continuation of the action based direction the second one took, only this one had boring action. Only thing it really had going for it was an excellent, cruel villain played by Hoffman.

film.summary: The Ghost Dimension, follows a new family, The Fleeges - father Ryan, mother Emily and their young daughter Leila - Who move into a house and discover a video camera and a box of tapes in the garage. When they look through the camera's lens, they begin to see the paranormal activity happening around them - including the re-emergence of young Kristi and Katie. (imdb)
film.quote: For any good there is bad. Makes sense that they don't put the camera down because the spirit camera allows them to see what's going on, but what you see isn't great, and the demon doesn't look threatening. The plot wraps up nicely, but it shouldn't have taken this long to do it (money money money). Jump scares with no buildup, it is way too reliant on 3D to the point of obnoxiousness. We'll always have the first PA, at least.

film.summary: Abstract short of men working on an assembly line.
film.quote: "Hey ma, I got myself one of these moving video camera things, can I go film dad at work?" "Why yes son, you can, but make sure to put this music over the footage, in order to make it kind of cool and make sure to keep it short, so it doesn't overstay its welcome, because that'll up the rating a little bit on Criticker." "Criticker? What's that, ma?" "Never mind son, eat your veggies."

film.summary: A sausage strives to discover the truth about his existence. (imdb)
film.quote: Sure, it has a mind and explores religious themes pretty heavily, and sure, it has a food orgy... but none of this can mask how painfully unfunny it is. I laughed maybe 3 times, and that's because it suffered from the virus that so many comedies do: it just get shoving moment after moment into my face and the jokes never breathed, nor were they amusing. I don't know if I'm disappointed but I was hoping Goldberg and Rogen would do better than this.

film.summary: This contemporary supernatural thrilled, set largely in the dark atmospheric backwoods just outside of New Orleans, stars Hudson as a live-in nurse hired to care for an elderly woman's (Rowlands) ailing husband (Hurt) in their home...a foreboding and decrepit mansion in the Louisiana delta. (Universal Pictures)
A training exercise for the LAPD SWAT Team goes terribly wrong when they find themselves pitted against two rival gangs while trapped in an abandoned Hangar, armed with nothing but blanks. (imdb)
film.quote: I love Stone Cold. This is one of those awful awful action movies that try to build suspense/action/thrills by being completely stupid. No, I don't want a realistic movie, I just want decent writing. Yes, even action movies should have decent writing... a script that moves the action along in an interesting way. Some cliches are allowed, so is some dumbness, but this is every second. "Eat my grandma" was a line, unless I misheard. Seriously. And what's with MMArtists being in shitty movies?

film.summary: With their collective eye on a $20 million payoff, a motley crew of bank robbers (including Paul Walker, Michael Ealy, Chris Brown and T.I.) get busy planning out their next heist. But a detective (Matt Dillon) who's obsessed with his work is just as obsessed with making sure the thieves never pull off their scheme.
film.quote: I love Idris Elba and always love seeing him in a gangster/criminal role (you know, cuz of the Wire). Unfortunately I also hate Chris Brown and TI deserved to be hit by Brown. Ultimately this movie fails to be a more serious Oceans 11 (which it wanted to be).

film.summary: A teenage girl risks everything when she falls in love with a vampire.
film.quote: Hahaha, what do I give this? It was unintentionally hilarious. I wanted to like this, I really did, because haters can be dumb. But this movie was awful. Bad acting, bad script (no character development... people just say shit), horrible special effects, lameness galore, some awkward choices of music, etc. What has Twilight contributed to the world? The song Decode, and even that took too long to arrive. I give this a 30 for it's hilarity though, me and my girl cracked up.

film.summary: A young woman fights the spirit that is slowly taking possession of her.
film.quote: Just really fucking forgettable. Hot girl, I really like Idris Elba (mainly cuz of the Wire) and Gary Oldman is cool. It has an occasional inspired moment. Too many cheap scares, an unbelievable script (draw me into your movie universe), some really stupid scenes. But at least we get girl in underwear.

film.summary: A pair of losers try to pretend that their murdered employer is really alive, but the murderer is out to "finish him off." (imdb)
film.quote: Probably could have been pretty funny had it not stretched out to feature length.

film.filmname: What Happened on Twenty-third Street, New York City (1901)
film.summary: A winner and sure to please. In front of one of the largest newspaper offices is a hot air shaft through which immense volumes of air are forced by a blower... (imdb)
film.quote: That one person who mostly stands off to the left is the most compelling character in cinema, ever. What is he thinking? What does his presence symbolize? He looms over the action, watching, observing... he's like the guy from The Decalogue, only 87 years early. 87... Decebalus becomes king of Dacia in 87, he waged 3 wars and negotiated peace twice... which means, that guy is an allegory for how we have war and peace in our hearts! I cracked the Da Vinci Code!

film.summary: Two African-American men trying to pass themselves off as very, very, very white women? Sounds preposterous. But with the help of an FBI friend, who just happens to be a genius with make-up, that&#039;s exactly what the hapless Marcus and Kevin Copeland (Marlon and Shawn Wayans) do when they go undercover as Hamptons&#039; socialites Tiffany and Brittany Wilson. (Sony Pictures)
film.quote: I won't completely shit over this because it has some heart and a few laughs. But it's still not even close to being a good film.

film.summary: Nick Wild is a Las Vegas bodyguard with lethal professional skills and a personal gambling problem. When a friend is beaten by a sadistic thug, Nick strikes back, only to find out the thug is the son of a powerful mob boss. Suddenly Nick is plunged into the criminal underworld, chased by enforcers and wanted by the mob. Having raised the stakes, Nick has one last play to change his fortunes...and this time, it's all or nothing. (imdb)
film.quote: Wild Card is a mess. Sloppy, terrible script and Statham phoning it in. He doesn't kick a lot of ass so don't go in expecting that... but when he does it's relatively entertaining, except the final fight which is pretty repetitive and unoriginal. I just ultimately didn't give a s hit at all about what was going on, the internal logic seemed off.

film.summary: A burglar falls for an heiress as she dies in his arms. When he learns that he has the gift of reincarnation, he sets out to save her. (imdb)
film.quote: What a piece of arse. Ultimately I just couldn't care; I didn't believe the romance. I think the casting was off on this or maybe they just phoned it in. Maybe a bit of both, though there were a couple decent moments.It was 2 hours and it seemed like an eternity. The dialogue was hokey and instead of being poetic it was cheesy and wooden. They take an hour establishing the central relationship that causes all this but it still felt forced. Decently shot though.

film.summary: Wolverine lives a mutant life, seeks revenge against Victor Creed (who will later become Sabertooth) for the death of his girlfriend, and ultimately ends up going through the mutant Weapon X program. (imdb)
film.quote: To be honest, all I wanted was a cool Deadpool/Wade and at first it seemed like they were doing alright but then it went bad. Almost everything about this movie is crap, except for a couple good performances (among some bad ones). The first 20 mins or so were genuinely interesting.

film.summary: Charlie is a Rhode Island state trooper with a split personality. He is otherwise mild-mannered and non confrontational until somebody or something pushes him a little too far. That's when his maniacal alter-ego, Hank, takes over. Charlie is assigned on a routine mission to return alleged fugitive Irene back to upstate New York, but they wind up on the run from corrupt police officers. And their escape would be a lot simpler on everybody involved if Hank didn't keep stepping in at the most inopportune times... (imdb)

Set in a future-world where humans can control other humans in mass-scale, multi-player online gaming environments, a star player (Butler) from a game called "Slayers" looks to regain his independence while taking down the game's mastermind (Hall).
film.quote: You can tell they've played games but outside of that there's very little. The movie tries to overload your senses but then ultimately becomes boring. I don't know how these people consistently do that... Crank bored me too. No memorable characters, and whatever satire there may be is basic at best. Some decent action here and there. The idea of the movie is interesting but then I wonder if it could even work as more than just a mild curiousity. It certainly didn't work as a feature length.

film.summary: Jack Black stars as Ignacio (friends call him Nacho), a cook by day in a Mexican orphanage, who moonlights as a lucha libre wrestler to raise money for the orphans in this comedy from the creators of "Napoleon Dynamite" and the writer of "The School of Rock." (Paramount)
film.quote: A mostly awful comedy with a scene or two that made me laugh. This is Jack Black being overly annoying.

film.summary: A remake of the 1976 horror classic The Omen (1976), an American official realizes that his young son may literally be the devil incarnate. (imdb)
film.quote: Pointless remake.

film.summary: After his partner is brutally murdered by the infamous assassin Rogue, FBI agent Jack Crawford vows to find the elusive killer and personally avenge his partner's death. But Rogue proves untraceable until three years later, when he resurfaces to ignite a bloody turf war between Chinese mob leader Chang and Japanese Yakuza boss Shiro. Eager to capture Rogue once and for all, Crawford leads his team of crime specialists headlong into the conflict... (Lion's Gate)
film.quote: It didn't have nearly enough of what it set out to do and what it did show in terms of action/fight sequences was really tame. Two good action stars, one bad movie. (How hip am I with the two girls one cup reference?)
