film.summary: Two brothers have half of a powerful ancient Chinese talisman. An evil gang leader has the other half, and determines to get the brothers&#039; half and have a complete medallion so he can gain absolute power. (imdb)
Sarah Michelle Gellar stars as Joanna Mills, a tough young Midwesterner determined to learn the truth behind the increasingly terrifying supernatural visions that have been haunting her.
Batman must battle Two-Face and The Riddler with help of an amourous psychologist and a young circus acrobat who becomes his sidekick, Robin

Milo (Gerard Butler) is a bounty hunter whose latest gig is a doozy, as he finds out too late that the bail-skipper he must chase down is his own ex-wife, Nicole (Jennifer Aniston), and she has no intention of coming in without a fight. Complicating matters, Nicloe's wannabe-boyfriend joins the chase in this high-octane comedy from director Andy Tennant.
film.quote: It felt a lot longer than it was, these two didn't have any chemistry and the script tried too hard. Yet, it's not quite as bad as people seem to be saying and it certainly isn't as bad as my PSI indicated (1? Really?). There are better rom-coms, and some of them are even this year. Go watch Going the Distance.

film.summary: 8 years after the disappearance of Cassandra, some disturbing indications seem to indicate that she's still alive. Police, parents and Cassandra herself, will try to unravel the mystery of her disappearance. (imdb)
film.quote: The main villain was so over the top. His looks also screamed pedo/villain. Anyway, besides that, people just didn't act believable at all, especially the one cop who was so irrational it was pathetic. Even the drama didn't make me feel anything. This should be a crushing tale because the subject matter is, but there was no depth here. No emotion. The script let this one down hard, but the atmosphere was pretty awesome. Snowy Canada is a dark, depressing place. perfect for a movie like this.

film.summary: Eight unsuspecting high school seniors playing a game of lies come face-to-face with terror and learn that nobody believes a liar -- even when they&#39;re telling the truth. (Rogue Pictures)
film.quote: Spoiled shitheads try to be edgy by playing games of lies and the like, followed by people turning up dead. Shit.

film.summary: Two separate pairs of voluptuous women are stalked at different times by a scarred stuntman who uses his "death proof" cars to execute his murderous plans.
film.quote: Tarantino let me down with this. Aside from the classy ending, there just isn't anything to recommend here. A failed experiment.

film.summary: The producers who took audiences on a &#034;Road Trip&#034; and back to &#034;Old School&#034; now invite you on a wild Eurotrip. (DreamWorks)
film.quote: This wasn't funny at all but at least it wasn't scared to show a ton of penises.

film.summary: Set, the merciless god of darkness, has taken over the throne of Egypt and plunged the once peaceful and prosperous empire into chaos and conflict. Few dare to rebel against him. A young thief, whose love was taken captive by the god, seeks to dethrone and defeat Set with the aid of the powerful god Horus. (imdb)
film.quote: Undeniably bad, with very little to praise. I guess you could say that some of the CGI is cool--or at least the designs are kinda neat--but a majority of the time it's pretty bad. Couple that with a terrible script and bad acting and you kinda wonder what they did with the huge budget. I'm not even offended by the whitewashing, but I can see why people would be. I'm more upset that Proyas made such a turd, because I think he's a very underrated director. This movie tries things but fails hard.

film.summary: "The Masked Saint" is based on a true story about one pastor's mission to help his community by risking his identity and returns to his former life as a wrestler. The triumphant story follows one man's journey and struggle between helping others and the consequences he faces doing this.
film.quote: Unfortunately it falls victim to the same problems that many faith-based films do; storytelling is secondary to the sermons and lessons, to the point that it's mostly cheesy and stupid, no finesse. And the way pro-wrestling is treated is especially lame. When he says he's been wearing a mask in the ring and people in his church got offended I cringed. Chris solves all problems with kindness so there's no real drama. Can't hate on the message, but an uplifting scene or two can't save this farce.

film.summary: Follows disillusioned young family man John as a mysterious stranger, Richie takes him on a murder-fueled ride that transforms the weak-willed John into a desperate hero willing to go to any length to protect his family.
film.quote: Sam Jackson is pretty much the only good part about this. The plot is just kind of silly. In fact, the whole movie is. That would be great if it wasn't so serious in its attempt to say the world is a shitty place. The dialogue is so bad a lot of the time (but Sam does have some good lines) and along with that, there's some horrible delivery of said lines, especially by the male cop, whatever his name was.

film.filmname: A Million Ways to Die in the West (2014)
film.summary: As a cowardly farmer begins to fall for the mysterious new woman in town, he must put his new-found courage to the test when her husband, a notorious gun-slinger, announces his arrival. (imdb)
film.quote: Blah. Seth has this habit of working on extremes. Sometimes he takes it too far and it reeks of trying too hard. Unfortunately, while Ted worked well because of this, A Million Ways was hard to sit through, watching them try to push the envelope over and over again just got tiring. The writing was just not solid, the jokes were not setup well, and even the delivery was just cheesy and stupid sometimes. There were a few laughs, but not even Liam Neeson's butt could save this.

film.summary: After hunting down and killing hundreds of violent criminals, Frank Castle, aka The Punisher, faces his most deadly foe yet: Jigsaw. (imdb)
film.quote: The beginning action sequence was aaaawful. In fact, I don't think there was a decent action sequence until the end which was pretty decent. The acting was horrible, for the most part (except for The Punisher). I appreciate dark humour but I really didn't see much of it. I just saw lame scene after lame scene. It was pretty dark but the gore was just there to be gore, and that gets boring. I wish I could appreciate it as unintentional hilarity but it wasn't even funny enough for that.

film.summary: A group of friends become involved in a potentially deadly diamond heist. (imdb)
film.quote: 50 Cent doesn't have the acting ability to make this a serious drama like they want. The story has been done a million times and there are some seriously stupid moments. Maybe with some decent writing and good acting from the lead, this could be a recommendation or at least close. But it's not, and the music really pushes how SERIOUS it's trying to be but again, it fails.

film.summary: When five sorority girls inadvertently cause the murder of one of their sisters in a prank gone wrong, they agree to keep the matter to themselves and never speak of it again, so they can get on with their lives. This proves easier said than done, when after graduation a mysterious killer goes after the five of them and anyone who knows their secret. (RottenTomatoes)
film.quote: This movie is lucky my hormones are out of control lately. The eye candy actually knocked this up some points. Besides that it's pretty much crap with maybe a good scene or two.

film.summary: A send-up of superhero films, from Batman Begins to Fantastic Four. (imdb)
film.quote: Leslie Nielson, good Tom Cruise impression and a plot gives this thing a plot. But the laughs are too few and far between, the slapstick is mostly awful and I didn't think most of the references were any good. Still better than the other Movie Movies, though.

film.summary: What happens when one man decides to embellish his online status? (imdb)
film.quote: It has a point I guess, about how sometimes I suppose people can glorify and manipulate their life on Facebook to make it seem more appealing... but I honestly don't think people exaggerate it like he did, even if they do it. Most people, at least on my FB, seem pretty legit and if you say "my life sucks..." then people will generally comment (if you're popular. Nobody likes me so they won't). Not funny, not really that dramatic either.

film.summary: People have always searched for a way to communicate with the other side - fascinated, motivated, driven to find a way to connect with loved ones who have passed on. Now comes this suspense thriller that explores this very-real, other-worldly communication - White Noise. Tapping into our deepest fears and most profound longings, White Noise forces us to re-examine the world in which we live and, in the process, question our most basic notions about life and death. (Universal)

It was supposed to be the vacation of a lifetime in the Australian Outback -- full of fun, sun and adventure. But what happened to a trio of twenty-something backpackers took a wrenching detour into the depths of unrelenting terror. Based on true events, Wolf Creek is the haunting story of their unthinkable ordeal -- a mounting white-knuckle nightmare so real it was destined to become horror legend. (Dimension Films)

Dreamcatcher, the film based on Stephen King&#039;s best-selling novel, tells of four young friends who perform a heroic act -- and are changed forever by the uncanny powers they gain in return. Years later the friends, now men, are on a hunting trip in the Maine woods when they are overtaken by a blizzard, a vicious storm in which something much more ominous moves&#8230; (Warner Bros.)
film.quote: Can't help but laugh at the very premise of this movie. Couldn't take any of this seriously.

film.summary: It was bound to happen, sooner or later. The raucous and lovable characters from the wildly successful American Pie series have gone and done it -- well they&#039;re planning on doing it. Really soon. In front of everyone they know. In a big way. Jim (Biggs) and Michelle (Hannigan) are getting married. (Universal Pictures)
Dennis, everyone&#039;s favorite kid from the comics is back. When his parents have to go out of town, he stays with Mr and Mrs Wilson... (imdb)
"21" is the fact-based story about six MIT students who were trained to become experts in card counting and subsequently took Vegas casinos for millions in winnings. (imdb)
A thriller about a college professor who, while moonlighting as a forensic psychiatrist for the FBI, receives a death threat telling him that he has only 88 minutes to live. (ifilm.com)
film.quote: God the villain is an annoying actress. What's her real name? I want to stay away from her.

film.summary: A moronic gas station attendant is seduced by a woman in a story that runs parallel to the opera "Carmen".
film.quote: 1: I know what it's like to be used for taco sauce, gas and ding dongs. 2: The bitch had it coming. But besides these two things, what the hell? Maybe I'm being overly sensitive in a comedy, but this just seems mean spirited. He's not a "moron," he comes across more as having legit mental problems. I chuckled a bit at like, two parts, but the laughter was very mild, and it wasn't at Joey and how HAHA HE'S A MORON he is. This is kind of a shit short.

film.summary: Graced with a velvet voice, 21-year-old Violet Sanford (Perabo) heads to New York to pursue her dream of becoming a songwriter only to find her aspirations sidelined by the accolades and notoriety she receives at her &#034;day&#034; job as a barmaid at Coyote Ugly. (Touchstone Pictures)

When he hears that the new female employee digs ambitious men who are the store employee of the month, a slacker gets his act together but finds himself in competition with his rival, an ambitious co-worker. (imdb)
Marvel&#039;s first family of comic superheroes takes the world by storm as the longest running comic book series in history comes to the big screen. (20th Century Fox)

film.filmname: Fantastic Four: Rise of the Silver Surfer (2007)
film.summary: Marvel's first family of superheroes, The Fantastic Four, meets their greatest challenge yet in The Rise of the Silver Surfer as the enigmatic, intergalactic herald, The Silver Surfer, comes to Earth to prepare for its destruction. (20th Century Fox)
film.quote: Too much crap, not enough Silver Surfer. No seriously, take the flaws of the first -- which were numerous -- and then make them worse, take a potentially cool character, wuss him up (outside of maybe 2 badass scenes) and then there you go. Off to the races!

film.summary: A brash young police detective (Dorff) joins forces with a beautiful, ambitious Department of Health researcher (McElhone) to find the answers behind the mysterious deaths of four people who each died 48 hours after logging on to the Internet site Feardotcom. (Warner Bros.)
After their high school basketball coach passes away, five good friends and former teammates reunite for a Fourth of July holiday weekend. (imdb)
film.quote: The movie just tries too hard. I mean, fuck Rob Schneider by default, but Chris Rock can do better. With a better, funnier cast I think this could have been much better. There are a few funny moments but way too many unfunny moments.

film.summary: When two kids play an old magic board-game they found, they release a man trapped for decades in it and a host of dangers that can only be stopped by finishing the game. (imdb)

When undercover cop Danny (Tony Schiena) gets framed on the job with illegal narcotics, he's sent to serve his time in prison, where he gets pulled into a dangerous subculture of underground cage fighting. But he can't reveal his true identity to anyone. Vinnie Jones co-stars in this gritty actioner as Anton Vargas, a tough-talking former Mafia boss turned inmate who runs the place like a well-oiled machine.
film.quote: Better than Shawshank. Here's my problem... Rashad Evans is seen throwing punches in this movie but he doesn't throw punches anymore. Zing! But seriously, shit movie. The acting is awful and made even worse by the fact the script is amazingly bad. Nothing really works in this... it definitely isn't a "gritty actioner." It tries to be but fails. I actually enjoy seeing Kimbo Slice and Vinnie Jones, though.

film.summary: Framed for assassinating the Grandmaster, the Lost Ninja Clan must battle their way up an underground nuclear bunker filled with hordes of supernatural enemies, mutants and flesh eating zombies. Trapped a thousand feet below the earth's crust, these ninjas will face hell. (imdb)
film.quote: It's like they thought ninjas are cool, zombies are cool, apocalypses are cool, and they threw it all together. Why are zombies in this though, honestly? Besides that, it's just terribly written with wooden acting. It makes little to no sense and the action is sometimes okay but other times is just boring and shot so poorly it was hard to get into it. We live in a time where &quot;bad&quot; movies get forgiven but this is just bad. It's not so bad and cheesy it's good, it's just terrible.

film.summary: Two teens battle their way through a religious apocalypse on a mission to defeat the Antichrist. (imdb)
film.quote: Pretty much came for Kendricks, left disappointed because its really just not funny and a waste of a good premise.

film.summary: The Undead Apocalypse continues unabated as super-soldier Alice (Milla Jovovich) finds her way to a supposed sanctuary in Los Angeles, which may just be a deadly trap set for her by the ruthless Umbrella Corporation. The fourth film in Paul W.S. Anderson's blood-soaked saga finds Alice teaming up with Claire (Ali Larter) and Chris (Wentworth Miller) and a handful of stragglers to save what's left of humanity.
film.quote: Outside of a scene or two that was good... this is uh... stupid. Not stupid in the entertaining way, just stupid.

film.summary: When a young doctor suspects she may not be alone in her new Brooklyn loft, she learns that her landlord has formed a frightening obsession with her.
film.quote: There were some decent scenes and whatnot but it becomes awful.

film.summary: A mysterious killer video tape is circulating around. One look at this tape and you have seven days left to live. News Reporter Cindy Campbell (Faris) witnesses this video tape and tries to work out a way to prevent her death. But this is not the only mystery to appear. Crop circles have been appearing in the local farm of Tom (Sheen) and George (Rex). With help from Aunt Shaneequa (Latifah), Cindy suspects that the aliens may be linked with the killer tape and must now work out both mysteries before it's the end of the world. (imdb)
film.quote: The sad thing is, that if the people involved in directing and writing were living up to their own standards they set years ago, then this would be a good/great movie. But it's not, and it only has one or two funny gags.

film.summary: A horny teenager brings his friends along on a road trip from Chicago to Knoxville to lose his virginity with a girl he met online.
film.quote: Blah, Seth Green doesn't save this. It has a few funny moments, the lead actress really is attractive and the acting was decent enough. But there comes a point where you have to pull out (ho ho, I made a sex joke) and just let the comedy breathe. They just throw joke after joke and very few of them stick. And the film has no real heart. You can make a silly movie with some kind of life to it. Mostly everything just falls flat.

film.summary: When Jay (Jason Segel) and Annie (Cameron Diaz) first got together, their romantic connection was intense - but ten years and two kids later, the flame of their love needs a spark. To kick things up a notch, they decide - why not? - to make a video of themselves trying out every position in The Joy of Sex in one marathon three-hour session. It seems like a great idea - until they discover that their most private video is no longer private. (imdb)
film.quote: Just a terrible attempt at raunchy comedy. Segel and Diaz don't have much chemistry, and it just throws curse words at us and expects us to laugh. It also fails as being romantic and seems content to do everything it canto be cliche as possible.

film.summary: Hal Larsen is the ultimate shallow guy. He finds beauty only in supermodels and centerfolds. But after an impromptu hypnosis by self-help guru Tony Robbins, Hal&#039;s view of women makes a 180-degree turn; he now sees their true inner beauty. (Twentieth Century Fox)

When young Jin Kazama (John Foo) discovers an opportunity to avenge the death of his mother, he enters a martial arts tournament sponsored by the futuristic Tekken Corp. to gain access to the man he wants to punish. But as Kazama closes in on his goal, he uncovers dark secrets regarding his own past and the true nature of Tekken.
film.quote: It actually started off pretty promising I thought. I thought, "Hey, why does everyone hate this? This isn't so bad." Then the movie proved me wrong. The plot became stupid, fights became dull, acting was always kinda bad anyway. Just a shit movie.

film.summary: Set in Sin City, story revolves around two people who discover they've gotten married following a night of debauchery, with one of them winning a huge jackpot after playing the other's quarter. Unhappy pair try to undermine each other and get their hands on the money -- falling in love along the way. (imdb)
film.quote: I actually kind of dug the beginning but then it just went to shit. I have no fancy words or explanations, it just wasn't funny or charming after a while.

film.summary: The largest storm to hit Oklahoma in more than half a century is brewing, and it promises to drop multiple twisters into Tornado Alley. It&#039;s the storm that two rival groups of scientists have been waiting for to earn their place in meteorological history. (Warner Bros.)
film.quote: Yeah so it's crap. As a kid though I had a crush on Helen Hunt.

film.summary: Karen Davis (Gellar) is an American Nurse moves to Tokyo and encounter a supernatural spirit who is vengeful and often possesses its victims. A series of horrifying and mysterious deaths start to occur, with the spirit passing its curse onto each victim. Karen must now find away to break this spell, before she becomes its next victim. (imdb)
film.quote: This is an awful movie that makes you laugh. So as an unintentional comedy it's at least a 70, but as a horror movie it fails miserably. The cat kid is hilarious, not scary. The various sounds in this movie are the same way. Ahhhhhhhhh, or whatever the fuck it is.

film.summary: Because of an unusual aging disorder that has aged him four times faster than a normal human being, a boy enters the fifth grade for the first time with the appearance of a 40 year old man. (imdb)

Bo Laramie is a movie star who has finally achieved success. But success comes at a price, in the form of four persistent photographers known as the paparazzi. Using their dishonest methods of getting the money shot regardless of what it takes, they'll stop at nothing in exploiting Bo for every last penny...
A simple tale of two people who lose their minds while trying to hold on to the elusive American dream. (Sony Pictures)

Deep in the heart of the African jungle, a baby named George, the sole survivor of a plane crash, is raised by gorillas. George grows up to be a buff and lovable klutz who has a rain forest full of animal friends. When poachers mess with George&#039;s pals, the King Of Swing swings into action. (Disney)
film.quote: I like the theme song. Yeah.

film.summary: Beethoven the St. Bernard dog becomes a father, but his girlfriend Missy is dog-napped, and his puppies are in danger of the same fate. (imdb)

film.filmname: Film in Which There Appear Edge Lettering, Sprocket Holes, Dirt Particles, Etc. (1966)
film.summary: Film in which there appear edge lettering, sprocket holes, dirt particles, etc.
film.quote: Well the ideas behind is are nice. You even think it's neat in the first minute... not 6. It goes into "Shit" territory. Watch it for 30 seconds and then you got the general idea. So points for the ideas expressed, no matter how abstract, and points for it being ballsy.

film.summary: Special Agent Ross's (Randy Couture) plans to reconcile with his ex-fianc+ª are ruined when she boards a private jet that is targeted by hijackers working for the same crime lord he is chasing. With no time to inform his team, Ross wriggles his way aboard the aircraft and risks it all to save the love of his life. An adrenaline fueled action packed film that puts the fear back in flying! (amazon.com)
film.quote: I hate to say it because I want him to be successful in movies, but Couture is a problem here. He lacks great acting ability at this point in his career... in a movie like The Expendables he's surrounded by action stars so he's not a "leading man," plus he needs a competent director to manage him. This movie doesn't have that. There's no tension, bad dialogue, run-of-the-mill plot, a couple wasted cast members like Holt and Vinnie. Terrible all around.

film.filmname: The Man with the Iron Fists 2 (2015)
film.summary: When a stranger, Thaddeus, is found badly wounded near the village, miner Li Kung and his wife Ah Ni offer him refuge. As he heals, he becomes entrenched in a conflict that pits the townsfolk against the evil Master Ho, his nefarious Beetle Clan and the terrifying Lord Pi. (imdb)
film.quote: Having actually kinda liked the first one, despite its flaws, this is a disappointment. I wasn't expecting greatness but all I got was boring fights, terrible acting and an uninspired plot. I like Rza, and enjoy the premise, but this is mostly terrible.

film.summary: An experimental short reflecting on the iconic power of Mickey Mouse and commenting on the cultural and sentimental value placed on commercial merchandise. (mediaartists.org)
film.quote: I get it. I don't think it does a particularly great job at doing it, but I know what is going on. I mostly gave it some points because I laughed in the beginning when Mickey was making a motion like he was jerking his little mouse dick. I laughed more when there were two of 'em side by side. I'm simple like that. But then the rest is just Mickey glory shots. Neat choice of music though, Anger is generally fun in that regard.

film.summary: A young Greek woman falls in love with a non-Greek and struggles to get her family to accept him while she comes to terms with her heritage and cultural identity. (imdb)
film.quote: My big fat greek SUCK! I'm here all week..... trying to figure out funnier ways to diss this movie....

film.summary: When aliens misinterpret video feeds of classic arcade games as a declaration of war, they attack the Earth in the form of the video games. (imdb)
film.quote: It actually consistently insults its audience, which is gamers obviously, calling us losers and not understanding how crucial games are to people TODAY (they say Sandler's skills are outdated at one point). Besides that, well, it's part of it... but it's just lazy jokes. Another Sandler joint that fails horribly. The visuals are kinda neat though, and nostalgia is okay if there's something built around it -- which there isn't. But I still like seeing Tetris destroy buildings!

film.summary: A group of friends whose leisurely Mexican holiday takes a turn for the worse when they, along with a fellow tourist embark on a remote archaeological dig in the jungle, where something evil lives among the ruins. (imdb)
film.quote: It had a moment of two that was pretty good but it had forced drama, and I really wasn't buying somethings from it. I went from a mild recommendation to not recommending it but only missing the mark by a bit to definitely not recommending it. This was like torture porn with no real scares.

film.summary: The story picks up seven years after the first film when little sister Samantha Darko and her best friend Corey are now 18 and on a roadtrip to Los Angeles when they are plagued by bizarre visions. (imdb)
film.quote: CASH IN! The cinematography has its moments, the script is bad and the actors are about as bad as the script. Where's the interaction or the chemistry? Where's the half intelligent dialogue or plot? The music usage is mixed, so it has its moments as well. Since it's a sequel maybe it should expand on the Donnie Darko universe but it really doesn't. Just a bunch of events (really... remade from DD) loosely linked together, but what's the reasoning behind it? The more I write the more I hate it.

film.summary: What do you get when you mix fearless comedic genius with the latest box-office blockbusters? You guessed it. The Scary Movie gang is back with the most hilarious and irreverent installment yet. (The Weinstein Company)
film.quote: Around Scary Movie 3 (I think), these started really losing their character. This is the worst of 'em.

film.summary: To grow up in America is to, at one point or another, rebel against the world around you. If you're Stevo (Lillard) and you live in Reagan-era Salt Lake City, then, well...you just have to rebel a little bit harder. To this recent grad, the world is his enemy, anarchy his religion, and the Ramones, The Specials and the Dead Kennedys his muses. As he takes us on a guided tour of his life, we meet all sorts of punks, poseurs, mods, freaks and a few others best described as indescribable. (Sony Pictures Classics)
film.quote: A movie which has unfortunately tainted a wonderful ideology. It's rarely entertaining. I can't help but watch it and cringe at a lot of it.

film.summary: Maria Altmann, an octogenarian Jewish refugee, takes on the government to recover artwork she believes rightfully belongs to her family. (imdb)
film.quote: Competently shot, well acted, with a bit of emotion near the end. But none of that matters because it's so boring. I fell asleep briefly, I woke up and things were still going on that I couldn't possibly care about. The Nazi parts were about what you'd expect, though I didn't care for the washed out colours (wasn't a necessary stylistic choice for the flashbacks). Agreed with Matthew Parkinson that it would have worked better as a documentary.

film.summary: 3 backpackers are in Amsterdam where they get locked out of their youth hostel. They are invited into a man's house where he tells them of a hostel somewhere in eastern Europe where the women are all incredibly hot and have a taste for American men. When they get there, everything is too good to be true - the hostel is "to die for" (imdb)
What seemed like a breezy idea for an engineer to net him millions of dollars, leaves him on the run for his life and piecing together why he's being chased. (imdb)
A high-tech action drama set in the dangerous, exhilarating world of open-wheel racing, Driven centers on the lives and careers of four drivers chasing the ultimate adrenaline rush. (Warner Brothers)
film.quote: A bore.

film.filmname: I Still Know What You Did Last Summer (1998)
film.summary: The screamer sequel to the blood-chilling box office hit &#034;I Know What You Did Last Summer.&#034; (Sony)
film.quote: Still Dre. Oh wait, that has nothing to do with this. Well, go listen to that song, anyway.

film.summary: A mercenary is killed, but comes back from Hell as a reluctant soldier of the Devil. (imdb)
film.quote: How somebody takes such a good character as Spawn and completely screws it up is beyond me. This comes off as campy even though it's going for a serious tone. The special effects weren't great to begin with and they don't hold up now, except for maybe the cape, which seems to be where all the effort was put. 80 for the cape.

film.summary: The polar ice caps have melted, and the earth is covered by water. The remaining people travel the seas, in search of survival. Several different societies exist. The Mariner falls from his customary and solitary existence into having to care for a woman and a young girl while being pursued by the evil forces of the Deacon. (imdb)
film.quote: See, there are things you can kind of like but the rest is bad and you never get to the unintentional hilarity so it's just a bad movie. A shame, really, when something like Twilight is better.

film.summary: It's been three years since Austin Powers, that swinging international man of mystery, has faced his arch-nemesis, Dr. Evil. But after Dr. Evil and his accomplice Mini Me escape from a maximum-security prison, Austin is called to action once more in this third installment of the highly successful "Austin Powers" movie franchise. (New Line Cinema)

Bud and Doyle stumble on what appears to be the opening of an ultra-modern shopping mall and duck in. Too late, they discover that they've compromised an experimental environmentally-controlled scientific community and they are sealed in for a solid year.
A group of Porn Filmmakers are systematically attacked by 2 children on the set of a remote shoot. (imdb)
film.quote: So awful. The film centers around pornstars and whatnot, and the acting is about that level. In porn it's forgivable, in a non-porn film, it's not. It's completely by the books, only it's a shitty written book. There's no flow, no fear, no good performances. Everything that happens is stupid.

film.summary: Owen never learned about sex or relationships from his parents, since they turned into cats. But today, with the help of a human girl, Owen is going to learn a lot. (imdb)
film.quote: I just don't see the point. It's not funny in the least, and it's just awkward. It's trying to say something about sexuality and it relies heavily on being &quot;weird&quot; but there isn't much going on. It's a shame because I feel like the premise could be good if done better. The sex scene at the end with hands coming out of their underwear is just stupid.

film.summary: Given incredible power by an ancient Celtic Cross. Callan continues to fight evil... Now, joined by a team of weapons experts, Callan battles an unstoppable empire in Los Angeles. (imdb)
film.quote: Hahaha so bad. I'll start with the good: Even though Vinnie Jones is in a lot of terrible movies, I still like the guy. The bad... everything else. At first I thought this was going to be a comedic take on comic books, so that was fine... but the movie is trying to be serious (minus a few jokes here and there). It tries to be stylish but looks cheap, the action is boring, the acting is mostly piss poor and it's just shit in general.

film.summary: An experimental film by Toshio Matsumoto
film.quote: I don't like this. I'm assuming the idea is that you go on acid, which okay, whatever. But I don't feel like risking a bad hit just to watch a movie. It gets so ungodly boring a couple minutes in. Why this had to be so long is beyond me. It's similar, psychedelic images over and over again. Do drugs, maybe this will be a 90. I don't know.

film.summary: In New York City, a young counterfeiter (Tatum) is introduced to the world of underground street fighting by a seasoned scam artist (Howard), who becomes his manager on the bare-knuckling brawling circuit. (imdb)
film.quote: This was an awful movie. There's really not much to say here. Never Back Down was better and Never Back Down was crap (though I enjoyed it... it's my boy... we all have those movies). Poor acting, poor chemistry between those actors and just a plot that didn't gel together very well makes it crap. Oh, and its attempt to be gritty. No, it's not gritty, it's a dude who can't act and seems to borrow mannerisms from Eminem, who gets in fights and emotes in a bad way. Skiiiiip.

film.summary: A dark comedy about a social media junkie who fakes his own death via social media just to see which of his "friends" will show up to the funeral. (imdb)
film.quote: There's a good satirical film to be made with this subject matter, but they've failed horribly. They play the main character way too over the top to the point of just plain dumb (as in not funny in the least), and every one else is played that way. Whatever good gags there are, and there may be one or two, are buried in all the crap. The movie tries way too hard to be funny and quirky, with a tacked on feel-good ending. Had they toned down the main character it coulda had heart and humor.

film.summary: Jimmy Duncan is a film director working on his fourth film but things are not exactly going as planned. (imdb)
film.quote: So this is supposed to be a horror comedy? I get the horror aspect, I don't really see the comedy, unless it's one of those &quot;intentionally bad&quot; movies. If it is, it still doesn't reach the greatness of other movies of that type. It's not that funny (it's just stupid, though I did chuckle once or twice) and everything is just really poor. Maybe that is the point, but I just didn't have a good time.

film.filmname: Mighty Morphin Power Rangers: The Movie (1995)
film.summary: The galactically feared, universally despised Ivan Ooze is released from a hyperlock chamber after six thousands years... (imdb)
film.quote: Feels like the TV show. Fond memories as a kid... opinion differs now. Doesn't survive the test of time like Ninja Turtles and other various things.

film.summary: When a missing page from the diary of John Wilkes Booth surfaces, Ben's great-great grandfather is suddenly implicated as a key conspirator in Abraham Lincoln's death. Determined to prove his ancestor's innocence, Ben follows an international chain of clues that takes him on a chase from Paris to London and ultimately back to America. This journey leads Ben and his crew not only to surprising revelations, but also to the trail of the world's most treasured secrets. (Walt Disney Pictures)
film.quote: While the first was actually pretty good, this fails on multiple levels. The story is poorly conceived and executed. Things just happen a little too conveniantly ruining any suspense/thrills that it could possibly have. Cage is okay, just being Cage. The action sequences are insanely boring and didn't make me fear for their lives at all. But I'm sure there's worse out there so hence the 10.

film.summary: Animal control officer Walter Sparrow (Carrey) has found a book he doesn&#039;t dare put down. By reading a mysterious novel, "The Number 23," given to him as a birthday gift by his wife, Walter twists his once placid existence into an inferno of psychological torture that could possibly lead him to his death and the deaths of his loved ones. And all because of a number: The Number 23. (New Line Cinema)
film.quote: The neo-noir aspects of the book were the ony good part. The rest of it is ridiculous. Let's face it, numerology can be fun and maybe it has a place in this world, but then there's this movie which takes it way too far.

film.summary: A son witnesses his father beat someone to death, then goes to jail at some point. Once he gets out of jail, he wants to change his life around, and finds out he has a son.
film.quote: It takes a potentially emotional premise, and shits all over it with a godawful script, shitty editing (the movie jumps around from moment to moment with no cohesion) and mostly bad acting (though I think the problems are more to do with the script... you just can't do justice no matter how good you are). When you're watching how people act in this movie, you're left wondering, 'Did I miss something?&quot; No, you didn't, stop beating yourself up over it. I like seeing Ed Harris and he was okay

film.summary: Jigsaw and his apprentice Amanda are dead. Upon the news of Detective Kerry's murder, two seasoned FBI profilers, Agent Strahm and Agent Perez, arrive at the depleted police precinct to help veteran Detective Hoffman sift through Jigsaw's latest grizzly game of victims, as well as piece together the puzzle. But then SWAT Commander Rigg, the last officer untouched by Jigsaw, is suddenly abducted... (Lionsgate)

The film follows the Spice Girls and their entourage (mostly fictional characters) - manager Clifford, his assistant Deborah, filmmaker Piers (who is trying to shoot a documentary on "the real Spice Girls") and others in their everyday life. (imdb)

A newlywed couple Ben and Jane move to Japan for a promising job opportunity - a fashion shoot in Tokyo. During their trip on a dark forest road they experience a tragic car accident, leading to the death of a young local girl. Upon regaining consciousness, they find no trace of her body. A bit distraught the couple arrives in Tokyo to begin their new life... (imdb)
film.quote: How could the director of the excellent Parasite Eve do this? It's not inventive at all, relies way too heavily on the same scare, and all I learned was that SPOILER SPOILER gay rape is bad END SPOILER END SPOILER. Nice.

film.summary: A random wrong number on his cell phone sends a young man into a high-stakes race against time to save a woman&#039;s life. (New Line Cinema)
film.quote: What is this? Me and my friend were in the theatre alone and if we were gay we could have made out and I wouldn't have felt bad for missing anything. This has a laughable script, bad acting, uninspired direction and a boring title. Plus much much more.

film.summary: As part of a routine mission, a unit of National Guard soldiers stops at a New Mexico outpost in order to deliver equipment to a group of atomic scientists. When they arrive at the isolated research camp, however, they find it is mysteriously deserted. After spotting a distress signal in a distant mountain range, the team decides to embark on a search and rescue mission into the hills in order to locate the missing scientists. (20th Century Fox)
Follows a struggling movie studio that's willing to do anything to make a mint - even if it means ruining their reputation, and running the movie industry into the ground. (imdb)
film.quote: The idea of the movie spoofing the people behind the shitty spoof movies we were getting flooded with is an okay idea. I mean, there have been a lot of shitty spoofs... but this isn't remotely clever. It's not fun sitting through a movie that's trying way too hard to be funny, just for a little laugh here and there. It's as fucking dumb as the movies it spoofs and no, that's not okay if it's 'the point.' Intentionally bad is a fine line, and it can work well, but it doesn't here.

film.summary: Oliver Stone has a quick conversation with a new found friend in a bathroom stall. (Funny or Die)
film.quote: Pretty terrible and unfunny.

film.summary: Shooting at the Moon is a short Super-8 punk/Remodernist film directed by Jesse Richards and Nicholas Watson, starring Matthew Quinn Martin (billed as Matthew Martin) as Buddy and Leila Laaraj as Lana, and features music by Billy Childish. (vimeo)
film.quote: Not really sure what the point is. Like, you get movies every now and again that aren't even poorly made from a technical standpoint but you watch it and you get absolutely nothing out of it. Not entertainment, nor did you feel/learn anything. This is one of those.

film.summary: Deuce Bigalow is a less than attractive, down on his luck aquarium cleaner. One day he runs into a male gigolo who asks him to look after his precious fish while he is away on business. However, he wrecks the house and needs quick money to repair it. The only way he can make it is to become a gigolo himself, taking on an unusual mix of female clients...
Batman, Robin and new crime fighting comrade Batgirl face Gotham City&#039;s deadliest threat yet when cold-hearted Mr. Freeze and venomous Poison Ivy team for some lethal mischief. (Warner Bros.)
film.quote: Greatest movie ever.

film.summary: A wildly diverse team of professionals journey into unknown regions of the earth in the hopes of detonating a nuclear device which they hope will reactivate the earth&#039;s core and restore balance to the planet. (Paramount)
film.quote: Armageddon going down. Down IN RATINGS! Ha! I'm so clever. No seriously, this movie is uninventive, typical, has poor acting mostly, failed to include me in what was going on and has a crappy title that reminds me of an apple.

film.summary: Jessica Spencer is convinced she has the perfect life. She's the hottest, most popular girl in high school, head cheerleader, and dating the dreamy quarterback. But she gets a big dose of reality when she wakes up in the body of a 30-year-old man (Schneider)! (Touchstone Pictures)
film.quote: Why the fuck does Schneider even try?

film.summary: The martial arts is not about all kinds of special agent Michael receives personally embarrassed by his boss ordered to infiltrate a gangster syndicate is suspected of acting to a large scale war with illegal weapons. So it is good that the daughter can make good use of a businessman just a bodyguard. Michael saves her life unselfishly and is promptly hired as a bodyguard. It turns out that his protegee is being blackmailed. Whether that has anything to do with the weapons? (The Pirate Bay)
film.quote: So I watched this dubbed; I don't like to do that because dubbing can really ruin something that's otherwise good. But to get the full effect of this movie, you should watch the crappy dubbed version, because the movie is so bad ANYWAY, that you might as well go that extra mile for it to be incredibly bad. Awful acting, a special power sub-plot that isn't explained (nobody seems to care that Mike walked off the set of X-Men), Awful script, blah blah. So unintentionally funny it hurts.

film.filmname: Paris Hilton Responds to McCain Ad (2008)
film.summary: An ad for The Paris Hilton Presidential Campaign.
film.quote: Oh I get it. It's Paris Hilton.

film.summary: The simple gesture of lighting a match fills the screen.
film.quote: Fuck off Yoko Ono. Who does this for that length of time? This is almost as bad as The Anarchist Cookbook.

film.summary: The big thing in 2005 is a violent sport which can have some pretty serious consequences... like dying. (imdb)

The fairytale rise to superstardom of America&#039;s favorite &#034;Idols&#034; continues as Kelly Clarkson and Justin Guarini make the leap to the big screen in this spring&#039;s biggest beach party, From Justin to Kelly, a musical romantic comedy. (20th Century Fox)
film.quote: I wish I could remember my score for Shutter off the top of my head. This is worse than that which is quite an accomplishment really. Ah, I'll just give it a 2 to be on the safe side.

film.summary: One lonely man, six billion sex-crazed vampires. Be careful what you wish for!
film.quote: My claim to fame is now that I added this masterpiece to the site. You're welcome Criticker. Honestly, I expected a bad movie and as sad as it is, I hoped -- and I know this is setting low standards -- for like, Seltzer/Friedberg level parody. I didn't even get that. This is a shit movie, but for those who want a little softcore porn in their parody, well there's plenty of that. I'm going to say about 30 minutes of it is spent watching softcore. The jokes are things like &quot;No way Jose!&quot;

film.summary: The Anarchist Collective and their crash pad known as SAM housed an idealistic assortment of unruly characters looking to make a difference and find a happier way of life. And then came Johnny Black... (Freedonia Productions)
film.quote: So if you're going to have a movie with characters that are basically a vehicle for whatever political beliefs you have, don't you think you should NOT fuck up what those beliefs are? This isn't anarchism. But it cleverly pretends to be, pulling you in with surface statements that actually slaughter the ideology once you see the context and where they go with it. As a MOVIE, it's completely amateur in the worst way possible. Looks like crap, feels like crap. Plot is crap. Characters are crap.

film.summary: Educational short showing how you should never show any emotions at the dinner table. (imdb)
film.quote: Almost as bad as Electrocuting an Elephant and right up there with The Anarchist Cookbook.

film.summary: An American black comedy about love and passion, betrayal and lies. It depicts the depths of friendship and relationships in one's life and raises life's real and most asked question: "Can you ever really trust anyone?...Are you ready to see reflections of your life? A successful banker, Johnny, is madly in love with his fiancé, Lisa, and plans to be married next month. His plans take a horrid turn when he finds the truth about Lisa and the people surrounding him. (IMDB)
film.quote: Oh, hi Criticker. Okay so, this movie is awful but the 1 is misleading. I can't give it a high mark but with that said, I STRONGLY RECOMMEND SEEING THIS MOVIE! You are my favourite customer! God this was a funny movie but like one person said, it can be boring at times. Still better than The Anarchist Cookbook.

film.summary: This is a film taken of the execution of Topsy, an elephant employed to help build Luna Park on Coney Island. She had killed three men, including a drunken spectator who fed her a cigarette. Cyanide-laced carrots fed to her by park officials failed, and the ASPCA forbade a hanging. Thomas Edison, meanwhile, had been publicly killing dogs and cats with AC power to show that his DC power was more effective and less dangerous. (imdb)
film.quote: This might be the first 0 I've ever given a movie. People have commented on Edison, so I don't have to, so I'm taking my disgust out on something else: Criticker. Why did you think I'd give this a 19? What the fuck Criticker, I thought we were friends.

film.summary: An eye blinks. That&#039;s it.
film.quote: Oh god, who would make such an awful piece of... wait, what the fuck? Yoko again? Ah, jesus christ, woman.
